Blog.post: Today at lunch I was surprised...pleasantly too, which is rare. There is a guy from my English class that sits with the group of people I sit next to at lunch and sometimes we talk. About rpgs, and grapes looking like fish eyes, and things of the such. He is a very interesting person...and perhaps as weird as I am. But today I think the intrigue was made official. I told one of my completely stupid, goofy jokes that I always make and no one ever laughs at, right? Well, no one laughed again so naturally, I started laughing at myself and then he, the guy that I described earlier, played off my joke and said something both witty and stupid at the same time, my kind of funny in other words...and he actually had been smiling at my dumb joke I made...which made me smile...and I laughed at his joke....which was funny...at least to me...I mean, he is definitely not someone people look at and think of as hot...but neither am I. From what I know, he is smart and apparently funny and really interesting...I'm not gonna say anything except that he is intriguing...but that is a lot coming from me....well, gtg...listening to some Something Corporate....awesome band, listen to their music...I Woke Up In A Car is their best song...in my opinion...but that is just because it made me fall in love with their music. Which reminds me, I went to their concert and was at the very front but didnt even get to see them come onstage because we had to leave early because of worried parents and icy weather...well, gtg for real now... lisa

I wish that I could be as young as my brother again, without really having ever gone through true heartbreak and confrontal with reality....here is an excerpt from our online conversation (he is in the 7th grade). TIMMAH34N: ive only loved 1 girl this year BananaFroggie: oh reallllly well your profile has said otherwise TIMMAH34N: i lvoed kristen last year BananaFroggie: what is love, Brian? TIMMAH34N: when u think about some one 24 seven and you want to be with them for a long time BananaFroggie: so your saying that thinking about someone 24 7 and wanting to be with them a lot is a sound basis for marriage? TIMMAH34N: and your willing to do any thing for them TIMMAH34N: you cant stand not ebing with them BananaFroggie: Have you ever considered that perhaps it is not love you are feeling, but a form of junior high infatuation? TIMMAH34N: nein BananaFroggie: so naive, thats what i like about you Brian TIMMAH34N: love is a many splendeed thing love lifts us up where we belong all you need is love TIMMAH34N: ok then lisa TIMMAH34N: tell me your definition of love? BananaFroggie: you remind me of myself at your age TIMMAH34N: smart genious girl BananaFroggie: well for one thing, i highly doubt if true love even really exists, but if it does, it does not come after a few weeks or even months of knowing someone, it comes after you have made that long term, once in a life time commitment to them and when you learn to trust and know someone better than you do yourself. BananaFroggie: but as i said, it prob. doesnt even exist BananaFroggie: you learn that after a few heartbreaks BananaFroggie: just wait TIMMAH34N: well if what u just said is true TIMMAH34N: then the girl that im goin out with right now TIMMAH34N: is in love with me BananaFroggie: oh please BananaFroggie: you have just missed everything i just said then TIMMAH34N: lol lisa ur funny and ignorant TIMMAH34N: ur clueless TIMMAH34N: u might be older but deep down TIMMAH34N: ur younger TIMMAH34N: thats why i love you and i hate you BananaFroggie: oh ok...i forgot that my 7th grade brother is so much more versed in the ways of love and life than i am TIMMAH34N: ive had more experiences TIMMAH34N: :-) BananaFroggie: i highly doubt that TIMMAH34N: ur very weird lisa BananaFroggie: Brian, I am just saying that you might think you are in love...I mean, sure, that is what it feels like, believe me, I know exactly what it feels like, and I know that even after I tell you this that you will not believe it and will just shrug it off as me being "younger" and more "inexperienced" but what you are feeling is not true love...believe me....of course, if your definition of love is thinking about someone 24 7 and wanting to be with them for a long time and being willing to do anything for them then sure, you are in love, and I have been a couple of times...but so far, it has led to nothing more than short-lived promises and relationships that die after about a year so just be careful TIMMAH34N: well it might not be true love TIMMAH34N: but its love TIMMAH34N: :-) See? Don't you just wish you could blindly believe in love the way he does? I know that I wish I could. I don't even know why I tried to destroy his dreams...I am such a horrible person. Oh yeah, did yall catch the way he called me weird? I'm telling you, that's what I am...we had another Key Club meeting today...I don't even feel like a part of the club anymore. I don't even know why I let things like that bother me...hmm...maybe cuz I wanted to be friends with Lyndsay and Nicole and all them but I don't think that they want to be friends with me. That is kinda sad, you know? Sigh...but oh well, maybe one day a guy will sweep me off my feet and my brother will come to me and be like, "Me and Lulu broke up, there is no such thing as true love" and I will smile and say, " So naive Brian, thats what I love about you." :) Lisa

Well, these past couple of days I have had a lot of time to think to myself because we were all iced in our houses and everything. And a lot of thinking I did. I don't know where people that send out their college mail get their information but I think that they think I am smarter than I really am. Yesterday I got this invitation to go to some conference this summer and today I got a letter from Yale about their school...but I mean, I don't think that I am smart enough to go to either of them. I spent a lot of time thinking about my self esteem and if I should just start thinking that I am really that smart. But, no matter how much I thought about it or tried to convince myself, I just didn't see it. I don't know. I think that maybe they think that just because my psat scores were kinda high, that i am some kinda genius person. cha, right. But anyways, enough on that subject. Sorry if I am boring anybody. So I watched Fiddler On The Roof for the first time yesterday....good good story and music....about a small Jewish town on the brink of World War 2 and this man who is the father of 5 daughters is suddenly having his way of life and his tradition challenged by everyone around him-even his own family. His eldest daughter asks him for permission to marry (instead of just waiting for him to pick a husband for her), the second one asks for his blessing, and the third one asks forhis acceptance. All three are slowly progressing further and further away from his tradition. His third daughter marries a gentile so he does not accept them because it would mean bending his faith and he doesn't feel as if he can do that. I had mixed feelings on the subject. I mean, keeping your faith is all good and stuff, but at the expense of completely excommunicating your own child from your family and making her cry and beg for you to talk to her? I think that is a bit extreme. But it is true that not every country and culture is like ours. And that is hard to remember sometimes. I mean, what would our culture be like if we had arranged marriages? Well, we wouldn't have nearly as many good movies or cds, that's for sure. But more than that, I think that people would be more focused on their lives and goals rather than who they are going to marry...but then, if our families were so tight knit that we had arranged marriages, then we wouldn't really have the freedom to move away and pursue our own dreams...so it is probably for the best...well, not probably, for sure...anyways, I am just rambling now (hence the name of my site) so I will go. c ya Lisa

You know, most dogs have a chew toy. And most of the time it is a normal chew toy; maybe a stuffed animal or a ball...or a little piece of rope like those ones they sale at the pet store. But, my dog? No, my spastic chiuaua of a dog has to be unique....or uniquer than he already is I guess would be more accurate. What does he chew on? A toothbrush. He just sits there and bites on the thing and growls at the same time. I don't even know whose toothbrush it is. Apparently nobody's in our house so I don't know where he got it. All the plastic is deformed, dripping with drool, and covered with teeth marks. He gets really defensive of it too. I tried to take it away from him and he barked at me and then grabbed it and ran under the bed. One time I saw it lying on the ground and took it. When he saw it in my hand, he chased me down until I gave it back to him. Now, whenever he sees me coming while he's chewing on the stupid thing, he instinctively runs away and hides from me. He chews on it so hard that it's liable to break his teeth one of these days. I mean, sure, ropes and stuffed animals are all good to chew on, but a toothbrush? I find it ironic that the one thing that will ruin his teeth is something meant to keep them in shape. Anyways, this weekend I saw How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days. That was one hilarious movie. I laughed the whole way through. And Matthew McConaughey was lookin pretty good. Well, he always does but that is beside the point. However, at the end it was one of those "true love" scenes with the perfect ending in which the perfect people form the perfect couple and live in a perfect world from that day forward...yeah freakin right....I mean, good ending for a movie and everything...but I'm not buying it. I wish. Lisa PS- Ewan McGregor is going to be in a new movie...he as well is not lacking in the good looks part of the gene pool

Two things to think about today: 1) When you look at your life, would you consider it a productive life? I was thinking about that today. I am not sure if I would consider my life productive. I don't feel as if I do anything except for school related activities and playing games. It kind of makes me wish that I did more with my life...maybe got a job or started volunteering on a regular basis...i am trying to get a job but I suppose it would help if I turned in some of my applications...sigh...I just don't want to live my entire life and then look back on it and say What the crap? Why did I waste my time like that??? And will I ever feel that my life is productive, even if I do become some influential person...I don't know...Do you ever wonder about things like that? I asked several people today if they felt their lives were productive and a majority of them said yes. 2) Is there really such a thing as true love? The more I see and the more I learn, the more my answer leans toward no. There have been a few times before when I thought I had found the perfect guy or true love and it always just ended up disappointing me. I really don't think that there is such a thing as true love. I mean, from the time we are little western pop culture bombards us with propaganda after propaganda of cheesy love stories and mushy poetry and music. I think it is instilled in us to believe that there is a "soul mate" for every person and that if you just have a pure heart then you will find "true love" What a load of crap. I don't believe I have a soul mate and I don't believe I will ever fall in love. And if I do, it will be short-lived because I wasn't made for love. I decided that today. I don't think I ever want to get married. Marriage to me seems to binding and boring. I would rather just focus on my career and social life...I do believe however, that a select few will find something closer to true love than the rest of us. You know, in every movie, when two people that are truly "in love" finally over come every obstacle that has been placed in front of them to be together, one or both of them nearly always meets their end in some sort of trajedy. It would seem that "true love" is characterized by the essential state of being apart and the fact that they will never really be able to be together the rest of their lives. They say that it is better to have loved and lost than to never to have loved at all....is that really true? Because if you have loved and lost, then you know what you are missing, and that would just put you in more misery than before...I kind of understand I guess how that feels...but it doesn't matter...i gtg now...c ya Lisa

I applied to the Texas Academy of Math and Science this year. And although I know that compared to a lot of other people, my grades are good and my tests scores are high, I do not think that I am as comepletely smart as every one makes me out to be. I am 4th in my class with a gpa of over 100...but I don't feel like I should be there, that I am that smart. It seems that everyone else around me that is considered smart fits in a whole lot better than I do with other "smart" people and that they are better than me. Some of them sure act like it. Victoria Miller beat me for the spot of editor on Key Club...and although I probably don't deserve to be an officer again next year, I can't help but think that it is because I just don't strike people as a smart, responsible person. Maybe that is because sometimes I will just completely forget about a homework assignment and do it the period before it is due or maybe it is because I cannot publicly speak worth crap. I don't know. But Victoria is annoying. And from what I know, she is not an extraordianry writer...which is what an editor is supposed to be I think. But anyways, back to what I was talking about before. If I do not get accepted into TAMS I think that will be the day I really start believeing that I am no smarter than the average person. I read all these stories about people who went to TAMS and were all genius-like. I just don't see myself as that smart. But at the same time, I really really really want to go. I observe people a lot at school. Mainly because I don't really talk to anyone. It kind of depresses me how I don't really get along with anyone. I mean, I am friendly with just about everyone. But I really don't think that I fit in at all. I am a little too weird, a little too quiet, a little too different from everybody else. The only person I really talk to and feel as if they have heard and understood is Amy. And Amy and I are complete opposites. In every way imaginable. Perhaps I feel she understands me because we grew up together. I don't know...latetly, i have been getting very irritated with people easily and being very judgemental. This is not a good thing. I don't want to become a bitter person. I am pessimistic also. Can you tell? sigh...anyways, gtg now. ciao Lisa

There is a party somewhere on my street and there are like ten million cars lined up on the sides of my street. I saw a police officer and I waved to him so he waved back and then like 3 other cop cars came down my street and they all asked me if I knew where the party was. I informed him that I did not. I think he was either surprised or annoyed that I waved at him. I think he thought I was associated with the party somehow. That amuses me. Well, I am here, home alone...which kinda scares me. I have to lock all of the doors. The other day I was home alone and the door slammed shut. It wasn't until after I had locked myself in the bathroom for thirty minutes that I deducted that it was probably the wind from the open windows that caused it to shut. And even then it took me another fifteen minutes to build up the courage to come out of the bathroom. I never want to live completely alone. But I don't think I ever want to get married either. This is a paradox. Well, maybe not, but still... I got fourth in writing and 6th in spelling at the district academic meet today. The writing judges did a pretty crappy job on their part. None of their comments on my paper made any sense at all. And they called my friend's paper bigotry....when it was obviously not. I think they are on something...or something... Well, I should know about TAMS soon. I hope that I got in. I need a change. I am going to write in simple sentences. This emphasizes my lack of writing skills. I need a job. I cannot find one. I think Hobby Lobby is hiring. I can hear the noise of cars leaving outside. Mest is an excellent band. You should listen to some of their stuff. Ok, enough with that literary crap...hey I have some interesting facts here: Amy Wallace on Notes On The Collection of Transfers : “This work is arguably the most boring book ever written, and as any bibliophile knows. The competition is fierce. It unquestionably placed him among the foremost ranks of literary eccentrics. Before Sidis arrived upon the scene, there had been a volume entitled Nothing , by Methelá which contained 200 blank pages.” In 1634, Charles Butler bestowed upon the world The Feminin Monarchi , a history of bees written phonetic spelling. In 1802, Timothy Dexter’s A Pickle for the Knowing Ones made the scene, composed of a single sentence, with all the punctuation on the last page in case you were inclined to re-insert it into the book. And in 1939 came Gadsby , by Ernest Vincent Wright, which was a fifty-thousand-word novel written without the use of the letter “e”. Now these people knew how to productively spend their time. William Sidis is my intellectual role model...he was extremely intelligent. I wish I could learn an entire language in a day.... I can hear people yelling outside...I'm gonna go spy. Apparently, the cops broke up the party. Then there was a parade of people walking down my street and getting into their cars. But there were so many of them that there was a back up and nobody could get out. One lady even started freak dancing in my driveway...I found it amusing. And they all had their rap on as loud as it could be with the bass all the way up so I could hear a loud boom boom boom coming from a number of cars at the same time. Then one lady started yelling, "I'm going to Wal-Mart! Meet me at Wal-Mart!" and the traffic finally started clearing away. I am acting completely crazy today. I feel relieved for some reason. Why would anyone want to meet at a Wal-Mart? Life is confusing. Lisa "Hey, I found this egg in the couch. Is this yours?" "Yes, it's very fragile. Put it down." "I found what I believe to be a goose egg in the couch." "Thank you Interruptor Jones, that is also my egg. Now put it down" "Here's a duck egg, a nut hatch egg, an ostrich egg, maybe a dinosaur egg, one of those brown eggs..." "What are you trying to say? So I got a lot of eggs....and I keep them in the couch..." "There needs to be a better word for weird." -SB & SS

Applying for jobs is like...asking a boy you like out...in elementary school...it's pointless, stupid, and there is always an inevitable rejection... but you know that if they said yes, you would be the happiest person on earth... However, now a days I am hearing the words, "We're not hiring" more than I ever heard the words, "No, you're ugly," or "I don't like you like that" back in the day. Well, I lie...I haven't been to thirteen places yet...maybe twelve...so I am almost there. So, uh, school is back in...and it sucks...as usual...we had to take the TAKS test today...those TAKS ppl must not be very....intelligent....one of the questions: Which word best helps the reader understand the meaning of the word poignant? (keep in mind that I already knew it) a) express b) personal c) today d) violet Now for the definition of "poignant": poign·ant ( P ) Pronunciation Key (poinynt) adj. a) Physically painful b) Keenly distressing to the mind or feelings: poignant anxiety. c) Profoundly moving; touching: a poignant memory. See Synonyms at moving. I was like: shuwaw! What are these people thinking? I picked personal, just because I figured it had to relate to your personal feelings or whatnot but it is those types of questions that make me sit back and say, "Just how smart are the people that are given the authority to govern us anyways?" Not very. Also, who besides me was outraged at Michael Moore's speech at the Academy awards? I mean, it's fine if you are anti-war and all, but publicly denouncing your president on a program that is being internationally watched and broadcasted on public television? That is bad taste. Our troops were watching that...what, does he want them to lose their morale or something? Stupid and annoying guy, or at least that was my impression of him. [Transition], Saturday I went to the Bowling For Soup concert...some awesome music...wow....probably the best concert I have been to in a long while. The Riddlin' Kids were good too...and they are both from Texas! of course, that's just because out of all the beautiful people in the United States, we are the most talented :). "And that, as they say, is that." (-FFX) Lisa "For the life of me I cannot remember What made us think that we were wise And we'd never compromise For the life of me I cannot believe We'd ever die for these sins We were merely freshman"

I often think that humor is a pretense...something feigned by people so that they do not have to face the grim reality that they live in. It is a wall of some sort that people hide behind so that they do not have to form opinions on issues that affect the entire world or think about something serious for more than five minutes. The weird thing is that I am not entirely opposed to this form of dealing with reality. I suppose I completely understand what they are trying to do. But instead of using humor to escape from it, I simply try not to think about it too hard and attempt to ignore it. However, this does not usually work...well, does not ever work would be more appropriate. I commend people able to make a comedy about the war that we are now engaged in. I admire anyone who can sever themselves so far from their emotions that they laugh at things that cause other people suffering. And seriously, I really don't think they are any worse than anyone else. Because I understand why they do it. I suppose it does the rest of the world good if it serves as comic relief to anyone. However, people who pretend that the war with Iraq does not affect them or their generation annoy me. I know several people around 16 or 17 who simply shrug when the war is mentioned and say that it doesn't affect them or their generation. Those people are too ignorant to acknowledge that people within a few years range of their age are the ones fighting this war and that even if it doesn't directly affect their lifestyle or their family, there are people suffering and lives that are being transformed, destroyed because of this. To not care about it because you do not see the immediate and direct effects is selfish....in my opinion. Sorry if anyone is offended by that statement. Well, that is all I have to say about this week's political developments, other than that my official stand on it is that while I do wish that we did not have to wage war on Iraq, war is perpetual and inevitable and I support our president in whatever he does, unless it is extremely despotic or cruel. Enough of that... My spring break has been both boring and fun...I went to a concert and saw SR71 (great music, let me tell ya), saw both sets of my grnadparents, went rock climbing, learned how to play raquetball, went bowling, and tomorrow I am going to another concert. I also spent two entire days playing Final Fantasy X, which I have nearly beaten. I am about to fight sin...but I will not have any time the next few days so I don't know when I will do that. I have been observing people as of late and have come to the conclusion that a good majority of people are fakes. They lead you to believe they are something they are really not. Especially at my church. People want you to think they are perfect angels and do everything right...but when you get them by themselves in private when they voice their thoughts, you realize that maybe they are not as perfect as you thought. But the next day, they are back at church, pretending to be as innocent as everyone thinks they are. Some people are completely honest with you and everyone else, which I respect more than anything...except for maybe modesty...Modesty and honesty are the two virtues I never want to lose, regardless of where my life takes me. Also, an interesting note....people are never what they seem either. One of my good friends from my church has told me very recently that for the past 4 months or so, she has had a secret relationship with a guy that her parents banned her from dating because he was Episcopalian (don't know how to spell, sorry)...and she is a preacher's daughter...a sweet one at that...I never thought she would do anything like that. But that also brings me to another point. I think it is wrong to limit your child's dating to people of the same religion. It makes me mad that people are prejudiced against other people like that. The only way I think that forbidding your child from dating someone because of their religion is justified is if the religion is some cult that could possibly put your child in harm's way. Otherwise, it is wrong to do so. That is just my opinion though. Of course, I also think that forcing your kids to go to church is wrong. Well, anyways, that is my blog for the day. All of this has been building up for the past couple of days...so it was a long one. c ya.. Lisa Why does my heart cry Feelings I can't fight You're free to leave me But just don't deceive me And please believe me when I say I love you. -El Tango de Roxanne

Oh right, the thing I was going to write about the other night... Well, today I noticed that all my friends play a different role in my life. Brittany is my rpg buddy, Olivia is my concert/music buddy, Ashley is my history studying buddy, Sarah is my blogspot buddy (j/k)...anyways, my point is that there are many different things that I connect with people on. That took shorter to explain than I thought. Good bye school, Hello Spring Break! Heck yeah...I have needed this for a while. I really do not have much to talk about so....good bye for now. Lisa

Today I was in history class when my teacher, Mrs. Roland, said she had to tell us something. She is one of those people that is always smiling, and kind to everyone...someone who everybody loves, you know? So she starts telling us how she is sorry that she won't be here for our midterm which is tomorrow and she was like, "It's just that, my brother got called overseas yesterday and I want to say goodbye to him" and they way she said it, it wasn't just a simple statement...even though she was trying to smile through it all, she started tearing up ans kept apologizing for being so emotional. Every time she had to say something about her brother, she would start to cry again. But, no matter how much we could tell she wanted to just sit down and cry, she kept a smile on her face and tried to counter her emotions by laughing. Which made me think of three things. Up until today, I really hadn't thought much about the pending war. I had heard about it on the news and I had said that I didn't really have an opinion on the matter, but today, I was really impacted by it for the first time. I mean, I guess I wasn't impacted directly, but seeing how something like that can tear a normally cheerful person up made me think about how if we get into a war, the casualties, whether they are Iraqian or American, will be many and devastating. It made me feel for everyone who will lose a brother or a father or a friend or a son if it comes to that. And I hope it doesn't. Another thing it made me think about was the way that people wear masks. Not literal masks, but things they do to hide their true feelings. I heard this story once about a girl who had a fatal cancer and she was in an unimaginable state of pain but until the day they took her out of school, no body even knew about it because every day she would come to school and smile and laugh while hiding the pain inside her. This reminded me of that. Even through her tears, Mrs. Roland was smiling. She didn't want to have to make us watch her cry. She didn't want to trouble people with her burdens. I wonder how often she does that... The third thing it made me think about was that she reminds me of Atticus Finch. I wondered in my last entry if there was really anyone like him. She reminds me of him with the way she lives with dignity. You know what I mean? Anyways, I was going to write about something else too but it is getting late and this is already long enough. Word of advice to everyone: Buy relient k's new cd. It will rock your socks off. ciao Lisa

Hey everybody! Just a little update: I beat Maester Seymour! But now all the guados think I am a traitor and are attacking me! Also, I apologize for all the grammatical errors of my previous entry. Lisa

To Kill A Mockingbird...I have just finished reading that novel. I finished the last chapter a few minutes ago. That book has put so much in perspective for me. Atticus Finch is by far the best character I have ever read about. He had wisdom, morals, determination, love...every good quality and yet he was human at the same time. I think that this book along with The Killer Angels are my two favorite books of all time. Even though I do love A Separate Peace also. A Separate Peace had a lot of the same type of themes as To Kill A Mockingbird when it comes to growing up and maturing. Sorry if this novel talk is boring anybody. I think it is funny that both of my favorite books have a form of the word "kill" in them. Anyways, most books have themes about the evil that lives in the human heart and all that. And I love books like that, especially the satirical types. Like Kurt Vonnegut. But there was something about TKAM that both revealed the evil that men could do, but also maintained that there is hope because of Atticus' undying faith in people. At the end of the novel, even after a man tries to kill his own children, he still tells his daughter that people are nice when you get to know them. An amazing story...wow...anyways, sorry about this boring entry. Nothing else new has happened. Finals are this week. I can't get past this part on Final Fantasy X because Maester Seymour keeps casting multi spells on me that knock out two ppl at a time...how can I beat that? This is crazy. Gtg...bye Lisa

You know, it's funny, the things you remember about certain people and certain things. And what you get nostalgia about. Every time I hear a certain song, I want it to be summer again, when the guy of my dreams was interested in me and every time we talked, I thought that I would never be happy unless I got to know him more. And I remember the times when there were a lot of people around, and still he seemed to only notice me. I remember the way I felt when our eyes met without meaning to and when they did mean to. And his smile. I'll never forget his smile. But as summers also do, this faded away, and after a while, we were nothing more than friends, if even that. It doesn't seem fair to me that the boy I fall for, after years of putting up walls of defense so that I would never fall for anyone again, is unattainable. And will be for the whole of my life. I tell people that knew me back then that I have no feelings for him any longer. But every time I see him, it is that feeling I got when our eyes met all over again. And even though he has someone now, who is not me, I still think that his smiles are meant exclusively for me...but then I face reality and realize that no matter how much I imagine or deny, things have changed and I need to move on. It is a sad reality. However, most reality is. I think that if there was ever hope for me finding true love, he was it. But, as I have aformentioned, he is currently unattainable and will be for quite some time. I just want to move away so I don't have to face him ever again, him and every body else that lives here. Sorry about the sad entry. Lisa

Things I Hate (And why I hate them) 1) Make up. Make up is so stupid. Why do girls wear make up? To cover up their blemishes? Well, I have plenty of those so I figure, hey, I'll give it a try...well, putting it on is all grand and all but does the mascara bottle come with instructions on how to remove it without smearing the black stuff all around your eyes?? No!!!!!!!! And also, this base/powder on the face crap...in the sunlight, it looks like a piece of crap cuz you can see every grain of powder and every line of color change!!!! I for one do not see the point in make up beyond a little lip color or eye shadow... 2) Everclear Read the below entry 3) Standardized Testing Aw man, we have to take those stupid tests this week. They are so gay! And for the math one, they had so much crap from Alg. 2...It was easy for me cuz im in Pre-AP Alg 2 but most sophomores have only gone through geometry so they didnt know half of the stuff on there! Oh yeah, and they expect us to remember history dates from the 8th grade. Smart thinking there, not. These people have no idea what they are doing. 4) Food Ok, ok, so I love food. And maybe I did say that if food were a person I'd marry it....but...but....it is bad!!!! Ok, so maybe it does provide the nourishment that I need to stay alive...but I eat too much of it!!! Maybe the title of this section should be The Good Tastingness and Seductivity of Food...yes,....mmm...chocolate donuts.... 5)Everclear Oh wait, I already said that one. 6) Watership Down Never read this book. Unless you are entertained by annoying, lost, talking bunnies who hop around and get a book written about them. 7) Elise Why? You ask. Well, none of you know this Elise I speak of. She is currently serving time in the penetentiary...man i don't know how to spell. She is the only person I harbor true hatred for. She ruined my life, she made my mom file bankruptcy, she stole my brother's graduation money, and she illegally stole thousands of dollars from my other brother. All of this while pretending to be our friend. And still claiming so to this day. I hope she stays in the prison system for the entiredy of her life. I hate her. Nothing new. C ya later Lisa

I just got back from the Everclear concert and I must say that I was quite disappointed. I can truthfully say that Everclear is the only band that I like less because of seeing them live. They must do a lot of sprucing up on their recorded tracks because in real life, that guy cannot sing worth CRAP. Sorry to break the news, but he sucks at singing. And he is OLD...you know all those pictures you see of Everclear and it is the guy with the blond spiky hair? Yeah, that's him....in like the frickin 80s. This was a middle-aged, graying, balding Alzheimer's guy who seemed to forget the lines to some of his songs sometimes. He tried to cover it up by fading out and then going, "Sing it!" But you could tell....his age had gotten to him. He actually kinda looked like Steve Martin except more annoying and less funny. They should have a law against old farts trying to rock on with the younger generation...heh, like once all your hair turns grey...And then, for the encore, all they did was invite all these sluts/whores onto the stage to "dance"/ put on a near strip show/ be all over the band members. It was sick. I did not want to see that. I mean, no one did. Unless they were just like the old fart on stage who probably liked the possibility of having sex with girls young enough to be his daughters. These two girls even started making out towards the end. It was so gay. In a literal and nonliteral sense. For the Everclear portion of the concert, I really didn't enjoy the music all that much and I didn't have just a whole lot of fun. However, on a positive note... The opening band, The Exies, was awesome. I loved their music and they acted with self-respect. Plus the lead singer could actually sing and he was not an old fart. Far from it, in fact. He was pretty darn hot. Afterwards, they gave out free posters and were meeting-and-greeting. I was first in line. They were all so nice and all shook hands with me and wrote personal notes on my poster. They acted with humility and class, unlike the idiotic headlining band. Their music was a lot better too and it had a lot more genuine emotion in the lyrics. Rather than "They all become Volvo Driving Soccer Moms" I cannot say how much I don't like Everclear because of this concert. The Exies however may become one of my favorite bands. I played their CD on the way home (cuz I bought it up there for $10) and they have some excellent music and beautiful lyrics. Well, anyway, that was my night. Still no word from TAMS. I'll keep you (Sarah and Jennifer, the only two who ever read this) updated. Lisa

GUESS WHO GOT A JOB?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?! WOO WOO!!!!! heh, I am ecstatic with joy. I have been looking for so long and I finally found it, the object of my dreams. Who cares if I am merely a bagger? Or that I will only be working 20 hours a week? Who cares that I will only make 5.15 an hour???? Not me!!!! CUZ I HAVE A JOB!!! My first, to fill some of you in. Life is good. TAMS admissions offers go out this week. I love it. I cannot wait until I find out whether or not I made it in...and I dread the prospect of having to find out if it is financially possible for me to go to it...it would be terribly depressing if I could not. I would work full time all summer if it meant I could go... I still haven't talked to intelligent/nice/funny boy. I do not ever see him. How sad. Oh well. Life is good. Good food. I like the Foo Fighters. They are an excellent band. "And I wonder when I sing along with you If everything could ever feel this real forever If anything could ever be this good again The only thing I'll ever ask of you You've got to promise not to stop when I say when" -Foo Fighters I love music. For a complete list of the bands I enjoy listening to, please visit my webpage: http://www.geocities.com/liawau87 and click on the music section. If you could go to college for two years when you were supposed to be in high school, would you go? Even if you would miss the academic competitions? Even if you would miss the class rank competition? Even if you would miss the teachers, the classes? Even if you would miss your school? Even if you would miss all your friends, including the people that you know you wouldn't keep in touch with, the people that you come into contact with in your classes and think are interesting people but you would probably not keep up with? The people that will make you remember your high school years. The ones that make getting up in the morning worth it. I will miss all these things. But I know that what I am missing out on is nothing compared to what I would miss out on if I did not seize the opportunity of going to TAMS. Sigh...it is a melancholy subject. Lisa

So the guy I like... He is such a nice guy. He is so smart. He is funny. He has a very good taste in music. And he looks very nice in dress-up clothes. What more could a girl want? Ok, so he is not like the typical guy that girls fall over themselves for, at least, I don't think he is. But he is very nice and he has a very cute smile. I only get to tall to him sporadically but I really enjoy it when I do get to talk to him. The problem is that I just don't know how to act around guys I like. It is pretty crazy. I wish that I could just completely forget all of my insecurities about myself and just not be afraid to go all out and make an effort to see him more and talk to him a lot. But I mean, I didn't even talk to him at the NHS induction and he was standing like right there. Oh the confusion. Heh, but it is worth it. I am serious. I haven't liked a guy in so long. I love it. I had a dream last night that I was buried up to my neck in sand and he came up to me and started talking to me in a foreign language. And then I was at TAMS but it was like a really rich school and really pretty and then he was there for some reason. It was a weird dream. I don't know if I will ever have an excuse to talk to him ever again...how incredibly depressing!!! I will find a way. I must find a way. hehe, I crack myself up. This is so fun. It's like an adventure. I wish I could have a relationship. I have music planned out for each stage of the relationship. Even the break up music. Well, anyways, I just thought that I would comment on this aspect of my life. But I must leave now. Lisa "Look at me, my depth perception must be off again Cause this hurts deeper than I thought it did It has not healed with time It just shot down my spine You look so beautiful tonight Remind me how you laid us down And gently smiled before you destroyed my life" -Saliva

I think that I have finally figured out how to conquer my discontent with life. And it all started with accepting myself... For the longest time, I thought that I should fight with all of my might against the person I naturally was and condemn myself for everything wrong I did. I thought that I was a horrible person and that I deserved nothing good. And its not that I think I deserve good things now but I guess I just see the pointlessness of going around in life believing that your existence is evil. Unfortunately, many churches encourage such ways of thinking. I think that I finally understand the meaning of living life. This past week, starting with the regional meet for ready writing, I have begun to see how teenagerhood and life in general is best lived...Being young is all about contradicting yourself. You're supposed to be a slacker while trying your hardest. You're supposed to not care while freaking out if something happens. You're supposed to like someone that you appear to be completely uninterested in. If you think about it long enough, you'll see what I mean. You have to enjoy yourself while hating life. You have to love your music and want people to love it along with you while hoping it doesn't get very popular. And I think that realizing this contradicting aspect of adolescent life has allowed me to enjoy it more and appreciate the idiosyncrasies and little quirks that make up my life and the teenage life of our generation in general. Not caring so much about things has helped a little too. Maybe this is not what some people would consider a very resposible or smart perspective to have on life...but I try to take a light view on things...you know...in my relationships with guys, I'm not looking for someone to marry or even a long term relationship...in my school work, I am not gonna worry so much about my class rank or my grades...but because I must contradict myself, I will also try my hardest in each class and try to get good grades. I think that a lot of problems would be solved if people would just learn how to chill out every once in a while. It would make a lot of mental break downs unnecessary. Do you see my point? Well, that is it for my entry. I love music. The relient k concert was "Wow" beyond words. No adjectives in the English language can describe the expressionless emotion of pure raw fun that I had. Well, bye now. Lisa

Ah, adolescent infatuation...I am so glad I'm in high school and still capable of having these crushes...even if they are inevitably leading nowhere. Heh...That is all I have to write tonight. Sarah knows what I'm talking about. :) Lisa "Theres something that I can't quite explain I'm so in love with you You'll never take that away And if I said a hundred times before Expect a thousand more You never take that away Well expect me to be Calling you to see If your ok when i'm not around Asking if you love me I love the way you make it sound Calling you to see Do I try to hard to make you smile to make a smile And I will be calling you to see If your sleepin' are you dreamin'? If your dreamin' are you dreamin of me? I can't believe You actually picked...me I thought that the world had lost its sway (its so hard sometimes) Then I fell in love with you (then came you) And you took that way (its not so difficult) You take away the old Show me the new And I feel like I can fly When I stand next to you So what if on this phone A hundred miles from home I take the words you gave And send them back to you" -Blue October

Well, I have just returned from Lubbock...and I must say, this trip has been one of the funnest of my life. Three things. 1) Where do you go to listen to a conversation about the superiority of the semi-colon over the colon, a J.R.R. Tolkien marathon 24 hours reading, and people using terms like glossolalia or macrocephaly in their daily conversations? UIL Regional Competition at Texas Tech. It is amazing how many people I met or observed that seemed to be as enthusiastic about learning as I am...at least, when school is not directly involved. 2) The same group of "smart people" that I had always wanted to fit into completely ignored and disregarded me again this weekend...so I have decided that I don't want to be a part of their little group anyways. It's not all that great. At first, I felt like this was going to be a horrible weekend because I would have absolutely nobody to talk to but it turned out to not be so bad. I got to know this girl named Caitlyn and we became pretty good friends...of course, it is probably one of those short-lived friendships that you only have because you have nobody else to hang out with, as demonstrated when I said to her as I was about to leave, "Well, I really don't have a way of getting in contact with you in case we ever want to hang out or whatever..." and she said, "Oh well, I'll see you at school." Cha right. She might as well have said, "Oh well, I will see you on Mars. We can hang out then." Oh well...it was fun. We stayed up talking and pulled practical jokes on our unsuspecting neighbors...it was great. 3) This weekend I also met a guy named Ryan. Well, I had really already known about him or whatnot because we had gone to the same meets before, but we never really talked. Anyways, he is the editor of our school newspaper. He asked if he could read my ready writing essay and I was like, "Oh yeah, sure." So he read it and he kept stopping periodically and saying stuff like, "Wow, you're a great writer" or "This is a good essay." and then he was like, "Have you ever thought about writing for the newspaper?" I kinda shrugged my shoulders and was like, "Do I have to take a class or anything?" and he was like, "Well, not if you know how to write like this ." It made me feel very special...So he told me that I can just come by the journalism room and he will give me some style tips on news writing and let me write for the newspaper...pretty cool, eh? I thought so. At the end of our conversation he was like, "Well, you're a good writer." and all I could manage to say was, "Oh thanks, yeah, you are too, I mean, obviously, you did win state last year and all (for news writing or something)." Point is, I have never had anyone just completely flatter me like that. It was kinda nice. He is one of those really intelligent guys that is also very interesting and very nice. For instance, he used to live in various countries of Asia because his dad is in the army so he knows, count them, five languages. I mean, wow. However, he was also kinda flirty with a few of the other girls...so you know...I don't really fit in all that well I suppose. But the important thing is that I get a chance to write for the school newspaper. This is going to be pretty awesome. So I was thinking on the way home, and I kept thinking about how my ending up alone was completely inevitable but also how I don't want it to be. I keep thinking about how I want someone that I can experience that romantic magic with that everyone is always talking about. But the more I see how I don't fit in with anyone, the more I realize that I will not ever have anyone to share that with. And it is kinda sad for me. So I try not to think about it. But it is hard. Now I am starting to get excited about Academic Competitions next year and about getting involved with the newspaper and maybe raising my class rank and now I don't know if I even want to go to TAMS anymore. I mean, I do, because I hate high school, but in a way, I don't. Is math and science really even what I am going to base my future career on? Shouldn't I do something that I am exceptionally good at, like writing? But what careers are there in writing? Journalism is the only one I can think of. But then again, journalism would be fun. Even if I go to TAMS, that doesn't mean that I absolutely HAVE to major in something math or science related. I am so confused about my future right now. I just don't want to think about it. Lisa

Ok so, today was interesting. This morning I woke up 20 minutes later than I was supposed to because Jennifer was going to pick me up for the first time so that I am not late to school anymore so I hurried and hurried to get ready on time...by 45 after....well, I did get ready by 45 after....45 AFTER 5!!!!! I didn't even realize that the clock said 5:20 instead of 6:20 when I got up!!! So I had a full hour of finishing my homework that I had not done. Jennifer got here around 6:40 and I was ready obviously so I went outside to get into her car...and she informs me that no, we will not be going anywhere because she has accidentally locked her keys in her running car! Wow, isn't this going to be fun. So, instead of being late to school, I just went ahead and skipped first period. We called a lock smith and waited 45 minutes for him to come and unlock her door, which took like 30 seconds, and she had to pay 45 dollars of her money that she had been saving up to buy a stereo for her car. But such is life. It was nice to miss first period...of course, I had missed it already yesterday for tennis and will be tomorrow for ready writing. But oh well. I got some more homework done during the time we were supposed to be in first. What we also missed this morning was the mandatory TCC class meeting that we had to go to to take TCC courses next year for dual credit...so we had to go with all the Seniors during second period...so that was cool...we got out of algebra for 45 minutes. History was normal...all we did was go over the two chapters...and lunch was funny cuz that one guy that Ialways write about put a Mr. peanut mask on his head and called me a retard...actually, he sat there and continually went, "retard, retard, retard..." ....um, yeah,....it was a bit funny if only a little immature...he is not my type of guy...but anyways...and then I watched Dunja and Nick play their tennis matches...and win them...they both got 3rd in district...that was some pretty amazing tennis I watched today...wow...anyways, sorry this isn't very interesting...I will have more to say some other time. Lisa

I did it!!! Thirty long hours without food! I know it might not seem like a lot, but you try it and see how hard it is to avoid food for thirty hours, unless you're anorexic...in which case you would not have any trouble. But anyways, this was an adventure for me. You never realize the ridiculous abudance of food Americans have until you try to avoid it and it is just abosolutely EVERYWHERE you are. And you see pound after pound of food being thrown away and wasted....and then you think about all the kids and people in other country that just don't have anything at all and you just think about how spoiled and pampered we are...I mean, obviously, if you are reading this, you have enough money for the internet and a computer which means that you obviously have enough money to buy your own food and whatnot...but it is sad to think about things like that...I am glad that I am raising money for kids in Africa to eat...and I appreciate every person that donated to me. Even just a little bit helps, ya know? Anyways, this week is going to be an eventful one for me. Tomorrow I go to District for tennis and then Friday I go to Regionals in Lubbock for Ready Writing...I get to go by default...pretty cool eh? I mean, 2nd place couldn't go so I was bumped up from 4th place to 3rd place. And Sunday I have a youth council meeting...and then next week is the RELIENT K CONCERT!!! That will be pretty freakin awesome...My friend is going to (she has seat considerably further back than mine :)) and she is going to wear a wardrobe entirely dedicated to relient k...like she made a belt and a shirt with the name on them and she put their name on her flipflops and she aid something about her jeans...and then she said she was going to have like three different posters and something about a cardboard box car...I just don't saee the point in all that...I mean, isn't a concert supposed to be for the music? But oh well, whatever floats her boat. Of course, she also sayd that relient k is the ONLY band that she listens to so I guess she would be pretty excited about seeing them and all but that brings me to another point...ho w can you only listen to ONE band and not any others??? I would go crazy...I need a diverse variety of bands to listen to. Well, that is really all I have to say...c ya Lisa Don't you see, don't you see that the charade is over? And all the "Best Deceptions" and the "Clever Cover Story" awards Go to you So kiss me hard 'cause this will be the last time that I'll let you You will be back some day And this awkward kiss that tells of other people's lips Will be of service To keeping you away -Dashboard Confessional

You might be wondering why I haven't updated this in about a week...well, I have been working on a little side project. To see what my internet ambitions have produced, please redirect yourself here: http://www.geocities.com/liawau87 Have a nice day. Lisa

I am in a melancholy mood. Please disregard everything I am about to write. Sometimes I am so annoyed with myself I just want to punch myself in the face. When I look at my life, I can't help but think how incredibly stagnant and unproductive it is. I do nothing. At all. Except go to school, pretend to be smart, pretend to be involved in stupid activities that I really don't participate in, come home, do stuff that means NOTHING to ANYBODY except for MYSELF because I am so freaking selfish. I wish that I was a different person sometimes and that I lived a completely different life than I live right now. Why am I so pessimistic?? I think that the past couple years the only things I have been shown in my personal life is disappointment and frustration and that has made me become bitter, cynical, and pessimistic. I have even started behaving angrily to my friends that have been my friends forever. I shut them out of my life and I don't let them connect with me anymore. I don't even talk to my best friend anymore, save for the thirty minutes I see her at lunch every day. And I haven't even attempted to make any friends in replacement of them or anything. It's like I strive for solitude...but it's a solitude I don't want. And also, according to my church anyways, I have become morally degenerate. I think I have been slowly losing my faith in God. Honestly, nothing they say or do at church means anything to me anymore. I just watch it thinking about how I see church as an excuse for men to have a position of authority or respect in life. And that is just a bad thought to have. Nevertheless, it is what I think. And I sit and listen to sermon upon sermon about not being hypocritical and serving God with every aspect of your life and I just don't care anymore. I can't even remember the last time I actually sat down with my bible and just read it. Along with this, I have expanded the music I listen to to include things that a year ago I would listen to once and never listen to again. I mean, it is not like Satan Music or anything, but some of it has some language and some subject matter that is not appropriate for all ages. The thing is that I simply don't care. To me it is not really a big deal anymore. I like the music, so I listen to it. Is anyone that knows me and reading this disgusted with me yet? I could go on. I don't "witness" anymore and in fact, I get kinda mad whenever people do witness. Especially when it feels like they are trying to impose their "superior" religion on others. I don't listen to any sermons anymore because all I hear when I try to listen is a man trying to impress us with his superior knowledge and vocabulary. I make up excuses to miss church because I find it pointless and boring. Do you ever feel like you have no emotions? Because that is exactly how I am feeling at the moment...it is how I have been feeling for a while now. In fact, I can type all of this stuff about myself with a completely calm face and while eating pizza rolls because I have no emotions. I am a horrible person... Lisa

So, it's around 2:00 am and I am awake on my computer. Why? You may ask. Why, when you have to be at school at 7 o freakin clock in the morning? Well, let me explain. Reason # 1) Recently, my sleeping schedule and patterns have become highly irregular and spastic. And there is nothing I can do to control it. Before Spring Break, I had been going to bed at midnight every night and getting a healthy five hours of sleep. After Spring Break, I fall asleep around 9, wake up at 11, fall back asleep at midnight, wake up again at 3 am, and force myself back to sleep until around 5:30. Reason # 2) Today, it was more spastic than ever. I fell asleep around 7, woke up at 9, fell back asleep, woke up at 11. fell back asleep, woke back up around midnight and realized that Hey! My To Kill A Mockingbird essay is due tomorrow and I have not even written the intro or conclusion for it! So, I dragged myself out of bed, opened up a diet snapple, and started typing. Well, now that is done and I still have some math homework to do. But amazingly I am no longer tired. I don't know if it is because of the five hours or so of sleep I got earlier, but I know this is not healthy in the long run. Maybe I need to see a doctor. Reason # 3) I tend to think a lot when I am by myself. Part of the reason I am not tired anymore is because once I started typing my essay I started thinking about what life would be like if I went to TAMS next year and how I would find out that my writing really sucks and how I suck at transitions within my essay (as demonstrated by the judges at the district meet who wrote about my paper, "Your paper is very unclear. I lost track of what side you were on, as it seemed to shift many times...your paragraph transitions added to the confusion, and your lack of focus made the paper hard to read." and yet I got 4th place...what are these people thinking??) and I thought about that guy I wrote about long ago...the one at lunch, remember? Yeah him, the intriguing one...well, he sits with me and my group of people now instead of the other group that sits down the table from us because they kind of just stopped making room for him (sad I know). He helped me study today for my history test and was very amusing, as well as helpful. He also retains a myriad of useless facts...I found it quite interesting. I am getting off the subject...so...whenever I started typing, I started thinking, and now I am wide awake Reason # 4) Even if I tried to, I wouldn't be able to go back to sleep. I have reached this conclusion after nights of laying in bed for hours on end, counting sheep, slowing down my breathing, trying to clear my mind...only after three hours am I able to somehow force myself to drift to sleep and if I did that now it would be useless because I would be waking up two minutes after falling asleep. Do you see my predicament? I have insomnia. I need to see a doctor. So basically, that is all I have to write about. Because I have no life. Oh yeah, I was gonna turn in an application to McDonalds today (because they are hiring!) but then I fell asleep before my mom got home with the car. I need a car. That guy has close to $10,000 saved up for a car because he worked two jobs this summer full time and is also working close to full time now (or at least I think that is what he said). He also turns 17 next week but can't get his license because he says his parents hate him. I hope no one reads this that will know who I am talking about. Well, gtg. Lisa "Only two things are infinite- the universe and human stupidity- and I'm not sure about the former." -Albert Einstein

Same Spiral, Different Day And when I say spiral, I mean the spiral of thoughts about whether or not I will ever find Him. And when I say Him I mean, the one, the guy, my one true love...blissfulness.. And here comes the spiral. I think I live a pretty full life. I mean, I have a fair amount of people I would consider to be my friends. I hang out with them occasionally. I talk about the meaning of life and love with them. I have a job, I volunteer, I get good grades, I play tennis, I am going to go to TAMS. All in all, I am satisfied with my life. I am satisfied just being me, by myself, without someone to be with, in an intimate romantic kind of way...however, every night, when I lie down to go to sleep, there is that feeling of that something that is missing from my life. It is not something that can be filled by religion or studying or friends...it is that something that can only be filled by having someone you can really talk to (and I mean a guy, cuz it is not the same with just regular friends, and you know it) and be close to...by a relationship is what I think I mean. But every time I think I have met a guy who I could see myself getting close to, I some how screw it up and the situation gets awkward and silly. I have begun to think that perhaps I was just not made for this relationship stuff. If I cannot learn how to open up to someone and tell them how I feel, how will I ever be in a type of life long relationship in which you share everything with your spouse/someone special/whatever? Let me paste you some stuff from an online convo I had tonight with one of my friends: "anyway, i think that being single when everyone else around you has someone sucks...even if you are satisfied with yourself...and if you aren't, then you'll never be satisfied when you do get into a relationship...its like this quote i heard once about winning an olympic gold medal "If you're not enough without it, you'll never be enough with it." and if you have to lie about being single, then I do not think that necessarily means you are not satisfied with yourself, just that you wish you had someone which would bring us back to the beginning...oh i dunno...well, maybe it does...i dunno...im no expert." If you ever find that person to be with, do you know whether you would find yourself wanting more, or do you think that the feeling would be sated? BananaFroggie: Well, I can only hope...I would imagine that if all this true love malarky is actually real, then if you find that person to be with, then you would be satisfied being with that person forever...and I can only imagine how extremely content I would be...however, that is assuming that there is a person out there that is perfect for you. I am scared that there is no one for me, but I think that if I never did find that special guy, then I could make do with being single my whole life...if I had enough music, literature, movies, and games...but it wouldn't be the same. So I am hoping that one day that feeling of wanting the other half of me will be satiated, but as i have previously mentioned, i can only hope. I think that about sums it up. Good night (btw there are three new posts tonight) Signing Out, Lisa

School is out. Finally. After ten months of pointless and tedious torture, it is over. For me, I will never have to deal with the pettiness of high school ever again. And, as previously discussed in my blogs, I have very mixed feelings about it. I am so exited about going to tams that there is really no way to put it into words, which is the way any genuine emotion really is-wordless I mean. Just the thought of being out there on my own (sort of, I mean, I guess living in a dormitory isn't really completely on my own) and away from my house and family and studying things that actually have some kind of significance with what I am going to do with my life and taking classes that will require more than fifteen minutes of studying the period before to make a perfect score on the final....I just cannot wait. Plus all the people I will meet. College and tams people alike, I know that I will finally be able to shed my reputation of being shy and quiet and I will be unshy and outspoken... only to a certain degree of course, because I really value silence sometimes, but you get the idea... I am excited to break away from my suburban life of high school and boringness. On the other hand, I am deathly afraid of it all. I don't think I have to explain much on that one. And I will miss everyone soooo much. Even though I hate our school, as I was walking away for the last time, I knew that I would miss my lost two years of high school. And seeing everyone every day of school...sigh....but enough chat about this college thing.... Summer. Oh summer. Fall is my favorite time of the year, but summer comes in at a close second. Especially the mornings and evenings. I am not too fond of afternoons however. Summer afternoons seem dead to me. Like from 12-3, no one does anything, no one is online, everything is boring and dead and heat-sizzled. Unless you are working, or out at Six Flags or something, it is just a dead time of day. Fall however has no dead time of day. Perhaps that is why I like it so much. All day the weather is perfect and the air is crisp...ah Fall....but I digress. Summer! Yay, it is finally here. I bought a ticket to Van's Warped Tour yesterday. Anyone who wants to experience a day of great music and excellent moshing should definitely go. This past week has been one of the most stressful of this year. Working and school are hard to do at the same time. I worked Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday nights and then Thursday night I went to a concert. The other eight hours of the day I was at school. I never had time to study for my finals or do my homework until like 11:00 at night. I think I got only about four hours of sleep per night. Ha, but I still aced my finals cuz high school is gay!!! Today I helped my mom move stuff into another classroom for next year. That is the extent of my summer so far. Well, anyway, I really have nothing of interest to say. I just thought I would write something, because I haven't written at all lately because of a lack of time for sleep, studying, or anything really. There should be more than 24 hours in a day. I would find ways to fill them up. Like writing long blogs like this...which I can do because school is OUT!!!!! Below is a blog I wrote like a week and a half ago but just got around to publishing. It is basically about Ryan and why it didn't work out and never will. Lisa

I was pumped up for this thing. I was going to talk to Ryan. I was going to sign his yearbook. I was going to tell him (if only indirectly) that I wanted to keep in touch with him over the summer. I was going to look him in the eye and smile. I was going to FLIRT goshdarnit. Well, things don't always (or ever) go as planned... First of all, he got off of the bus wearing his athletic shorts and a t-shirt, bouncing the basketball around like he was "The Bomb" when obviously, he was not. I guess you would just have to know him to see what I mean when I say that he is not the athletic type of cool jock guy who shows off basketball skills... It made me embarrassed for him. But you know, i am just as big of a dork when it comes to things like that so I was not going to judge him, you know? So the guys went off to play basketball and the girls went off to play volleyball. Well, interesting side story here: I was diving for a ball to save the play and the game when: RIIPPPPPP...yup, my pants ripped....in the freakin CROTCH! (Ok, I know that only guys have crotches, but I don't know what to call it for the girls.) Luckily, only one guy was there and I don't really care about him all that much. But he laughed so hard at me, and apparently, he told everyone else about it later on. Well, I really didn't know what to do after that. I mean, I just couldn't walk around with a big hole in my crotch all day. So I timidly went up to our sponsor, Mrs. Anderson to ask her what to do. And what do you know. Right when I get there to tell her, the guys decide to end their basketball game and make their way over there. Well, I was not about to let Ryan see me with a big hole in my pants, so naturally, I stood facing away from them and whispered to Mrs. Anderson what my problem was. She understood, and got a teacher to drive me home so that I could change. Well, I did change, but in such short notice, the only thing I could find were the UGLIEST pair of shorts I own. So I changed into those and went back to the park. He was in the middle of a kick ball game when I got back so I went walking with my friends. Soon, the game ended and we all headed for the pavilion, where I was hoping to catch him by himself so that I could say hi to him. Well, catching him by himself proved harder than it seemed because he was CONSTANTLY SURROUNDED BY GIRLS. But I thought, hey, it is a free country, he is allowed to do what he wants, let him talk to girls, I don't care. Well, ok, then the guys went back to the courts to play some more basketball. Except this time they were joined by a pretty, athletic, intelligent, and popular girl named Ashley who is also what some may describe as a hoe. And of course, she used her powers for evil, not good. She would wrestle the ball away from the guys who of course were loving it, and every time she did something they liked, Ryan would give her a high-five/hug type thing. But I thought, Well, this is a game and he needs a way to congratulate his teammate...well, then I noticed that hey, Ashley was the only person he ever bothered to congratulate. After a while of watching this sick display of public congratulation, I decided to go help pick up trash with a few of my friends. Now, I am a pretty prideful person so when someone tells me i can't do something, i normally do it merely to disprove them...well, this is what I tried to do when JoAnn told me that I couldn't jump across the ditch. I suck at long jumping. Aw man, the mud smelled horrible, even after I washed it all off. I smelled like a piece of dog crap. This whole time i was thiking, Wow, do I ever know how to attract the guys...:). By the time I got done washing it all off, I realize that the entire group was gathered at the other end of the park for a game. Apparently, for this game everyone had to have a partner. So I watched as Ryan and Ashley chose each other as partners and were all laughing about it. By the time I got there, there were no partners left, so I had to sit out and watch. Past this point in the day, I stopped trying to keep track of Ryan. I found it unamusing and pointless and I just didn't care anymore. A while later, it was time to leave. I got on the bus and watched from the window as Ashley and him walked together, talked together, laughed together, and flirted together. Then of course, they chose my bus to get on. I will never know why they chose my bus and I will never know why he chose to sit in the seat directly behind me. But he did, and he purposely (or so it seemed) ignored me for the entire time. I was so annoyed with him...but secretly, I was probably more annoyed with myself for even ever thinking that I should go for this guy. Sigh...oh yeah, and God or fate or whatever has some kind of sense of humor because the next night I was out at the movies with my brother and who do I run into but good ole editor boy. Heh, he probably thought I was on some kind of date or something :). Well, he waved at me (probably only because he saw me looking at him) and I waved back at him. That was the last time we ever acknowledged each other this school year. Btw, I wrote most of this blog a long time ago but am just now getting around to finish it (it's May 31st now) so....that is why I say all this. Well, now for a new blog...

I am really going. This is so weird. I guess it didn't REALLY hit me until just today, when I got the information for the Summer Orientation in the mail. I am going to college, two years early, and leaving everyone I have grown to love behind. I didn't really let it soak in before that I am really going. This isn't just something I casually do on the side and throw on my transcript, this isn't some extracurricular activity, this is going to change my life...this is going to make me independent, this is going to put me in a position where I am out on my own and fighting for survival in the college world!!! And I am really going next year. I am really going to move away from this place that I have hated for so long, so long that I have grown to love it. Do you realize I haven't lived anywhere else my ENTIRE life?!?! This is going to be a great experience, but I still just cannot believe that I am really going, and that I am really doing it. I am out there making it happen...And I still don't even know what I want to do with my life...and I still don't even know what I really believe. And I still don't even completely understand myself. Is this how all people feel when they move away from home for the first time? Sigh...I am kinda scared I guess...I mean, anyone would be, but...man, this is just weird to think about...I must stop it. Anyway, yesterday night my friend Ashley and I were talking out on my driveway and I got her to tell me about the guy she likes. Well, I asked her why and then she said something to the effect of : "Have you ever felt like you had a connection with someone you hadn't even talked to or that you didn't know well at all?" and I just stared at her and was like, "That is exactly how I feel." I mean, I know that my nonverbal communication has told Ryan that I am interested in him, because I am so blatantly obvious when it comes to liking guys...the thing is that his nonverbal communication says the same thing, if I am reading it correctly. He seems almost nervous around me and he is not nervous around any other girls that I know of, of course, I don't really know him that well...When we do talk, he smiles just as much as I do...the first time we talked, his hands were shaking as he was typing up some news writing rules for me...It just seems like he acts much in the same way I do towards him...but I dunno, I could just be getting the wrong vibes from him...but, anyway, I do feel that connection that Ashley talked about...like, even before we ever spoke, I knew that he noticed me and I am fairly confident that he knew that I noticed him and then after we did officially meet, there has always been some tacit connection...but perhaps I just make stuff up. Yeah, that is probably what it is. Gosh, I am a retard. Heh, but I am not afraid anymore. I know exactly what I am going to write in his yearbook :) . If I ever get to sign it that is...and I plan on doing so tomorrow....ahhhhh.....this is so confusing...oh well, I am going to go now...I will write later, if circumstances permit. Lisa

Ok, so, I guess I should update all of you who are just dying to know what is going on in my life (ok, so I am being sarcastic, so shoot me The last time I updated this was the night of the concert that really sucked. So I won't write about that except to say that it....really sucked, so there ya go. Saturday....oh what a night...haha! It was sooo fun! It kinda sucked at first because we had lawn tickets. We snuck up to the front but we were caught and almost kicked out of Smirnoff...but oh well. The Riddlin' Kids rocked....again! They get better and better each time you see them play live. MxPx had some mad mosh pits going on that I was a part of. Talk about getting a work-out. And talk about the hot sweaty, shirtless guys that kindly help you up when you fall down...heh, good times, good times...the music was amazing during the first two I mentioned, Good Charlotte, and New Found Glory. Excellent stuff, let me tell ya. I mean, wow! Sigh, that night will live in infamy...so much fun...except for the part where some ppl stole our stuff. I lost a poster, Olivia lost her t-shirt. Sunday morning when I woke up, I felt like a ton of bricks had hit my head, so I slept through church. Oops. Then I went to work. I came home and worked on my gay English project until 2:30 and then went to bed. I woke up late and still had to print out some stuff but my brother had screwed up my mom's computer so my mom told me to just drive myself to school so I go outside and....our car is missing!!!! So I was late that morning and my teacher STILL made me get a tardy pass even though I explained to her that I didn't have a FREAKIN CAR to get to school!!! They have no emotions, I'm telling you. Well, I told everyone at school that our car was stolen and they were all like, "Wow" Well, I get home to find out that it was gone because my mom hadn't paid some money on it and so they towed it. Now, we have to move to a cheaper house because my mom has to use her tax return to pay to get her car back rather than pay her property tax...I have such good role models for parents... :) Today, I did not really have a good day, but I am trying to remain positive so I'll just leave you with that I am extremely tired and have been so for a while now...seriously....I am so tired. I need sleep. Well, I must go now and sleep! Lisa

Once again, I am in a melancholy mood...and I am so confused. About pretty much everything in my life. I am tying to figure out whether or not there is any point in liking Ryan anymore. Not that deciding there is no point could alter my emotions, but I wish it could. He just seems so.....well, I can't even really think of a word that I want to use that won't make it seem like some elementary crush...which I guess is what it is anyways, since I have no experience with guys at all but still....someone said something today that really connected with me. This one guy said that what he liked about the girl he liked was how her personality and her honesty relaxed him. You know, like to escape from the stress and current of his life, he talked to the girl, and all his problems seemed kind of dim. Or at least, that is how I took it. I suppose I can apply that a little to my situation, except that I don't really get to talk to him much. But just talking to him is calming I suppose. And he is just so nice and intelligent and still has such a great sense of humor, personality, and taste in music. Of course, this is pointless and I don't know why I torture myself so. He probably has a girlfriend, and if he doesn't, I don't see how anyone like him could ever have feelings for anyone like me. I hold myself in such low esteem...However, I did talk to him again yesterday, and it was cool, although I have a feeling that I was completely transparent about liking him during the entire thing because I was really nervous, blushing, and couldn't stop smiling. He was smiling too (very cute smile, I might add) but I don't think it was because he found what I said amusing or that he liked me. I think it was a pity smile, yes, that is it. It was a pity smile. God, I'm stupid. I just feel like screaming into my pillow or hitting myself in the head and yelling, "Idiot! Idiot! Idiot!" heh, and I actually did do that today in the car...Dunja found it rather dangerous... :) There are other things that I am confused about, but I am sooo tired and I don't feel like getting into them tonight.
