I will write later. Lisa

I have been very busy lately. This is why I have not gotten to write for a while. I keep thinking about whether or not I want to leave next year. In so many ways, I do. And I know that I will. But there are sooo many things that I am going to miss! All of my friends, all of my aquaintances, my school (the one thing I want to escape from above all others). I guess it is kind of like being a Senior and realizing that you have to leave your childhood behind...except that I know that I wouldn't have to leave if I didn't want to and...things will go on with everybody long after I leave. I would be willing to wager that after the first couple of weeks, people would quit asking what happened to me and go on with their school lives without ever thinking of or remembering me. It is kinda sad. But I promised myself a long time ago that I would not let my emotions get in the way of me capitalizing on opportunities, so I guess that I am stuck with going...of course, I want to. I just know that I will miss everyone. Anyways, enough of that... My new job is quite exciting. I have started saying things like, "Have a nice day," to my friends at school out of habit. But really, I get to meet some interesting people...if not so intelligent. One time this lady and this middle-eastern guy came through my line and the lady was like, "He's from Germany" and then he was like, "Yes, I am from Germany." He sounded like Apu from The Simpsons. And then the lady said something like, "We have come to free the Texas. They are the least free out of any of the states." I was just like, "Right....." They said some more weird stuff and then left, thankfully, because they creeped me out. Then one time, this old lady came up to me and was like, "What would you do if I said 'Smile! You're on candid camera!'" And I was like, "Right....." I didn't know what to say! She creeped me out too. But I get a work out. I think by the end of the summer, my right arm will be hauss-like. The people that work there are pretty interesting also. Let's see...Austin was really quiet the first day but the second day, really talkative and he got arrested a while back for drug pocession...David is a unique individual. He thinks that I am a good bagger. That is good. Oh yeah, and Spencer found out that it was me that rolled his house! And I don't know how! Well, I kind of do but I don't know how he got the url to me website or WHY he went there! He and Matt both saw it on my website when I practically confessed to rolling his house. I tried to deny it, but I really suck at lying so it didn't hold up for very long. Well, that is all that has been going on lately. Bye Lisa

I got in!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Sorry this I took so long to write one of these telling all of you who didn't already know (no one in other words)....but I got into TAMS...I got the envelope yesterday. Anyways, I am very happy and excited...however.... My parents are the most pessimistic people I know (Now you know where I get it from). Because of budget cuts in the state of Texas and the school district that TAMS was in, the cost for me to go to school there next year will be about $4,800 for room and board plus about $1,000 for tuition...which is not a whole lot considering normal tuition for a year at UNT is anywhere from $6,000-$8,000. Anyways, once I get financial aid, I think the cost should be considerably lower AND I am working full time this summer to earn anywhere from $1500-$2000 to chip in. However, all my parents see is the $5,800 total and are being sooooooooooooo pessimistic about it all. My dad was more supportive over all (which is weird, if you know how my dad's mind works when it comes to money) but he still just was so difficult. I explained to him that he wouldn't have to pay that much because the cost would be split between me, my mom, him, and the financial aid people....but noooooooooooooooooooooooo....he just kept saying things like, "Well, you don't understand, this is a lot of money. I don't want to have to put a $400 deposit down if we are not even going to be able to afford it. I told him, "Look Dad, if we can't afford it, I'll make it happen...I'll sell my computer, my stereo, all of my furniture...I'll work two jobs this summer and I'll get enough money to go if you don't think that you can handle the costs!" And he was like, "Well, I know this means a lot to you..." So in the end, after much complaining and about three readings of every letter and form I got in the mail, he wrote out a check for my deposit. I can't say I was mad at him for being doubtful about the money because I see his point. I just don't think he understands how incredibly determined I am to get out of this place and be out on my own. I am going crazy here. The thing that made me mad is whenever he started talking about college... "You know, college isn't like high school." "I know, Dad." "You won't just be able to make all a's and not study that much." "Yeah, I know." "Cuz I went into college thinking it was just going to be a breeze and I was slapped in the face...blah blah blah blah blah.....and then I figured out that I wasn't as smart as I thought I was and that I actually had to spend hours studying...blah blah blah blah.....I ended up taking five years to get my Bachelor's....blah blah blah..." Man, I just wanted to scream, "I AM NOT YOU!" And then he went on to Jason, my oldest brother. "Jason was just as smart as you when he was in high school and he had a difficult time adjusting to college classes because they were sooo much harder than high school classes and he only has a gpa of a 2.6 and blah blah blah blah blah blah..." I'M NOT JASON EITHER!!!!! And really, I made a higher score than Jason did on his SAT and I am a freakin SOPHOMORE who hadn't even taken Algebra II when I took the test. And my grades are much higher than his...I am not saying that I am so much smarter than him but I am not stupid enough to let my grades drop below a 2.5....I have to keep them above a 3.0 to stay in the freakin school anyway!!!!!!!!!!! And then came to comparison to Matthew, the next oldest to me. This was in response to when I said that I would work full time this summer and donate all my money to paying for me to go there. "You know, Matthew said that he would get a job this year and help pay for his college, but I have yet to see a dime from him....blah blah blah blah....so I can't count on Mom, I can't count on you, I can't count on Matthew....blah blah blah blah..." I ALREADY HAVE A FREAKING JOB THAT I TOLD YOU ABOUT FIFTEEN FREAKIN SECONDS AGO!!!!! I'm getting about 30 hours a week when SCHOOL IS STILL IN...I'll probably get a heck of a lot more during the summer!!! And plus... I'M NOT MATTHEW!!!!!!! Matthew is a slacker and irresponsible...He is about to turn 19 and he has never even had a job!!!!! He was smart enough to graduate in at least the top ten percent, but he chose to not CARE!!!!!!!!! I AM NOT HIM! AND I AM CERTAINLY NOT NOT NOT NOT NOT NOT MY MOM!!!!!! I am not ANY of my family. Period. I am not, nor do I want to be like ANY of them. That might seem mean, but there are just no traits in my family, save for my brothers' sense of humor, that I want. I can't help it if my mom filed bankruptcy and had her friend steal all of my brother's money. THAT DOESN'T FREAKIN MEAN THAT MY DAD SHOULDN'T BE ABLE TO TRUST ME!!!!!!!! AHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!! !!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! So anyways, that is my frustration with being tied to my family. Oh yeah, and any money that my Dad gives me for this, I have to pay back. But I don't mind. I will go to TAMS, if it means taking two full time jobs this summer, selling everything in my room, and begging on the streets for money. That is how determined I am. C ya. Lisa

Hmmmmmmmm Still thinking about what to think about last night. Hmmmmmmmm So I woke up yesterday morning and decided that I needed to just relax about the whole thing, I mean, it was just going to be a concert and I shouldn't look like I was trying too hard or anything, so in the end, I just decided on wearing my nfg t shirt with some nice comfortable jeans...very me in other words. and then I added some of my own accessories. But ANYway... Jennifer called around 12:45, wanting to know if I would go to the mall with her for like an hour and so I said yes and we went to the mall and I bought some stuff at The Icing's 10 for $5 sale, so that was cool, and then I went back home and finished cleaning my room and whatnot. I then made my way over to Olivia's. The band that we were going to see was one from our school with a lot of people she knew in it. Her ex-boyrfriend, his best friend that used to like her, and a couple of other guys. It was like their first show at a real venue or something. She had decided a while ago that we were not going to drive ourselves, we were going to get a ride with Alex, one of their good friends, so that it would be easier in general just finding the place and finding people to hang out with. So, we were going to ride with Alex. Online, an hour before we get picked up, Alex is on. And he tells Olivia about everyone that is going to be riding with him. Me, Olivia, Suzanne, and....Ryan?!?!? What? When did this happen? So there is me sitting in Olivia's room, trying to not show that this new information kinda shakes me up, cause you know, I was not expecting this. Sooooo, I decided that plain old me wasn't good enough anymore and straightened my hair (so it would not look as if it was about to attack somebody :) ) and put on a little makeup (::gasp::) and tried to reassure myself that it was not that big of a deal, which it wasn't, but I make a big deal out of things that are not, soooo.... Alex got here, and we got in the car, and Ryan flashed one of those really flattering smiles, and we all said hey to each other and stuff...it was pretty routine I guess so far. I of course said something extremely weird and random on the way there, and Ryan just turned around and went, "Huh?" But he was smiling so it was all good....I think it was something about how if I put eyeshadow on my younger brother and he grew his hair out, he would look like a girl....something to that effect I am sure.... So, Dreamworld. Big warehouse-looking thing with sign that says "Dreamworld." Looking around I think, Wow, if there was a bad side of Arlington, this would be it. And it's on Division Street, so I guess it is in what is officially considered "the bad part of town." There were many people there from Summit, lots that I knew and for like an hour and a half, all we did was sit around in the parking lot and hang out, talking, listening to some guys play guitar...it was cool...I met some really interesting people and just liked hanging out with them all. I mainly stayed with Olivia and Suzanne the whole time, but sometimes I would just be by myself with a group of people that I either didn't know, or had just met. I didn't really talk to Ryan all that much, but...I didn't really have much to say to him, so...how could I have talked to him a lot? Good question, I know. I watched him play the guitar for a bit, and he is pretty good I think. Ok, so by this time, I have already realized that I am not HALF as cool as the least coolest person here, besides myself. Everyone is so witty and funny, and I am...not. But it is fun just listening to them and laughing! Anyway, so the band finally went on at 9:30 ish and played for about 30 minutes and then everyone left again and hung out in the parking lot some more. At one point, this freaky goth-looking guy came up to me, got in my face, and was like, "Hellooo..." in a really creepy kind of way. I was by myself, kinda away from the crowd, so I was just kind of like, "Ummm....hey." and walked around him...heh, and apparently Ryan had seen the whole thing cuz he came up to me and was like, "I think you handled that pretty well." "Yes, yes, I thought so too." "It's like...maybe if I don't make any sudden movements, he'll go away..." Heh, yeah...so, I sat with Olivia, and she was getting rather quiet herself, because next to me, she is the one that is most a non-part of the group we are with. So, we just sat there for a while and then Alex and Ryan came and started talking to us, and then they left, and then Olivia and Suzanne talked about how Ryan had all these girls all over him and how he could probably get any one he wanted, which left me thinking about how if he did, he would never like me, so what is the point of all this pointless pointless CRAP....? But I digress.... Then everyone decided to go to Craig's house to hang out afterwards. On the way there, Olivia and Suzanne had to stop by the theatres because they work there and had to request something. While they were inside, Alex and Ryan were like, "Hey, this is a fire lane, so we can't park here." and so they started driving back and forth in front of the theatre like ten times...it was funny. Then one of the workers came outside and stopped us and was like, "Can I interest you in purchasing some movie tickets?" heh. Then these Mexican duded thought Ryan had flipped them off and so threatened him...wow, that was interesting. So then we all go to Craig's house. I don't know much about these people right now, so I am sitting there thinking, Please don't let this be one of those smoking drinking party-type things...Please! We get to the front door, and Craig is like, "Anyone want a drink?" and I am like Crap. Haha, but then he is like, "We have water and umm....lemonade." Yessssss...these are all clean people that don't get into that kinda crap. Even though they are about the funniest people I have ever known. Oh yeah, sidenote here. Craig apparently knew me by both first name and last...and I had never met the guy before. I asked him how he knew my name and he said something about being in uil with me...I felt really bad because I had never heard of the guy before, and he knew me!!! But how? Well yeah, UIL, but...I never met him...I never talked to him...so just how exactly does he know my name again? Hmmm I dunno, but it was interesting I guess. Right so, more people got there and then we all decided to go out to eat...Steak N Shake is like the only place open at 11:30 at night so we went there...and that of course was very fun. Because everything these people say is hilarious...I really don't understand how a person can be so funny!! Maybe it is just because I am the biggest nerd in the world, but I had never laughed so much in one night before. Ryan as well, btw, he cracked me up so much. And I didn't crack anyone up...save for maybe Olivia, but that is because we have inside jokes and whatnot...well, anyway, after that, we went home and I spent the night at Olivia's. She agreed with me that they are a lot of fun to hang out with, but she doesn't feel like a complete part of the group or whatever. She says that it really just takes time and hanging out with them a few times before you really get comfortable making your own jokes and stuff, because really you are just afraid that no one will find it funny, but really, they are not mean and someone would pretend to think it was funny. Heh. In conclusion, yeah I might still like him, but he will never like me, and I should just stop pretending that he might. See my point? And I wish I was a witty, funny person now. Perhaps some day... -Lisa

Some days you have good tennis days, and some days you have CRAP...lol, but it is ok because I am in a good mood. I think the reason I did not play well today is that many things were on my mind and I could not relax and focus on just hitting the ball...so I lost my first match to a girl that I placed above in the last tournament by much...and the girl that got first in today's tournament was a girl I beat in my first match last week...*sigh* but oh well... So, afterwards, I called JoAnn (after I called Fifer of course....GET HOME SOOOOONNNN!) and she invited me to an outing with her, Naomi, and Bethany (the old group...we are not dead!!). So we went to the mall and saw Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle, something I had never even given a second thought about seeing...but they are all those kinda girly and hyper girls, so it is something they enjoyed...well, except for maybe Bethany, but that is just because she said it is not as "realistic" as the first one (I was like, "Um, the first one was...not exactly realistic itself..."). Anyway, it was fun. Even though I am not as crazy and hyper as them, I kinda prefer it that way. I gave a kind of sanity to the group. Besides, some of it was immature in a way. Not that I am judging them or anything, just explaining why I wasn't like them :). We had some time to spare after we bought our tickets like an hour and a half early...so we went shopping a bit. Now, I wanted to go to the book store, but apparently, all of my friends have decided never to go to the book store with me because I spend "too much time in there." and since I was outnumbered three-to-one, I had to go to Charlotte Russe with them and look at underwear...oh man, was this ever interesting. Now, I don't want to get too personal here, or give more information than is wanted, but...gosh! I don't understand how girls can wear thongs and feel comfortable!!! Furthermore, they are made of an amount of cloth that is worth perhaps a nickel and they are $3-$6 a piece!!! Is that not the craziest thing you have ever heard??? Heh, but in the end, after many "Oh, this one reminds me of you, Lisa," or "Oh, you like these colors right? AND it has a butterfly!!" I ended up being conned into buying two. These people go out like every week and buy tons of them. Craziness, I am telling you. Well, after we got out of there, I was like, "So on to the book store!!!!" which was inevitably met with a resounding, "Noo!!" I need to find some good nerdy friends :) :). But, anyway, it was all great fun. They make me laugh so hard, when I just observe them being crazy and hyper, and when I add in my own remarks that are so much in contrast to theirs that they just stare at me in unbelief...a good kind of unbelief, mind you. And I laugh whenever JoAnn screams every time someone touches her neck, and when Naomi makes dirty jokes (Because I never thought she would!), and when me and Bethany argue about who is fatter. Plus, JoAnn had Finch in her cd player (good screaming music :) ) and me and her head banged and screamed at the parts where they scream. Bethany and Naomi didn't know the music, but it was all good, cuz they laughed at us. Naomi and I talked more about what we are going to do with our dorm room...she read through the handbook and found out that street signs are banned at tams!!! seriously!!! they have the weirdest rules...but our room will be the best by far. Oh, and this morning I opened my own bank account!!! Score, huh? Well, I'm off. Big day ahead of me. Learning standard, getting a tan, going to Dreamworld, seeing Ryan....I feel a long blog coming on tomorrow...longer than this one anyway... "I don't wanna wait til tomorrow Yesterday's gone Tomorrow never knows (goes?) Today will never be the same again." -Jibe -Lisa

Wellll...since blogger has been really gay lately (yes, I think it likes other blog-hosting sites), this blog should be like three days worth into one. However, now I cannot remember all that I wanted to write about so I guess I'll just wing it. Lessee.... Tuesday I went to Six Flags with Olivia and her younger brother and sister. That was ok, we were stuck riding the rides they wanted to which were like...the texas tornado (big swings), the sombrero...and such....hmm...but we left there kinda early and then me and Olivia went to see Alex and Emma for free cuz she works at the theatres now. Then I spent the night at her house. I had so much fun tho, she is one of the funnest people to hang out with. It was like 2 AM and EVERYthing made us double over with laughter...it was great...Oh, and we were talking to people online and then Ryan got on and said that he was going to be going to the same concert as us on Saturday, so that should be incredibly interesting...I just hope I don't screw up the opportunity or anything ;). Wednesday and today I just worked...and I must say, customers have begun to piss me off...some of them are soo....gah, I can't even think of a word to describe them...last night, this guy, Darius told this woman he hoped she had a wonderful evening and she was like, "No, you talk too much and you take too long." It was so rude, and Darius was just trying to be nice. And then this other time, this old man came through Jennifer's line and for some reason he was gonna get this cake for free, but Jennifer couldn't read the note that our manager scrawled on it, so she just scanned it. The old man came back and was like, "EXCUSE ME, I was NOT supposed to get charged for this." and Jennifer, smiling and trying to be as hospitable as possible said, "I'm sorry, Sir, I couldn't read the note there." and he was like, "Well, MAYBE they should hire people that know how to read." and left. I mean, honestly, the mistake would take about five seconds to fix at Customer Service and he has to be all....that word I can't think of. And then there are always the classic people that are all, "Hey, those were $1.59 NOT $1.55!!!! GET YOUR MANAGER OVER HERE. I get those for free don't I? You had better give them to me for free." Yes, customers can be very trying sometimes...some are cool though. Today, one of our floor supervisors, Stephanie, had some blank bags and started making her own store slogans...like "Kroger...You don't care about us, so we don't care about you." or "Kroger...Where the customers get on our damn nerves." or or...." Kroger...Where our customers ask 50 million stupid questions a day" One of the first was "Kroger...Our customer service really sucks, and our prices are even worse." LOL and they were funny because they are so true! Haha, some of them were sooo freakin hilarious, it was great. I wanted to get one and hang it on my wall, but I don't know what they did with them...oh well. Well, that's it...see, blogger sucks...if I had gotten to write the blogs right after the day I experienced them, they would be better....I wonder if the new improved version lets my archives be available...shall check now... Oh, the word I'm looking for is a mixture of pretentious, anal, immature, and inconsiderate....anyone know of a word to encompass all of those? Let me know if you do. I can actually think of a couple of words that might do it....heh...but I won't go there...well, bye. Lisa

Sometimes I wish that some things are that aren't and that some things aren't that are... Today all I did was go to the equestrian center and then go cd shopping with Leah. The CD Warehouse is probably the coolest place I have ever been. So many good CDs that are so cheap! And they buy CDs from you! CDs I bought today: The Used The Ataris-Anywhere but Here The Starting Line-Say It Like You Mean It Mest- umm can't find album name Sugarcult-Start Static The Verve Pipe-Villains And they were all only $38....ok, ok, so I know I said I would not waste any more of my money....but....They were beckoning to me!!!! Seriously! How can you be in a place with cheap good music and not buy any??? But, from now on, no more wasting money for Lisa...and someone please remind me of when I said this when I decide to go shopping again so I can leave all my money at home. :) It is funny how going music shopping can remind you of so many people. Namely when I found the cd of the band called "Slow Children At Play." I laughed sooo hard! Not because of the name mind you, but because that is what Naomi decided to name her band, and it was seriously just a random whim of hers...it strikes me as extremely funny that another person had the exact same random whim and capitalized on the idea. Oh and then there was Incubus (Fifer) and They Might Be Giants (J-Chan) and Switchfoot (Sarah...your makeout music...LoL)....Anyway, it was tons of fun. Leah insisted on going through EVERY single cd in the pop/rock section, but it was all good. We got free slurpees from 7-11 and the lady was really rude. I think she started cussing at us under her breath...but oh well. Y'know, I think that gay guys are some of the sweetest people out there. Now, I don't know if it is all of them, but the one that I know personally is so nice to me. In the past week he has called me cute, smart, sweet, and strong...all at different times...and it is so random when he gives me a compliment. He'll just be standing there checking or something and then randomly say something like, "Lisa, you are one-of-a-kind....aw, you're blushing how cute." If he wasn't gay, I would think he was hitting on me :). So yeah, that is interesting...I don't even really know why I am writing about this, I guess it is just that there is not much new happening since it is summer...not many people to interact with as there are at school. I miss hanging out with all of them...I am gonna see Olivia tomorrow and I plan on going to Dreamworld with JoAnn sometime...but I just don't talk to some of them anymore...hmm...I haven't talked to Fifer since like a week ago...I think I shall call her tomorrow. Now I really am just rambling. Man, I wish someone was here to tell me to shut up. Haha, but no one is so I shall continue...besides, this is my blog and I really don't have anything else I could be doing because it is midnight...well, I guess I could finally start unpacking some of my stuff...hehe...Ok, I seriously need something to write about. Let me look around my room for inspiration...ah, I know... Amy, my best friend...one thing that has always amazed me is how two people that are so completely different could just click like we do. We have known each other our entire lives, and although both of us have taken two drastically different paths in life, it seems like we have always stood on the same ground, and have always understood each other perfectly. However, it saddens me how after the beginning of this upcoming school year, we will probably see less of each other than we ever have before. I will be away at college, she will be busy having a baby...and getting married...gosh, and it is such a young age for her to do so...but I always joke with her about how both of us found a way to get out of high school early...they were just two completely different ways :). I like to think that no matter what happens in our lives, we will always be best friends. But even this year was difficult for us to keep ties with each other. People just change with time I suppose...hmm...interesting how that works... Well, I guess that is it. I really could find more useful things to do like unpack or read or something. Both of which I have not done in quite some time... Lisa

So, today was interesting. I worked from 7-3 which was kinda fun because the first 4 hours went by so quickly but then my entire body was aching from literally giving everything I had at the tennis tournament yesterday. After work I went to the horse handling classes at the All Star center. I really enjoy working with horses. With dogs and cats, when you talk to them, they usually just look at you as if you are speaking some foreign language or something. However, when you talk to horses, they look at you seeming to say "Yes, I understand what you are saying, and i sympathize with you." There is more of a connection I guess. And it is just really cool working with animals three times my size. After the classes I came home and hung out with my family for a bit. It was Matthew's birthday so we all had cake and his girlfriend came over and we watched some Japanese extreme sports or something...it was pretty funny. Then I went to my dad's house. I feel really bad. Tonight his cousin Keith was over there with his 20-year-old daughter, Andrea. Well, Andrea is gorgeous, and she has been gogeous for as long as I can remember. She's always had all these beauty pageant trophies and stuff...well, I hadn't seen her in about three years...she had changed a lot. She smokes now and drinks a lot and has a belly button ring and a tattoo...all of which does not detract from how naturally beautiful she is, but still...well, anyway, back to why I felt bad... When Andrea left, she gave her dad a huge hug and kiss on the cheek and said "I love you." and whatnot. Now, if you know anything at all about the relationship I have with my dad, you KNOW that I am not like that. I feel very awkward around him for the most part. Our relationship never has been so great since I found out in the 7th grade about the crap he did to my mom. That is when i think I started hating him. I hated him for like a year before I finally found it in my heart to just forgive him and accept what had happened...but things are still kind of weird between us. So, whenever I went to leave, he came over and gave me a big hug and I hugged him back, and he said, "I love you." No matter how hard I try, I have not been able to say that to my dad for as long as I can remember. Tonight was no exception. I just said, "See ya later." and walked out the door. I could feel Keith watching us and smiling in victory because him and Andrea have a good relationship. I felt bad, but....I just can't do it...and I really hope it isn't because I don't love my dad, because I do...I think...or at least, I hope so... Btw, Jennifer (not Lemmers in case Fifer or J-chan happens to read this one day) is making me very upset. She threw a party Friday night and used me for a lot of stuff and THEN she tells me like five minutes before I have to leave to go there that she decided to invite Spencer (my ex) and his new girlfriend. How nice of her. ugh, she can be really cool, but she also knows how to be the most insensitive, annoying person. She was so rude about it too....Must let go of resentment and remember that we are all not perfect...ok, remembering...forgiving...maybe...ahhh!!!!!!!!! Well, anyway, I am still dead tired and it is late once again...so I will go now. "the things you make me wanna do I'd rob a quik-e-mart for you" -the ataris Lisa

Hey everyone...I saw J-chan's blog and how he put his quiz answers on it sooo....I am stealing his idea because I have nothing better to do and I thought it had some interesting questions. YOUR NAME (1) The singular boring question: What is your name? Lisa (2) If you had been born a member of the opposite sex, what would your name have been? I believe my mom told me once that I would have been an Aaron, but I dunno... (3) Would you name a child of yours after you? Not really (4) If you had to switch first names with a friend of yours, who would you switch with? Leah. I like the name Leah. (5) What's the way people most often mispronounce any part of your name? People often try to pronounce my last name as Wa-oo-ters...I am assuming because of the silent U in there... (6) If you were to become famous, would you drop your last name (like Madonna, Cher, Roseanne)? I will never become famous. DEEP THEOLOGICAL QUESTIONS (7) Do you believe in the traditional view of Heaven and Hell? What is meant by traditional? And probably not anymore, to be entirely truthful. (8) Do you think God has a gender? Don't know if what God is could be considered a gender... (9) Do you think science counteracts religion? Albert Einstein once said, "Science without religion is lame and the religion without science is blind." Soo, I guess the answer would be...it depends...on what one means by religion. (10) Do you believe in organized religion? Haha, sensitive subject for me. I am tempted to say NO in capital letters, but I will refrain and just say that maybe there is some organized religion church out there that could defy what I think of organized religion at the present moment in time. (11) Where do you think we go when we die? Good question. Maybe heaven. It sounds like a rather nice place, don't ya think? (12) Do you feel a little funny thinking about the questions in this section? No not really...I do not think I have fully realized yet that I will one day die...Even typing that gives me chills down my spine. :) HUMOR (13) How easy is it to make you laugh? I laugh more than anyone I know about the stupidest things. (14) What person you know makes you laugh the most? hmmm...i dunno, everyone is funny in their own way, however, Chris Farley has never once failed to make me laugh, no matter how many times I watch one of his skits...oh wait, but I don't know him...umm...skip this question. (15) Do you laugh at jokes you know you shouldn't? I try not to...but sometimes, I just cannot help it. (16) Do you tell jokes you know you shouldn't? Probably not. Unless the mathdebate joke counts...(say it three times fast...yeah, I know, it's stupid...GOSH see this is what I mean....laughing at immature things :) ) (17) What words instantly make you laugh or at least smile? Embrocate!! (18) What do you think is the funniest thing you've ever said or written? I do not recall MUSIC (19) Do you ever dance to music when nobody's watching? All the time. (20) What is/are the worst song(s) you have ever heard? Pretty much all techno...and most of rap...sorry guys, but I just don't see the point of mechanized music. (21) What song(s) do you wish you could understand a little better? Well, Letter Twelve has beautiful music, but when the guy starts...umm..."singing"...all I hear is a guy yelling...so, maybe those lyrics? (22) What song(s) are constantly in your head? It varies. Usually a song that I listened to the previous night. Today it was "I Remember you" by the Ataris (who else?) (23) What song(s) do you think describe your personality best? Right now, "My Sundown" by Jimmy Eat World...it just makes me think of the future and the opportunities before me and leaving behind my past. That is directly connected to my personality somehow. (24) If you were to serenade the object of your affections, which song(s) would you use? oh, there are a few...lemme look real quick. Ok, "Do I Love You..." from the Cinderella Broadway Soundtrack, "Love Theme" from Braveheart (even tho it has no words, the music speaks worlds of emotion), and "Come What May" from the Moulin Rouge soundtrack. Oh yeah, and how could I forget? "Walking After You" by the Foo Fighters. Oh, AND "I Wanna Grow Old With You" by Adam Sandler (The Wedding Singer soundtrack)... (25) If the object of your affections were to serenade you, what song(s) would you hope he or she used? Any of the above :) :)...of course, it would also be nice if said object of my affections would compose/write a song unique to their feelings for me ;) MOVIES (26) What movie(s) do you love that nobody else seems to? umm I liked the move "Pi" LOL j/k...probably, well, I dunno...I do not think I like any movies that are just absolutely hated by everyone else. (27) Do you agree with the idea that sequels are always worse than the original? Definitely. Name one that is not, and I will give you a dollar... (28) Who's your favorite Star Wars character? I always had a crush on Luke. He was so ambitious...*sigh* (29) What kind of movie do you think there should be more of? Ones that make you think...or cry...or both. As of today there are only three movies that have made me cry, and those three are my favorites...so, there should be more good movies like that...Oh no, wait, I lied...four...The Lion King also makes me cry. (30) What movie(s) do you simply not understand the appeal of? "Me, Myself, and Irene." There is a distinction between being funny and being plain disgusting...that movie crossed the line in many ways. FOOD (31) When eating, are you more concerned with taste or healthiness? Taste. Although I often look back at the health-quality of the food I eat and feel regretful... (32) What's your favorite kind of cheese? Mozarella (33) What do you think your answer to the previous question reveals about your personality? That I like Mozarella cheese. (34) If you knew exactly what went into Chinese food, hamburger meat, etc., would you still eat it? Yeah, prolly, unless it was like...super disgusting or something... (35) Do you ever feel guilty eating meat? No...although sometimes I do look at a piece of meat and say to myself, "This used to be a living, breathing animal." But then I just squish my conscience into the back of my mind and dig in. COMPUTERS (36) Mac or PC? PC (37) How much do you actually care about the inner workings of your computer? I actually wish I knew how everything worked in a computer...of course, that is probably only because mine SUCKS and I want a better computer. (38) Do you ever begin preferring IMs to other forms of conversation? Haha, seems that way sometimes :) but no, not really...I much liked talking to Ryan better in person than on the internet...so much nonverbal communication that goes on that is soo much funner (yes, I know it's not a word) than "emoticons" (39) Do you find you're different talking through IMs than face-to-face or on the telephone? Yeah, I am more talkative online and more inclined to try to be funny...but, it rarely works... (40) Have you ever ended bid on something on eBay and regretted it later? No, never got into the ebay thing. THE BATTLE OF THE SEXES (41) Have you ever wished you could experience being the other gender? Actually, no. Well, maybe I did when I went through my tom-boy phase, but I never really wanted to be a guy... (42) What do you love most about the other gender? How some of them can make you feel so...perfect...like you could live forever...or that your happiness would never end. (43) What do you dislike most about the other gender? How those same ones can turn around and make your life a living hell. And make you feel the worst you've ever felt. (44) What do you understand least about the other gender? ummm....EVERYTHING...but one thing more than all the others....If you don't like me, why do you flirt with me?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!? CELEBRITIES (45) Do you sometimes see a movie or watch a show just because a good-looking celebrity is in it? Ha, occasionally... (46) What celebrity's autograph do you want most? I really don't place value on signatures...but, if I had to choose...oh I dunno...how about good ole Ewan...Star Wars boy...he would be fun to get the signature of. (47) Have people ever said you looked like a celebrity, and if so, who? Nope (48) If there was to be a movie about you, who do you think should play you (in personality, looks or both)? I think Sandra Bullock could maybe pull it off...if she were younger...and not so pretty. (49) Does it ever annoy you when you know someone is a celebrity but you can't remember why? That has never happened to me before. (50) If you could enter any celebrity's mind like in "Being John Malkovich", whose would you enter? God's....haha, just kidding...he's not much of a celebrity...probably Jim Carrey...how does his mind work?? (51) Do you want to be John Malkovich? I have never seen the movie, and don't know who this John Malkovich character is... NUMBERS (52) Do you laugh when you hear or read the number 69? No. (53) Were you lying about your answer to the previous question? Nope. (54) Do you actually know your Social Security Number? Yup. 46....wait a sec....ummmm nm.... (55) Do you actually know your IP address? Feeling really stupid now cuz what is an IP address? (56) Do you know what an IP address is? Oh goodie, I am not the only one...NO (57) Do you know the four-character extension on your ZIP code? Nope. (58) Ever thought there were too many numbers floating around in our lives? I have actually sat down and thought about all of the different numbers we memorize in our lifetime. Sit down and think about how many phone numbers you know, and how you can connect them in your head to certain people...that alone has got to be a minimum of like 15...and then there is soc. sec...DL #, address, pin number....it is crazy how many numbers define you as a person... (59) Does your head begin to hurt when you think of infinity, imaginary numbers, irrational numbers, etc.? Not really...although, infinity has me stumped...my mind just cannot grasp the concept of eternity...and that is the same thing as infinity imo. (60) What do you think of pi? The movie?!?!?!?! Quite disturbing, actually... LOVE, SEX AND ALL THAT (61) Did you get a little frightened or uncomfortable seeing this as a section title? Nooooo. (62) If someone you had no interest in dating expressed interest in dating you, how would you feel? Sorry for them..in a really nice way... (63) Do you prefer getting to know someone first before dating them or going in "blind"? I don't know...getting to know them a bit first I guess... (64) Could you carry on a relationship with someone with the same first name as a family member? Haha, I like a guy with the same name as my best friend's fiancee and brother (oh, they are two different ppl, the brother is not the fiancee).... (65) Have you ever wished it was more "socially acceptable" for a girl to ask a guy out? Nooo!! Cause I am deathly afraid of it... (66) What's your opinion on sex without emotional commitment? Baadddd...lol, well, I just think that sex shouldn't just be something that one does lightly without realizing what kind of commitment needs to go with it. (67) Have you ever been romantically attracted to someone physically unattractive? Yeah. Maybe it's just me growing up, but I don't look at physical looks as top priority anymore. The last couple of guys I have liked have just been your average looking joes...maybe a bit less...i dunno. (68) Do you think the opposite sex finds you good-looking? Highly unlikely. I wish tho.... (69) Would you be willing to give up sex in exchange for an emotional commitment you knew would last? Well, right now, having never experienced sex, it would be easy for me to say, "Oh yes, I am so not shallow, i would do that any day!"...but then, if I had experienced it, and knew how great it was, then maybe I wouldn't be so willing...I do not know... (70) Do you think the number of the last question was a coincidence? Yes. POSSESSIONS (71) What is your favorite possession? Toughie...probably...my Pocket Dictionary...or my CD collection...or my library (72) What physical, tangible possession do you want most? All of the Ataris' albums that I don't have (73) How badly do you want it? Oh, I want them a lot, but I am trying not to waste any more money sooo...must wait.... (74) Have you ever seen 'The Exorcist'? Yup. (75) How long did it take you to understand why the last question is in this section? Actually, about thirty seconds after I read this question and had to look back up at the title of this section. HOLIDAYS (76) Does Christmas music too far away from Christmas annoy you? Nope...well, within reason... (77) How old do you think you will be before you stop liking getting older? No Idea....probably like 30 or something. (78) What was the best Halloween costume you ever had? i was Michaelangelo...the ninja turtle, not the painter/sculptor (79) What was the worst Halloween costume you ever had? In 7th grade I wore a nametag with my friend's name on it and went as her...lol, those were the good days... (80) What holiday do you think has still managed to retain its original meaning? Maybe the 4th of July...but maybe it has just become an excuse for fireworks... (81) There are currently no federal holidays during August- what should be put there? The National "Have Fun Like There is no Tomorrow" day. MEMORIES (82) How good is your short-term memory? Excellent (all tests studied for within 15 minutes of test :) ) (83) How good is your long-term memory? Too good...there are some things I would rather forget...but maybe not cuz of the lessons they taught me... (84) What is your earliest memory? Sitting in a room on a blanket and there is sunlight shining through the window (85) What is your happiest memory (other than recieving this survey)? The freedom and naitivety of 6th grade...I really thought I knew everything about life and love, and I had so much fun that year... (86) What is your strangest memory? I don't want to say so I will just step it down a notch and say my next strangest memory...I remember how my brothers and I used to cover our floor with toys like completely and three feet tall and then three of us would hide in the "debris from the tornado" and the other one would be the rescue unit and would have to find all of us...yeeeah....we were weird...now you know why I turned out the way I did :) There are so many things we did that were weird like this...but I won't bore you with all of the stories. (87) What song, movie, etc. do you wish you could memorize? Moulin Rouge. And I am pretty darn close. TEARS (88) What movie makes/made you cry? BraveHeart, Gladiator, Moulin Rouge, The Lion King (89) What book makes/made you cry? The Killer Angels, To Kill A Mockingbird, A Separate Peace, The last two Lord of the Rings, pretty much all of Goodkind's books, A Time For Dancing, Night, and so many more...Broken Child for sure.... (90) What song makes/made you cry? Depends on my mood. A lot tho. Music has a way of grabbing your soul and running away with it. BraveHeart music makes me cry...FF7 makes me cry....and many many others..some of Moulin Rouge's music...Gladiator's music...some of The Lion King's music...haha, those are all the movies that make me cry :) (91) What makes/made you laugh so hard you cried? I have never cried as a result of laughing...but I have laughed pretty darn hard before, so maybe I am just weird. THREE TRULY RANDOM QUESTIONS (92) Would you like to be cloned? Not particularly (93) Do you wish you could be alive when the world was ending, just to experience it? Nope! (94) Scaramouche, scaramouche, will you do the fandango? Thunder bolts of lighting Very Very Frightening me! Galieleo! Galileo! Galileo! Galileo! Galileo Figuro!!!!!!!! I'm just a poor boy, nobody loves me...HE'S JUST A POOR BOY FROM A POOR FAMILY. Sharing his life from this monstrosity. Mommamia, Mommamia, Mommamia let me go! Beezelbub and the devil (something something) for me, for me, for mEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEe.....nothing really matters, anyone can see, nothing really matters, nothing really matters to meeeeeee...... (Bohemian Rhapsody, -Queen) THIS SURVEY (95) Do you think that one hundred and one questions is too long? Yes, but I will not complain (96) Do you think the one hundred interesting questions actually were interesting? Tis why I filled it out in the first place (97) Are you sorry you began filling it out? Nope. (98) What question do you wish it had asked? What is the meaning of life? (99) How would you have answered it? The world will never know. THE TWO MOST IMPORTANT QUESTIONS (100) When was the last time you let the people you love know you love them? Forever ago...I am not very verbal with my feelings. (101) What do you want the people who are reading this survey to know? That I apologize for every stupid thing I have ever done and every stupid thing I am doing right now and every stupid thing I will ever do.

Today was the first day I have had the internet since...forever. These past few days have been crazy-like. Friday I went to the TAMS orientation. It was pretty fun! I mean, I don't know if it was supposed to be, but I had a good time. And the people there are not as nerdy as I imagined them to be. Some of them were actually really cool. And a select few even had a great taste in music. Heh. Anyways, let's see...Naomi rode up there with me and we talked about the different things we could do this upcoming school year and planned on ways to get around the rule of not being allowed to have a car your first year. We are probably going to keep either her car or my car (if I ever get one) up at my brother's apartment complex and then walk up there whenever we want to use it. It should be fun. Ha, and we had the idea of bringing a golf cart just to get around campus. When she asked the guy if we could, everyone, and I mean everyone, started laughing and clapping. It was great. I met lots of people and they were all really nice. Well, most of them anyway. I played hackey sack (sp?) with some of them for a while and that was super fun. Basically all we did though was sit through extremely boring lectures and speeches, and we had an egg drop competition Friday night. My roommate for Friday night was a girl named Angel and she was really quiet but we got to talking about how both of us don't feel smart enough to be going to TAMS and how we both like to read. That was pretty cool. Saturday I tried to test into Honors Chem but I didn't remember crap from Chemistry since I took it last semester. Oh well. All in all, it was an interesting orientation and everyone was really laid back and they were all quite funny in their respective ways. Naomi and I decided to be roommates and we have lots of ideas for our room in the fall. *Sigh* How I wish fall was getting here more quickly (more about that later). I am finally moved. I mean, I wish so much that I wasn't, but I am. And although I kinda like our new house, I absolutely hate it. I don't know if that makes any sense. I will miss our old house so much. I have been through everything in that house. I went insane (literally) last year from the whole Elise situation and our house was there with me through it all. My heart was broken repeatedly by Spencer and a couple of other guys whom I shall not name and my house was there with me through it all. When my parents divorced in the 4th grade and I cried myself to sleep every night, my house was there with me through it all. I think that sometimes people think that I am kidding when I say that I miss my house. But I am being as serious as I get. My room has been there through every triumph, disappointment, challenge, emotion...it experienced EVERYTHING with me....and I miss it. This new room may be bigger and have its own bathroom, but it lacks comfort, sympathy, and understanding. My old room had all of that. I am too emotional. Tonight when I went to get food (because my mom claims that since I was not home when they ate dinner, I need none) I just drove around, listening to Jimmy Eat World, and thinking. I went up to Summit (old high school) and drove around the parking lot listening to "My Sundown". As I was leaving the parking lot, the part of the song came on that goes, "Good goodbye lovely time. Good goodbye til sunshine. Good goodbye I'll be fine. Good goodbye, good goodnight." Now, you would have to hear the song to get the effect, but it was so perfect for the moment...I have decided that this song is now my anthem for the time being. Let me quote you some more of the lyrics. I see it around me, I see it in everything. I could be so much more than this. I said my goodbye's this is my sundown. I'm gonna be so much more than this. With one hand high, you'll show them your progress. You'll take your time, but no one cares. No one cares. I need you to show me the way from crazy. I wanna be so much more than this. I like the part that says "I need you to show me the way from crazy" Story of my life right there. I feel as if a new part of me goes crazy every day. *Sigh*...so now I guess I need to explain from earlier when I said that I wish that it was fall already. I am ready to get the hell out of this place and go to TAMS already. Basically, I am tired of all of this crap and all of the people that make me feel like crap. Summer has been great so far I suppose, but I wish it was over already. Except for the Warped Tour. Ah, that will be fun. So much moshing to do, so little time...since TAMS freaking banned Deep Ellum from us!!!! It was the stupidest thing I had ever heard. Oh well. I guess it is worth the freedom...and there are other places to go to small venue concerts besides Deep Ellum, right????? Ok, so I might have to break some rules....nah, I don't want to get kicked out...I guess I will just have to wait until Spring Break and summer to go to any good concerts...Will think about all this later. Well, I am tired so I will not explain any more right now. Oh, and congratulations Sarah...haha, and I think making out is classified as whatever you want it to be...so....that is all. bye. Lisa

Today was a relatively good day. I woke up, went to my old school to withdraw, found out I couldn't do it until Monday, went to the box store, got some boxes for moving, went home, and packed all day while listening to extremely good music. At around 2:45 I went to my tennis tournament and I won my first match to make it into the semis ( I think I had a buy the first match) and then I lost the next one 8-4. But it was a good match with many deuces, and we battled it out...she was better and deserved to win, so I am not being too hard on myself. Afterwards, there was this park nearby and I just laid out under the trees for like ten minutes and relaxed before driving home. I think I am going to the movies later. It should be fun. That is all. Lisa

AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH !!! !!!!! !!!! !!!!!!!!!1 !! !!!! Oh my gooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooossssssssssshhhhhhhhhhh..............VICTORY IS MINE!!!!!!!!!!! Setting: graduation at the Daniel-Meyer Coliseum; June 4, 2003, around 7:00 pm ::Lisa drives into parking lot and finds relatively close spot despite being practically late:: Lisa: Score! I am the master! ::Gets out of car and walks to coliseum only to see... Lisa: Ryan! Hey! Ryan: Oh hey. ::smiles very cute smile and then looks back down at special edition newspapers he is selling:: Lisa: oh hey, how much are those? Ryan: A dollar. Wanna buy one? Lisa: Hmm....I'll be right back. ::Walks back to car in relatively close parking spot, gets dollar out of cupholder, walks back to in front of coliseum:: Ryan: (again) Hey. Lisa: Here you go. ::hands him one dollar bill:: Ryan: Oh thanks, here. ::Hands Lisa special edition newspaper:: Ryan: (randomly) It should be really good, it's actually quite well written. You know Aimee Wendelsdorf? She will be a staff writer next year. Lisa: Oh yeah, she's cool. Ryan: Yeah, she is....so, are you going to be a staff writer next year? Lisa: Oh no, I am going to TAMS Ryan: Oh right, I forgot! Where is that again? Lisa: The University of North Texas. In Denton. Ryan: Yeah, there is actually another guy I know that is going to that next year. (mentions some name I have never heard of) ::Lisa smiles and nods:: Lisa: Oh yes, I didn't even know that. Ryan: He is going to one for math and science. Lisa: Yeah, that's the one I am going to, even though I don't know what I want to do with my life yet but, eh, two years of college credit......high school ::does overdramatisized weight scale with arms, college credit outweighing high school by much:: Ryan: (smiling at Lisa's attempt at being cute/funny) Heh, yeah I would do it too. ::More people walk up and Ryan continues selling newspapers, Lisa walks away:: ::Lisa walks around coliseum, looking for people. Finds none. Has thought.:: Lisa: It is the end of year, this is the last time I will ever see him, and I like him...hmmm ::Walks back outside and approaches Ryan, who is looking confused but not particularly disappointed:: Lisa: Hey, who are you sitting with? Ryan: Oh I don't know, we might not even be staying for the graduation ceremony...but maybe. Lisa: Oh I see. Well, I don't have anyone to sit with sooo...you know, it would be great if I could sit with you and your friends or something...(trails off) Ryan: Who did you come with? Lisa: umm, myself. (smiles) Ryan: (smiles also) So why are you here? Lisa: Well, Dunja is graduating... Ryan: Oh yeah, Dunja, I saw her a while ago...(realization) but she can't sit with you... Lisa: No, she can't (smiles) Ryan: (smiles also) Yeah, I haven't seen many students here save for the ones who are graduating. Lisa: Yeah... Ryan: Well, where are you sitting? Lisa: I dunno. Ryan: I will look for you. I'll be with all the other juniors helping out with graduation, so I will find you. Lisa: Uh, ok. (gives it is ok smile). Ryan: I'll find you...eventually... ::end of second convo:: ::Lisa sits through entire graduation service by herself, listens to incredibly inspiring speech made by Valedictorian Michael Hsu, and walks out of coliseum, looking for Dunja:: ::Finds Dunja. There is much celebration:: Dunja: Oops, I forgot to give this medal back to the people. Lisa come with me to do so now. ::They walk away:: ::Ryan walks past them:: Ryan: Oh hey guys. Congratulations, Dunja! Dunja: Thank you! ::There is pause. Everybody stands around smiling for a moment:: Dunja: Soo, what are you doing? Ryan: Trying to get rid of these stupid things ::indicates toward stack of unsold special edition newspapers:: Ryan: You want one? Dunja: Sure. ::Hands newspaper to Dunja:: Ryan: I am basically giving them out free now. Lisa: (indignantly) Hey! Why didn't you tell me that? I would have waited. Ryan: Oh, I just did. (smiles) Lisa: (jokinlgy grumbles) I want my money back. Dunja: So, you are just giving them out for free? Ryan: Oh yeah, the only people who actually paid for them were like the parents of the featured kids, and teachers. Lisa: And me. Ryan: (laughs) Yeah, and losers like her (jokingly)...Do you want your dollar back? Lisa: (laughs) No it is alright. I get my paycheck tomorrow so it is all good. ::short convo about where Lisa works and such...not very interesting:: :: more chit chat ensues, things turn towards college:: Ryan: So, Dunja, what are you doing now? Dunja: Um, leaving graduation... Ryan: (laughs) I mean, are you going to go to college, or what? Dunja: Oh yeah, I might go to this place in Vermont. They offered me a $16,000 scholarship. Lisa: What?!?!?! ::Ryan laughs:: Lisa: When did this happen?! Dunja: Oh, I didn't tell you? Lisa: Apparently not. (smiles) Ryan: So is it for tennis? Dunja: Half for tennis, half for international. Ryan: Cool. Well, congratulations again, you have finished American High school, like it was hard (smiles) Lisa: (laughs) Yeah, Dunja how are Croatian schools anyhow? Dunja: Think Japanese schools. ::Both Lisa and Ryan laugh:: Ryan: Well, then..... ::long pause:: Ryan: (tentatively) We need some way to keep in touch....both of you I mean. ::Everyone stands around looking at each other; Dunja starts walking away:: Ryan: Oh, well, I guess I will talk to you later (to Dunja) Lisa: You won't talk to her later. Ryan: er, yeah I will, I will get her email or something from you. Lisa: (suavely) And how will you get it from me? ::All three stand looking at each other again:: Ryan: Oh right, you won't be here next year. ::gets out a special edition newspaper:: Ryan: So, how are we going to do this? Does anyone have a pen? Lisa: I sure do. ::opens purse; takes out "Chess in a Tin" and hands it to Dunja:: Lisa: Hold this. Ryan: (laughs) What is that? ::Lisa takes out a random number of other things:: Lisa: Hold these too. ::finally pulls out two pens and a pencil:: Lisa: You have three choices. ::Ryan chooses blue pen:: Lisa: Excellent choice. ::Ryan writes something down on special edition newspaper and hands it to Lisa:: ::Lisa briefly looks at paper, writes down email and AIM sn and hands it to Ryan:: ::Dunja does the same:: ::more pointless chit chat:: Ryan: Well, I guess I will see you later (to Lisa.) ::Lisa looks, smiles, and walks off:: I AM THE MASTER!!!!!!!!! I have overcome the shyness! This is the closest to a phone number I will EVER get!!! ::Jumps for joy:: Yippee. In State of Euphoria, Lisa

So I wake up this morning when my brother leaves for work at 8:30 cuz I told him to wake me up. But then I didn't feel like getting up so I went back to sleep. I woke back up at around 9:30 and was just laying there. Phone rings. Tis Olivia. "Get your lazy butt down here!" "Yeah, yeah, I'm coming, I'm coming..." "You just woke up!" "Hey, for your information, I woke up FIVE MINUTES ago." Our conversation lasts a couple minutes more, and I tell her I will leave in 15 minutes. But I leave in like 30, because it is of course not humanly possible to take a shower, get dressed, and dry as much hair as I have in 15 minutes. So i get ready and go to watch the tennis tryouts. I do not know for why I do this, as it will just make me wish I was not leaving in August even more. But nonetheless, I went. And it was fun. Allyn, Shawna, John, Kevinh, David, Melissa, Braittany, Nick, Nick, Taaha, Shaby....I am going to miss them all so much. Kevinh is prolly the funniest guy I know. He cracks me up sooo much. Sigh. Oh well. I took Brittany home, and we decided to go to the movies sometime this week, if we can work it out with our work schedules. Then I came home and went to eat lunch with Ashley (not drill team Ashley). We got some chinese from Mr. Wok's. But then she had to go to work. So I came home and desperately searched for someone to go shopping with me. Because I told myself yesterday...I said to myself, "Self, you are going to go get some school shopping done tomorrow whether or not you have anyone else to go with." But yeah that was a stupid idea. A note about jeans: THEY NEVER FIT like they are supposed to. At Khols I try on these 13s that are wayyyyy too big for me so i am like ok, maybe i lost some weight, so i go down to the 11s...exact same brand and everything....one pair is bigger than the 13s I tried on and one pair is wayyy too small. i am like, what the crap is this crap. So I left Khols with just buying some shorts for 6 dollars. Lessee then I went to the mall and that was pretty boring. I looked around in a few stores that didn't have anything cheaper than $30. My resolution this year is to not spend over $20 on a pair of jeans. The clearance rack at American Eagle had cheap jeans. Originally 50, marked down to 40, plus 50% off of the marked down price. Most of them were stretch though, and I hate stretch, so I only ended up getting one pair. They fit quite nicely. Then I went to a couple of other stores and THEN heh...I went into The Buckle. I had never been in there before because every time I was with someone, they'd just be like, "Oh, they are really expensive." and so we never went in there. Well, I walk in there and this guy that works there comes up to me and is like, "Hi! How are you doing today?" and I am just like, "Fine." This guy is super attractive, btw. Way out of my league. And then he was like, "Looking for anything special?" and I was like, "Nope, just looking around." and he was like, "Have you ever bought jeans here before?" and I was like, "No." and so he was like, "Ok, I'll tell you a bit about our jeans. We have Lucky brand. (he looks at me) and these are generally around $80. And we have CKY (I guess thats how you spell it) (he looks at me again). And those are anywhere from $50-$60." I was thinking: bastard! What, do I look like I can't afford your crappy ass jeans? You think your store is just "too expensive" for me??? Well, screw you. So, instead of raising my eyebrows in shock and saying something like, "Heh, I dun think so." I just nodded and looked like I was interested in buying something. Heh. What a big mistake. So I was like, "I'll just look around." and make my way to the wall o jeans. He follows. "So, what size do you wear?" I am just like, "Eh, like an 11." Their jeans aren't sized like that, they actually have measurements so he found some that matched up and gave me like three pairs. All the time asking me questions like, "Do you like a big flare, a small flare, or maybe a boot cut?" To which I would reply, "Uhh...a regular flare?" Then he pointed the way to the dressing room. However, before I got in there, he was like, "Now, the only condition is that when you try on a pair, you have to come out and let me see how they look on you." I was like, ahhh! Is he hitting on me or am I imagining this?? So I was just like, "Uhhh....let you see?" and he was all, "Don't be shy." Ok, so I was thinkin, heck I am not going to parade around in front of this guy so he can tell me if he likes the jeans on me...except that the only freakin mirror was outside the supid dressing room! So, I go in there and within seconds he has three more pairs of jeans thrown over the door and he is talking to me through the door. I am so uncomfortable. I mean, talking to a guy while you are half-naked and changing is just....weird. So yeah, he ends up giving me like 7 more pairs before my visit is over. Anyway, I come out the first time and he is like, "Oh those look good, but are they too long?" and calls another of the workers over there and so they are both looking at my legs...jeans...whatever...and are like, "Well, what are the measurements? We can go one smaller." So the other guy is like "Well, turn around, the measurements are on the back of the jeans." and I am like are you kidding me!!!! Luckily, I found the measurements on the front part of my jeans and read them to him. hahahahaha. I only tried on like two more pairs because I felt really bad that I was wasting all their time because there was no way I was ever going to buy their overpriced jeans. He even got me a bunch of shirts to try on with the jeans!! I mean, seriously, it reminded me of shopping with my mom when I was a little kid and she would put more and more clothes over the door of my dressing room and be like, "Oh these would be cute on you!!" Right, so anyways, I finally left and brought the seven pairs out of the dressing room and was like, "Umm...I think I will come back...Saturday....when I have more cash...." and he was all, "Oh well for only 20 dollars you can put two pairs of jeans on layaway and pay for them over an extended period of blah blah blah blah..." and I was like, "Well, the thing is...I am not sure that $50 is worth one pair of jeans. (Major embarrassment for me right here, because he is just realizing that he wasted his selling skills on me). He turned around to go do something, and I slipped out of the store before the situation became any more awkward. I am not going back Saturday. I hope to never return actually. :) Even if the guy was really good-looking. Then I came home and my brother came in my room to use the phone. If anyone ever wonders where I get my nerdness from, talk to him for like five minutes. Phone convo. (Note: This Ryan is not the Ryan that I like) "Hello, is Ryan there?" (long pause) "Hey, Ryan, this is Matt. You wanna go to Best Buy with me?" (long pause) "For fun. You know, just to hang out." LOL....ahhh second instance of nerdness. ::In car. System of a Down's Self Righteous Suicide is playing:: Matt (screaming): TRUST IN MY...hey, you know what? I could play this on the trumpet. ::Starts moving his fingers on an imaginary trumpet:: ::Lisa hits forehead:: Third Instance... ::Matt is looking for a computer desk for his new apartment:: Matt: Well, I have got to test it out to make sure it will be ok. ::Puts hands on imaginary keyboard and mouse, stares intently into imaginary computer screen, and makes explosion noises as if playing a game.:: yes, this will work nicely. He is so funny. We ended up going to Wal Mart to get a desk. It was an adventure. In other news, STUPID 24-SECOND BOY!!!!!!! I don't even think I like him anymore because I never talk to him or see him. But i dunno...the heart works in mysterious ways. That is all. I am getting the feeling lately that people are avoiding me. Call it paranoia... Ok i will. bye -Lisa

Rarely does a movie really make me think. And when I say really, that doesn't mean cry a little at the end and long for love, but I mean honestly and seriously challenge what I think and believe. Tonight I bought tickets to see Seabiskit (I tried to spell that word like five times and could not think of how to spell it...must be the fatigue setting in), but we saw 28 Days Later. Ok, so this is a British film apparently, enough said....Damn British...lol j/k. First 30 minutes of movie: Nude guy wakes up on hospital bed (we see everything . Ok, I am thinking, what is this? porn or movie?!?!) Luckily, guy gets dressed and looks around hospital. Nobody is there. It is eerily empty. So this kinda creeps everybody in the audience out. You know...ooo creepy, nobody is there. 5 Minutes later...still checking out empty hospital....maybe something scary will happen now. 5 Minutes later....Nope, still checking out hospital. 5 Minutes later...ooh he left he hospital. Get ready for some action! 10 Minutes later...oh gee, look at that, the entire city is empty too. And there has been ten minutes of footage of this guy walking around. This must be an important part of the storyline. Can't wait until it gets exciting. 5 Minutes later...it would seem that the movie people think that we (the audience) are too dense to grasp the concept of an entirely empty city. 15 Minutes later...Ok, I think we get the point people. The city is deserted. There are no people. Yeah, I get it. 10 Minutes later....OMG something happened! There is a car!!! In the middle of this town square seemingly for no reason!!! Formerly nude guy approaches car...oo this oughta be good... 5 seconds later...whoop-dee-doo....car alarm went off. I am almost wetting my pants (sarcasticness). This movie blows. Ok, so maybe I exaggerate with how long this whole empty part took...but it felt that long!!! Now, after this, it actually does get interesting. And I won't ruin anything for you people who haven't seen it yet. But this movie ranks as one of the top five strangest and twisted movies of all time. It was not scary, just demented and disturbing. And extremely so. Example: Background music is nice, soft-sounding Enya-like music. Movie Scene: ::scream:: Blood, guts, gun goes off, mass stabbings...."(expletive)! (expletive)! GET YOUR (expletive) (expletive) MOVING!!!!" "GOD(expletive)IT!" "OPEN THE (expletive) DOOR, MOTHER(expletives)!!!" Nice, Enya-like music continues in the background....I mean.....What the (expletive) is that?!?!?!?! One of these Classical music bloodbaths happens like three times. But, ok, on to how it made me think (finally). Basically, is there any hope at all for mankind? Are we really as sick and twisted as this movie portrays us? Is man's true nature that of violence, selfishness, lust, and domination? Because really, this movie will scar you for life, and it will challenge what you think of man's inherent values. Just when the survivors had thought they had found their salvation...it turned out to be their downfall. Members of their own kind...turning against them...full of the urge to rape and murder...all when earth's entire civilization was in tatters because of people having no will to stop all of that. Other things it made me think of too, but I do not want to write an entire essay on this movie, which is really no good. There are parts in there that will haunt me for the rest of my life, just because of how sick and gory and whatnot it was. Today I woke up at 7:55 (CRAP) and my tabc class started at 8:00....sooo, I am out the door by 8 and get there about ten minutes later. Nobody really cared. I looked like I just rolled out of bed, which I had. So that was a loong four hours. It was supposed to be five, but she went through it quite fast. It was so super easy, I made like a 97 on the test to get my license. So now I can legally sell alcohol to people 21 and over. So then I went home and me and Fifer went thrift store shopping (one of the most entertaining things to do when you are bored) and she got a couple of t-shirts and I got seven books and a new purse/shoulder strap bag/whatever and wallet...it is so cool. It has like three different openings to get inside of it so you can get what you want out of the top, bottom, or middle. And it is really nifty looking. The bag and wallet together were only $7 so it was an extremely good deal. I was happy and still am. Then me and Fifer drove around listening to some good ole Irish punk rock (Flogging Molly) (You rock too Fifer) and I unsuccessfully tried to do a jig and headbang while driving. I almost rammed into the back of this one car...omg...soooo freakin scary. I about had a heart attack. But it was all good, because of my super braking skills, we stopped in time :). Then we got slurpees and bought some hardcore edible slurpee straws. And then I went home because my mom needed the car at 6:00. JoAnn was online and invited me out to eat with her and her mom ( a long-standing tradition we have). So I did that and then we decided to go to a movie. We called Tiffany and invited her to come with us because she is one of the coolest people you will ever meet and we hadn't hung out all summer. Then we saw 28 Days Later. Hmm...already wrote about that experience. Well, now I am tired and still debating as to whether or not I want to go paintballing in the morning. But I guess I will since I already told Chris I would go. I just hope he doesn't like me. I hope he invited me as a friend only. Because I do not feel like rejecting anybody right now. -Lisa You're Garnet from the Final Fantasy series. You're a little naieve, but you're ready to learn more about yourself and the world, and you'll express that self-discovery by forgetting how to talk and cutting your hair. Your beautiful hair! Why did you cut it, why?! urlLink Which video game princess are you? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla I loved this game!!! And I loved Garnet. She was so mysterious and nice. And she was a summoner which made her extra neat. But it sucks because I have not played it in sooo long. Or any rpg for that matter. I cannot even remember the reason she did end up cutting her hair!! All I can remember is that it was a sad, sad moment in rpg history. Not quite as sad as Aeris' death, but that is like at the number one spot, so you can't beat that. -Perfect- You're the perfect girlfriend. Which means you're rare or that you cheated :P You're the kind of chick that can hang out with your boyfriend's friends and be silly. You don't care about presents or about going to fancy placed. Hell, just hang out. You're just happy being around your boyfriend. urlLink What Kind of Girlfriend Are You? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla Cha, I wish I had a boyfriend to be the perfect girlfriend for :). nuff said.

Yesterday and today I had to be up and out of the house early so I could get to the equestrian center on time. Yesterday morning it was 9, today it was 8. Whhhyyyyy do people insist on doing things so early in the morning during the summer time. I really just want to sleep in until 10:00 or 10:30 one day this week. But alas, I have a tabc class tomorrow morning for work at 8:00 AM which means I will have to get up at 7:00 because I actually want to get ready for this one. For the equestrian center all I do is get out of bed, put on some clothes, and leave. ahhhh. Oh right, yesterday after I got back, I went swimming at our swimming pool, in which I had not yet swum (is swum a word?). My younger brother was there with his new girlfriend, some tall skinny blonde who was actually pretty nice. My mom went to...Kodak moment haha. No, it was pretty relaxing. I brought a book in the pool to read and my brother teased me about that, but it was all good. Then I went and picked up my brother from work and then went to my dad's where I took a nap because I fell asleep watching my brothers play some video game. Then I dropped off my lollapalooza money at Fifer's house and ended up staying there for a while, talking to people on the internet, pretending to be her. Mua haha ha ahahaha. Then she came back to my house and we hung out here for a while, burning CDs and talking and finding out that our tastes in music are really more different than we originally thought. But it is ok because people are different, you know? Anyway, then I fell asleep and woke up and went to the equestrian center. After that, Jennifer called and I went to the mall with her. I ended up spending about 35 dollars. I bought a new CD (Wakefield...just your average punk band, but good) and a pair of really nifty shoes from Payless for 18 dollars. Then I got some Dip n Dots. So yeah then I came home and did nothing the entire day. Except take a nap from like 3:00-7:00 which really was quite refreshing. Jennifer got off of work at 10:00 and we went and played tennis at Stovall. Afterwards, we were talking about her little thing she has going with the 31-year-old at work and she wanted to know why I thought it was a bad idea. I was like, well, it is just extremely inappropriate for a 31-year-old to have a crush on a 16-year-old...I mean, if he had started early, he could very well be old enough to be your father. She argued back with that it was society that said it was inappropriate but...I just think that this guy has got to be a lot immature to be liking her. And he has kids. Another big issue. I told her that I just didn't think she should get involved with a guy that has kids already. And she was like, "Whyyy?" There is no getting through to her. In the end, I just told her that dating this guy would be like giving up on her teenagerhood, her youth...whatever it is called. She said she didn't care about that either. She also said she is not going to go to UNT, but probably UTA. When I accused her of wanting to stay because of a guy she got all huffy, but I really think that is why she wants to stay. Crazy. Run from this town and never return, that is my advice to anyone and it is what I am going to do. I would never let emotions get in the way of me leaving this place and going to other places and seeing the world. Anyway, there were also a lot of people playing volleyball there in large groups. It looked so fun. Sometimes I wish I had a group of friends that I could hang out with. You know, like I call a couple people and they call a couple of people and pretty soon you got like 15 people meeting somewhere to just hang out. I experienced that a little bit with the hardcore rockers at dreamworld earlier this summer, and it was awesome. But only that once. So, yeah, that is pretty much it. I think I am going to go paintballing on Saturday. Maybe. Have not decided yet. Oh yeah, one of my new favorite bands (I have like a zillion of them) is the early november. the guy has a beautiful voice and it is just really good music. -Lisa

Found out that the member of the Starting Line I met was not the lead singer, but rather a guitar player who does not sing....but I am still in love with him. :) :). I think it is funny how all the bands I like like the other bands that I like. For example. In Mae's "Summer" video, the drummer is wearing a Starting Line shirt. At the concert, one of the starting line members was wearing a Something Corporate shirt. So yeah...that is interesting. Today I swam and hung out with Fifer for a while. I don't really feel like blogging much, just had to say how the guy I met was a guitar player and not a lead singer... -Lisa

I finally finished sorting out all of my financial aid for this year. It turns out that with both my grants and loans, my parents will not have to pay a dime. My dad will be thrilled to hear this. I will also be getting just a tad bit more than I need, so I will have some extra money for stuff like getting a yearbook, going on fieldtrips (if we have them ?) and the such. So, this is relaxing to know. Today was pretty cool. I slept downstairs last night on the couch and my mother woke me up at around 9:00 and told me to go sleep in my room. Unfortunately, when I got there, my brother was sleeping in my bed and so I did not get to sleep the extra hour I wanted to. *Sigh* am so tired...really need to start going to bed earlier.
