Anyway, so I just got on the internet and took a shower and got dressed and ready and then at around 12:30 went to Amy's house because she wanted to hang out with me today. I just talked to her until around 1:45 when I had to go to my supplementary training class for work. That was pretty boring except that I sat with this guy that works with me, Matthew, and we made fun of stuff the whole time...quietly of course. There was this one part on the video we watched where they showed the cashier for like a second and all he said to the customer was, "Would you like some beans with that?" For like...no reason at all! Matthew and I just looked at each other and died laughing...it was silent laughter, but I was nearly crying :). And what made it funnier was that NOBODY else even cracked a smile. Ahh...it was quite funny. After that, it was about 4:30 so I went back to Amy's house and then we went to Target so she could register for her baby shower gifts. So they gave us a scanner to "tag" things. She went all scanner-happy and scanned like over 100 things. It was pretty funny. It is still weird to me how she is pregnant....hmmm Well, we got back to her house at like 6:00 and there was a bible study gonna happen there so I helped clean up and whatnot. Leah came to it and I got to drive her home afterwards...that was super fun. She is one of the coolest people. She is so crazy, but her parents won't let her do anything because they are the pastor and pastor's wife and such...so she does stuff without their permission sometimes. They have never let her go to a real concert, even though she would be crazy in a pit, so I told her that one day, when she finally has some freedom, her and I will go to a concert. And then I mentioned how before the summer is over, I want to see the Rocky Horror Picture Show and she tells me that she wants to go too because she loved it when she went a while ago...so, we made plans to go sometime this summer. I think it will be fun if me, Fifer, her, and Olivia all go. If I can somehow work it out. We also talked about how Bam Margera was beautiful and an excellent choice for a future husband :) :). And how we are going to have a party at a red light. After I dropped her off, I went back to Amy's and Mark (her dad) started recommending all these books to me because he knows I love to read, and so I ended up walking out of their house with five books, including biographies on Genghis Khan and Attila ("King of the Huns"). It should make for interesting reading. I promised to hook him up with some Steinbeck and Hemingway the next time I saw him. He told me this one story about Genghis Khan that I found extremely intriguing...in a healthy sick curiosity type way. Apparently, in one of his attempts to conquer a group of people, good ole Genghis could not get into this fort some people were hiding in. So, he waited until people from his army would die from the plague and catapult their bodies into the fort. He did this one by one, until the plague had infected everyone in the fort, and they all died. Genius borders on the line of insanity, eh? Oh yeah, I cannot believe my freakin house did not burn down today. I left my hair straightener on for a good 12 freakin hours. Scared the hell outta me when I realized it was still on at midnight. Gah... Also, am starting a new acne treatment regimen today. Is supposed to work quite nicely. Only time will tell. Well, that is all. Had some nice homemade ice cream as well. Good stuff it was. Night. -Lisa Bands to check out: Bottom Line Everydays Monday Don't Look Down AWESOMENESS!!!

Ahhh...the stuff that memories are made out of... Friday I had a tennis tournament and that was ok, in spite of the fact that I lose two out of three matches, was extremely exhausted the whole time, and then locked my keys in my car afterwards. Southlake is a good 30 minutes away from my house and not all that easy to find and my mom was not home so the only thing I could do was call a locksmith. So that was $24 and an hour and a half of my life wasted away. Oh well. Then me and Fifer hung out for like the whole night. Saw The Italian Job, got food, ate it, and talked. It was cool. I didn't get to bed until about 3:00 or later, I don't even remember. But I had to wake up around...was it 8:30 or 9:30? One of the two....felt like 8:30. But it was worth it because I was so excited about Warped Tour. It started at 11:30 and Olivia and I planned to leave at 10:30 giving us a good 30 minutes to spare when we got there. Of course though, we did not leave at 10:30 as planned. I got over to her house at 10:30 and then we had to go to Jennifer's house to get our tickets and leave her Olivia's cell number, and Wal-Mart to find some kind of a bag/purse to hold all of our stuff in, because neither of us wanted to bring a backpack (Oh, but we will next time we go to a concert, which might be in October...or sooner :) ). I found one on sale for $5 and it looked to be quite perfect for the job. Then we got McDonalds and then started out...at like...11:20. Heh. Then half way there I realized that I was below the empty line on the gas gauge and so we had to take this exit into Ghetto-Land and get some gas. We got to Smirnoff around 12:00 and then waited in this long line until like 12:30 and then finally got in. Of course, it didn't really matter that we had gotten there late because the first show wasn't even until like 1:00. Anyway, we met up with Olivia's old friend from Texarkana, Brittany and then the concerts started... 1:00-The Starting Line...am sooo excited. They get onstage and start the chords to one of their songs (GREAT song to start out the day with for me). The music was amazing, the moshpit was awesome, and I cannot even describe concerts with adequate words so I won't try. The last song they played was this one that is probably their most popular, even though I have never heard it on the radio or anything. But at the end, there is this part that is like, "We will kiss, girrrrrrrrllllll." And like everyone sang it and it was acapella, and soooo freakin amazing. So yeah, that mosh pit took a lot out of me so before the next set, I got some water and relaxed some and bought some t-shirts. 1:30- The Suicide Machines... Actually waited until about 2 songs into the set to join in, but once I did....this one competes with one other I was in for best moshing of the day. Punks, generally speaking, are very anti-republican and anti-Bush. It doesn't even matter if they are democratic or not, they are anti-Republicans. So, the lead singer was like, "How many of you are registered to vote?" and like maybe a third of us have and so he is like, "Comeon! I know there are enough punk rockers in the United States to vote GW out of the white house!!" and everyone goes crazy and he goes into his next song. All of their music was incredibly awesome (of course) 2:00- Simple Plan... Actually did not go into this moshpit, as was looking around at the different booths and I didn't think theirs would be too great. But I listened and they were good of course. 2:30- Mest Oh my God. This was probably the best live show I have been to in....well, in ever, because I have never been to a live show like this before. This one DEFINITELY wins best moshpit of the day and the music was awesome and the band was awesome and....wow. That's all I can say. Wow. 3:00-AFI Just listened to them because all of us had gotten separated and me, Jennifer, and Olivia were supposed to meet somewhere around 3:00 so. I know Fifer will kill me because I did not go mosh with AFI because they are like, "the best punk band ever" or something...but, eh, I only know one of their songs anyway. What I heard was excellent though. 4:00- The Ataris... Was actually kind of disappointed with the lack of good moshpit. But they mostly played their new music which, although very good, is just a little too poppy for good moshing, you know what I mean? But other than that, they were awesome. Then I went right over the the other stage for... 4:30- The Used Wow. This one was unbelievable. The half-screaming, half-singingness was aboslutely amazing. Awesome moshing...sooo fun. The Used was one of my favorite bands before this, and they have now just climbed my favorite band scale. At this point, we all met up at our meeting place because we were all separated again. It was about 5:00 and no one was really playing until 6:00...well, no one we wanted to see anyway. Olivia had seen Vendetta Red (playing at same time as The Used so I made my choice...and have no regrets...) and she met the guy again and got his autograph. So since we had nothing to do, we relaxed because trust me, all this moshing in about 102 degree weather surrounded by other people...it makes you feel like you are going to pass out. So we sat under these things that shot out water and drank nice cold water and then...we look over and the lead singer from Mest is just standing over by this fence! So we all timidly go over there and Jennifer says hi first to kinda break the ice and then he was like, "Oh hey" and Brittany is all, "Can I take my picture with you?" and he is like, "Sure." and so she gets a picture with him...and then I do!! It was so cool. 6:00- Dropkick Murphys From what I saw and heard, they were good. 7:00- Bowling For Soup... Not as fun as they were before, but still pretty fun. They do this mix of covers and stuff...it is pretty funny. Oh! and then there were some people surfing the crowd in between songs and so the lead singer was like, "We got some in-between song surfing!" and they started playing this song that went, "In between song surfing, in between song surfing..." it was soo funny! Guess you would just have to be there. 7:30...Thrice We made our way over to the Thrice stage, stood there for about a minute until Olivia was like, "I don't really know any of their songs." and I was like, "Me neither." and so she was like, "Let's leave." And we did. Sore from head to toe, dead tired, and unbelievably happy and amazed at how incredibly awesome this day was. But wait! It is not over! I wanted to buy a Starting Line poster so I could hang it in my dorm room come fall. So I buy one and there is the lead singer of the starting line in his booth signing stuff for people!!! And not many people know he is even there so it is just like me and a couple of other girls!! ANYway, I asked him to sign my poster and he was sooo nice about it and he signed it and thanked me and smiled and I just fell in love....with this punk rock band guy that is amazingly nice, cute, and well....the lead singer to The Starting Line!!!!!!!!!! sigh....they are sooo awesome. Soooooooo awesome. We smelled though. Imagine the stench. We smelled like a mixture of marijuana and sweat. The sweat being only about 25% from us...lol. It was so hot and everyone was sweaty and you are just so close to them when you are knocking them around in a pit or just jumping next to them. Yeeah...so, you get the idea. Probably the worst I have smelled....ever. Then Olivia and I went home and got some food, ate, and went swimming around 10:30 for about an hour and then went back to her house where we just hung out until like 12:30 and went to sleep. My body is sooo sore, but it is worth it. It is worth it soo much. That was the most fun I have probably had in my entire life. Besides Edge Fest, Edge Fest was awesome too...as awesome as this? I don't know...But probably not. Well, I have to go now. Responsibility calls once again. Lisa
