So I took this test today on this website designed to find you other people that share the same personality type as you or whatnot. It was called the aeananasumthingram...i don't even remember what it was called. Anyway, it told me I was extroverted, decisive, and organized. So I tried again. I only changed like three answers but all of a sudden I was not so extroverted and not necessarily organized. So then I used that information to search for the livejournals and blogs of people like me. Apparently people like me are depressed and alcoholic. Interesting I think, since I suffer from neither depression or alcoholism :). Today all I did was work, help out with tennis camp, and volunteer at the horse place. It was a very busy and full day, if only routine. I had fun at the equestrian center. I was talking to Aimee (girl from Summit that volunteers there) and she was telling me how next week she is gonna go on like a four day long trip with the newspaper staff cuz she will be a staff writer next year and so of course, Ryan is going. And I was just thinking about how if it weren't for tams, i'd be going to that thing....*sigh* oh well :). TAMS is like a two-year-long camp, right? :) :). Work was soooooo boring. I just wanted to come home the whole time. Tomorrow is payday. Yay. So today I was thinking about why do I think the things I think? Like when I eat homemade blue bell vanilla ice cream, why does my brain tell my tongue that it is deliciously creamy and...delicious? And why does my brain tell my tongue that whipped cream is the devil when in reality it is not that far from vanilla ice cream? And whoever decided that pain was a bad thing? Pain is merely what your brain tells your nerves to feel, so why does your brain think it has to be bad? Why are our perceptions on these matters the way that they are? Why does it bother me when the two stacks of hand held baskets at work are uneven? Why does it bother me when one bag is fuller than the other? Do I think that the emptier bag is more lonely? In the end, I end up using the same amount of bags anyway, so why does it matter to me so much that the bags have equal amounts of groceries in them??? Or like when you hurt one leg, you feel that the other leg is jealous of the other leg so you have to hurt your other leg too so that they are equal. And it REALLY bothers me that my eyes have different seeing abilities. One is at like -5 and one is like at a -4.5 (this is contact prescription talk here if you don't understand it). WHY ARE MY EYES UNEVEN??? IS MY LEFT EYE JEALOUS OF MY RIGHT EYE? DOES IT SIT IN THE DARK AT NIGHT PONDERING SUICIDE BECAUSE MY RIGHT EYE WAS BORN WITH BETTER VISION?????? Why the hell should an eye have to live with a burden like that? Now, I feel sorry for my left eye. And it sucks for my left eye more than it does the emptier bag of groceries because I can even out the grocery bags but I can't do diddly squat for my left eye. Except for maybe stab my right eye out with a stick. But that would make my right eye worse than my left eye so I would feel sorry for it. AND it would cause pain, which my brain perceives to be bad, much to my dismay and bewilderment. You know what, I do not understand relationships. Say in a hypothetical situation you have an awesome relationship with a guy at school, just a friend or whatnot but you can have awesome conversations with him. Deep, philosophical, but also funny and easygoing. Then summer comes and you do not talk to this guy for like a month. Then, when you finally talk to him again it is like the magic is gone. You just don't get along with him like you used to. And this saddens you. Why did the relationship go sour? Can a month really change people that much? Well, I guess just look at me and how I have changed so much this past six or so months. A year ago, I was a completely different person. I rather prefer the person I am now. Much more open-minded I am. Change is an interesting thing. We dread it, and yet, without it, life would be terribly dull. I mean, I love summer and wish it would last forever, but if summer lasted forever it would lose its appeal, its ability to seem magical and free. Infinite.... Ever since I brought up that word with Fifer I have been thinking about it a lot, what it means to be infinite. It is the feeling you get listening to an acoustic guitar while driving into the sunset....it is sitting in a group of your favorite friends talking under the stars...it is laying down in the middle of a field and looking up at the sky for an hour...its hanging out with people and listening to music...its laughing while completely forgetting that a grim reality awaits you when the laughter is over. It's everything that the good stuff in life is made out of. That is what feeling infinite really means. Our childhood is infinite....our teenagerhood is infinite. While we may grow older and die, it will never fade away. It will live in our minds as the best years of our lives. And that is what it truly is. It is time for bed now. I downloaded much good music today. I am only to the fs though. Tomorrow I will get further. Goodnight, goodnight. Sleep well and when you dream, dream of me. (West Side Story) -Lisa

Okkkk so.... one of my friends that works with me has a crush on another guy that works with us. The only problem is that he is 30-years-old. And she is 16. No, but wait. You haven't heard the best part. The sick part is that he also likes her. And they both have told each other and have admitted they want to date each other. AND she is stupid because she is like, "I don't care that we are 14 years apart. But its illegal so we really cannot do much about it." I am just like...gah, yall are freakin retarded. And then she asks me how to stop liking him, and she is all, "I need your advice!" I just looked at her and was like, "You want MY advice on how to stop liking a guy?!?! Are you crazy?" I mean, comeon now, since when have I pretended to know anything about how to get over a guy. It takes me months and months. So anyway This morning I helped out with Summit's summer tennis camp. This week it is for kids from like 5th grade to 8th grade. It was pretty fun. I actually felt really good at tennis compared to these kids. Heh. And they are really sweet. Coach is being really nice too. And Nick, Nick, and John were being really cool. I am gonna miss being on the tennis team as well.... :( I am gonna miss everything goshdarnit! Oh, and today, I flirted a lot with that guy at work, Daniel. He is so funny, it cracks me up. And he is really nice, to me anyway. When I say really off-the-wall stuff like.... you have a dining room and I don't so I am going to egg your house, he just smiles and laughs and you know, says something to contradict or challenge my weird thinking. I love it. :) Of course, this is just a flirting thing, and it is not like I am leading him on or anything. At least, I hope I am not.... So that is it. Tennis camp, home, shower, worked for eight hours...that's about it. I'm off. Toodles. (hehe I said toodles) -Lisa

I just got back from hanging out with Ashley and JoAnn (my drill team buddies). I went to Six Flags with Ashley around 4:30 or so and then went back to hang out with JoAnn but then JoAnn had gone to some guy's house so we went to Ashley's house and then JoAnn gets home so we go back over there but then my mom calls and says that I have to pick my brother and his friend up from Hurricane Harbor now and so I go and do that and they want to go to some place to get applications and all they know about how to get there is "it's off I-30" so I try to go down that for a while and we don't spot anything so we go down the other way for a while and still don't spot anything so we ask for firections and the freakin thing is at Hurricane Harbor but THEN HH is closed for the day. So I spent two hours on the road. Accompanied with good music, of course, thanks to my adapter :) :). Spending the day with Ashley was fun, but kinda weird. We've been friends since the 3rd grade and were best friends in 5th/6th grade, but then started not talking to each other so much. The only reason we started talking this year was because we had history class together. So at first, it was awkward trying to make conversation with her but after a while, it was cool. We talked about many things...and brought up our...interesting...past a couple of times. I was like, "Ok, remember that time that I spent the night at your house the day I started going out with AJ?" and then she'd think for a couple of seconds and come to a realization of what I was talking about and go "Ohhh yeah....heh. We were pretty stupid. Can't believe we did that." It is nice to have someone that you have history with. It gives you a sense of your past and where you came from. Hmm... Well, that is all I really have to type about. Maybe I would have more, but I am just soo extremely tired and I have a lot to do this week. I work Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. I am helping out with tennis camp those days also and Friday I have another tennis tournament. And then Saturday is....WARPED TOUR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I am just a bit excited. I wish I could get online at earlier hours though. I miss talking to certain people whose parents make him....i mean, him or her...get off at like 10:30. I didn't get home tonight until like 12:30 cuz we were talking and laughing and whatnot at JoAnn's house. She is so crazy. I read Fifer's blog and then she said something about me missing my precious ryan-san....and it is true, I rarely get to talk to him on the internet because I wait so freakin late to get on. :(. Oh well. Well, I guess I should email her now...Fifer I mean, because apparently, she has been trying to get ahold of me all day. heh. -Lisa

If I could express my emotions entirely in song or verse, I would do so. The most amazing feeling in the world is hearing a song, or a line of a poem, or even just a sentence from a story and thinking That's it. That is EXACTLY how I feel. I could not have expressed it better myself. But, I do not think I am talented in the area of poetry or song writing. I think it is because I think too much about it. The best poetry comes when you just write without thinking, and let your thoughts speak for themselves without having your mind censor what you say. And I wonder where these dreams go When the world gets in your way What’s the point in all this screaming No one’s listening anyway -Acoustic #3, the goo goo dolls I have fallen in love with this band the past couple of days. It's like acoustic guitar and emotion. I love it. Anyway... I had this beautiful, thoughtful, inspirational blog typed out but then my internet went all gay so I lost it. I really don't feel like writing it all out right now so I will do an abbreviated version. Wednesday- Thrift Store Shopping with Naomi, Work Thursday- Activated debit card, got PIN number, deposited $190, talked to Amy for like two hours, went to see Pirates of the Carribbean with Olivia and JoAnn, drove around for a while, went and played basketball at Stovall at like 11:00, met three guys who we played three-on-three with, Jonathan met us up there, we hung out with him for a while, he cracked me up....went back to house Today- Ok, this is where I pick back up normal because I had not typed today out yet. I got about three and a half hours of sleep and woke up at 6:30 because Olivia and I had to go to our tennis tournament. We got there ok, but then got lost in the parking lot :) :) but we kept driving by the swimming pool to watch the uhh...lifegu...I mean, cool slides they had... First match I played like crap (naturally) and the second match was pretty much crap too. The third match is when I really started actually playing. I lost the first 5-8 and won my second two to get consolation again. Olivia got 1st place. So we dominated. :) I have so much fun with her. We laugh so much and can talk about serious things too. It's cool having a friend like her. Got home and was bored...did not have stable internet connection as internet is gay. So Fifer called me and I told her to come over to my house and hang out with me so she did and just watched TV but then my mom got back with the car so we went to CD Warehouse and I got two cds, one of which was a single but I didn't know that until after I bought it. Ohhhh well. Yeah, then we went to the mall and to best buy where I got an adapter for my mom's car so I can listen to CDs in the car now because... "its plain to see that the radio still sucks" (theres my life in lyrics again). Sooo that was all fun and then we went and ate at Wholesome IHOP. There was this guy there that I knew and he ended up being our waiter. It was fun. At one point he just randomly went, "Hey, is that your parking job out there?" Me and Fifer look and burst out laughing because I had parked like on the line between two parking spaces and it was just hilarious because I suck at parking and we hadn't even realized we had done it. Good times, good times...then more driving, more music, and then more movie watching at my house, and then I drove Fifer home and then my internet pissed me off. I really do not feel like elaborating on much tonight. Am thinking much tho. Much more than usual. Well, I have got to go and finish chatting with my internet buddies. Tonight I'm tangled in a blanket of clouds Dreaming about you. -Foo Fighters -Lisa PS- I got a commenting system!!

Have decided that room is being overrun by ants...probably from outerspace as would explain the giantness of them and the way they attack me everywhere in my room. And some other stuff from my past.... Other than that, nothing is new... PSYCHE!! I woke up today and called Olivia because we had planned to do something today so I could be rescued from the inevitable boredom of having nothing to do. So I call her and she says she'll call me back so i then go upstairs and get online. And then, after a while, who else gets on but J-chan! So I talked to him for a bit, because he is a really interesting person, and while I am in the midst of a highly intelligent conversation (umm just go along with it), Olivia calls and asks me to go play tennis with her. And this guy named Patrick. And Ryan. Fifer is right. In her geniosity, she has developed a theory that maintains that if you believe that you will never see the guy/girl of your dreams ever again, you will, inevitably, see them unexpectedly before long. This has been tested and proved. QED. Lmao... ANYway, so then I kinda started freaking out, because although I had decided not to like him, that was a bunch of crap that I told myself so that I would not be so...insane. So, I turned to J-chan for advice, and he gave me some that helped me calm down and see that this was really not a big deal, which it wasn't. But, as I have written before, I tend to make a big deal out of things that are not. Big deals I mean. So, I calmed down and continued talking to him for a while and learned that he is at the top of his class, literally. I didn't know that, and apparently Fifer did not either. I guess he just never talks about it...which shows great humility...hmm...well, anyway, on with my day. So, I get ready and then go to Olivia's and pick her up and we make our way to Stovall, because like, all the really cool tennis players play tennis there. :) Oh, and that thing happened again. The thing that happened with Craig, remember...where he knew me but I had no clue who he was. Well, so, this guy I met named Patrick, who was funny and kinda cute....Olivia was like, "This is Lisa," and he was like, "Oh yeah, I know her." and so I naturally was quite confused and he was just like, "Oh, I've seen you around and I've seen your picture somewhere before." So I asked him where he had seen my picture and then...hehe...Ryan goes, "In my wallet." hehehe....he was kidding, of course...:) So, yeah, we played tennis, and it was really fun. Ryan was kinda good. Patrick was horrible, but it was funny. He had never played before. Patrick had to leave at like 3:30 cuz he had to work at 4:00 so then it was just Olivia, me, and Ryan. We played tennis for a while, and then we played basketball...well, I attempted to anyway, but since I have a major lacking in the hand-eye coordination department, maybe not so much. That was fun. All we did was shoot (or try to shoot) baskets and talk. Then these guys were playing a game of basketball on the other court and trying to look all cool so I told Ryan he should go and show them what was up so he went and played a game with them. Me and Olivia watched. They all had their shirts off ;) so we discussed in a very logical and organized manner which of them had the best body. We decided that it was between Ryan and Nice Pectoral guy in the blue shorts. Nice Pectoral guy won though because he was really tan and Ryan is just...WHITE beyond belief...lol. So after that, I took Ryan home (he lives in a yellow house btw, it is quite amusing...) and went back to Olivia's for a bit and then left there and went to the mall by myself because I needed to buy a tank top and...some other stuff...but uh, a guy reads this sometimes so I won't go into details on the other things I bought. It was nice just being there by myself. I got to go into the book store and look around for ages because I did not have anyone with me saying "Ok Lisa, we've been in the book store for 45 minutes now. It is time to leave." and I never really get to do any real shopping when I am with a group of people. I got to think a lot too, about many different things. Mostly how I am gonna miss everyone and everything when I go to TAMS. I am starting to have second thoughts....but I musn't. *Sigh* It is just that...I listen to people like Jill and Rachel talk about everything they are going to do with their Junior year...and I won't be there with them. Oh well. I am sure it will all make up for itself in the end. On the way home, I was at a red light, looking at the sunset, and the sky was just gorgeous. The clouds were mixed with a dark and pastel blue that when put together just took my breath away. And then, at that very moment, "Name" by the goo goo dolls started playing. That song is so beautiful. And the lyrics...the lyrics were amazing. The red light seemed to last forever and the sunset with that song playing was so...perfect. I don't even know how to describe it. It was like everything I had been thinking about resolved itself, and I was at peace with everything. It was an amazing feeling... Home: I ate chalupas and then got on the internet only to talk to Ryan for a long time again. This time we had things to say to each other. And when he left he said, "See you later. Had fun today." and I was like, "Yeah me too." and then he said goodnight, and i said goodnight...and, as I said to Fifer earlier today, I think my crush just went up a few points...because it was so fun just hanging out with him today. I have no idea how he feels, but it is nice just being friends with him, if nothing else. I am content with that. Well, I am off. So much thinking and reading to do, so little time. And even though the moment passed me by I still can’t turn away I saw the dreams you never thought you’d lose tossed along the way Letters that you never meant to send lost or thrown away And now we’re grown up orphans that never knew their names Don’t belong to no one that’s a shame You could hide beside me maybe for a while And I won’t tell no one your name I won’t tell em’ your name Scars are souvenirs you never lose , the past is never far Did you lose yourself somewhere out there , did you get to be a star Don’t it make you sad to know that life is more than who we are You grew up way too fast and now there’s nothing to believe And reruns all become our history A tired song keeps playing on a tired radio And I won’t tell no one your name I won’t tell em’ your name I think about you all the time But I don’t need the same it’s lonely where you are come back down, And I won’t tell em your name -"Name", the goo goo dolls -Lisa

Today, today, today... Hmm...went to OVERPRICED Barnes and Noble, then resorted to buying frappucino and giant, delicious to point of dying happy sugar cookie, and then made my way over to the cheaper, more comfortable Half-Price Book Store...all of this with Fifer, of course...showing me the ropes and whatnot of Half Price and teaching me how to judge a book by its cover...lol...so that was like an hour or so of her showing me how uninformed and unexposed to American underground/nerd culture I am and me trying to find books that Half Price does not sell. I ended up buying two books...forgot titles....hmmm Then we went back to my house with my theatre-like living room (ha) and watched SLC Punk...very interesting movie. It used humor to show how a life of "anarchy" and partying and drugs is pointless and not very smart. Even though it was mainly a comedy, there were some deeper messages in there I think. VERY funny tho. Ahhh lmao..."One time, when he was drunk, he decided that all the cars on his block would look better without windows..." ::nerd guy starts bashing out windows with baseball bat:: hehehehehehehe....good times, good times...yeah, so I was late for work about 15 minutes because I wanted to watch it all, but it was worth the $1.50 or so that I lost... :) It taught me the meaning of being HARDCORE...heh. Then Fifer went home and was attacked by neurotic bird. And I went to work...hehe, work was sooo fun today. There is this guy, Daniel...I've mentioned him before (the grape-thrower)...anyway, he is so funny and I kinda liked him a bit so today I started bagging for him like most of the day and we flirted A LOT. It was super fun....hehehe....he has a cute smile I think. I mean, you know, it's not like I have a full-blown crush on him or anything, but it sure is fun talking to him and working with him....speaking of flirting, btw, I think that I have developed a liking for it. I flirt with pretty much all the guys at work now :). Harmlessly, of course, just in stupid ways...like making corny jokes and whatnot...but it is fun. Lessee....Daniel, Jonathan, Eric, and Jason...yup, those are the main ones that I like to flirt with...cuz they are funny...or interesting. Whatever, the point is...I don't see why I didn't see the fun in this before! Heh, of course me flirting is probably nothing like other girls flirting...I'm all nerdy-like and whatnot...but its all good. Oh yeah, I also got to start checking (cashiering) for like an hour and a half to get practice because I start next week :) :). I am moving up on the Kroger ladder. Last night I passed the test and today I pretty much finished training. I think I got most of it down. Jason and Jonathan trained me :) :). So, yeah, work was fun...I also made friends with all the girls btw, I am not just boy-crazy. Joseph, the guy that is gay, is really nice to me also. Man, I love everyone at work now. It is gonna suck having to leave in August :(. Well, I am off. Not much new as you can probably tell. -Lisa

I love the way that time at my grandmother's house seems to almost stop. I spend a day there and it feels like its been a week...but in a good way...not like how a four hour detention feels like eight. I wish I could record the conversations that go on there. My family is so weird! I am the normal one there, which may be because I do not say much, but even if I did...I'd have some pretty tough competition. LoL, my aunt and Paw Paw cussed each other out spelling it out because my aunt's three-year-old daughter was right there. It was like "B-I-T-E me!" and he was like "B-I-T-C-H you!" They were kidding, but it was very funny. Kayla, my three-year-old cousin spent Friday morning running around yelling, "I'm butt naked!" (which she was). Cody, her 7-year-old brother, went around swearing at everyone and telling his mom how he peeked in on her and dad when they would go in their room to "talk." Sooo weird, I am telling you. My Nanny (grandmother) let me drive her car home from the grocery store. I was in shock. I was like, "You're not going to let me drive your car home." and she was like, "You want to?" and I was like, "You won't let me." and then she threw me the keys. It is a very nice car AND it was raining. And it amazes me how every relative has the EXACT same questions to ask me. "Lisa! Have you lost weight?" "So, Lisa, tell me about this college thing." "You're so pretty! You must have a boy at home. Do you have a boyfriend?!" "Haha, this book is named The Ultimate Hitchhiker's Guide . Hey, you are not planning on hitchhiking anytime soon are you?" and then questions about Amy's pregnancy and when she is due. After a while I resorted to shaking my head to the yes-no questions and giving a one-sentence explanation about TAMS. The highlight of my day came when I got to take my little cousins to the movies. Cody, 7...Everett, 12...and Elizabeth, 15 (who might as well be an 11-year-old because that is how she acts). We actually just met Elizabeth there. We saw Sinbad because I did not feel like sitting through Finding Nemo again and that was the only other one rated low enough for Cody. I was expecting it to suck (as was everyone else there, including Cody, but we couldn't do much about it. I think Elizabeth maybe wasn't expecting it to suck but ANYway) but it actually surprised me. I love stories of redemption and finding out that you can be more than you expect from yourself. Sinbad ultimately has a choice to make in the end. Run away and live in paradise, allowing Noble Prodius, his childhood best friend, to die, or return to the city himself, which would mean forfeiting his own life. He has been repeatedly told throughout the movie that he has no heart and that he cannot overcome what he inherently is...but he overcomes what he is told and returns to allow Noble Prodius (noble isn't actually a part of his name, but whenever I refer to him in my mind, I always say Noble Prodius because he was...very noble that is) to live. And even though the love story was kind of corny and rushed, it was important just the same, and made me wish for that kind of love all over again...*sigh* but then, every movie does that for me just about. So, yeah, after that, we went back to the house and ate a big 4th of July dinner (hamburgers, sausages on a stick, and potato chips) and played some of our traditional Family Bingo with prizes from the local Dollar Tree. Then we all went out to one of my cousin's house and shot off many, many fireworks. I insisted on using the lighter instead of the little stick that is meant for lighting fireworks (the name of it just escaped my mind...) so the tips of my fingers hurt a bit from being burnt so much :) but it is all good. I am supposed to go shoot some more off tonight after work with Naomi. So, that will probably be around 11:00. Ha, and I listened to some of Jeff Foxworthy's "You might be a redneck if..." A good number of them actually applied to my family (we're country folk) :)...so, that is all. I enjoyed being around my family, although I think they think I am too quiet...but oh well. I've got work today 2-10... Ohhh I almost forgot. Darn you Sarah for making me rethink my decision!!! "Haven't you ever heard the phrase "Opposites attract"? Come on, I KNOW you have......so what if you have nothing in common.....so what if you think you have nothing to talk about......lately, Paul and I have had nothing to talk about online, what does that mean? And since you think you are so non-commonly compatible (um...something like that), why not talk about the different things that interest each of you. Find out about some of these differences. You give up too easliy....lol. J/K If you really wanna forget about him, by all means go for it. Work on getting used to forgetting about guys. I'm sure this skill will be plenty useful later. ;)" Yes, I am sure this skill would be useful later, if it were possible for me to learn it. Hmmm...yes, opposites attract, maybe...I wouldn't really know. Oh well...I guess I will just see what happens, but I am definitely not worrying about him anymore. If anything is going to happen, it is completely up to him from now on. Yeah, I do give up too easily, I should probably work on not doing that...hmmm well, this really is it. -Lisa "In the hands of an expert, a good knife has 1001 uses." PS- Fifer, I don't know how to add a comments section to my blog...

Ok, this is my second post today, but I feel as if it is necessary I get this off my chest. I am forgetting about him! That's it! It is over! I am not gonna like Ryan anymore! Now, you might be thinking something to the effect of What the (insert word you would use)?!?!?! You are a spaz!! How can you like him one day and then the next decide you want to forget about him? What happened? Well, let me explain. Today I began reviewing the facts in my mind. And reviewing fact after another, two things became blatantly clear. 1) We have little to nothing in common. 2) Even if by some miracle, we ended up dating, we would never get along in a relationship of that kind. I mean, upon first glance, it may seem as if we have lots in common...we both love writing and academic competitions...we are both in the NHS, we are both aquariuses (don't ask). But really, beyond the academic stuff, we are nothing alike and we work on different levels. My sense of humor is more...quirky and random-like while his is more the kind of humor you would find on say...that one TV channel that is meant for guys. Which is nothing bad, I think it is very funny...but I do not believe he finds mine very amusing. Another difference would have to be how he has girls all over him, and he probably enjoys being all over girls, and I am just not like that with guys. I don't think that we would get along in this respect. I don't know...I guess I realized this today when I tried to hold a conversation with him online and we really just had nothing to say to one another. Just like when we saw each other in person. We have nothing to say to one another because I don't think we click like that. Furthermore, I am so much more of a nerd than him...he wouldn't stay with me for very long even if we did ever get together. What is the point of holding onto a crush that is utterly pointless? I don't know why I didn't just give up on the idea altogether a long time ago. I realized these same things on the NHS fieldtrip and I just ignored them. So, thanks to myself, Dunja, and Something Corporate for inspiring me to let go of the crush. It is time I started moving on anyway, since in the fall I will probably never see him again as I will be living in Denton. Yay! Well, this is all I have to say. Must go now. Goodbye. -Lisa

"Probably not so possible nowadays, but still worth a try, is to go out and purchase a garden bench. It can then be carried to the local park where you and a friend can perch comfortably until a policeman passes by. Take the opportunity to pick up the bench and run out of the park with it. You will almost certainly be chased by the policeman. When he catches you, you can protest your innocence and produce the receipt for it. If this is carried out enough times then eventually you will not be chased and every park bench will be yours to take, as they will think that you have got a receipt.." Hehe. Yesterday, I woke up and went to the Equestrian Center. For the 11:00 class I sidewalk for a boy named Christopher, who really cannot communicate much at all with anyone and who cannot really do much of anything. After the class was over, I asked his mom how old he was. 17. He was seventeen years old. I don't know why, but that just blew my mind. Probably I had always just assumed he was like 11 or 12 years old and he can't do anything for himself. It was just weird, that's all. Well, after I got home, Jennifer was already there burning cds on my computer. She had apparently gotten there when no one else was home and just let herself in (because we don't lock our doors) and just got on my computer...then I called Fifer and invited her over to hang out because I hadn't seen her in like two weeks because she went to San Antonio and FORGOT TO TELL ME ABOUT IT :) . But it's all good. That was fun. We watched a movie and ate macaroni and cheese, and talked about...Craig and Ryan...hahaha....we could go on double dates....writing news articles and BUILDING ROBOTS!!!!!!!! Yes! Haha. They are good friends, and we are good friends. We just need the hookup...ANYway... So, Jennifer just stayed up in my room the entire time on my computer, which really really annoyed me because what is the point of going over to someone's house if you don't hang out with them??? Well, I had to go see Olivia around 4:00 to see what our plans were so then they both left my house while I took a shower. In the shower, there is an ant that is like 3/4 of an inch long. It was crazy...I took one of my old razors and killed it so it would not eat me alive, like the roaches in my dreams... So I go up to Bowen, find out that our movie does not start until 9:50, and that I am not meeting Olivia at her house until 6:30 or so. Then since I do not want to go home, I drive to Naomi's house because she called me earlier and I had not seen her since the TAMS orientation. So we went out and got Chinese food. That was pretty good...I like Chinese food. We talked a lot. It was cool. I was with her until about 7:00 when I made my way over to Olivia's. Over there I ate a brownie, played tetherball (and won :) ), and talked to people on the internet. I accidentally left my nametag in Alex's car on Friday night. Oops. :) We left there around 9:00 and met everyone at the theatres around 9:30 (everyone consisting of three guys that work with Olivia- Mike, Mike, and Stephen). We saw Legally Blonde 2, which really was a let-down even though it had some funny parts. So after that, we went and tried to play tennis at like midnight, but midnight is when Stovall closes so that didn't happen. Soooo we just got some Taco Bell and came home and watched some more movies (that is like four in a day for me...crazy..) We watched 8 Mile (it was ok...) and Jackass (HILARIOUS and shocking). It was great fun. Great, great fun...hmmm...well, that is all. We were up until 4:00 which I haven't done all summer, and I woke up at 10:00 so I am kinda tired I guess but oh well. I am about to go spend some quality time at the g-rents for the 4th of July... -Lisa PS- In my past life, I was a transvestite monk who was both gay AND lesbian... You can't beat that!!

So the past couple of days have been uneventful. I have worked for 16 hours, slept for 16 hours, so that leaves...16 hours unaccounted for....hmm that was probably spent by me in the shower...or eating...or watching a movie...or being on the internet....yep, that about covers it all. I work too much. Last night JoAnn came over at like 11 and we burned some of each other's cds. I got Finch and Simple Plan. When she comes back from her drill team officer camp, I will burn Nirvana, Audioslave, Trapt, Breaking Benjamin, and another one I forgot the name of...yes, they will be great additions to my already great musical collection. Oh, and Fifer is gonna burn me Taking Back Sunday, cuz even tho I know some of their songs, I have not heard their cd. Oh, JoAnn told me about some stuff her, Naomi, and Bethany did the other day. They are really weird in some not-so-good ways sometimes...I'll leave it at that. So, yeah, that is pretty much it. Work is pretty...boring...and slow...there is this one guy that keeps treating me like he is my baby-sitter or something in that he acts like my mom...I used to think it was flirtatiousness but now I see that he sees me as a little girl or something which really irks me because he is only a year older than me. Today he thought I had cussed or something and he was like, "Oh, I thought you said some very, very bad words! I was about to tell you to watch your mouth!" I was like, "Umm...ok...." No one else treats me like that, just him. And it isn't like he said that because he has something against cussing, because I have heard him use some very colorful language himself before. Grr...and so what if I want to...it's not like there were any customers around...geez, I hate it when people that are not my elders pretend to be. Daniel still cracks me up. He throws grapes at people and then denies it in an indignant way...that guy is great. Oh, and Matt came up there to see me tonight. I only know him from English class but he is pretty cool. It is weird how he remembered where I work. Gosh, see how boring things get around here. Ok, I am going to stop writing now. Wish that someone interesting would get online...like...anyone because no one is on right now...*sigh* Good night -Lisa

Tonight's concert was great. Great bands, good music, much craziness. Everything you could ask for in a concert. Only a little moshing, at least for me. Because I didn't want to mosh with the little 14-year-old friends of Restricted and then I realized I had flipflops on so that kinda "restricted" (hahha I am ever so clever) what all I could do. I eventually disregarded that though. Lessee...The Euphony...I really, really liked them. They were good. And the bassist...well, let's just say he reminded Jennifer and I of Halston. I should hope that by now you know what that implies. :p Anyway...yes, yes, very good...I really liked them. But I think I already mentioned that. Josh something or another...too lazy to look up his name. He had a really pretty voice and like a combed over mohawk...or was that just his band member? Hmm I dun remember. Oh well. Yeah, they had some pretty weird instruments in that one. Restricted. Awesome. Very, very awesome. ESPECIALLY for being as young as they were. They were all 15 (or about to be) and that is just crazy-like. They sounded like they had played together for quite some time and they were the first band to get the audience into it. But WoW, were they ever awesome. I consider myself a fan. Clover St....ahhh...They have gotten so much better than last time and last time they ROCKED so what did they do this time??!?!?! ROCKED HARDER!!! Hehe. Yes. It was so much fun. Got into the moshpit a little bit. Towards the end was really into it and lost one of my flipflops so I had to just go without it until the end of the song. I found it though :) :)! They were so much fun. Why did they not have any CDs to buy?!?!?! The world will never know. Hmm...the ride home was interesting. Jennifer makes Hannibal seem sane. I ended up chasing her with my car down the street and telling her to get in the car but she wouldn't...so after like five minutes I turned around and started leaving but then she was like, "Noooo! Don't leave me!!" so I, being the good friend I am, went back and got her. Then I dropped Fifer off and then me and Jenn went and bought tickets to The Starting Line's concert. That is Sep. 19th. Can't wait! Will be so much hardcore fun. I had some chicken nuggets for dinner after I took Jennifer home. That is all. -Lisa PS- For pictures, redirect yourself here (It's Fifer's thing, so her comments...) http://www.angelfire.com/nm/fiferland/083003/index.html

Hahahahahahahaahaha last night was so fun and +ny. Fifer and I laugh so hard sometimes that I think I burn more calories with her than I do working out at the gym. If you really want to flirt with a guy, just act like a retarded kangaroo!! ::hops around in retarded kangaroo form:: Or um...my hypothetical, nonexistant, hot, passionate make-out sessions with um...people. And of course, who could forget the familial, platonic muscle feeling?!?!?!?!?!! JUST FEEL HIS MUSCLES, GAH!!!!! Umm... I think I am crazy. Of course, Fifer doesn't help any with her unsaneness and all. So I got home yesterday and then called Fifer and after dropping off my brother at the Summit football game, I went to her house and we ate dinner and talked/laughed our asses off a lot. And then we went to Kroger so I could say hi to Jennifer and she totally freaked out. I was like, "Yeah, I need some Marlboro Light 100s" and showed her my college ID. It was pretty funny. No, I don't smoke...I was just being stupid. So, she said to come back at like 11:30. Sooo then we went to pick up my little brother but uh.....was distracted...by sprinkler systems....mua hahahahahahahahahhaa. Got there though and picked up him and his friend. By this time I was feeling particularly hyper and crazy so I think I kinda scared his friend. I was all, "Hey! Are yall HOT???" and they were like, "Yeah, I guess..." and so I was like, "::evil laugh:: Roll down your windows!!!" and then we made another cameo at the sprinkler system party. :) :) Brian was all, "Mom is gonna kill you!" (laughing of course) and I was all, "Well, only if YOU TELL HER." Hahahaha,..... So after some jamming and driving, I dropped those two back off at home and my brother was being all crazy hanging out the window and stuff so i was like swerving so he would fall out...but he didn't...so I TRIED to get Fifer to feel his biceps but noooooooo.......LOL. This was all very exciting. Then we went back to Kroger and talked to Jennifer for a while. Then Fifer had to go home because she had a midnight curfew....awww... oh well. And I just went and chilled at Jennifer's for a while. I had to buy her some Parrot Ice first though and I didn't know where the place was so I was kinda late getting there. I only stayed there like an hour, and we got caught up on stuff and watched this messed up horror movie. It was pretty fun. The Dashboard concert is this Thursday and she is going to help me convince my brother to let me borrow his car. Right so today I went and spent some time with my mom. It was pretty fun. First I had my eye appointment. I am always afraid to go though because I don't want the eye doctors to find out how irresponsible I am when it comes to taking care of my eyes...like...umm....stretching a 6-month supply of disposable contacts to last 2 years....heh...heh....and you know, I don't really ever take them out when I sleep either...heh...heh....but my optic nerves are good, Doctor: "You have beautiful optic nerves! Any guy ever tell you that?" Me: "Ummm.....no....." My eyes have gotten considerably worse since two years ago. No wonder I couldn't see things very well. My right eye used to be -4.5...now it is a -5.25. My left went from a -5.0 to a -5.5. I am seriously almost blind I do believe. It sucks not having good vision. He put up the letters and was like, "Ok, what is the smallest line you can read?" and I was like, "Well, actually, all I see is a white blob." I'm not sure he gets many people that say that...hmm...Man, I have been wearing contacts for what...going on seven years now....WoW. Haha, at least I don't have to wear those huge glasses that covered half of my face that I had to wear in 1st grade...hehe...I looked like a geek. Ok, ok, I was one. So SUE ME. Then we went and ate at Chic-Fil-A and then we went to Target and she bought some stuff for me and my dorm/college life...It was pretty fun hanging out with my mom (Is that weird??). Must go now. An adventure awaits. Ciao! -Lisa

Ok, the last time I posted was Tuesday morning...what has happened since then? Lots. Tuesday...MISSED MY FREAKIN BIO LAB!!!! How?? Well, people told me that all of the Chemistry 3-hour labs were cancelled this week and for some reason, when I read my schedule, I was totally convinced that I had chem lab that day and not bio so I DIDN'T GO. Translation: a 5-point doc my first week. Gah!! Oh well. I was really freaking out right after I realized what I had done. But, I talked to this guy in my lab and he said all we did was go over safety procedures so it was ok. At least I didn't miss a lab. Tuesday was also the TAMS Student Activities Fair. All the clubs set up booths and you could go around and sign up for whatever you wanted to be in. The main ones I signed up for were newspaper, yearbook, MHA (it is like a group that represents the dormitory on campus...all the dormitories have one), and the TAMS version of Key Club. There were a few more that I signed up for too, but I do not remember them all. Heh. The Pool Club and the Ping Pong club were two others I signed up for. Oh, and I think AfterProm too. Wednesday...the day of five classes. And the only time I have a break is right after Biology. I have begun to take a nap in between Biology and Pre Cal...it is like an hour and I am really tired. I am definitely not a morning person. Nothing really interesting happened after classes if I recall correctly...After our wing meeting, I did talk to this girl about playing tennis with her and to this other girl about sharing mp3s over aim (because kazaa traffic gets lowest priority in our dorm). Then Naomi and I went to this SWAT team meeting (SWAT is just an acronymn for Students Working at TAMS) and we are gonna build a deck for some project or something. Thursday...only one class because my chem lab really was cancelled this time! I spent only two hours in the library tha day as opposed to the three hours I had spent in there Wednesday. I actually took a nap in there Wednesday for like 30 minutes...it is so quiet and peaceful...and secluded...so once you lay your head down, you can't help but close your eyes... Then we went to some UNT Pep Rally to get free flipflops but they ran out when we were like five people in the line from getting them :(. Oh well. Then...my first TAMS dance. I have mixed feelings, very mixed feelings. Ok, for math and science geeks, this party was krunk yo. Err...it was really cool. Mostly rap. A couple of techno songs (they actually brought out the little glow-in-the-dark sticks and did some raving stuff), and a few swing-dancing songs! Those were the only ones I knew how to dance to but I did not have anyone to dance with...soo.... There are some crazy-good dancers here. Osato being one of them. And this other guy named David...and this Asian named Kevin...I just watched them do their stuff a lot of the time. Kevin could break dance pretty well and David did this backflip that was hellatight (ahahahaha hanging out with Osato is teaching me some ebonics yall). Osato could do all the moves. The foot one and the shoulder one and everything. I felt left out simply because everybody paid attention to Naomi and didn't give a crap about me, and I was feeling lonely for a while so I came up to my room, but I got over it. There are a lot of things I just need to get over sometimes. At around 11:30 we all went outside to look at Mars because the Astonomy club brought out their telescope. It was pretty cool. You could actually see the polar ice cap through the telescope. Today I just went to classes. And now I will be leaving in just a bit to go home for the weekend! Yay! It feels like I have spent a month here, as opposed to just over a week. It is certainly different, and I do not have as many friends or as close friends as I did before, but I am working on it. I hope things will start to change soon. Despite feeling lonely sometimes, I really like it here. It is pretty cool. Well, talk to all you guys later. -Lisa

Hey everyone, only read this if you have a lot of spare time on your hands because this is pretty long, seeing as how I haven't been able to post in a while. Enjoy! Sunday Morning... Well, the internet is down so I cannot post any blogs right now, but I really need to blog, so I guess I will just start writing on WordPad and just publish it later for you guys... The past couple of days have been fun but there is still something that really bothers me about myself. All the girls on my wing have begun to form groups I guess and have all made friends with each other. All of them I should say, except for myself. And I have no idea how to really. I mean, I have made a few friends but it seems sometimes like they are just mainly friends with Naomi and I am just tagging along. I suppose I am a bit jealous of her. She is so outgoing and friendly and can just make friends on the spot with anybody without even trying or thinking about it. I have never really been jealous of a friend before, and it isn't everything about her that I envy, just the way that everybody knows and loves her already...and it has been less than a week. I can't help but feeling like the girl everyone will know as "Naomi's roommate" and that's not what I want to be known as. She already has a lot of Senior and Junior friends calling our room for her all the time and a guy that I am pretty sure will pursue a relationship with her and I do not have nearly as many friends...but, in a way, I think I prefer my way. Instead of just having lots and lots of friends, I tend to make my friends slower and get to know them really well. But still, sometimes I cannot help but wish I was a little more outgoing and that I had more...what is that word? Charisma? The thing where you walk into a room and everybody wants to say hi to you, everybody notices you. That is what she has. But oh well. So Friday morning we all did our community service and had a "Victory over the Vines." They gave me a pitchfork ;) and I was just plowing down the thorny vines...it was great. It was this looooooong stretch of fence that had fallen down because of all the vines that had grown on it and around it and it was all standing by the time we finished. It was a pretty cool feeling. Then Naomi and I met this girl named Starr and we all went to the new Rec Center to work out. This place was so huge and nice. It had an endless supply of biking and running machines, the weight room was so big, there was an olympic-sized swimming pool, a hot tub that holds up to 40 people, and a lazy river. Not to mention that there is a running track upstairs and about ten basketball courts. In the PE center, there are a lot of raquetball courts...I want to take up that as a hobby. It is so fun. Saturday we started off the day by running a mile in 7:50 (Holy cow, that is fast for me) and then ate some breakfast and then just went down to the Union to hang out with some people. Osato and Johnathan are the guys we usually hang out with, and they had a couple of friends with them. One was a 14-year-old pool prodigy...or perhaps just a prodigy in general. He made a 1350 on the SAT in the 8th grade...and he has finished all the math courses through Algebra II, which is why I guess he was admitted to TAMS, but I mean, wow...I have decided to adopt him as my younger brother, since I miss mine so much. ANYway, he was awesome at pool. He kicked all of our asses. He was pretty good at ping pong too, but I think he met his match at that sport when he played me :). We had some looong rallies. It was pretty fun. I just can't believe he is skipping out on all four of his high school years. He is going to college two years earlier than the rest of us who are already going two years early...He could be done with college by the time he is 18 if he so wished. The other guy that we met was Alex. He was a really, really quiet guy that was kinda creepy. Out of all of us that were there, he had the highest SAT with a 1490 or something like that. He couldn't play pool or ping pong worth crap, because he would always play in a jerky motion...it was kinda weird. I mean, I guess he was nice but eh...Ok, listen to this. I was talking about how I had tried to test into Honors Chem but didn't remember anything from my class so didn't and he was like, "Do you like chemistry?" and I was like, "Uh, yeah, I guess, I liked the class." and he was all, "I have recently aquired an interest in chemistry. It just fascinates me how different substances can react with each other so differently. Just imagine everything you can make knowing chemicals!" and I, jokingly, was like, "Yeah, drugs." and then he was like, "Bombs." and I was like, "Heh, you are not going to grow up to be one of those guys that blows up a building or anything...?" SILENCE!!! Note to self: Be kind to Alex. This one guy, John, that we went on our Wal-Mart run with had a 1600 on his SAT, and he is only 16....I wish I could make a 1600 on the SAT :) oh well. Let's see...we had some boring seminars.. And then they had a DDR machine set up downstairs! Apparently EVERYONE here has one and they bring them down for all the LAN parties. Anyway, it was projected on the wall and then there were two little squares hooked up to the playstation right? It wasn't like the kind you find in the mall. Naomi and I tried it (it was my first time) and I sucked soooo bad!! I honestly don't understand how people can be so good at that! I got a C and a D...Naomi got an A and a B. I want to start learning how to be good at it. Oh and then last night was Frog Night. Basically they pair a Junior up with a Senior and turn them loose for the night and hopefully the Junior will get to talk to the Senior about some of their questions or concerns. They have sheets to fill out with your interests that we filled out at orientation. They did a good job with my match. It was this guy named Steven who, from the back looked EXACLTY LIKE Ryan Essex. It was kinda creepy. Same blonde hair, same haircut, same body build...but his face, and his personality, were nothing like Ryan's. I mean, for one thing, he wasn't stuck on himself. Anyway, their pairing in the music department could not have been better. He had a mix CD in his car. First track: Phantom Planet, California Second Track: Smile Empty Soul, Bottom of the Bottle and so on. He had The Foo Fighters, The Ataris, The All-American Rejects...basically EVERYTHING that I listen to. It was amazing! And he was a really nice guy. We were with a group of people and we all went to Grapevine so I didn't really talk to him until we were all eating but he just talked to me about the classes, and the studying and then his friend Louis came over there and we all talked about movies and whatnot. Then we all went to see My Boss's Daughter, which was alright. Some parts really cracked me up. Others were really stupid. But oh well, I guess that is how it is with nearly any comedy. The two Juniors I hung out with for a majority of the time were Jennifer and Jalissa, and they were pretty cool. I went back and hung out in Jennifer's room for a while after we got back, but I didn't have anything to say really. I think that is the problem with me making friends. I never have anything to say. And I am the kinda person that if there is nothing to say, I'd rather not say anything. I do get talkative when I have stuff to say, but that has only happened a couple of times so far these past few days. Classes start tomorrow. I think Naomi and I are going to go scout out our classrooms sometime today. I guess my overall feelings about this place is that it is really great, but I just hope that I can make a few friends that I can be close too, because I really miss being able to talk to everyone...*sigh* I was laying down the other night trying to read and all I could do was look at all your pictures and think about how much I miss everyone :( but it is cool :), it really is very, very cool here. -Lisa ----------------------- Monday Evening... Internet is still down. Today was the first day of classes. Biology was pretty interesting. This is like the signature TAMS class so our entire Junior class has the class together and then there are like 3 or 4 regular UNT students. One of them happened to be Nic. I got his attention at the beginning of class and said hi. It was sooo funny. He didn't even realize he was surrounded by 16-year-olds and younger. When the professor asked who was not in TAMS and like two other people raised their hands he just started looking around like crazy looking all confused. It was hilarious. :). He was trying to make fun of me afterwards with, "Well, I am not in high school...I have to go to class. I have 17 hours." and I was just like, "Oh. I have 16." Haha. That shut him up right quick it did. then I had a whole HOUR before my next class! So I went back to my room and took a nap. My next class was Pre-Cal. That one was pretty interesting too. Both Osato and Alejandro are in my class, so that is cool. Other than Naomi, those two are probably the two that I talk to the most. Sidenote here: You see the most interesting pair ups here friend wise. Today I saw a Muslim girl in a full hair wrap talking to another girl in full punk wardrobe with a mohawk. That reminds me of that commercial I wrote about in my other entry...Only at TAMS. Ha, and then there is Aarron and Johnathan. Aarron is like 4'11 or something (the 14-year-old) and Johnathan is like 6'7 or something. They are always together and it is pretty funny watching them walk together. And they weren't kidding when they said this was a multi-cultural school. It is so weird seeing all these different people hanging out that would have never hung out together in high school. Very extremely awesome imo. Anyway, back to my day. Chemistry was next. This is the first class I had that was comprised mostly of regular UNT students. There were only like 3 or 4 of us youngins in there. Nobody really notices though. Unless you tell them, or they freakin see your ID. Instead of the word Student under our name it has TAMS!! How much does that just scream NERD!!?? But oh well, I am one. I admit it :). Then I had an hour that I ate lunch during with some random girls and then I went to Writing about Literature, which I was really excited about, but it is pretty boring so far. Tomorrow I only have Pre Cal and a Chem Lab for like three hours...Crazy right? Pre Cal is going to be my hardest class I think. It is every day and we have homework every day and he actually grades it for 17% of our grade. That class is most like high school out of all of them, although it is still way different. I spent soo long on the homework today. Osato and I worked through it together and a lot of people joined and left us during our study session. It is cool. People just hang out and study, but have fun at the same time. I can tell I will like this year. I felt really in place too because I got to help a lot of people with their work. I love helping people understand something. When it clicks with them, and you can see that, it is so amazing I think. Even though it was difficult, I love having math homework again... Does that make me weird? Ahahahahahahahahahaha. I am glad school is in. I am excited about this year. I am gonna study so hard. 4.0 BABY!!! That is my goal. Then Naomi and I went and worked out at the Rec Center and then we went to Clark Hall and got some dinner. We made it back like 8 minutes before curfew. It feels like I have been here forever, and it has been less than a week. Maybe it is because the internet is down, but I feel so disconnected from my old life, and so connected here. Sometimes it is hard to remember that only a week ago I was sleeping in my old house, talking to my best friends, saying my goodbyes...I am going through Internet Withdrawal btw. It is one of the most difficult experiences of my life...j/k :) but really, I hope it is up soon. Of course, I am still extremely busy here without the internet, but it would still be so great to talk to all my Arlington buddies. So, yeah, I am beginning to make friends. Slowly but surely. The people I am really getting to know well are...hmm...Osato and Alejandro...and...Aarron (14-yaer-old), and Johnathan. And Naomi of course but I already knew her. Jennifer is pretty cool; I talk to her sometimes. Starr is nice too. I met this other girl Casey, tonight, that told me I should hang out with her and her friends. She is another loud and outgoing person like Naomi, and she was pretty nice. A bit on the vulgar side...well, a lot on the vulgar side...like every other word. But I really don't care. She like analyzed me right when she met me. She was like, "You are one of those people that is kinda quiet but then makes a remark that is hilarious and no one ever hears it except for the people that are close to you." and I was like, "hmm...I guess..." So yeah that was interesting. They all are. I wish all of you could meet these people. They are some of the funniest and weirdest people ever. Not as funny as yall are to me of course ;) because I miss yall soooo much!!!!!!!! Ahhh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Well, gtg read up on Biology... (Yes, you actually have to READ the textbook to survive here) Hope the internet is up soon so I can post all of these! -Lisa

I am too tired to blog completely...all I have got to say are little details about today. 1) Finally met Alejandro in person! Yay. He was pretty cool. I didn't know what he looked like but from what I knew about him, I deducted which person was him. I saw a tall Mexican with an Anti-Flag shirt on and was like...it's gotta be him. I think we may hang out a lot...it would be cool. 2) I met four Asians while I was playing pool. Now I met a lot of people, but I just think it is funny how their names are Paul, Tim, Lucas, and Kevin. If I had said that I met four guys named Paul, Tim, Lucas, and Kevin, would you think they were Asian? Lucas was definitely one of the cutest Asians I have ever personally met. Keanu Reeves is like one-fourth Chinese.... 3) When the time came around when Naomi and I were waiting for our ride to Wal-Mart, I pulled out the Chess in a Tin. Oh yeah baby. We had a freakin crowd!!! They were like taking bets, and commenting on our moves. They kept telling Naomi she could put me into checkmate within three moves and Naomi is like, "Really?" We are not hardcore chess players. But then I would make a counter move and they'd all be like, "Ooooooo, that was a good move too. Good move! Good move!" It was so fun! And I couldn't help but thinking, Only at TAMS. That should be like their slogan. Commercial: While hanging out with your friends, have you ever felt the urge to program a calculator? Do you often find yourself counting in binary instead of sheep when you cannot sleep? Do your nightmares involve a world without math class? Come out of the closet. Only at TAMS. Aw man, I would have sooo bought into it. This really is awesome. I really cannot describe how awesome this is. Maybe I will hate it a month from now, but wow...I mean, WoW. The collage on my walls is looking pretty impressive. I will have to take a picture and post it on here sometime. I have like a bajillion posters. Yup. Ok, now on to something that really annoyed me today. So Naomi and I were walking and talking, and out of the blue she goes, "So I see you have your "rocker" friends now" (Yes, she actually did the little finger quotation marks...) And I was like, "Uhh...I guess.??" and she was like, "Yeah, I never really understood how people can just sit and talk about music and concerts like that is all they talk about." and I was like, "Actually, we talk about a lot of things." and she was like, "Well, yall just seem so fake. You try so hard to not conform." and I was like, "I don't try to not conform or conform, I am just myself." and she was like, "Well, it's kinda stupid." and I was like, "Well, you wanna know what I think is stupid? STEROTYPES." That put an end to that conversation. I think she is just jealous because the most she will ever get into the good music scene is Simple Plan and Bowling For Soup. Both of them, even though they are very good bands that I like, all only the tip of the iceberg and do not even begin to offer everything the music I listen to offers. So, yeah, I hung out with Alejandro, Katy, MiMi, and a couple others that dressed like "rockers." (LOL) But they are nice and fun and smart (obviously). And are just cool to hang out with. Soooo, whatever...I don't care if Naomi does not "approve" of them. It may be because she heard them cussing too...hmm...oh well. But they were not the only ones I hung out with. Quite the contrary. I do not limit myself to a certain number or kind of people. I hung out with some Asians, a black guy, and other people too. I am telling you, white is the minority here, it is CRAZY! There are mostly Asians and the such, all the cultures from the east side of the world. Well, I suppose they only make up about 50-60% BUT since they are a minority everywhere else, then it seems like a whole lot. It is cool with me though. I did so much today. I am so tired and tomorrow will be just as busy...hmm...well, off to bed. Am going to read. Peace out yo. -Lisa

OK yall, here it is. After months and months of anticipation, I am finally bringing you what you have been waiting so long to read. I call it... "Lisa's Good-bye Blog" Ok, ok, screw the months of anticipation...let's get on with it. I am packing my computer up tomorrow morning, and I have no idea when I will have it up and running to talk to all you people. It could be as soon as Thursday evening, but it may not be until Friday or Saturday. I know this does not seem like many days, but in internet/blogging time, it is FOREVER. Well, I suppose I never thought this day would come. At the beginning of the summer, I told myself I had two and a half months to spend with my friends. It seemed like it would last forever. But, as Robert Frost so eloquently put it, "Nothing gold can stay." And so, after two and a half months of the best summer of my life, spent with the coolest people I know, I have to go away. At first, when I think about it, I want to cry, and stay here, and refuse to leave. I just want to stay here and be able to see everyone every day like it has always been. But then I realize that if I am not strong enough to finally capitalize on an opportunity, then I will never be strong enough to make something of myself. We all have to move on. I was talking to a good friend of mine and he put it somewhat like this. Even if we refused to move on and away, the people around us would, and we would be stuck in a place without the people or reasons that we originally stayed for. Life is all about change, and constant motion and new experiences. Without change, it would be terribly dull and stagnant. Without new experiences, we would never learn anything, and never fully appreciate life. The constant motion is necessary to keep us from boredom, a fate which I would consider worse than death. I may have mentioned to some of you before that my biggest fear in life is that I will end up to be a jobless, mediocre, suburban stay-at-home wife. Before yall get defensive saying that your mom is like that, I am not saying that it is a bad thing, or anything like that at all. Some of the nicest, most caring, most interesting people I know are just that. However, I know in my heart that it is not for me. I have always wanted to see the world, learn everything there is to know, meet lots of people, fall in love (Well, don't we all?), and then live my life with a career that helps people while still always trying new things, travelling, and always meeting new and interesting people. Going to TAMS is the first step I have taken. I just cannot believe I am finally taking matters into my own hands and DOING SOMETHING with my life! Until this year, it is just like I went where the current took me. Elementary school, Middle school, High school...they just all came one after the other, and me, powerless to have any influence on where I went in my life, went along with it. And it wasn't bad, just...I need to be independent. I hate asking people for help, and I think that from Thursday on, I will finally have the independence I have wanted for so long now. Maybe I am just being too optimistic about this whole thing, and it will end up not being such a great experience after all, but I can always hope. And "hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies" (-Andy Dufresne, TSR) So in the end, even after the sadness of leaving this place forever, and all my friends and family along with it, I KNOW that it is what I HAVE to do. I will literally go insane if I do not. Now that that is out of the way. Here are all my thoughts and words to my friends. You can just skip down to your part, if you wish, since this last part ended up being a lot longer than I anticipated. Amy- Has it been 14 or 15 years now? However long it has been, I have always had you, and you have always had me. It is hard to imagine life without you, because for as long as I have been alive, you have been a part of it. We have been through EVERYTHING together. Your 22 or so boyfriends, Drew, David, the situation of last year, your pregnancy this year! And with me...my parents' divorce, Spencer, learning about my dad, Elise (The only person I truly hate)...as I said, everything...We have done some stuff we are not proud of, sometimes together, sometimes not...but no matter how disappointed I would be in you or vice versa, we were always best friends. And even though this past year we have both changed drastically, and didn't get to see each other as much, when I did see you, I felt like I could talk to you about pretty much anything, and that you would listen with all your heart. I thank you for that! Jennifer (Erwin)- 5th grade was it? Yes, yes, I remember. 5th grade because YOU HATED ME!!!! Haha, j/k, j/k...that is long in the past and we have both grown and matured together since then. The one thing about being your friend that I love more than anything else, is how stupid and crazy and bold, and WEIRD I can be and you are always just a little bit more so and therefore, when we hang out, it was ALWAYS fun. Mmmm....listening to FF Music at the moment...orchestra style....could listen to this and bask in memories all day...that's weird...memories about a video game...hmmm... Not to mention when Olivia and I went there at midnight and were hit on by some guys...hmm but it would be so cool...I would definitely hang out on the vegetable aisle....hahahahahahahah NOT. That would be the sex aisle. And I don't want to have sex in a Wal-Mart. Right, well, anyway... So I got Amy's baby shower gift which was like $40 and then two dvds in the sale bin so I spent about $50. The checkout guy was funny. His nametag had flipped over so that his entire name was showing and then it flipped back over to where it showed only his first name and I noticed that his last name was Strange, and that happens to be the last name of this other guy I know. So I was all, "Hey, are you related to Gary Strange?" and he was like all confused looking and looked down at his nametag to see if I knew his last name from that but it was on the first name side so he was like, "My last name is Strange." and I was like, "Really?" and he was like, "Yeah, but I don't know a Gary Strange. That is weird." and then me, like the big dork I am, replied with, "Yeah, it is strange ." ahahahahahahaaa..ha..........hah..heh. cough. I am pretty stupid, I think. So yeah, I got Joan of Arc and A Midsummer Night's Dream. Yay. Then we went to Barnes and Noble and I found me an FFX strategy guide that I glanced at before leaving. Psh, it didn't even tell me anything I couldn't have figured out on my own. Oh well. Then we were gonna go to 7-11....hahaha but I was distracted by the elementary school with their sprinkler system on. So I had to go crash that party. Well, we then went to 7-11 but they DIDN'T HAVE ANY SLURPEES (sign that the world is ending #4) and so I just bought some starbursts. Yummm those were good. And then I dropped Fifer back off at her house. Well, I wanted to listen to my Moulin Rouge soundtrack that I had burned customized to my song preferences at the beginning of the summer because I had never gotten to listen to that the whole way through in my car. It is so cool too, it has all the good songs from the first and second soundtrack, but none of the crappy ones from either. ANYway, I put it in and realized that it was a completely different mix of songs I had made and I just labeled the CDs wrong. But it was all good because it was a mix of songs that I liked because they helped me think about life. Saliva, Jimmy Eat World, Gershwin, Nicole Kidman, John Williams, and Hans Zimmer to name a few... I still think my theme song of the summer is "My Sundown" by Jimmy Eat World. Then I went to Amy's baby shower, at which I saw more people to say goodbye to. Then I went and visited Olivia up at her work and she hooked me up with a free ticket to see Freddy vs. Jason so I did that. And then I just came back here and am chilling. My brother cooked us dinner tonight! I am so proud of him. And not just because he cooked dinner, but because I think he has really become a great guy. He has matured a lot over the past few years I think. I know it is too late to turn back and I know that I do not really want to turn back, but sometimes I have moments where I seriously think that I am stupid for leaving everyone. Hmm... Well, I am off to eat dinner. -Lisa

I am saying goodbye to my past a few friends at a time. Thursday night JoAnn and Ashley wanted to do something so we went to the mall and then to Stovall Park and after deciding to all spend the night at Ashley's house, we had the brilliant idea of silly stringing Kyle's house. Kyle is an ex-boyfriend of JoAnn's that has been a real jerk to her. So we each got two cans of silly string and totally covered his bushes. None of us wanted to go to the other side of his house because it required walking by his window which happened to be lighted, but JoAnn ended up doing it. Ashley and I started walking away because we were both out of string and it was kinda suspicious looking ( :) ) and then Kyle's dog freaking went crazy and started barking as loud as possible. Ashley and I just bolted. JoAnn followed. Aw man, it was fun. Once we got back in the car and sped away, we couldn't stop laughing. And then we drove back by his house twice to empty the rest of the cans, and to see what it looked like. Hehehehe. It was crazy. Then we went back to Ashley's house after eating all the food we bought at Wal-Mart (pizza, ice cream, goldfish, buttery kettle corn, and candy! Healthy, no?), Ashley and I played Final Fantasy X while JoAnn tried to work on her summer reading. Ok, so I hadn't played FFX in like 3 or 4 months. Ever since before summer started. But I still clearly remember the story, and it was a good one. Well, Ashley was on a boss that she thought was the last of the game and she couldn't get past him. It was Sin Part II. I had never tried to beat Part I more than once because I stopped playing. However, after warming up a bit, I am proud to say that I have not lost my touch. I not only helped her defeat Sin Part II, but also the guy after him, Seymour (for like the 8th freakin time!!) and then he was finally sent. Then we finally did get to what I believe was the last guy of the game. Jecht, the main character's father who had become Sin (looong story) to help save the world. So you have to fight him, right? Well, he doesn't look so intimidating until he falls into this thing and comes back up like fifteen times bigger and all firey and scary looking. We didn't beat him our first try, and it was 3:30 by then and both of us were trying to sleep, so we just turned it off. I think during the three days next week when everyone has school except for me, I will definitely beat the game. I woke up at 7:00 because my mom told me the night before I was to have Brian up at the school for football by 8:00 so I went home and he is not even there! Hours of sleep wasted for nothing! Oh well. So I picked him up at 12:00 and then...hmm...did nothing...and then I....did nothing some more. That was fun. Oh and then I....did nothing! But at around 4:00 I went to Grapevine to watch the tennis team play their tournament and I went out to eat with all of them afterwards just to say bye to all of them. That was sad/fun. Heh. Oh! And then while we were in Wendy's, eating...all the power in that part of town went out and so everyone was like, "Ahh! It is like New York!" and I was like, "The world is ending, you know." and they all said I was depressing, but ok. Look at the facts with me will you. 1) Just LOOK at all the rain we have been getting lately. Didn't the last time the world supposedly end have something to do with a lot of rain too?? 2) Big blackout along the northern US and some of southern Canada. People could actually see THE STARS. If this isn't a sign of the apocalypse, I don't know what is. 3) Avril Lavigne's Sk8er Boi movie. ....nuff said. As you can clearly see, we have but a mere while to say goodbye to everyone we know and get ready for the "end of the world as we know it" Do you feel fine? Ok, I'm done with that now. So ANYway, then I went to Dreamworld because Olivia invited me to go see her boyfriend's band play there. It was Alex, Ryan, and Will...Hansen! When I had heard that their drummer's name was Will, I had no clue that it was that Will. So afterwards I talked to him. You know how I am doing the TAMS thing to get out of high school early? Well, Will decided he didn't need a fancy program or whatever, so he just dropped out of high school and got accepted to a college simply because his SAT score was high enough. So he is going to just go to college without ever having to get a high school diploma. That is crazy! He tried to tell me that what he was doing was cooler because it is not a program like mine, but then I got him back with that he is going to UTAH out of all places, and I said that was clearly a gay state...ahahaha. So that was funny. He is leaving Monday. Oh right, I got his IM sn so I can talk to him about college and stuff. So that was interesting. I didn't talk to Ryan at all. Thank goodness. hahahaha, can't believe I ever liked him. Oh well. So 9 Volt Nova (their band) was pretty good and the next band (Censored) was awesome! They were ska and did a lot of covers that I recognized but could not for the life of me remember the name of. The Punks Unite song...gah, who was that by? Oh well. They were awesome. Then we all just talked in the parking lot for a while. You know, it kinda sucks how I am leaving when I am finally starting to make friends...oh well. There was this one guy that I was kindof interested in...but its not like I will ever get to see him enough for anything to ever happen so that's it for that. Well, for some reason, no one decided to hang out afterwards so Olivia and I just went to Blockbuster and rented Ghostship, which was scary. It didn't completely make sense or explain everything, but oh well. So that is it. I have work in 45 minutes, so I had better go. -Lisa

When Jennifer told me that Ben had died, I was in shock. You know how on all those tv shows when people say things like, "Oh there must be some mistake"? For a moment, that is what I thought. I thought that she had to have heard something wrong from somebody and that it was just a sick result of a twisted telephone game. I was at work, in the middle of a small rush, and all I remember thinking is oh my god. and all I remember feeling is this sadness. I suppose I never was close to him. I mean, we never saw each other outside of school, we never talked to each other save for the occasional greeting, but he was always there, for as long as I can remember. Since I first met him when I was in the 7th grade and thought he was cute. The second thought I had was one of how unfair this is. He seriously was a nice guy. I know people always say that about people who have died, but he really was. And as far as I know, everybody loved him.
