And he had had such a hard time this past year with his father dying and then his grandfather...and yet he pulled through it all and stayed in school and was still involved in school activities...he probably enjoyed his summer, he was going to be a Senior, he was probably looking forward to it...and then it all just ends. Just stops. It's over. If there was ever any injustice in the world, this is a prime example. He did not deserve to have his life cut off short like this. He had his whole life ahead of him. Graduation, college, marriage, children, a career. EVERYTHING. So why the hell does God or fate or whatever decides this stuff decide to CUT IT SHORT? WHY? I think the answer is perhaps simple, but not always easy to accept. I do not think there is a reason. People die every day, it is just a matter of who and how many. Why is not important in the scheme of things. And yet, no matter how many times I tell myself that, it does not stop me from being mad at whatever higher power or being decided to allow this to happen. Even if there is not one. Even though I did not know him well, every time I think of him, it will be of him smiling and talking to me after school when we both went to T.A. Howard or him filling me out a tardy pass in the mornings for me to get to class. It will be of the nice guy that I never heard anything bad about. I am perhaps not as sad as most, for I probably did not know him as well as most, but I am sad just the same. And I am left wondering about the why. Our lives are more fragile than we like to admit. Because we're young, we like to imagine we have some kind of immortality flowing in our veins because of our youth. Not one of us believes that we will meet death before finishing school, getting married, and living a full life. We know that one day death awaits us, but we do not really believe it. It is too far away, we are too young, there is too much of our life ahead of us. The truth is that every day could be our last. Tomorrow you could wake up in a state of nothingness. The last thing you said to your best friend could be the last thing they ever hear you say. Tonight could be the last night of your life. It makes one think. Are you doing something meaningful with your life? Do you make the most of each moment, do you live it to the fullest? Are you surrounding yourself with love and people that love you and people that you love? Are you living like tonight is the last night of your life? No one knows without some kind of a doubt what lies beyond our realm of life, although we would like to believe we do. The only thing anyone knows for sure is that we are here now, living life. That we live it right is the only thing we can be sure of doing. The only hard part about that is finding out what living right means to you. It is a personal meaning that only you can define. That way if the injust forces of the Universe decide to take you before you have established yourself in the adult working world, you will have enjoyed life to the last drop, and really experienced it before you went. It may not matter in whatever comes next, but at least you will have not wasted your life. Today Fifer and I went to Collins Park thrift store and got some cool t-shirts. I am wearing my element shirt right now. Then we went to T.J. Maxx and I got some jeans for $15 (Woo! Have not yet gone over my $20 jean spending limit). Then I drove her to Summit and she got her schedule fixed. She has a family development class, hahahahaha. We wanted to see Mrs. Lands, but she was not there. Then I went to work. Jennifer visited me around 9:15 and waited for me to get off at 10:00. Then we went and played pool at sparetime lanes. She almost made me cry tonight because she was talking about how she will miss me so much when I go away. She told me that I am her only and best friend and that things are going to suck when I won't be around. I told her I was going to cry and she said that I should. I think I am crying now. I am gonna miss all you guys so much! But, I must refrain. This is not yet my good-bye blog. I will save this for later. I need to go to sleep now. I am in a melancholy mood. -Lisa

Eight days until I leave. I really don't think it has really set in yet. I mean, I realize that I will be moving away from the Arlington/Mansfield area for the first time in my life and that I will no longer be able to see all of the people I have grown accustomed to seeing, but at the same time, it is like...it hasn't hit me yet. It may not be until I am away and living on my own that it finally does hit me. I am still not sure what is the best decision to make, but I have made one, and I am sticking with it. Besides, I think that this will probably be one of the best experiences of my life. Hopefully. So I bought our mini-fridge yesterday. 99.99 plus tax, but it is worth it I think. I still think that I got the expensive side of things what with having to get a 100 dollar fridge while Naomi gets a 40 dollar microwave but oh well, it matters not. I had totally forgotten that I had told her that I would go look for a refrigerator after work yesterday so I had already told Fifer I would call her and then Naomi called and reminded me and then said that she had gotten me a ticket to the Rangers game that night. But it is cool because everything was sorted out in the end. Well, the game ended up being cancelled because of the storm so Naomi's friend who had invited us invited us to hang out with him and his friends so we went to this random guy's house. His name was Toby. So there were about fifteen people there. Most of them were seniors and there were a few juniors. They all went to the same school or church or something. I dunno. It was fun I suppose, but it is always weird going to someone's house you don't know and hanging out with people that you just met and they are all friends so you are just kind of the outsider. Naomi was outgoing and whatnot because she had met most of them at some church camp she went to. At one point, when I was not talking much, she started explaining to people that I was really quiet. I HATE when people do that. It is almost like they are talking about you like you are not even there and on top of that, they act like they are apologizing for your behavior. But oh well. I just honestly did not have anything to say. And they were all quite interesting people so for the most part I just enjoyed listening to their conversations. After a while we all ended up playing Catchphrase. That was pretty cool. They seemed like they would be a great group of people to have as friends. So that was my night. This morning I woke up to my mom yelling at me. "Remember to pick up Brian from football!" "Yeah, yeah, I know, Mom..." ::Looks at watch. It is 6:00. Moans and drops head back on pillow:: "And remember that your eye appointment is today at 3:30." ::Bolts up:: "I work at 3:30 today!" "Well then you had better get someone to fill in for you, because they do not have a spot open for another two weeks." ::Falls back down and sleeps:: Yeah, the only person I have the number of is Jennifer, and she has church today. And she already has more than 40 this week so that is kinda impossible. So this sucks. Why couldn't she have told me I have an appointment today at 3:30 before TODAY?!?!?!?! Oh well. It matters not. So then I picked up my brother and got some donuts/sausage rolls and then I came home. Then the neighbors asked me and my brother if we wanted to go "lift" with them. My brother does this all the time so I went and hung out in their garage for a bit and watched this guy nearly kill himself lifting over 200 pounds. That was pretty interesting. And then I came back here. On an ending note, I would just like to say that I have a lot of fun with Fifer! She is one fun person to hang out with. Seriously, we have fun together because we are just crazy like that. It is like Fun Inc. open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Ok...I am done now. -Lisa

I love life so much. I think I will die from happiness overload. Cowboys was so incredibly fun. Yay! Who knew that you could meet such nice 18-year-old guys? Or that you could have fun playing pool with them? Or that you would be sitting at Friday's with them an hour later drinking milkshakes? Not me, that's for sure. I bet Ashley and JoAnn never did that!!! hahahahahahahhahahaa. Not that I am rubbing it in their faces, lol. I mean, it is not their fault that they thought I was too boring of a person to take clubbing with them...:) :) :). Oh well, I am sure that next time they will be thrilled to go with me! So happy about TAMS. Naomi and I had so much fun tonight and TAMS will be awesome. Well, I am off to sleep on my balcony tonight, under the stars. Today I was thinking that if I don't want to be a doctor, I could always be a medicine researcher and help just as many people in that way. Good idea? I think it might be. Hmm...well, bye for real. -Lisa

Yesterday was really fun. Hehehe. After work, Naomi picked me up with Bethany and we made our way to Dreamworld. The only problem is, Naomi swore that Abram turned into Division (the street that Dreamworld is on) and sooooo to make a long story short, we went so far down Abram without running into Division and then turning and still not finding it that we made this big loop around Arlington and hit about five cities in 20 minutes. Mansfield, Arlington, Grand Prairie, Fort Worth, and Pantego. That took about 30 minutes and then finally we stopped at this gas station (and they made ME get out lol) and we figured out the way to Division. Not too long after that we got there, finally. But let me tell you, getting lost with these two was fun, not stressful like it might have been with other people. We constantly found things to laugh about and such...like the guys in this truck. We stopped at this red light and these guys were all staring and waving at us, so we were waving back. They were pretty cute too ;). We had this flirtatious thing going on for a few miles and then we had to turn left. But it was ever so funny. So we got to Dreamworld, and the band that Naomi knew someone from was on. They were a scream-o band (lol, I saw that word somewhere last night and that it was HILARIOUS. Emo...screamo...Get it!??!? Haahahahahahahaha) and they were pretty good. The guy that she knew was the bassist and she wore a shirt that she made that said "I Naomi was driving, so of course, we got lost. We drove around for like 30 minutes past 360 and into Grand Prairie, but not any of Grand Prairie that I had seen before. Finally we turned around and I instructed Naomi how to get home from 360. Then we went to Bobby V's and ate. That was a lot of fun too. Naomi and I decided to go to Cowboys tonight....it should be mui, tres (accent grave, correct?) interesting. I got home ten til midnight and Olivia called like five minutes later, because she was done with her date and was coming over. After my DVD player was being gay (it wouldn't play Moulin Rouge for some reason...we have issues right now. I am not talking to it.) we decided to just get on the internet (because that is what all the really cool people do). Well, it all started with "I Will Always Love You" and us singing our freakin lungs out to it...well, for that one actually it was more like me singing and her watching...but for the rest of them...hahahahahahahahahaha it was sooo fun. We started downloading all these old pop songs and singing our loudest to them. It was a trip down memory lane :) :). Wow, you have no idea how much fun we had. And then we rated pictures at hotornot.com. Keep in mind people, if you ever want to put your picture on there, that it will inevitably be met with one of four reactions. 1) Laughter. 2) Awwww. I feel sorry for him. 3) Eh. He is ok. Pretty cute. 4) OMG he is so HOT. It is completely look-based and so people will give you their opinion entirely based on your appearance, and not your personality. That was great fun too. I think we got more of the first reaction more than anything...lol... Oh and then we went to this website . It was very interesting. But you might have to turn up your volume a little bit, because it is hard to hear at this one part... Right so we were up until 5. And then I got up at 10:30. So I guess I should be tired...but...I'm not! I can't be...I'm going to Cowboys tonight!!! If JoAnn reads this, YES I AM GOING WITHOUT YOU. That is what you and Ashley get for refusing to go with me. I resent that :) :). Well, that is all. -Lisa PS- Hello by Lionel Richie is so beautiful. I hope someone sings it to me one day...

Lollapalooza was pretty cool. I felt kinda bad because I just wasn't as excited about the concert or seeing Incubus as Fifer was, and it was kind of hard for me to get into the music but oh well. I now have a newfound respect for girl punk bands lol. I had just heard that one song by the Donnas on the radio and I really hated it, but seeing them live was pretty cool. I liked Burning Brides because their music was good, and they had a hardcore girl bassist. If I could play in a punk band, I would sooo do it. That would be so fun. Out of the four headliners, I liked Queens of the Stoneage the best. And then Incubus. And then Audioslave. And then...Jane's Addiction. Funny how that also happens to be the order they played in. I swear the lead singer of Jane's Addiction dressed like he was gay, but Fifer won't admit it, mua hahahahahahahaha. It was like a body-tight blue space suit! I dunno, Jane's Addiction was prolly my least favorite of the night. That guy's voice just annoys me for some reason... We saw Shayne, Colin, Heather, Amy, and....JESSICA!!!!!!!!!!! I really really really really can't stand her. She was flirting with Shayne, but I have it on good authority that he is not interested in her at all. She got free tickets apparently and that is the reason she went. Why couldn't people that actually like the music get free tickets?!?! That is some messed up stuff. So, what else happened? Hmm...oh yeah, at the first set we went to, a drunk guy came up to me and put his arm on my shoulder and was talking to me...that was pretty scary. I guess the reason I really did not enjoy it as much as I did Warped Tour is that I hate having to be so far away from the stage, that just doesn't get me into the music enough. Warped Tour's stages were all small ones with no fancy lights and no seats...just the stage, the band, and the crowd. And that suffices for me. Plus, I was tired for some reason. Oh well. I had fun. Great, great fun. If I go to Lolla again, I'll be sure to get pit tickets :) :). I'm off to a night of bathing and reading...preferrably at the same time if at all possible. -Lisa

So I just got done doing most of my dorm shopping, and let me tell you, I am beginning to be very optimistic about the upcoming year. I mean, I thought that hanging out with Naomi would be kind of hard without getting annoyed, but once I am past some of the stupid things she does, she's not that hard to hang out with. I actually enjoyed myself. And we got to talk a lot about our feelings about leaving and how we are excited but nervous, and how we are going to miss everyone but will be glad to leave the high school system and finally be challenged! We went to Wal-Mart and Target and got everything fairly cheap. I mean, for about $100 I have everything I need for my room save for the refrigerator. It is all dark red and blue, we are doing a color scheme type thing...it's going to be pretty cool. All of you people will have to come up there sometime and see it. We ate at an Italian place afterwards, and it was really good. So that was fun. Hmm...I am excited (but nervous) about leaving in two weeks!!! "You knew they were there, didn't you?" Kahlan asked in a hushed tone as she leaned closer. Against the darkening sky, she could just make out the shapes of three black-tipped races taking to wing, beginning their nightly hunt. That was why he'd stopped. That was what he'd been watching as the rest of them waited in uneasy silence. The first two paragraphs of Naked Empire by Terry Goodkind! Ok, don't ask me why it is named what it is. I wish it had a cooler title like the sixth book, Faith of the Fallen...or the fourth book, Temple of the Winds...or any of the other books. But, regardless, it will be an awesome story, as they all undoubtedly always are. All 7 of the previous ones and now the 8th! I speak of The Sword of Truth series, if anybody is wondering. I wandered into the book store today and saw it and had to get it...I had been waiting all summer for it to come out, and it finally did! But, it sucks because I don't want to start reading it while I am in the middle of Hitchhiker's Guide...so...hmm....will have to read quickly :) :) Well, that is all. -Lisa

It is funny sometimes, how when you think something will be completely unpleasant and horrible to deal with, it turns out to be not nearly as bad as you thought it was going to be. I really thought that my dad would freak out and be furious with me for getting in a wreck. But...he was cool about it. So cool that for a moment I thought that I had gotten another "David" from Information Services. I feared his wrath. But I think that perhaps my fear was unjustified. I don't know. And this morning, my mom was not really mad anymore, just...a little weird acting. But I think that maybe all of this will be okay in the end, and I was not expecting things to be cleared up so easily. In fact, I am actually starting to feel like myself again. The past couple of days I have not felt quite like I was living my own life, but rather the movie version, if that makes any sense. I was actually convinced for a few moments after I woke up that I had dreamed the wreck. And yesterday morning when I woke up I was actually convinced for a few moments that I had dreamed the night before, that is, until I realized Olivia was at my house. And really, when I look at my life in a certain perspective, I can't believe it's my own. It's a weird feeling... "Almost as weird as going to Kroger at midnight and realizing they don't sell Maxi pads, but that they have a section for 'Men's needs'" -olivia haahahahahahahahahaha. Sorry, I had to put that :). When I listen to music now, I feel like I am in it.... The music encompasses me, and I am lost in it. Maybe that is why I love music so much. I went and got an estimate today for my mom's car. The lady said it would be about $1700!!! For this dent in the corner of the car. It hardly seems worth it, but as my dad said, "that's why you have insurance" (in a calm and reassuring voice...I'm telling you, it's weird...maybe space aliens have pocessed his body and are experimenting on him). Of course, half of the cost is labor costs. It was like 30 hours at $36/hour or something like that. Personally, I don't think that it would take 30 hours to fix it, but whatever. I think maybe I will get another estimate just to see if I am getting ripped off. Well, I'm off to my dad's and then to the skating competition!! I'll prolly write more later...oh, and just in case none of you know what I am talking about, just read the entry below...it explains a lot. -Lisa

I hate driving, I hate driving, I hate driving. I really hate driving, I really hate driving, I really hate driving. I wish I could crawl into a hole and never come out. You know that feeling when your parents get mad at you, but its not for something like not cleaning your room, but something like getting into a wreck with their car? Oh my God, I HATE driving. I am such a horrible driver, and I feel like crap. It's like one minute your driving down Green Oaks on your way home from work like any other normal evening and suddenly you realize that the car in front of you is stopping just a little too quickly and you are following just a little too closely and you know you are not going to be able to stop in time. So you swerve to avoid a collision but still hit the car with the corner of yours and pieces of metal and glass shoot out and you stop dead in the middle of the road, freaking shaking and crying and feeling like you want to be dead. Then a car that was behind you drives by you and flicks you off/cusses you out. And the car you hit drives onto the side of the road and just...waits for you. And so you drive by and roll the window down and profusely apologize because it was entirely your fault and the person you hit turns out to be THE FATHER OF ONE OF YOUR CO-WORKERS DRIVING HIM HOME FROM WORK. And nothing is really wrong with his car except for a scratch or two and then he is like, "Well, you better look at your car. That is what I am worried about." And then it hits you. HOLY SHIT. My car...my car...my mom's car...crap crap crap crap crap crap CRAP. So you get out of the car and you see the huge dent in the corner of your car. SHE IS GOING TO KILL ME are the only comprehensible thoughts in your head as you sort out the final details with the guy and drive away, and you can't stop shaking and you are on the verge of tears the entire way home and then when you tell your mom about it she just gets really angry and silent and walks back to her room, leaving you to cry out on the driveway and you know that you have screwed up bad and you just want to crawl in a hole and die somewhere. And then your brothers have no emotions and try to tease you about it when really, that just makes you want to cry even harder. And then you realize that you have to tell your dad the next day and face his disappointment and anger and lectures and you'll probably put all of your money that you have been saving for TAMS towards fixing the freakin thing and you want to cry even more and it is like why does one of the best nights of my life have to be followed by one of the worst? This is the worst I have felt in a long time. Last night was like a dream, tonight is like a nightmare. I would have tons to write about last night if it were not for this overshadowing the good time I had. I HATE DRIVING, holy freaking crap. I cannot even describe how spectacularly crappy I feel at the moment. Last night I just hung out with Olivia, Colby, Jordan, and Seth until like 4 in the morning. It was sooo incredibly fun. But it matters not now. God, I can't believe how stupid I am. I feel like such a horrible person. -Lisa PS- My brother fixed my computer.

Hey Everyone Just so yall know, if I am not online at all anytime soon it is because my computer is being gay and is broken and refuses to start up. All that happens is a blue screen comes up and says some crap about how Windows cannot be started because of something that was improperly installed and I need to uninstall it but how am I supposed to uninstall it if I cannot get on my freakin computer??? So yeah, I hope this is fixable, because that is the computer I was gonna bring to TAMS. It would suck so much if I could not bring a computer there. Sigh...Whyyyy does my computer have to start sucking now???? So, yeah, that's why I am nowhere to be found!! -Lisa

So yeah, I have just been working the past couple of days. Oh, and I bought some shoes this morning. I like them. Jennifer's reaction: "Yes, they are very Lisaish." Olivia's reaction: "Yeah, they look like just about every other pair of shoes you own." Ok, ok, so I don't like to change my style. Jeans, t-shirts, and tennis shoes til the day I die! Lessee, then I worked after that. I got off at 7:15 though so I had time to actually enjoy my evening. First Olivia and I went and ate dinner at Wiener Schnitzel (heh, it is funny trying to pronounce that when you say it like 5 times in a row...) and then she left to go somewhere with Alex (her soon-to-be boyfriend) and I went and visited JoAnn in her groundedness. I hung out with her and Victoria for a while and then I went home, and upstairs, and got on my computer. Olivia is supposed to be coming back over around midnight so we can watch movies and whatnot...maybe go swimming, I dunno. Sooooo, that is my life. Interesting, no? Wednesday will be fun. I get to go to the skater competition! And then Friday is Lollapalooza. Yay. Peace, Lisa

So I keep having this recurring dream and it kind of freaks me out. A lot actually. So I am in this movie theatre type thing with a crowd of people. I mean, it is crazy how many people are in there with me and this guy comes in there and locks all the doors so no one can get out and then he hides and he is like, "The first person to find me, I will either spare their life or kill them, but I will not tell you which." So no one knows whether or not to look for him and everyone starts running around in a panic. Then this one girl finds him and he is like, "This decides what happens. Either I kill you and everyone else here lives, or I give you this match and this key and you walk out but you have to strike the match and throw it on the ground (which happens to be doused with gasoline...I dunno how I knew that, but dreams work in strange ways)." Up until last night/morning, I had never remembered what she picked or maybe my mind just didn't dream it, I don't know....but she picked something last night. It makes you wonder doesn't it? What would you choose? I mean, of course we would like to think that we would choose to sacrifice ourselves for the sake of 100 people or so...but I guess you do not really know until something like that actually happens, which is about 99.9% unlikely. It is like that one story, The Lady and The Tiger...the princess has to choose whether or not her secret lover chooses one door with a tiger behind it so that he is eaten alive, or the other door with a woman behind it, that he would marry and be with for the rest of his life. Would the princess let her jealousy go so far as to let her lover die so that he would never know the love of another woman??? Do I just think too much? My dreams are crazy, especially as of late. -Lisa

Wow, yesterday was so fun. Almost unbelievably so. After the tennis tryouts that I watched in the morning (wrote about those in the last entry), Olivia and I went shopping for a little while and that was really fun. She was going to use my no-rules house to come to after a late date with her "friend" Alex, but she decided not to in the end. I got another pair of jeans for only $20 and avoided The Buckle, lol. But I saw the guy again!!! I was like, "Olivia! Hide me!!" It was funny. After that I came home and my mom said that Jennifer had been calling me all day so I called her and she says she wants to do something tonight and I was like, "Well, me and the other Jennifer are doing something tonight, so we can all go." and she is cool with that, so yeah. Jennifer's sister is a big fag. She hates me for absolutely no reason at all, save for the fact that I am her sister's friend. And she is just a big whiny fag. Ok, enough said. Victoria had an away message that said something about the concert she was going to at 8:00 so I thought that would be fun to go to, but Jennifer's mom wasn't answering her phone so she couldn't ask her to go, which was ok because we decided to try and find the skatepark that Nick had told me about. I don't think any of us really expected to find it, especially after the directions we got from the guys at the gas station, but we did, finally. In the middle of nowhere. All the guys there were kinda young and no one was spectacularly good. There was this one guy that was pretty cute and me and Jennifer watched a lot. But he ended up being a jerk. When Jennifer waved to him and tried to say hi or whatnot he moved to the other side of the park and started totally avoiding us. Soooo, whenever we left, I drove up to this big opening and we just sat there watching him. He was kinda freaked out, and then Jennifer honked the horn and the turned around and was all, what the...? Ahahahahahhaa. Then we left. I think Jennifer, Fifer, and I were all dying from laughter. Twas great. Then, HOOTERS!!!! I was just curious. I mean, I had never been there before, and I knew it wasn't like a strip club or anything. Although, I guess it was kind of strange seeing three girls go in there without any guys. But oh well. On our way in there were three guys hanging out outside and they were all, "Hello ladies" and I was like, "Hi." and then one of them was like, "Do you work here?" hahahahahahahaha. I laughed and was like, "Uhhh, no." Fifer was right behind me laughing too. But it raised my self esteem! A guy thought that I was as pretty as the girls that work there! (Which I don't think I am, but whatever...he prolly wasn't paying attention to face/hair/whatever else is above the chest....lol) Anyway, the food was actually really good, and our waitress was really nice. The only thing different in that place from a normal restaurant is that the clothes that the waitresses wear are just a tad more skimpy than regular clothes...heh. The only freaky part was when these old men started talking to/hitting on us. I am sooo inspired to get a job there...lol...ok ok, I am like 75% kidding, but seriously...think of the tips you would get!! You'd be rich! So anyway, after that, we went to Kroger for a bit, and Jennifer talked to her old man crush, and I talked to Daniel a bit, although I have decided that I don't have a crush on him because....well, just because. As of right now, I don't really have a crush on anyone. It's kinda nice, kinda not. Heh, I wonder if I'll ever be married. Then I dropped Jennifer off and me and Fifer went to my house. We both fell asleep pretty soon after the movie started because I was really tired. Today all I did was swim and then go to work. That was boring. Oh well. Lisa PS- 18 DAYS!!!!!!!! (Am I excited or dreading the prospect of leaving??? It varies on a minute-to-minute basis)

so these last couple of days have been interesting. Wednesday I went with Jennifer to Burgers Lake because it was Kroger's company picnic thing. I was like, "You know, Jennifer, there aren't going to be people our age there with Kroger. It is going to be a bunch of 40-year-old men and their families playing horseshoes and eating barbeque." Well, I was right about everything but the horseshoes. Except for this one guy, Cody, that was there with his mom and little brother. He was absolutely beautiful and he was playing with his little brother who was like 2 or 3. It was soooo cute. He was probably 17 or 18. And then there were all the guys that went there just because it was burgers lake. Jennifer somehow convinced me to jump off of the tallest diving board....I don't know how she did that. I hadn't jumped off the diving board since...umm....6th grade? 7th? Gah, it's been so long, I don't even remember. And then we did a lot of swimming in general. It was fun. Afterwards we ate barbeque with the old folks and then played some volleyball. That was a lot of fun too. I think Jennifer and I kind of made our peace. I had been really annoyed with her for most of the summer, but we talked some things out and I think we're ok now. So that is good. When I got home, my brothers and I all went swimming until around midnight. That is about it. Thursday I worked and then Olivia and I went to a midnight showing of American Wedding. That was really fun. There were a lot of people that showed up. A lot of the workers and their friends. Most of them were cool, except for a couple of them. The movie itself was hilarious at parts and disgusting at others. There were parts that made me just shudder and gasp in shock. I guess I should be glad that I am still capable of being shocked and not desensitized to everything. This morning I got up and went to watch the tennis tryouts again. I brought donuts for everyone. Still trying not to think about how much I am going to miss everyone and everything so much. How many times have I written that before? I don't know, but I know that it is true. Last night I had this dream and I do not even remember exactly how it went. All I know is that it had to do with a couple guys I know. Anyways, I woke up this morning with that weird awkward feeling that you get after you do something that makes you feel guilty or stupid and then you have to see the person that saw you do it. Like a "I wanna crawl into a hole and die" type feeling. And it's really weird, because I still have it, and I am not even sure why. Hmm...interesting the way the mind works, eh? Well, I am off. Going shopping today, woo! Lisa

Mua ha. We just got docked for quiet hours. Hehe. I was sitting on my bed when I had the vague suspicion that something was wrong. Oh wait ...I thought... is that my saline cracker...moving? Yes, yes it was. Or more accurately, it was the WORM on the cracker moving. And we were all eating them (the crackers, not the worms). The announcement of my discovery was followed by a rush to the bathroom across the hall to rinse out our mouths and much screaming and laughing (from shock). Apparently, we were being very loud, so our RA said she was going to doc us. Hah. We deserved it though, although it was well worth it. Ugh. Can't believe I was eating those crackers. Disgust. I went and tutored high school students today. At first, I was afraid that they would hate us, because we are their age or younger, and helping them out. But, most of them were pretty cool. I mainly helped out this guy with electronics (I don't know why he took this class, because he didn't seem to have a desire to learn about it.), which I did not know anything about, so I was kinda teaching myself the chapter as we went along, and I helped him step by step do this problem. So, I now know like four or five electronics formulas! It was interesting, I should take it as an elective sometime. Hmm...and another Sailing Club/Team meeting. Signed up for my second practice. Should be fun. Am excited. Woop. English was only like 5 minutes long today. Sooo cool. On our way back from eating, Naomi, Rebecca, and I were doubled over with laughter. I seriously had to stop in the middle of the parking lot because I was laughing so hard. I haven't laughed that hard in a long time. Not since I have been here, for sure. It was fun. So, yeah, today was definitely a good day. And now I am off. Bye! Lisa

So I just finished my last pop ice. It was banana flavored. I think I am addicted. But, it's all good. At least I am addicted to pop ice and not like...glue sniffing...or antifreeze...or something. So, the weekend, while very relaxing, was also unproductive as far as studying goes, although I did manage to drag myself through the 2 and a half hours worth of Pre Cal homework he gave us. Yesterday I was kinda bored all day because Naomi, Rebecca, Laura, and pretty much everyone else was doing something all day, and so I didn't have anyone to hang out with. At some point, I hung out with Jonathan and Osato in Smitty and beat Osato at pool and this other guy at ping pong. Then I...did nothing, I think. Naomi and Rebecca got back soon and we all decided to go to 7-11 and Jack in the Box and that was really fun. All the college people were all yelling and getting drunk because we had won the game. Then, we went and played soccer, just the three of us, and we were joined by this one guy later on. It was pretty cool. Today it was so pretty outside that I "studied" outside for a little over two hours. When I say study, I really mean that I did five Pre Cal problems over the course of two hours and spent the rest of the time thinking, enjoying the beautiful scenery, and listening to my autumn CD that I burned today. I burn one of those every year. There are just songs that need to be listened to in fall weather. Then, I ate with a bunch of people. Then, Naomi and I went and played tennis for two hours. We went into a three-setter. It was some hardcore stuff. We played some nice points. I won 6-1, 4-6, 6-2. Then we played a set of doubles with these two guys that I am pretty sure were gay. That was interesting. That is about it. It was a nice weekend, I suppose. Ciao amigos. Lisa

So, apparently, sailing is a sport. No, I'm serious. You get a semi-workout!! At least for your muscles. Today Laura and I were talking after English and she tells me how her, Lisa, and Gilda are all going sailing with UNT's sailing club this afternoon, and she invited me to go. I was like, "Sure!" We rode with this guy, Zach, who is practically professional when it comes to sailing, and he was....nice...but...he is one of those guys that like....has no apparent sense of humor. Everything is informative to him it seems...but I dunno...maybe we just had different senses of humor. His choice of music was country. And ok, as much as punk rock is my passion and soul as far as music goes, there will always run in my veins country blood. My entire family is diehard country folks. I know almost every song out there, and listening to country sometimes just relaxes me and reminds me of how time at my grandmother's house seems to stand still. Life is so relaxed and pleasant, and country people have attitude. I love it. Like, there was this one song, and the chorus was basically, "Screw you, we're from Texas. Screw you, we're from Texas. Screw you, we're from Texas. We're from Texas, Screw You!" It was sooo funny, because that is how the hardcore small town Texans are. They aren't Americans, they are Texans. I love being from Texas, it is great. Sailing itself was soo fun. We went to this lake about 45 minutes away and it was really beautiful. First, I sailed on this one called a "Sunfish" and that was basically just a one person boat. It is kinda confusing knowing when to pull the sail in and let it go out, and tacking is kinda confusing sometimes, but I got the hang of it after a while. However, the really fun part was sailing the 420. That is a two-person boat. Twas Zach and I. He was the "skipper" and I was the "crew" which means that he steered and did all the complicated stuff while I took care of the front sail. I got to hike, which was fun, and tacking was really fun, and after a while, it gets tiring. But, it is really fun. I felt soo stupid though. Sometimes I should just not talk. He said something about regattas and I was like, "Oh, you do races?" (Looks at me like I am dumb) "That is all being in sailing club is about." :) Oops. Haha. But it was really fun. I think I am going to go next week. I should take this up as a hobby. After that, I chilled for a while, eating and whatnot, and then it was off to Argentinean Tango!! It was really fun as well! My first partner was Kyle, and he really wanted to learn, which was good. I think we had good chemistry as far as dancing goes. We got the hang of it after a while. My second partner was this other guy I don't know the name of. Then I danced with this other guy named...Raul?? Something like that. And then I danced with Carlos...the roommate of Kenney, the guy that I thought I liked for a while but then decided I didn't. Carlos was a pretty good dancer. We did one of the more advanced moves. Twas pretty cool. I dunno, it was different from what I thought it would be. I guess real tango, at least the Argentinean kind, isn't like what they show on movies and stuff. You don't get all close to your partner and stuff, although our insructor said you could do whatever after you got the basics down. But, the basics include staying about a foot apart from each other, with the guy's hand on the girl's back, and the girl's hand on the guy's shoulder and the other two hands holding. I'll have to show some of you people some time. I am going to start doing that every Friday too :). Then Rebecca and I walked around a lot and talked, and went to 7-11, Sack-n-save, and IHOP. I had a really fun night tonight. Yes, quite fun, quite fun. :) Well, we are having a Moulin rouge party in my room after curfew so I'll go now. -Lisa

Hmm...interesting night... So, I have this picture of the moon on my desktop now, right? And so everytime I get on my computer I feel like I am WALKING ON THE MOON. It is pretty mind-blowing, if I do say so myself. If you are not interested in why money stresses me out, skip the entire next two paragraphs... Ah, where do I start? Oh yes. Money. I went to the financial aid lady today. I thought that I was going to have everything covered with my loans and stuff. Well, she told me that I could get a room and board scholarship for about 75% of what it is, but that I would have to unaccept all the loans I had already accepted and you know, it would be better because then it is free money that I wouldn’t have to pay back and whatnot. So, I unaccepted them, and I don’t regret that decision. I mean, I don’t want to start out my life with over $2,000 in debts that I didn’t have to have. So, yeah…that scholarship still only covers 75% and with my grants and such, that would be almost perfect…I would only have around $33 to pay each semester to go to TAMS. However, this year, with budget cuts and all, we have to pay about $1000 in tuition and for some reason, we have to pay it all this semester. We cannot split it in half and pay $500 next semester or anything. My loans, had I accepted them, would have covered that and room and board. Basically, what it comes down to is that I have to come up with $1100 this semester. That is like impossible. She said I could reapply for loans after I get my room and board scholarship, but then it is based on only what money need I have left, and the loan people don’t figure in the $1,000 I pay of tuition because I pay that through TAMS, and not the university. So she said that will only give me about $250 more this sesmester which still leaves me with around $850 to pay!!! I don’t think my parents can really pick that up. I mean, I don’t know for sure, but I know I don’t want to make them pick it up. So, I don’t know what I am going to do. *Sigh* Stupid budget cuts. She said that every year before this, the students didn’t even have to pay anything, TAMS would just pick up 100% of their need. Oh well. I guess I will just have to deal with it. How? I don’t really know. I guess I could try to get a job over Christmas break and then pay my parents back with the money I earn then. Because I may be able to call Kroger and ask them if they need any extra help for the holidays, since those are extremely busy. But, once again, I don’t know if I could get hired for a month or not. Geez, things are confusing. I wouldn’t be so reluctant to ask my parents for that money if I thought that I would be going to a college that accepted all of the college hours I earn during these two years. But, for the most part, private universities rarely accept more than 12 to 16 transfer credits…hmm…I am checking into Boston University, but I don’t know for sure. I think that right now, that is the school I want to go to the most. That or George Washington in D.C. That one looked pretty cool as well. I mean, I will apply to a couple of Ivy Leagues just for the heck of it, but I don’t know if I could get in. Of course, it may end up that I will not even be able to go to a private school, since they cost so much. But that is where I would want to go, if I get enough scholarships and financial aid. It kinda sucks how much money my family doesn’t have. I am thinking that once Jason graduates in December next year, it will be less of a financial strain on my dad, but I just don’t know!! Why does education cost so much? Dunja used to tell me how in Croatia, if you made really good grades, and you were smart or whatnot, the government just paid for you to go to school where ever you wanted to go. It should be like that here. Oh well. I need to stop thinking about this money situation or I will go crazy. *END OF FINANCIAL BORINGNESS NOW* Tonight was pretty fun. I went to Clark with Sarah and Sal and ate. That was pretty cool. And then I went to watch karoke. Man, TAMS is the home of some of the funniest kids. Ever. Haha. It was really funny. I have just hung out with Naomi and Rebecca a lot. It was great, great fun. Much laughing, many jokes...ah, every night is like a sleepover. Except for the night before a bio test, of course. Er yeah, Jaison IMed me tonight and was like all inviting me to get drunk with him. I can't tell if he was being serious or not because he is weird like that sometimes. Hmm...I am gonna have to talk to him tomorrow. Well, That is all! Lisa

Oops, haha, my first tuition payment of $500 was due on September 10th. Eek. Oh well, :). So I got a good grade on my biology exam...one of the highest in the Junior class. Hmm...I was excited about that for a while. But, you know, I am just in one of those moods when I don't really have an opinion on all too much, except that I am really tired of math. Urg. So much math I have to do the next two years. Calculus next semester. Calc 2 and something else (Calc 3, Linear Algebra? Economics?) next year. Too much. I think I had better teach myself to love it. Step 1) Forget that I hate it. Step 2) Convince myself that I like it. Step 3) This will develop into love. I guess sometimes it is ok. I actually like doing problems when it isn't like 20 or 30 problems that I have to do in one night. *Sigh* oh well. We go into trigonometry (sp?) sometime this upcoming week. Yay. I also have to write an essay on this poem that makes absolutely no sense. I mean, I guess it could make sense if you looked at it in a certain perspective, but it is just messed up. "Portrait of a Child" by Corey Marks. I mean, what the crap, where do these people come up with this stuff?! Hmm...Blah. That is kinda how I feel. Just blah. Sometimes, I miss home so much. I miss Olivia, Fifer, Jennifer, Amy, my little brother, JoAnn, Ashley, my mom, my dad, Leah, Jon, the other Ashley, and Dunja...and everyone at school. And I mean everyone. I miss everyone that I grew up with. I mean, here is great and everything. I have tons of fun and there are lots of really cool people that I am friends with, but I just miss everyone so much. I often find myself wondering what this year would be like had I stayed at Summit. I was just fitting into a group of friends when I left, and I kinda wish I had gotten to see how that turned out. But at the same time, it is a good thing that I came here. Going back to high school right now would be hell. Just because once you are used to this, there is no going back without realizing how much high school sucks. Hmm...so many mixed emotions. In other news, I kinda wish Osato would stop hinting at stuff and then not telling me any straight facts. Like today. "Me and Jonathan stayed up talking about you for like 30 minutes last night." "Really? What did y'all say about me?" "Just stuff. It was good stuff, don't worry." I asked him a couple more times, but he refuses to tell me what he is talking about, as usual. I dunno. Sometimes I think he is just making stuff up, but why would he make stuff up like that? Wow, this is a really boring blog. I should probably try to make it more interesting now. So, on Sunday, Naomi cut off all her hair to give to Locks of Love, which is basically a foundation that makes wigs out of real hair to give to cancer patients and the such. I thought it was a really cool idea and a really generous thing of her to do. She cut off about 16 inches in the end, what with trimming and all. It was pretty crazy. I think I need to get some more opinions. I am so non-opinionated. Especially when it comes to politics. I need political stands, don't ya think? I mean, I don't even know whether or not I like GW as our president. I talk to a lot of people who are so pro or anti something and I am just like, "Yeah, yeah, whatever floats your boat." Hmm...I guess some things just don't matter a whole lot to me. So, tomorrow is the season premiere of Gilmore Girls. I am very excited. Apparently, Luke is supposed to have gotten married on the cruise he took with that one woman, but she is stupid, and I think I also heard that they are gonna get divorced asap. They had better. Luke and Lorelai all the way! And I am Pro-Dean as well. Isn't it sad that I have more adamant opinions about a prime time television show than I do the state of our president/government? I think it is pretty messed up. Oh well. Being in an apathetic mood and all, I guess there is not much I can do about it. Well, I am off to try and decipher this stupid poem. Wish me luck. au revoir lisa

I know it says Sunday, but it is Saturday. And I know yesterday's says Saturday, but it was really Friday. Today I was awakened by Fifer calling me at 7:30. Her: Hey Lisa Me: rrriasffjrigdjfkdgirr Her: Oh, I’m sorry, are you asleep? Me: hmm not anymore… I went and helped out with “Denton Kids” for a while. The kid I was helping out was kinda rebellious. He kept trying to steal all the prizes, and then when it was time for coloring, he decided that the paper was too boring to draw on, so he started drawing on the tables. So, I was like, “Ok, Edward, the tables aren’t for drawing on.” And so naturally, he started drawing on me. *Sigh* I don’t know if I could ever handle having kids. He was bearable towards the end because I distracted him with tic tac toe, which he liked for some reason. When we were driving back, I looked out of the window and saw Mrs. Lands! I was all, “Hurry up!!!” and so I ran over there and said hi to Fifer and Mrs. Lands and Ruchi. It was interesting while it lasted. Then I went thrift shopping for a while, but it wasn’t like a real thrift store, it was like a fake one, and it really annoyed me. They sold the kind of really random shirts that aren’t really random because they are made at factories to look random and they were selling for freakin $12 a shirt. That is not thrifting!! What are those people thinking?! Then I read/slept for a while and then Rebecca came and got us and we all went out to the fields and played a little soccer between the three of us. It was such a beautiful day outside. We all were laying on the ground talking for a while. It was great. Hah, and tonight was the annual Screw Your Roommate Dance. I wore a non t-shirt (gasp), and some nice jeans that I have only worn twice before. And I actually put on some makeup, which is weird for me. My date ended up being…..Jonathan! Haha. That guy is hilarious. And he is pretty cute too… Him and Osato are roommates, and so, for the dance, Jonathan wore one of Osato’s “pimping” outfits and Osato wore Jonathan’s all-American white boy clothes. It was soooooooo-------------- funny. They are the funniest pair. So, yeah, it was pretty interesting, I guess, that Jonathan and I were matched up. He was #2 on my list and I don’t know if I was on his. The first time we danced, it was somewhat awkward, but after that, it was cool. He is so much taller than me though. I was all looking up at him. Hmm…he had to leave early though because his parents insist on picking him up really early every Sunday morning and he is one of those guys that has to have lots of sleep. I also ended up dancing with Osato, Mordechai, and Alejandro (my goodness, why can’t they have normal names?!) Mordechai talked to me about how he likes Naomi, Alejandro didn’t really talk to me about anything, and Osato talked to me about…Jonathan. I think he is trying to hook us up. He was all, “Sooo, you and Jonathan got to spend some quality time together tonight?” and I was like, “Uh, I guess so.” and he was like, “Yeah, he is a nice guy, you know?” and I was like, “Yeah, he is.” and then he was like, “And he has a cute smile…right, right?” It was like he was trying to get me to say that I liked Jonathan, and it isn’t the first time he has tried to do that. I don’t know if I would go for Jonathan. He is, as Osato pointed out, a very nice guy, and he does have a cute smile. And he is quite hilarious. But, do we get along in a way that would be good for dating-wise? I don’t know. I guess I won’t try to decide anything right now. I don’t think that he would ever like me anyway, so I guess it would be pointless to decide to develop a crush on him…ANYway… On an unrelated topic, I feel really bad. Sometimes I should just keep my mouth shut. Last night and today I had convinced Rebecca that Sal liked her, and she liked him, so she was all happy. I got her hopes up, and then tonight she found out that he told Naomi that he did not like her. I felt crappy. From now on, I will not try to convince anyone that the person they like likes them in return. We went outside for a while though, and just sat talking about things. Here is my deal: I feel so behind other people my age. I mean, I haven’t ever really had a real relationship. I haven’t ever had my first kiss. Sometimes I just wish I could have already. I want to experience all that, I really do, but at the same time, I am not desperate, and I don’t want to just get together with any old guy that comes along. You know? I want my first kiss to be somewhat special. I want any relationship I have to be because we both like each other, not because one of us needed a boyfriend or girlfriend for the week. And for some reason, guys don’t like me. I mean, I don’t think I am ugly. I’m definitely not all that pretty, but I don’t think I am ugly, and I am friendly around guys and the such, but they just are never interested in me…and it has always been that way. I don’t know what I do wrong. Gah. I just see all these couples together and it depresses me. What do I want, anyway?!?!? I don’t freakin know. I am so confused. Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh The End Lisa

Today was the first day of true fall weather. And I absolutely love it. I woke up this morning primed and ready for the biology test. This first biology test is the one everyone talks about. It is supposed to be the "wake up call" for most Juniors, it is freakin hard, there are only a few select A's. In short, it makes or breaks you as far as biology goes, which is one of the most stressed Junior classes we take. It goes into stuff REALLY in depth. Chapters 1-5 were a review of stuff I should have learned in High School biology, had I taken it. We tested over Chapters 1-6. It was crazy. Keep in mind that last week I didn't know the difference between a cell membrane and a mitochondria. Today I can tell you that and then some and then some and THEN SOME. It is amazing how much I have taught myself about biology (utilizing the book, of course). So, I studied hours upon hours, days upon days, and yes, I was prepared for this test. I woke up an hour early this morning and was in a very good mood. When I went outside and smelled the crisp, fall air, I was in an even better mood. It was a bit chilly, so I went back upstairs and got my letter jacket. It made me feel all warm, fuzzy, and...lettery. The test was...almost easy. It would have been hard if I hadn't studied. It is weird because this is the first time in my life that I actually had to work hard and actually do hardcore studying for a test. It makes me feel good inside. After that, I had an awesome day. I went to two more classes, went out to eat like twice, and then a bunch of us watched 36 Crazy Fists in our room. It was soooo funny. It was this old Asian kung fu movie with really bad english dubs. Aw man...sooo hilarious. It was all, "Return my hand!" ::Guy gives him his severed hand back:: "Mua hahahahahahaha." Maybe you would just have to see it to understand the hilarity, but it was there, let me tell you. Then, Rebecca and I wrote our news article about roommates together. It was the first time I have ever cowritten anything. It was pretty interesting. It turned out to be...er...something. Haha. Next issue I am going to write some real stories or editorials I think. Naomi decided to go out with some of her guys, so it was just Rebecca, me, Sal, Osato, and Jonathan that went to play soccer and they wanted to play indoor for some reason, which turned out to be not such a hot idea. We were playing with all these 20-sumthin-year-old-guys that thought they were all good, but really they were just ball hogs and would not pass Rebecca or I the ball because we were girls. Ok, so the ball was really high up in the air so I went to head it and then the RETARD in front of me decided he was going to do a bicycle kick to get it into the goal (even though he was not good enough to do it). He kicked me as hard as he could under my jaw. There was a burst of pain, and then blinding white light, and I hit the ground. Osato rushed to my rescue I guess you could say. I was crying because of the pain and I couldn't move my mouth. He just escorted me off the court field thing and then he just ran back out there wanting to play some more. So, I just proceeded to leave by myself. But, Rebecca wouldn't let me so she came with me. My mouth was full of blood and my jaw is disaligned (I think I just butchered that word and I am not even sure it is a word...). For a while, it felt as if my ears were bleeding too, but that faded after a while. I cried for like a minute and then stopped because I HATE crying in front of anyone. It is just not me. By the time we were out of the rec center, I was laughing at myself again, despite the constant pain. Other than that, my evening was grand. Rebecca and I hung out for the most part of the evening. We battled it out on DDR (I am actually developing something that resembles skill at that game). It was so fun! And then we baked cookies, and hung out with people. It was pretty fun... Tomorrow will be a busy day. I think I get to see Fifer (Woo!) and then I am helping with Denton Kids and then the Screw Your Roommate Dance is tomorrow night! I wonder who my date is. Ah, the suspense is killing me. You know, sometimes, when I look at all these other couples being all happy, I wish I had a guy. I just...haven't really met anyone I am really interested in yet. *Sigh* I just dunno...I just...don't. Lisa
I GOT AN AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA ON MY PRE CAL EXAM!!!!!! Last night's entry below....

Fifer, I am not avoiding you! I promise! After my test Friday, I will prolly be an internet addict just as bad as ever!! Ok, so the past couple of days I have been really busy. Basically, I am teaching myself an entire semester's worth of biology in a period of about 5 days. And I don't think I did so hot on my Pre Cal test that I took yesterday. I get the grade back tomorrow, and I am mui afraid. In other news, I sliced my head open on a nail today but it didn't hurt after about a minute so I just went about my business and then I realized I was bleeding but I didn't think it could be too bad...and then I started getting very sleepy all of a sudden... After Naomi woke me up, she examined my head and was like, "Oh my gosh, it is like an inch long and is really deep...and bloody.." Ah, I had a good laugh about that, let me tell you. I don't think that is still affecting me I mean I haven't passed out yet or anyth,;vl;k

OK, I honestly, honestly, honestly do NOT understand the male species...and YES, they are a species, a completely different one from the Female SPECIES. Nothing as simple as gender could be the differentiating factor between two organisms that share NOTHING in common (save for the fact that we are both human, which is of little to no importance). And NOT just when it comes to the romantic side of things, even when it is just concerning the day-to-day platonic friendships you hold with them. FOR INSTANCE. Today, everyone who had been playing soccer was racing back to the dorms to beat curfew when I tripped (as I do fifty million times a day) and totally wiped out on the cement. I writhed in pain on the ground for a few seconds and Jonathan stopped and was all, "Oh my gosh! Are you alright? Do you need ice? Are you alright??" and I was just like, "CURFEW!!!" and jumped up and sprinted inside. Once inside, we examined my bloddy knees and shins and he was all being concerned and sweet about it and kept asking if I needed ice for it and everything. He was just being really sweet. Ok, so I call him and I thank him and I am like, "I just want to say thank you for stopping to see if I was ok and all that." and then said some other stuff. Him: "Yeah, ok." END OF PHONE CONVERSATION. Maybe I am just making a big deal out of something that is not a big deal, but does anyone understand it? And Osato, who for the past four or five days has been kinda ignoring me and being rude to me sometimes gets all concerned all of a sudden and calls me up to make sure I am alright. The first freakin time he has really talked to me in a week and he acts like we are the best of friends...I just don't get it. And Jaison. I mean, really. Don't know what to think about him. Last week he called me like three or four times, talked to me a lot. Now...nothing. Do guys just get tired of being friends with certain girls sometimes or WHAT!?!? I don't understand. I would hate trying to understand a guy if I were ever in a relationship. Maybe I will just never get married. It would save a lot of confusion on my part, that's for sure. Maybe it is like they say in Men are from Mars, Women are from Venus. Men are like rubberbands. They get all close and then they pull away and then THE CYCLE STARTS ALL OVER AGAIN. Why can't they just make up their freakin minds? Ok, that is my rant of the day :). My apologies go out to the guy and/or guys who read this. -Lisa Scene from my dorm room tonight: Lisa is on computer talking to Naomi over AIM BananaFroggie: aye that she does ::Naomi jumps out of the chair and starts spazzing out on the floor:: Lisa: What the heck are you doing?! ::Looks at computer screen:: supertomatoe: rofl Naomi: You can't say it if you don't mean it. ::Lisa can't stop laughing for minutes on end:: College life is the greatest.

So the weekend was cool. I slept in both days until really late, but it was good since I did not go to sleep until around 4:00 both Friday and Saturday night. I had a nice, relaxing weekend full of soccer, movies, and Pre Cal studying (our first test is Tuesday). Saturday night I watched Say Anything with John Cusack and thought that it was really cute and then I went to the coffee haus thing, which is just like an open mike thing for anyone. There were some pretty WEIRD people that got up there to talk. This one girl did this speech that didn't make any sense at all, and I think the only reason she liked it was because of how many times it let her yell a curse word really loud. Rebecca and I were just like, "Riiiiight." Haha. And then there was this guy that was like, "We got any Douglas Adams fans out there tonight??" and I was all, "Wooo!" but I was the only one ;). So, he read a passage from one of his non-fiction books that was pretty interesting. After a bit of that, a group of us went and played soccer. It started out just being Rebecca, Naomi, me, Osato, Sal, and Norton but we picked up a few regular UNT students to play with us so we got a pretty good game going and played for a couple of hours. It was pretty cool. After that, Rebecca and her roommate, Jennifer, hung out with us for a while and we all watched some Strong Bad. Hmmm...and then, after they left, Naomi and I stayed up and talked for two hours straight...until 4:00...and we had some really good conversations. Today I basically just studied and hung out in my room and then played some soccer again tonight with some random UNT students. It was pretty fun. It brings me back to the ten years I spent obsessed with soccer. Select, practice, games, everything...there is an entire soccer culture out there, but it can get tiresome when all they care about is winning. That's why I like this better. It is more fun when you just get to play for fun, no worries, you know? I think I really want to go to college in Massachusetts somewhere. MIT, Boston University, Harvard...I want to go somewhere over there. If I want to get into MIT or Harvard, I had better start working my butt off, because it will take a LOT of work (and that is not to say that getting into Boston University would be a breeze either). And I will have to get many, many scholarships, financial aid, grants, and loans...I looked up a lot of scholarships today and there are some I think I could get. There is this one for Boston University that I might look into, if I get admitted there. There are a lot of essay scholarships that I could try to get. And there was one I was looking at that was up to $50,000 for first place and it was an essay that you wrote and then recorded or something like that...anyway, I am going to start looking into those now, if I want my dream colleges to be a reality. Well, that is it, I suppose. Tomorrow I have classes, yay. I think I will get the grade I got on my Chemistry test back, but I am not too worried about that. Heh. Watch me get a lower grade than I thought. Peace. -Lisa

Today I woke up to the sound of Naomi screaming, "OH MY GOSH IT'S 8:15!!!" We both jump out of bed, break some kind of record for getting ready in the shortest amount of time, and run to biology, but it was too late, they had already taken attendance. So, we will be docked for missing class, but only like 5 points, so it is really not that big of a deal...but still....it ruins my clean slate since they never docked me for my first bio lab. Oh well. I guess now is the time I back up and explain why we woke up so late. Around 10:00 Thursday night, Rebecca, Naomi, Sarah, Jennifer, and I all went to the rec center to play indoor soccer, but the court was already being used by a lot of people so Rebecca was like, "Well.....we could always play outside." Mua hahahaha. So we all went outside, took off our shoes, and played soccer...excuse me...TACKLE soccer...in the mud. How many times can a person say the word fun in a sentence? I could answer that question if I felt like describing that experience. Eventually, we ended up just chasing and tackling each other in the mud...forget the soccer lol. We left at like 10:45 COVERED in mud, from head to toe. It was kinda embarrassing, so we all ran as fast as we could up the stairs and jumped into the shower....er...separate showers, mind you. So, ANYWAY, due to the irresponsibility on my (and Naomi's) part of ditching homework for funness, I did not start my Pre Cal homework until around midnight...and I had sooo much. I didn't finish until around 2:00, and then I couldn't get to sleep until around 3:00. I promised myself that I would fight the insomnia and go to sleep earlier but ahh! It is so impossible. *Sigh* is this a mental thing or what? Yeah, so, missing biology put me in a kind of bad mood, even though I did laugh at myself to keep from being annoyed with myself. And then I got a crappy homework grade in Pre Cal, so that kinda made me feel more crappy. AND then I had a test in Chemistry that I had not adequately prepared for. But in the end, that turned out alright, since I have taken it before. I remembered more than I thought I remembered. I'm pretty sure I got an A on that one, so that is good. After my last class, Writing about Lit, Naomi and I went to Maple to eat and ran into Jaison (yeah, there is an i in his name, isn't that weird?). We hung out with him for a while, saw his dorm room and such, and then we went to these little soundproof piano booths, and listened to Jaison play the piano/sing in really ridiculous keys lol. He was really good. When he did play and sing seriously (instead of singing Enrique's Hero in a really high voice), it was so beautiful. I could sit here and try to explain how much I am in love with music, but I don't think I could adequately describe it. Piano, guitar....it all conveys messages that words or thoughts never can. Naomi thinks Jaison has a thing for me, and then the Jennifers said that they thought so too, but I don't think so. I think he is just a friendly guy and he is like that with a lot of girls, but whatever... :) Jennifer picked us up around 5:45 to go to the concert. I showed her and Fifer my room, and introduced them to some of my friends, including the girl that has my name, and then we all left. My friend and chem lab partner, Laura, went with us too. She is really cool. The concert was AmAzInG. I think that is some of the best moshing I have ever been in. It was fun, crazy, awesome, crazy, loud, rough, crazy, fun, and a little crazy, too. I was feeling particularly crazy today, and so I acted particularly crazy. And it wasn't just one band, it was all of them. They were all so extremely awesome...mm....so awesome...This concert vies with Warped Tour for being the best concert experience of my life. The only thing that may have ruined the perfect concert experience was when a guy passed out at the end of the starting line's set. He literally fell on Naomi and I, as we were jumping up and down. We thought he had just fallen down, so we grabbed his arms to help him up, and then I realized that he wasn't conscious. So, a bunch of us made a big circle around him and waited for the management people to come and get him. It made me really sad. After that, I wasn't into it as much, even when tsl did their encore. I just watched. It seemed....wrong...somehow to watch someone look like they are dead on the ground (he wasn't dead though) and then go back and act like nothing happened. So I sat the last couple of songs out. They were the only ones I sat out on though :). The Starting Line did this thing with confetti that was Soooooooooo cool (hardcore). During their last song, at the climax I guess of the song, when the entire audience was singing along, and it was an emotional moment, confetti went everywhere. It was so awesome. Unfortunately, that was during when I was protecting the guy on the floor, so I didn't get to enjoy it that much :( oh well. So, anyway, I got another free cd, and then we went back to Arlington, and my mother gave Laura, Naomi, and I a ride back to UNT. She was less than thrilled, that is how I will put it. We made it back with ten minutes to spare until curfew. But it was so worth it, because it was so extremely fun. I think that Naomi now understands why I have concert withdrawal sometimes. Haha. I also think that Laura thinks I am some crazy, hardcore moshpitter. Oh wait, I am! LoL. No, I am not completely hardcore. I mean, I haven't even crowd-surfed yet!!! (Note to self: Update List of Things to do Before I DIE). Sooooo, that is that. I was drenched in sweat. Literally. My hair, my clothes...and I smelled so bad, but it's all for the cause. That's what I told Naomi and Laura when they had to take off their shoes and go barefoot in the moshpit (ouch) because they kept falling off. It's all for the cause. Which cause, I don't know, but that is what it is all for. Ate some food, and am about to go take a shower. I am so detailed in these things, it is amazing. -Lisa (I am waiting for an explanation from a certain someone on why my name is so cool. :) )

Today is September 11th. It is weird how many connotations of sadness and hurt this date has. Just remember two years ago. I was in my freshman geography class... So, today and yesterday have been really weird for me. I don't even really know why. I suppose I have just been thinking about a lot of things. There is still that something I am trying to think of, but it isn't coming. I have the feeling it might be important. Gah, I confuse myself so much. Another reason I am feeling kind of weird is that I don't know what to think about certain things anymore. Yesterday when I was sleeping in Chemistry (JoAnn, the saga continues), I had this dream that was really weird and today it almost happened in a way. I just don't know what to think!!! I am so confused, it's crazy. And the insomnia is getting worse. The past few nights it has been around 2:00. Tuesday night it was around 3:00. Last night it was around 4:00. Maybe it wouldn't be so bad if I slept later in the morning, but I don't. I don't know what is wrong with me. Grr. I hate my sleeping patterns. Last night I went to this recycled book store with Alejandro and Josiah. This place was so cool. It was three stories, and FULL of books, as well as movies and music. It is like Half Price except so much bigger and with so many more books. It was amazing. It is like a library and a thrift store put together. Haha, just my thing. On the way back, we heard a garage band practicing and this one guy just playing the acoustic guitar. I got really emotional when I heard that one for some reason. I was trying to explain to them how I just thought it was one of the most amazing feelings to sit in the dark and listen to someone play their emotions on a guitar. They were just like, "Oh yeah, sure...it's cool." Music is so powerful, it amazes me. So, the annual Screw Your Roommate Dance is coming up and Naomi and I have a truce not to screw each other over. The thing that sucks though is that I know that I am not on any of the lists of the guys that are on the list she made for me. I know this because Osato told me who all is on his and Jonathan's lists and Kenny is someone I hardly even know, so neither him or his roommate will think to put me on his list. I will probably just end up with some other random guy who didn't get put on any lists. :) oh well. I guess I should be happy that other people don't think of me as someone to screw their roommate with. Haha, that sounds dirty. It will be interesting. The other night, I talked to Ryan for the first time in a long, long while. Hindsight is a funny thing. Looking back, I don't know how I didn't see what kind of a guy he is, that is, how shallow of a guy he is. I suppose the thing that made me realize how uncompatible we are is when he said something to the effect of, "Oh yeah, she really wants me to ask her out but I think she is really annoying. It's just like shutup and let's go screw." I was so shocked, I nearly fell out of my chair. How can someone have an attitude like that?? How did I not see this? I feel really stupid. People constantly amaze me. Sometimes in good ways, sometimes not. This was definitely a big not. It is rainy today and I am listening to a song about rain. This is a random coincidence; it is just on a playlist. Hmm...rain is awfully depressing. Tomorrow night is the Starting Line/Allister/Homegrown/Early November/Senses Fail concert. I think it will be great. I am hoping it will be great. Maybe it will end all of this weirdness for me. It could be that I am just changing as a person. I wouldn't be surprised. Well, there is maybe more that I could write about, but I really can't think of it and I know that I am probably rambling as it is. -Lisa

Neutron -- You don't take sides, you just sort of hang out and blend into the crowd. If someone lets you loose though, you can cause some serious damage. If you are arround too many other neutrons you get bored and start to decay. urlLink What kind of subatomic particle are you? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla So, I was ecstatically happy when Naomi's mother came over Sunday morning and fixed my internet. She had to like totally reconfigure my entire connection. I don't even know how it worked for as long as it did. So, out of gratitude, I made her her very own backdrop for my computer. I would put a picture of it on here but unfortunately, I have no idea how to soooo....you know how it goes. I can tell you that it is a red star on a black background that says, "Nopei is a computer genius." I don't know how long it will stay there, but I am really grateful so it could very well be a while. So, I am like the employee of the month or something on my wing! I got to fill out a little survey and everything and it will go on our bulletin board. So that kinda made my day. Our wing date was tonight. It was pretty fun. Naomi, Rebecca, Sarah, and I all hung out together for the most part. We just went to Putt Putt and played golf and rode go carts and played games. Naomi and I wanted to battle it out on a DDR machine but the only one they had was like an off-brand or something and instead of the regular squares they had like...criss cross ones...it was really weird. But, we decided that most every one has one in the dorms anyway so we'll just do it another day. And then we went to Sonic and all talked some more. Rebecca and I planned out how we are going to write our first article together. It should be pretty cool. So basically, I made two really good friends today. It was pretty awesome. Tonight I was watching some Seniors reminisce and be all best-friendish and I was just wondering if by next year, I will be like that with people. I think probably so. You know, I honestly cannot think of one thing that I have a legitimate reason to complain about. This is a good thing. I am so glad I am out of high school, you have no idea. Naomi is having boy troubles. I suppose I kind of knew that it would all get messed up in the end. Hmmm...I also had a productive conversation with her about my beliefs not being hers. She is really accepting of it though and I think that is a good quality to have. Her and I are becoming really close. I mean, I suppose we would have to be, since we do live together and everything... You know, they say that college is a time where you find things out about yourself that you never even knew. I think I am beginning to really understand myself better. Maybe. There is something I am trying to say, trying to think, and it is on the edge of my mind and my tongue, but I can't seem to find the thoughts or the words to say it. It's there, but I can't completely grasp it. -Lisa Dianne Wauters

OK, gotta type fast cuz the internet goes off in a while. Today was sooo fun. Wowness. OK. First off, more guys hit on me here than ever did back at regular high school. Today, three things. 1) There was a note on the dry erase board on my door that said, and I quote, "Lisa, I have a crush on you. -Mr. Crush" Umm, something tells me it is a joke, but still...and I am not sure I would want a guy that called himself "Mr. Crush" hitting on me ;). 2) This guy, Josiah, was like kinda hitting on me, as far as I could tell I think. He was all, "Ok, tomorrow we are gonna go do blah blah something something." and I was just like, "umm, ok." and he was all, "Well, actually, I am just trying to find an excuse to hang out with you again." and I was just like, "Ohh reallly?" and then he was all, "Hey, do you have AIM?" and I was like, "Yeah, you can get it from Alejandro." and he was like, "Ok, I just wanna talk to you cause you are really cool." To which I replied, "Actually I am a big dork." 3) I was hangin out with Osato and he was like, "Oh yeah, one of my homeboys was telling me how cute he thought you were." and I was like, "One of your homeboys?!! Who?!" and he was like, "I can't tell you. Code of honor. The only way you'll ever know is if he has the balls to tell you." I begged him to tell me for a long time, but he wouldn't!! Ahhh! Right. Today I went out to eat with a bunch of people. (Aaron, Darlene, Andrew, Ed (real name:Jordan but I call him Ed because he looks and sounds EXACTLY like Edward Norton), Kyle, Ian, and two other people that I can't think of...) We went to The Tomato, reallly, really good pizza place. Then when we were leaving, Russel, Alejandro, and Josiah walked in so I sat with them while they ate and talked to them about how they had watched anime all day the day before. And then we went to CD Warehouse and I got a Warped Tour Compilation with 50 songs for $9!!!! The music is so good, you have no idea. And then I went back up to their room and they showed me some of their anime. It was really fun. They are cool to hang out with (this is the part when Josiah starts to hit on me). At one point, the room across the hall starts blasting rap so Russel whips out his Death Metal and plays it so loud...it was frekain hilarious.
