We were all doubled over...ahh...so after about three hours of anime watching, Osato kidnapped me from their room (literally, he tried to pick me up over his back and everything) and we went to his room to work on our enormous amount of Pre Cal homework. He played some of his hip hop for me, lol. And thennn... At 10, visitation was over so I went back to my room and went to talk to Rebecca about her idea for an article for the newspaper (she went to state for newswriting last year and I went to regionals for ready writing so we have decided to collaborate) and got invited to play some cards sooo me, her, Sarah, Katie, Andrew, Kyle, Ankit, Stephen, and...uhh...some other people, all started playing Go Fish, black jack, and Group War (that was interesting). At 11:00 we all went to play soccer. That was pretty fun. There wasn't much of a soccer game going on, because it was like a ton of people, so it kinda ruined it, but it was fun just the same. I got some breakaways and had an assist. There was this one annoying guy that I pushed down a couple of times because he was really annoying. After every goal we made, Naomi and I would run up to each other yelling and like beat the crap out of each other. After the game like three guys came up to me and told me good game. It was cool. And this other girl was like, "hey, i am trying to start a TAMS girls intramural soccer team. You should be on it." I was like, hell yeah I should. Ahh, guys are so funny. It's funny. Back at home, I made friends with girls easier. Here it seems like most of my friends are guys. Except for Lisa, Rebecca, Naomi, Jennifer, and some others. But yeah, it is great fun here. I like it. Tomorrow is convocation and I need to study some more. Time for some Kidman and McGregor. You know what that means. Mua hahahahaha. Just kidding. I wish ;) Lisa pS- Did you know that they have an Anime Convention?!?!

Ok, right now is actually Friday, but it will show up as Saturday because it is past midnight and all. Anyway, to add to my day. It got a lot better. 6:30 went to see a movie at the Magnolia with some people. Went out to eat at IHOP afterwards with some funny, funny people. Took a walk to 7-11 at midnight with some more random people to get a refill on my 1.5 liter mug for slurpees. Am now back up here so that I can read. Tonight was really fun. Ok, am now going to go read. Read the one below if you haven't already. Peace and much love, Lisa

I had a lot I wanted to write about, but I forgot a lot of it...oh well. Last night I talked to a guy on the phone just for the heck of it for the first time since...well, a long time. I think the last time I did that was back in freshman year, when I still liked Jon. It was just to Jason, the guy that Naomi was going for the first week (because he liked her) until she met Josh (who was introduced to her by Jason) and decided she liked him. He was actually calling for Naomi, but she wasn't there so he just talked to me for a while. Just about boring things though...like classes and homework and all that fun stuff. When I told Naomi how long it had been since I had talked to a guy on the phone (for conversations sake), she thought I was weird and I guess it made me realize that I know absolutely nothing about how to have relationships with guys. Hmm...oh well. Osato cracks me up so much. Today in Pre Cal, we were doing something with the inverse of some function and we got two answers instead of one (which isn't possible) so our professor was asking if any of us knew how to determine which one was right, so Osato spoke up and was like, 'Well, according to the definition of the inverse of a function, which states that the graph of the inverse is a reflection of the function over the line y=x, then both of the proposed answers are necessary to complete the reflection in question. Therefore, one can tell that it is both the positive and negative number." Then he paused for a moment and was like, "Who's your daddy?" Well, our professor just pointed to something on the board that made everything Osato had said completely irrelevant, and so he was like, "I don't know who my daddy is anymore." It was sooo hilarious. That boy cracks me up. I guess you would just have to be there though. That is pretty much it. Oh, I wanted to post a speech from the play I just finished reading, The Lady's Not For Burning. It is lovely. JENNET. I am interested In my feelings. I seem to wish to have some importance In the play of time. If not, Then sad was my mother's pain, my breath, my bones, My web of nerves, my wondering brain, To be shaped and quickened with such anticipation Only to feed the swamp of space. What is deep, as love is deep, I'll have Deeply. What is good, as love is good, I'll have well. Then if time and space Have any purpose, I shall belong to it. If not, if all is a pretty fiction To distract the cherubim and seraphim Who so continually do cry, the least I can do is to fill the curled shell of the world With human deep-sea sound, and hold it to The ear of God (Fifer), until he has appetite To taste our salt sorrow on his lips. And so you see it might be better to die. Though, on the other hand, I admit it might Be immensely foolish. See? Isn't it great? I can't put into words why I like it because I can't explain how things impact me sometimes, I am weird like that. Hmmm... All I can say is that I am glad I am a banana, and not a kiwi. That would be horrible. ;) Lisa

Things are looking up. I found my motivation I think. It came from Tolkien...and Something Corporate. I guess I was still in summer mode or something, and did not want to be serious about school but...now I am I think! Heh, hopefully this will last. But anyway...my day... I had Biology at 8:00 and I am still kinda lost in that class because I am in Honors and that is building upon High School Biology...which I NEVER TOOK. I am beginning to regret skipping to Chemistry...oh well. I told Naomi she would have to sit down and explain to me the rules of cytoplasm, mitochondria, cell membranes, and all that jazz. And organelles. I don't know how those work either. But I am learning a whole lot about amino and nucleic acids or something like that. Must look over notes....hmmm... Then I slept an hour before Pre Cal. That class was the same as it ever has been. He gives us an assignment and then gives a lecture but doesn't really teach so we are left to figure out the chapter on our own. Homework takes forever, but Osato, Casey, and I have formed some sort of a study group for that. Chemistry...was interesting. We got lectured on how to name and distinguish between ionic and molecular bonds and things of the such. It was all stuff that I had learned before, but it is always good to touch up on it, ya know? I am talking to the extremely shy guy next to me...he is so shy, he makes me look outgoing. But he seems like he would be pretty cool if I got to know him. Then I ate lunch and ran errands with Naomi and then I went to English. We discussed the play in small groups. We have to present our answers to the questions about imagery and language and plot and all that on Friday. My group was pretty cool. Four of us ended up walking back together after class and we had a semi-philosophical conversation and I was invited to the Modern Philosophy Forum tomorrow night. It sounded really interesting, I think I will go. After that I mainly just did Pre Cal and went to club meetings. First was Academy Players...mua hahahahahahaha. TAMS Theatre. Why? You ask. Why are you in the theatre club when you obviously have a shyness/stagefright issue? I have one word for you: Tech. I love doing the tech side of things. Sounds, backdrop, lighting. That is my thing. I am the person behind the scenes. And also because the people in that club are Hil-ar-i-ous. I think I will have fun. A while after that was the Ambassadors meeting. We are basically the people that run interview days, preview days, tours, Spend-a-Days....all that stuff. That was pretty interesting I guess. And then I went to the Pool Club meeting. mua hhahahahaha. I had to have one "Drifter" Club, ok?!? I am in a lot of clubs, I think. Like 7 or so. I may have to drop a few. Last night was Yearbook and Key Club. Tomorrow night is J-Board and newspaper... Yeah, I will probably have to drop one or two. But not until my busy schedule forces me to! After that, Naomi, Osato, and I all played tennis for a while. It was the first time I have played tennis in like a month. It was great. When it was just Naomi and I playing, we got really coimpetitive and we played a nice match. I beat her! We hadn't played in over a year and back then she was a lot better than me. So I think I have improved...Yay. That was super fun. Then we had our Wing Meeting. We had it downstairs with one of the guy wings because Monday we are all going on a "Wing Date" to Putt Putt. Haha. I looked around for....prospects...hehehehe. It should be great fun. Well, that is about it, I do believe. I will go now because I want to do some Chemistry and I think I only have 2 classes tomorrow. Yessssssssss. I am beginning to really like it here. I didn't for a while, but I guess it is true what they say. It takes a couple of weeks. Hmm... Bye! -Lisa

Two things: 1) Amy had her baby this morning! Karen called here around 8:00 and said that they had been there all night and that by noon Heather will have been born! Well, it is 3:00 now...so...this is exciting! I hope they call later! 2) I got my Letter Jacket on Sunday. It is so pretty. And new. I smelled it like a million times and wore it a lot even though it is really warm outside. Tacky to wear on a college campus? I don't know...but I will wear it somehow or another... So yeah, my computer is being gay (again). The internet is connected, but the explorer and AIM do not recognize the fact. They think that I am still offline and so I can't really use it at the moment. It kinda sucks. I am on Naomi's computer right now. I don't think she minds...hmm... I am so not motivated to study or do school work. Someone please motivate me. I just look at my books and know that I have no motivation whatsoever to actually study them. When my first tests come, I will die. *Sigh*........ Hah, I sat in the wrong Bio Lab room for like 15 minutes today and there was this really foreign lady who I could barely understand. She was giving a history of the metric system or something and was all, "blah blah blah during the French Revolution. But they were too busy killing other people so they forget about metric system, yes?" It cracked me up...on the inside. Then I was redirected to the room I was supposed to be in and that lab was really boring, but we are supposed to have some sort of a quiz over it next week but I have no motivation so I don't know if I will be studying for it. I think I need to find some way to motivate myself. Like...no internet until I am done studying. But wait! I already have no internet!!! Oh well. "Down" by Something Corporate is so lovely. So I saw four movies this weekend. Two in theatre. Both practically for free. I saw Real Genius on tv (which was really interesting), Uptown Girls Sunday afternoon with Olivia (it was ok, but some parts were really stupid), The Faculty that night at Olivia's (it was weird seeing Elijah Wood minus the hobbit look), and Jeepers Creepers 2 (just as gay as the first one, but at least it provided some good laughs). Yeah I pretty much spent Sunday and Monday with Olivia...but in weird intervals...hmm...and now I am back here. This blog is very poorly designed. I jump around from this morning to Sunday to today to Sunday and Monday...oh well. I am sure all you wonderful people will understand. We have so much food in our dorm now...mmm...food... -Lisa

I'm in one of those moods...the kind where time seems kind of slow, in a good way, and everything is nice and peaceful, and I just kind of...float...from place to place. Like I am on a cloud! If that makes any sense... These past couple of days have been interesting. I saw some things I never thought I'd see...my grandmother crying being one of them. Completely broken down...not even caring that people heard her call her Momma...I just can't...relay what it meant to me. Some things don't need to be marred with words, like the rest of the funeral. I'll just leave you with that...it was sad, yes, but beautiful in so many ways. So many thoughts I am having...or I have had...and I don't think I could put them into words. It's weird like that...I suppose... Yesterday, before I left, I was in a horrible mood. I was angry, sad, frustrated...and I just didn't want to deal with people. When my mom first picked me up, I think that she and Brian could see that I was in a bad mood. But after a while, they cheered me up, I got better, and I realized why I miss my family so much. My brother, for one. He is so adorable, and he is only a year younger than me. He is really goofy or silly, or whatever he is...and he made me laugh so much. My mom talked to me about a lot of things, and I just got to tell her about school and the such. It was nice. My grandmother. She is such an amazing person. I hope I never have to see her sad again. I got to talk to her a lot yesterday and today too. The way my family came together and supported each other just made me thankful to have a family like them. We may not see each other just a whole lot, but everyone is there for each other when they need to be. Sooo, anyway, in some other ground breaking news, I went to sleep at 9:30 last night. 9:30 !!! I don't even remember the last time I went to bed that early! Certainly not sooner than about 7 months ago. The last time I went to bed before midnight was at least 3 months ago. I woke up this morning, and I wasn't even tired! And I had a thought that maybe this was how I was supposed to feel every morning...it was nice. I think perhaps I will start trying to go to bed earlier. So, tonight I am going to the haunted house at Bruce (where all the music majors live) and then tomorrow it's back to Arlington for the weekend! Wooooooo! -Lisa

So yeah pretty much my day went ok. I had to write this essay by 8:00 and I printed it out with about ten minutes to spare. Went to play soccer, but Zahir didn't look at the game times right, so we went back. Had some funny times today, as I do every day. They never get old :). In sadder news, which is why I really wanted to write tonight, my great grandmother died today, and while some of you have lost most or all of your grandparents already, this was still really shocking to me. I knew she was getting old, and I knew her health was deteriorating, but I guess I just never expected her to pass away... I think one of the things I'll remember the most is that even after like two or three strokes, and being so very old, she always remembered all of our names...and there is like 15 of us (cousins). And there has got to be a whole other set of great grandchildren that she remembered the names of too. Back in the day, she could even remember all of our birthdays. I dunno, I don't even feel like thinking about it right now, because I know that I will become sad, and start pondering my own mortality and the such, but I need to think about it, and get my feelings out. Ben dying this summer got me thinking about death, and it just amazes me how someone can be there one second...and gone the next, never to return, never to make an appearance ever again. She was affectionately known as the "other Nanny." My Nanny loved her so much, I know she is taking it bad. And she has a lot on her plate to deal with. I should call her tomorrow. "Other Nanny"...one of those family constants...always there...always loving...such an amazing person... I think I am taking off Thursday to go to her funeral, but I don't know if the tams police will let me go. Hopefully, because I really need to go. I really want to go. -Lisa

It's cold!!! Finally!! I was worried that the semi-summer weather would last through Halloween, and Halloween is just not Halloween without cold weather. So, nothing happened this weekend. Well, except for the Star Party Saturday night. It was pretty fun. We made s'mores, and me and Sarah did some climbing on the playground because it was one of those crazy maze-like wooden ones with many climbing possibilities. Naomi, Rebecca, and I were all wrapped up in this blanket for a majority of the time. It was at this park by the lake that was really pretty. And then Saturday night we watched Good Will Hunting and Sliding Doors. I had never seen Sliding Doors, and was a bit disappointed to tell the truth. I mean, it was ok I suppose, but not as good as I was expecting. It is funny because Naomi and Rebecca think that I know everything there is to know about movies and music. Probably because I have seen ten times more movies than they have, and know a whole lot about a whole lot of different genres of music. But, my knowledge of these things compared to Fifer's...it is not as detailed or vast :). I mean, today I couldn't even point out Michael Moore in a picture. Sad, ne? Today I ate and attempted to study. Urg, no concentration. Hah, Rebecca is so innocent. It amazes me. Today she was all, "What is an orgasm?" I just couldn't stop laughing, and it wasn't in a mean way, it was just funny. So, she went into her room and looked it up on dictionary.com and sent me the definition. That made me laugh harder and then she came into my room and was all, "What is lamow?" and I was like, "What?" And she was like, "You know, l-m-a-o...what you said to me after I sent you the definition..." Laughter is good for the soul. She makes me laugh so hard sometimes. Arts and Crafts night was at 7:00 and we made some pretty nifty stuff. I have on my toothbrush bracelet right now. And then me and Rebecca went running. I think we ran about 4 miles. We ran all the way to the QT and then past my brother's apartment complex. It was so crazy. But, yeah, that is about it. It's a funny thing when I'm running. Sometimes, I feel like I can't go any further, like I am burned out, like my lungs are about to burst. But then, I focus on a stop sign or something and I tell myself, "Just to the stop sign, Lisa, you can make it to the stop sign." So I get to the stop sign and then I see a big tree up ahead, and I tell myself, "Just to the tree, Lisa, you can make it to the tree." It continues like this, until I am finally done with the course, and I look back on it, and the distance between my landmarks are much longer than they seemed when I was running. I just have to take it a little at a time, and soon the little distances add up. I think that maybe I look at life like that. Last year, I was like, "Just until the end of this year, Lisa, and you'll be at TAMS, just until the end of this year." and now I am like, "Just a year and a half, Lisa, and then on to Boston, just a year and a half..." And maybe all these distances will add up, and before I know it, my life will be over, and then...whatever comes after. Maybe the cool down. We are running, and running, and running in life. Maybe in the afterlife we will finally relax and start our cool down, and things will be good. Funny quote of the day (from an old creepy man talking to me and Rebecca from his car as we were running): "What are you girls doing? It's colder than hell out there!" Just ponder it. Colder than hell. Colder than Hell . Does anyone see how funny that is? Aw man. -Lisa! "So, if I asked you about art, you'd probably give me the skinny on every art book ever written. Michelangelo. You know a lot about him. Life's work, political aspirations, him and the pope, sexual orientation, the whole works, right? But I bet you can't tell me what it smells like in the Sistine Chapel. You've never actually stood there and looked up at that beautiful ceiling. Seen that.... If I ask you about women, you'd probably give me a syllabus of your personal favorites. You may have even been laid a few times. But you can't tell me what it feels like to wake up next to a woman and feel truly happy. I ask you about war, you'd probably throw Shakespeare at me, right? "Once more into the breach, dear friends." But you've never been near one. You've never held your best friend's head in your lap, and watched him gasp his last breath looking to you for help. I ask you about love, you'd probably quote me a sonnet. But you've never looked at a woman and been totally vulnerable...known someone that could level you with her eyes. Feeling like God put an angel on Earth just for you..who could rescue you from the depths of Hell. And you wouldn't know what it's like to be her angel, and to have that love for her be there forever. Through anything. Through cancer. And you wouldn't know about sleeping sitting up in a hospital room for two months, holding her hand because the doctors could see in your eyes that the terms "visiting hours" don't apply to you. You don't know about real loss, because that only occurs when you love something more than you love yourself. I doubt you've ever dared to love anybody that much. I look at you and I don't see an intelligent, confident man. I see a cocky, scared shitless kid." -Sean, Good Will Hunting

Putting on a Haunted House takes so much work, time, and effort. From now on, whenever you go to one, scream, have fun, and don't mock, no matter how stupid it is. It makes the people feel good inside. We spent so much time decorating and we all had matching costumes because our theme was a "Jail." The inside joke was that it was a TAMS jail but we just said it was a jail and we all had black and white striped costumes. I looked hella scary with my makeup on. I will have to post the pictures sometime this weekend. I would have them tonight along with the other pictures I want to post, but I used the yearbook camera and Cathy doesn't want me putting them on my computer before they are loaded onto the yearbook database thing. So, our wing really bonded, we really had fun, and we won first place!!! We had the highest points for creativity and presentation or something like that. Naomi and I put on a "scene" of sorts with arguing and fake stabbing (of me by her). Rebecca laid like she was dead on the ground and popped up. Starr was at the end of the hall with our skeleton in a noose, and would yell, "BREAK OUT!!" (cuz we were in jail) at the end and everyone would chase the people down the hall, yelling and screaming. Some of the other wings were pretty scary too. The one above us had people popping out of boxes and a tunnel of mattresses to crawl through. And, yeah, more about Steven. Hah. He dressed as this boxer, but not like a scary one, like a funny one and he had these huge blow up boxing gloves. Anyway, me and Naomi walked downstairs and he was playing with this one little girl, like pretending to fight her, and she was giggling and having a fun ole time. It was probably one of the sweetest/cutest things I have ever seen. :) :) Oh, and then I made this really cool cookie after all the kids left because Lisa and someone else made all these cookies and let the kids decorate them with all this icing and m&ms. Sooo, I made a pumpkin! It was my pride and joy! And then REBECCA tried to destroy my creation, TWICE. She PUT ANOTHER COOKIE ON TOP OF IT, SMEARING the cheerful yet mischievous grin. AND THEN she smeared it AGAIN with her finger! LoL, but it is ok because I repaired it as best I could. And then, since I am "obsessed" and apparently a "psycho" (according to Rebecca), I took a picture of it. I hope it gets into the yearbook. :) I feel as if there is more to talk about, but I can't think of it at the present moment in time. Life's good. You know? Seriously. I like it. And I think it has a whole lot to do with how I am not letting things get me down anymore. I get melancholy sometimes, when I think about how I don't think I will ever find "true love," but you know, I think I have learned to shrug it off. If I find it, I find it. If I don't, oh well. I can be happy living a life of solitude :). Tomorrow I get to play some tennis and go to the Star Party and maybe, just maybe, get back in time to complete our mission. Mua hah. Well, am going to go now. And start my Pre Cal homework. Byyyyye! -Lisa

Ok. I told myself I would post something before the internet turned off soo here it goes. This week has been so weird. Monday and Tuesday were pretty messed up, as Rebecca had stopped talking to us over the weekend and then Naomi got really upset for a while and for a few days, I just don't know what happened. Everyone was so...depressed. Now, it's ok. We are back to the closeness of before, probably better though because we are more separate from each other, I think. And we understand each other's limits better. Me and Naomi have gotten along really well today. It is amazing how fast relationships change when you live with the people that you have relationships with. I mean, family of course, but that is different. Just because...they are not your friends, you know? Sooner or later, everyone burns out, everyone reaches that low point. Sometimes, people don't want to talk, they just want to be quiet. And I think that is what happened. Ever since we got here, it has been like camp. Now, it's just normal. And this week was just the first big burnout. Being around people 24/7 and having almost no privacy can take a toll on people. It is nice sometime to just take a walk by yourself around here, to just think, just be by yourself. I usually do not get my time alone until the wee hours of the night/morning...since I rarely get more than four hours of sleep. I like to take a book out in the hall at around 2:00 or 3:00 and, if I am lucky, no one is being obnoxious or loud, and I can just read, and get caught up in the story, in the fiction, in the unreality of it all. Because sometimes, escaping from reality is the only way to deal with it. Wednesday night we won our second soccer game. Am loving the team feeling we have. It is quite excellent. I have slacked off a whole lot this week, mainly because of how I studied my arse off for the bio exam that one night and all the other midterms I had last week. It is nice to slack off, even though I do it a lot. Sometimes I wish I could just throw all my responsibilities down the drain and just be a penniless musician living on the streets of New York. The only problem is that I can't do anything musical. That, and I don't want to not get to live out my Boston dream :). I was thinking again about how much I love music the other day. I just can't express :). My days are pretty full though, for slacking off. I can't stand sitting around and doing nothing. Today I had some classes, I wrote an article for The Scoop, I went to eat with my brother, hung out with Laura and some people, watched Jonathan and Stephen (different Stephen) have an ice cream eating contest (now that is what I call entertainment), went shopping for our haunted wing that we are decorating tomorrow, and went to the GA. Oh my gosh, the people here are so freakin hilarious. Guys left in a dorm together always produces some form of hilariousness I guess. They just taped a bunch of pranks they pulled on people. Lucas and Tim...squating on the bathroom counter...holding bowls of water over their heads...and the look on their faces...priceless. Mua hah. And then Kevin, one of the admin, made a couple of Seniors think that they were gonna get arrested for stealing cars so they secretly taped the conversation in his office when he told them. Aw man, I laughed so hard I nearly cried. Steven didn't have a very good day though, and that made me sad. He is cute. And just a really sweet guy. Nice style too, I think I've mentioned this before. I just wanted to make him feel better. :). Oh well. I think there are like a million guys named Steven/Stephen at this school. I know of at least four. There are probably more. Is that not crazy? Oh, and I got to talk to Amy on the phone! I can get the really pretty dress for her wedding for only $131! I was excited. I miss her a lot. Hmm... I also heard Cody is gonna propose (To Courtney, not Amy) so that is exciting. Ok, I am done rambling now. I plan on having pictures up soon, so that everyone can match some names up to a picture when I talk about people. I am trying to get the yearbook camera to take pictures at the Halloween Extravanganza tomorrow, so maybe I will get pictures of everyone that you need to know or something :). Ok, well, bye now. Lisa

88 on the biology test. Average is now a 92. Urg. Will be harder to keep an A in that class now. Oh well. I suppose I am happy with my grade, you know? Today Pre Cal was cancelled and we didn't have lit so I only had two classes! Joy. And tomorrow, I only have Pre Cal and bio lab. But then after that I have a super busy day. Tuesdays are always the busiest. We had our first soccer game tonight. 5-0 baby. wut wut. We fit like ten or eleven people into a mini van and that was our transportation there...it was so fun. I felt like a team :). It helps me to deal with missing my tennis team so much. Zahir is so crazy...he is like our coach I guess and he gets so excited. Omg, I was rolling on the ground laughing, seriously. That guy cracks me up so much. Then, after curfew our wing got to escape the jail we know as TAMS. For a whole hour dawg. Is that not the coolest? Taco Cabana has really good food. Yeah, everyone is really depressed today. I was going through blogs and realized that everyone was sad about something, or pondering melancholy things. And with my blog earlier this morning, and the conversation Rebecca and I had over lunch, I am thinking that is was a universal thing. What is it about today anyway? People's emotions are very fragile, and I think sometimes we don't realize how much the things we say and the things we do affect other people until it is too late. That is all. I am too tired to elaborate on this much more. So tired...so exhausted....I have gone...more than 48 hours now without sleep...I think probably like 55 or so. I mean, my eyes feel like they are lead. And my body feels like a ton of bricks has hit it and is permanately in the state of hitting me. My bed looks really inviting...and yet, I can't sleep. What is wrong with me?!?! That is it, I am making myself go to sleep. NO MORE INSOMNIA FOR LISA. Sometimes I really do wonder about getting some kind of medication for this. I know it cannot be healthy. Well, I am off. Lisa

Lisa + night before bio test she hasn't studied for + two loads of laundry + Pre Cal homework that she hasn't started + Double Shot of Starbucks Expresso with Cream = a sleepless night of sleeplessness. Oh, but it was fun. Everything seems so weird right now though, like I am living in a dream or something. Hmm...must ponder on this some. I am so annoyed with certain people right now. And I am a tolerant person. Pet Peeve #1: When people ignore me for no reason and act like they are above talking to me. Pet Peeve #2: People that only like to talk about themselves, and won't shut up about it. I mean, seriously, I don't usually get annoyed with people. But, right now... Man, the frustration is building. I need some good screaming music. Ahh...Senses Fail...a mixture of emo screams and good music...and emo music...and emoness in general. It helps a bit. Just a bit. But it helps. Ah if it weren't for music. How insane I would be. There is a lack of good music junkies here. I met one last night, and she was really excited about meeting someone as in love with music as she was. Said something about a band being like The Cure only with a bad case of PMS. Oh, it was great. Ok, the frustration is ok now. I think I may be ok. I just had to vent. Stupid people...stupid people...stupid people...I'm good though, I'm golden. Evenly golden soil, yo. Definitely not blowing chunks in the big house. Maybe I was just being harsh on those people. Prolly so. See? This is why I am so tolerant. I always think people deserve second...and third...and fourth chances. People are inherently good at heart, right?!?! Ok, well, so I won't debate with myself about that last statement, I will leave now. Ciao ppls. -Lisa

Only at TAMS line of the day "Dude, Terrell I saw this girl the other day...on the learning channel." LMAO Zach is so funny. You know those days you have that you finish and just say, "Wow, that was nice." Today was definitely one of those days. And yesterday for that matter. Even though nothing significant happened, I feel as if I have tons to write about. :) Friday after classes I don't know what I did. At one point Naomi, Rebecca, Sarah, and I all went shopping at the dollar store and had tons of fun. I went to eat at Bruce a couple of times. Then we decided to go play soccer, but were distracted by the fireworks and the huge bonfire. Sooo, we walked over to the bonfire and watched that and the show that went along with it. It was basically just one big pep rally. We met up with Hudgens and hung out with him for a lot of the time. I loved just sitting there on the edge of the lake with everyone, just looking at the fire. It was hypnotizing in a way that made me think. Sarah is so fun. Sometimes we just sit and analyze people, what they might be like. So, I came back and then was invited to run with Steven, so I went and did that. It was like 1 1/2 miles or something crazy like that. In fact, I hung out a lot with Steven these past couple of days. But, we'll get to that later. We went to sleep after I studied for a bit, without actually studying. Like, I didn't soak any new knowledge in. Tomorrow all I am doing is studying. Haha, Naomi said that at around 2:30 (AM), I sat up, looked around and said, "Who gave him my email address?" and she was like, "Lisa?" and I screamed like I was mad at someone and laid back down. She does a really funny impression of me. haha. I didn't know I talked in my sleep, but I guess you learn something new every day. This morning was the PSAT. Hmm...I don't know how I did. I finished all the sections this year, as opposed to last year when I didn't finish two of them. I just needed to raise my score a little bit...I really hope I did. After a short nap, Naomi and I went out to eat with Steven at this place called Thai Cuisine. It is soo cool. I love it. It is really small, and the prices are super cheap. It is $1.30 per Chinese dish you get. So like, if you got some fried rice and sweet and sour chicken, it would only be $2.60 ( I am a math genius). Is that not awesome? And it is really good food! They had this back porch to eat outside on...the atmosphere was just soo cool. And they had little flowers on the rails. Twas great. Lunch was just random conversation and eating. Steven tried to get me to go to Houston for the tbs concert, and I told him to just stay in Dallas. So, yeah, lunch was nice. Then, I wanted to see my brother march, so I went to my first UNT game. And guess who I went with. Hah. Yeah. Naomi didn't want to go so I was gonna go by myself (and we had this huge fake roommate fight, it was cool) and I went downstairs and Steven's all, "Yeah, I guess I am going by myself." and I was all, "We should go by ourselves together." So, that is how that happened. We walked there together and then met up with Christina and some other people. Left after the third quarter because it was boring. I studied Bio for a bit but was then distracted when Laura told me she was gonna go play volleyball. So I went and did that for a while. It was about 12 of us. Really fun stuff that was :). And then Steven and I went running again. He is just a really cool guy I think. I mean, as of yet, there aren't any sparks, so I guess I don't really expect to become anything more than just friends, but that is super cool. Out of my crush that I had this past week, I gained a new friend and a running partner. :). That was around 10:30 but wait! My day isn't over yet! So, then, Naomi and I meet up again and we go play some frisbee game with Colin, Terrell, David, Hudgens, and Zach. That was soo super fun, especially when we played "Dead or Alive" which was basically tackle frisbee. Oh man, it was so cool. And then we watched Terrell and David do all these matrix tricks and break dancing moves. It was an experience just sitting outside on the grass until around 1 in the morning, hanging out with some of the coolest kids I've ever met. And a thought occurred to me. They are all Seniors, and all best friends. They must spend night upon night doing things like this. They're seniors though. In a few short months, they have to leave all this behind, and start over again. It made me sad. In less than two years, I will leave tams. And while I do complain about the restrictiveness of this place sometimes, it is true that I have grown quite attached to the people and the experiences here. It is different than I expected, yes, but...I am not sure whether or not it is different in bad way or a good way. Most of the time, I think good. Let's see. I think that's it. I really have to go study. Bye guys! -Lisa

And so ends a stressful week of near impossible Pre-Cal and studying for midterms last minute. Urg! Math is so frustrating! Chapter 7 is crazy mad hard. Analytical Trigonometry can die for all I care. They say it gets easier after this. I sure hope so. Bio Lab midterm I am pretty sure I got a high a on. English was more difficult but I am pretty sure I got at least a 90 on it. And I think I just BSed on the essay, but its all good because.....I don't care! Sooo enough about school. It is the weekend. Yell Like Hell baby here I come. Tomorrow morning the PSATs! Exciting, right? I am excited. It will be one big PSAT Party. Oo, that reminds me of something that we talked about at dinner Friday. Steven said something about having a college app party and I was all, "BYOA!" I am such a dork, it was funny. Hyper I am, yes, hyper I am. Must study for Biology this weekend as our midterm is on Monday. Erk. I am scared of that one, I am. I know absolutely nothing about biology. Last night we played some acoustic tunes on Naomi's guitar. Ahh it was fun. Well, guys, Motion City Soundtrack is playing on my computer and I just got finished eating lunch and acting like a big dork...the weekend is just starting, the weather is perfect, it's 3:21 and the day is calling. I must be going! Loveeeeeeee Lisa

Why do parents always try to make things more awkward than they really are? Ok, so I am talking to my dad today on AIM (my whole family has it...I even have my MeMaw's sn now :) ) and he asks me to come see him next closed weekend and I am like, "Ok, I prolly will." and he is all, "No, I don't want no stinkin (yes, he did use the word stinkin) prolly, I want a yes." so I was like, "ok, Yes, I will come see you." and then he is all, "I miss you." Awkwardness. I mean really. In the first place, I didn't see him any more often when I still lived in Arlington, and he never made any attempt really to talk to me more then. Secondly, it's like he is trying to guilt trip me into going to see him. I was going to go see him anyway. And it's not like he actually misses me. We have never really had any sort of a relationship, and certainly not one where there is missing involved. I remember the year that he didn't even remember my freaking birthday and just handed me some money- no card, nothing- a month after when someone said something about it and we were all at his apartment. It's stupid. Sometimes I really don't understand him. I feel bad, because I don't really miss him that much, but it is just because he was never really in my life, if that makes any sense at all. Maybe he is just trying to repair our relationship, I don't know. All I know is that I don't want anyone telling me they miss me when they don't mean it. And I don't think he meant it. I think he just said it because it is one of those things that every parent is required to say to his children. On a lighter note, I had a good day today. Erg, my resolve did not last very long. Hehe. Crap, I am developing a crush again. Oh well. He is super cool, and I already wrote Fifer about this....but...He is like a whole frickin case Underground. And probably 750 packets hardcore. And he is a little quiet and shy...it's so cute. Ahhh boys. They are crazy. I am crazy also. This is not a good thing. I am shy too. I saw him at lunch and was all ::shy wave:: "Hey" and he was all, "Hi." and then I started blushing so I left. I was already on my way out anyway. Ok...soo...that is the end. The End. La Fin. Oo, that reminds me of the shark fin, which reminds me of that one commercial, which reminds me of CAKE!!! LoL. Some people are crazy. And no two people are not on fire. The End for realz this time, guys. -Lisa Oh yeah! For those of you who care, I finally made a list of my favorite songs at the moment. For all of you who have courageously kept a p2p service on your comp, you should dl the following tunes and check them out. 187 by Senses Fail Sunday Drive by The Early November The Closest Thing by The Juliana Theory Seventy Times Seven by Brand New Hands Down by Dashboard Confessional Cute without the E by Taking Back Sunday I Remember You by The Ataris The Classics of Love by Common Rider Hit or Miss by New Found Glory I Woke Up In A Car by Something Corporate Leaving by The Starting Line Why Doesn't Anybody Like Me? by No Use For A Name In Love With the 80s by Relient K Pretty Girl by Sugarcult Buried Myself Alive by The Used L7 (Medication) by Wakefield The Freshmen by The Verve Pipe I think that's all. Not that everyone cares all too much, and I feel I have left off many a good song, but this is what grabs my soul and runs away with it at the moment. Ciao

It occurs to me that things will never change. At least not in the way I want them to. Last year, whenever I thought of how much I just wanted to escape high school, I thought of TAMS and how next year it would be ok because I would be here. I get here, and escape my high school, but now find myself wishing sometimes that I had never left. It's times like those that I think about Boston and how in less than 2 years, I could be living there. I always look at pictures of the buildings and wonder what it is like to go to college there. At night, the buildings light up with an array of colors against a black velvet night. In the morning, there is a blue harbor with a gold ribbon of sunlight reflecting off of it and an orange sky giving a backdrop to the same buildings that were lit up only the night before. The weather would never be ridiculously hot like it is here. It would snow in winter. A lot. It would be by the water. I could go out on a Sunfish, sail for an hour, and think about my life. I could find an underground coffee haus that has guys serenade the place with acoustic tunes every Monday and Wednesday afternoon. I could wear a sweater every day. I could get a job at a small shop on the corner of some street and talk to everyone that came in. I could volunteer at a Children's Hospital and get to individually know each of the kids, and make them feel better about whatever they were in there for. I could go to all of the east coast concerts and be crazy with other crazy people. I could find myself a nice east coast guy and finally experience love and all that jazz. I could have a small group of friends that I did everything with. We could all know each other better than we know ourselves. Every Tuesday, after classes, I could go to the local tennis center and play some hardcore tennis in the cool Boston weather. Thursday evenings I could go to my weekly Yoga class and get in touch with my inner feelings while also getting in shape. My weekends could be spent with my friends at comedy clubs or with my guy, cuddled up and watching a movie together. I could finally have a passion for learning and studying. I could find out what I want to do with my life. I could spend my night dreaming of Texas and TAMS and all the people that I had to leave behind to go to Boston and feel all nostalgic about it. I could live in Boston. But, something tells me that it would be like now. I would finally get to Boston, and it wouldn't be as perfect as I imagined. Like here, there would be no guys interested in me. Classes would be like here. There would be no small bookshops with weird obscure indie rockers that are obsessed with Tolkien and Douglas Adams. There would be no coffee hauses with aspiring Jeff Buckleys. The children's hospital would already have enough volunteers, and a Sunfish would be too expensive for me to buy. And I would want to go back to where I had left. But, I wouldn't, because that's not me. Sometimes, I wonder why I came here, and what it would be like if I hadn't. I just...I don't know...I am a sap. I love this place most of the time, but it's like...not what I imagined. At all. And I miss everyone so much. So incredibly much, sometimes, you have no idea. I miss Arlington and Summit and the tennis team and Kroger and all of my friends. I miss being third in my class and not feeling mediocre. But, more than all that, I miss Boston. And I haven't even been there yet. So I just tell myself 2 years, Lisa...no, less than 2 years....and you could be living there. -Lisa

Underground is my new word. Hardcore=overused and out. Underground=my new word. And packets. The measure of everything is in packets. 1000 packets=1 case. Lisa=approximately 850 packets underground. Fifer=approximately 999 packets underground. If you don't understand, don't worry. This is a whole case of confusingness. So, I finally got Naomi to start her own urlLink Journal . It reminds me a lot of my urlLink first entry (scroll down to the bottom). I think blogging is an art. Throughout the existence of your blog, you mold it and shape it until it really reflects your own style and what you are trying to communicate. Just look at the difference between my first one and now. Craziness, eh? urlLink Rebecca's is cool too. :) Well, that is all. I don't have a whole lot I want to really write about. This is like a crap entry. Crap, I tell you. 50,000 packets of CRAP. Bye! -Lisa

My week was really pleasant. I know there were some things I wanted to write about but I forgot about all of them now so I guess I will just wing it. I think it was Thursday that I got kinda down because of certain things and I was in a woe is me mood but I hate when I get like that so I got over it pretty quickly (like the next morning) but you know, there are still the remnants, and I still get melancholy for a few moments whenever I think about it. Oh well :). I am a happy person. Friday night I went swing dancing for almost three hours. It was so fun and I learned so much! I had a lot of different dance partners and I got to dance with like four of the instructors so they taught me a lot of different moves. There was this one really creepy guy I had to dance with during the actual lesson because we don't really get to choose our partners and he was super creepy, but after we switched partners again, it was all good. Wow, swing dancing is so incredibly fun. When I get a boyfriend or get married or whatever, I want to go dancing with my guy. Maybe I should change that when to an if. Today I was actually in Mansfield for a while because I went to JoAnn's birthday party. We got there at around noon and then ran around like crazy. Me and Rebecca went to Super Cuts and got our hair trimmed while Naomi went shopping at Kroger and then we met up and went back to her house and made three cakes and then went to the mall to get Jo's present and ended up getting her some really random things. We went back, ate dinner, and finally got to JoAnn's house 30 minutes late. Oops :). In between all that, we also did three loads of laundry. Yeah, my hair sucks. :) (why I put a smiley there, I don't know) The party was ok. I got to see Ashley, Tiffany, Victoria, and JoAnn (obviously). I was thinking about how all my friends that are friends together became friends separately and it just so happened that we all knew each other. It is pretty crazy. I met Ashley in the 2nd grade, Naomi in the 6th, Tiffany in the 5th, JoAnn in the 8th...and JoAnn became friends with Naomi after I did, without me introducing them, and then with Ashley in 9th grade, without me really doing anything, and then Tiffany last year, once again without me really doing anything. Jennifer and Ashley did that too. I dunno, maybe it doesn't sound like much, but it is pretty cool I think. So, that is it. Oh yeah, and I met a pretty cool guy on Friday. His name is Stephen and he is really smart. He had an interview with MIT today. And he likes Taking Back Sunday (is going to their concert in Houston Nov. 1st), and he has the whole thrift style down, he has really cool hair, and we both say plethora the same way. I was all, "Yeah, I should interview you for the newspaper," because he is the committee head for the Halloween Extravaganza and I am writing an article on it. Cool, ne? But, I dunno, I am still kinda interested in Jonathan, so...my options are open. I don't have a really big crush on anyone really right now. Until a guy shows me how amazing he can be...I don't want to get attatched. Are you understanding? You had better be, because I am going to go now and actually study , since I have failed to adequately prepare for the past couple of tests I have had. Well, this is the end I suppose. -Lisa "The Lisa" Wauters PS- Fifer, I wore my "FINA AIR TEAM" shirt today. Mua hah. It was soo cool.

Sooo, yeah, I am pretty stupid, I think. I mean, what good does studying for a test do if you can't read directions? Yeah, that's right. Pre Cal...the highest I can get is a B because I found the area instead of the perimeter of this one problem and on this other one I thought it said the one-to-one not the inverse of a one-to-one... And I knew it all! I could have gotten an A! And a high one at that. Urg. Sometimes I feel like punching myself in the face. Oh well, at least I know it all. And deep down, I know that grades really don't matter that much anyway. ::Punches self in face:: ANYway. In other news, I met my BUGS mentee today! Her name is Micaela and she has red hair, freckles, and braces. She is so adorable! And she is smart for a fifth grader. We went to this presentation by the Physics team. It was really interesting. We volunteered to do this one thing where they had a bed of nails for us to sit on to show the distributed pressureness of it all. It was fun. I am gonna be studying a lot this week for midterms next week, so I may not get to blog as much. But, you will just have to take a deep breath and relax. I know it may be tough for some of you, and you may experience some symptoms of withdrawal, but I promise that in the end it will be ok. -Lisa

This weekend was absolutely amazing. I wish I could have individually blogged after each day because then you would get the full effect, but you'll just have to deal :). So, after class on Friday, Matt took Naomi and I home, and that was really fun. We got pulled over by the cops and it was exciting because they made Matt get out of the car and everything. Hah. I get home and walk inside and... it is spotlessly clean. If you know anything about my house or my family, you know that my house is NEVER clean, and certainly not spotlessly so. And my mom had already converted my room into a guest room. It was so freaky. It was like, this is what it would be like if I did not exist. Well, almost. There were still remnants of me. She had packed up most of my library collection, but put a few stacks on the book shelves (I assume for decoration). And My yearbook from last year was on the desk. My room just seemed so empty and blank without all my crap. It was weird... So, right off the bat, I call people. I confirm my homecoming plans with Olivia and call Fifer. After much begging, her and her mother decide to take me to get food, and they end up paying for me! Double score. The food was extra good, cause it was from Quiznos and then I just hung out at her house for a while. We have good conversations, we do. And she understands music, and the passion for it. I have met only a few people just as or more passionate than I about music. It is the blood of the veins of life. Homecoming was...eh. It reminded me of why I wanted to escape Summit so much. People are so fake and...what is that word I am looking for? Heartless? Shallow? Nah, not all of them...but...superficial is definitely another word that comes to mind. I was with Olivia, Alex, Suzanne, and Travis, and they were all really cool. We left after half time because we wanted to go see School of Rock. Jack Black is so hardcore. That movie was great. On the way to Olivia's from the movie, after we dropped off Alex, we were driving down Harris with the windows down and the something corporate cd just starting. standing on the edge of morning... and with the cold october air blowing on our faces...almost like ice...and the beauty of the music...and the feeling of driving into the night...I just wished it could have lasted forever. I didn’t want to use the word infinite again but… Saturday Amy, Heather and I all went shopping for Amy’s brides maids dresses. Heather is Amy’s month-old baby. Oh my goodness, I am in love. She is sooo adorable and cute and everything you could ask for in an infant. And she fell asleep on my shoulder…on more than one occasion. *Sigh* it was great. Anyway. I am the Maid of Honor, so I get to kinda pick the dresses, but it is really Amy and I together picking it out. There was one we saw at David’s Bridal that was so beautiful and we both loved it. It was $175 though. Ouch. Lol, but I guess all dresses like that are expensive. For lunch, we went to Pei Wei Asian Diner and the only reason I mention this is because it had the air of a coffee haus and served the best Asian food I’ve ever had. Then we saw Wendi and Robert with their children. I have only one thing to say about them. “So, since you’re in college now, you probably get drunk all the time!” “Er no, I don’t actually.” “Oh so, you don’t do drugs or anything?” “No.” “Well, then, what do you do??” Anyone with the misconception that the only fun things in life are getting drunk and doing drugs have OBVIOUSLY not spent a Saturday night with Fifer, Jennifer, and I. Mua hahaha. I could have a whole blog just on that night (but this is already long enough so I will cut it down a bit). Me and Fifer went thrifting for a while, and then to B&N (I love the smell of books), and then went and hung out at Jennifer’s. I was trying to figure out what we could do until midnight, but Arlington is somewhat boring sometimes, so I was stuck. We went to Kroger for a bit and that was not unboring. ANYway, to make a long story short, we ended up at the elementary school again….mua hah, sprinklers are fun. And then Summit. Their sprinklers are funner. I was lying on the ground with Jennifer after we had all ran around for a while, watching the mists of the water against the light of the lamp against the blackness of the night. And Fifer was talking about the helicopter that was spying on us and we were all laughing. Infiniteness. Why can’t moments like these last forever? We get back in the car, only to realize that the car we thought was vacant was driving around the parking lot. Apparently, the person in the car had been watching us. Creepy, ne? So, he goes around the field house, and I go the other way to just play around with him and then Jennifer honks the horn and we drive by all quick-like and then he starts following us and then his friend shows up and they are both chasing us throughout the parking lot and we got trapped like twice but thanks to my super driving skills, we got out of the sticky situations and then we escaped!! And then we taunted them some more, so they started following us down Turner Warnell and Matlock ! It was super scary/funny/exciting. We lost them in the end because they are stupid and went in front of us. Aw man, it was so exciting. I don’t even know how to describe. Fifer and Jennifer are really fun people. Hmm…graded some of my mom’s papers and went to bed. Sunday morning: Went to Woodland West, saw lots of people for the first time in like a month. Me and Jenn left early cause I had shopping to do. Bought lots of dorm stuff. Then I visited Amy’s. It was like two summers ago. Me, Sarah, Amy, Ryan, Cody, Brett…all hangin out. It was like the old days. It was the first time I have really talked to Cody since…well, since he left for SFA in January. I didn’t even think he remembered who I was, since he did always call Jennifer “Lisa.” But oh well. Sarah is so funny. She was all showing us the formulas for girls and guys evilness. Hah. Funny stuff, maybe I'll post em tomorrow. I got back like ten minutes late though and couldn’t find the keys to my mom’s car so I didn’t get to go to Brighton Beach with Fifer. But I guess it was alright in the end because I had so much laundry that I was putting on and switching loads non stop until around 7:00. I watched Old School. Will…why give up on being super hilarious?? Curious George? The Elf? *Sigh* what are you thinking? It feels weird being back here on campus. It’s good though, I like it here. It’s just that after a weekend of awesomeness, it’s weird being back here. I miss everyone again. Hmm…I guess it is a never-ending cycle. I am off to bed I suppose. G’nite, don’t let the bed bugs bite. -Lisa PS- Cds I got this weekend (either finding or getting them burned) Motion City Soundtrack (Thanks, Fifer!) Jeff Buckley (Again) Wakefield (Thanks, Mom, for finding it!) Vendetta Red/The Juliana Theory (yay)

(Wednesday) So, nothing too terribly interesting happened today. Um, I actually don't think I have anything to write about. But, for some reason, I feel like writing. Hmm... So, I woke up at around 7:30 and proceeded to straighten my hair and get dressed. Breakfast was a breakfast burrito, a waffle, and some malt-o-meal that I enhanced with a few packets of sugar. Bio was bio. The prof lectured about nothing...or at least, nothing that meant anything to me. Some really annoying kids tried to sound smart and tell her she was wrong...but eh she has the PhD so what can they say? I mostly half-slept through that one. Then, I went back to my room and took and hour-long nap before Pre-Cal. Pre-Cal was Pre-Cal. I was in a really pissy mood for...um...no reason at all...cough. Ahem. ANYway, so Josiah commented on my tired appearance and that really set me off. Maybe it wouldn't have if he had rephrased the way he had said it. But, noooo...he was all, "Man, you look high. Are you high?" Maybe it doesn't sound like much, but that in addition to...no reason at all...really pissed me off. So, I didn't talk to him the rest of the class. Not that I usually talk a whole lot in there anyway. Oh, and afterward, I got to ask Dr. Allen when Casey, Rebecca, Osato, and I can all come over to his house for a movie night. hah! I don't know if there are any plans set in stone as of right now though. :) Then, I had chemistry. I don't remember much from that class because I think I semi-slept through it all. Chem Lab lecture was next. We don't actually listen in that class because no one has any idea what he is ever talking about, so I just did my Pre-Cal homework and entertained myself by watching Kenney doodle in his notebook. He is a pretty weird guy. He drew pictures of people hanging from nooses and the such. Oh, and then he drew a picture of our biology professor holding two guns and labeled it, "Dr. Elrod is THE BITCH. And she hates TAMS students." Mua haha. If I hadn't been in class, I would have laughed mui hard. Yes, so, he was a form of entertainment. Lit was after that. What did we do in that class? Oh yes, we discussed The Tempest...again. For how uninteresting that play was, we sure talk about it a lot. It was around 2:00 after that, and I ate my second meal of the day then. I had two chicken strips, some mashed potatoes, a salad, and an ice cream cone. Let's see. I came back here, got on the internet for a while, was entertained by CiDi and Betsy who both played the guitar. CiDi played some Green Day and Alkaline Trio. Betsy...attempted to. At some point, Megan brought in the cookies that her grandmother baked her, and oh my gosh, it was like I was in cookie heaven. If such a thing exists. Where do cookies go when they die? The world will never know. Naomi, Rebecca, and I went to Clark and ate dinner. Pizza. Yum. Oh, and a salad. And then I came back to the dorms and finished Pre-Cal in Rebecca's room with her and Osato. Around 9:00, Rebecca and I went to go work out. 10:00, we came back for the AfterProm meeting. 10:15 we went back with Naomi and worked out again. According to the machines, I burned 700 calories. That is all, I do believe. I had a wing meeting, and heard a funny story about the gay guy that talks about porn all the time, and then had an interesting conversation with Jaison again about him getting drunk. Then he was all, "No, no. I am really a good kid, I don't do any of that stuff." and I was like, "Ok, a minute ago, you were inviting me to take a travel weekend and spend it at your dorm so I could go clubbing with you all weekend. And you sounded like you knew what you were talking about." But, whatever. We ended up having a somewhat nice conversation, in which he told me I was a superb young woman or some crap like that. Hmm... Yeah, yeah, that is it. Goodnight. -Lisa "I believe in you so much, I could die from the words that you say." -Dashboard

Sometimes I forget how much it hurts to have a friend rub something in your face or to have someone you consider a friend brush you off, like you are just a nuissance. Oh well. Actually, I think that's all I have to say. I went to our first BUGS (Bringing Up Girls in Science) today and found out the name of my mentee. She is either in the 4th or 5th grade, I don't know which. Gilmore Girls was on tonight. It was pretty good, I suppose, although lately it has not been as entertaining as it used to be. Amy's wedding is in December. Does that not just blow your mind? My best friend is getting married...hmm...everything's changing. Oh, and we are going shopping for dresses this Saturday. Why am I in a non-good mood? I mean, I wouldn't consider it a bad mood, but its definitely not good. Probably the friend thing. Yeah, definitely. -Lisa

So I don't even know why I am in such a bad mood. I guess it could be just because my brothers managed to get on my last nerve today...or it could be because of my insomnia problem that is getting increasingly worse. But whatever the problem, my nerves or my sleep, I really really really cannot think of a word to rhyme with sleep that would make sense in this context. Wow. Do you see how out of it I really am? I don't feel like being back here already but I don't feel like being back at home either. In fact, I just don't feel like being. I wish I could curl up in a ball and sleep for 72 hours straight. Oh well. I guess it doesn't really matter. I don't know how to make myself sleep. The past two nights I have just laid in bed for two hours in the pitch black, trying to make myself go to sleep. Or rather, let myself go to sleep, because the exhaustion in my mind and my limbs are telling me that I need to sleep, that I want to. But, I can't. I try to sleep, I try to clear my mind, slow my breathing, count sheep. Nothing works. Nothing. I don't understand it. As a result, I haven't gotten to go to sleep until past 4:00 the past few nights. And I wake up like regular...7-9 AM. More often 7 than 9. It is really getting to me. I just feel like screaming...well, primarily I want to sleep, but secondarily I want to scream. AND IF I HEAR ONE MORE WORD OR STATISTIC OR ANALYSIS OR ANYTHING ABOUT FOOTBALL I WILL GO INSANE. I swear. My brothers are obsessed. Watching game after game. NFL, college, IMAGINARY LEAGUE GAMES ONLINE. Playing game after game. Madden after Madden. Sitting in front of the playstation for hours on end PLAYING A FOOTBALL VIDEO GAME. And then and THEN in the car instead of being like normal people and listening to music we listen to people ANALYZING football games THAT HAVE NOT HAPPENED YET or people analyzing games that have ALREADY BEEN PLAYED and lost and/or won. And the arguments. The incessant, loud, yelling arguments about the most insignificant details about teams, players, coaches...Gah. I just can't take it anymore. Thank God I am not around people obsessed with football anymore. But I make it seem like my vacation was all bad. When in all reality, this is just my current mood. Seeing my family getting drunk and trying to play games like Win, Lose, or Draw and Taboo was exceptionally amusing. I saw American Beauty, Joyride, Death to Smoochie, The Matrix:Reloaded, Finding Nemo, and Old School. The first four were my first time to see them in their entiredy. American Beauty was such an amazing movie. I mean...WoW. I really loved it. Wednesday night I hung out with Fifer and Jennifer and we had a blast. Woo Woo, great fun. Thursday night I went to A&M's yell practice. That was really, really fun. You don't know school spirit until you've been to an A&M yell practice. Friday night was the night that my family got mind-blearingly drunk. Man, my cousin, Adam, who is just a year older than me, comes in with a beer in his hand, and sits there and drinks and gives his 15-year-old girlfriend wine coolers and his parents don't even care!! He walks out the door with like five of his friends and my brother was all, "You aren't going to be drinking or anything, right?" and he was like, "Yeah, I am." and his parents did not care! It was interesting. I can't imagine living under the authority of parents that don't care whether or not I go to parties and get drunk all the time. They are all country people though so maybe it is different for them. Saturday night I went over and chilled with Amy until around 1:00 in the morning. Oh, and I watched this really interesting documentary on UFOs that was showing on the Discovery channel. Amy will always be my best friend. I know a lot of people think she threw away her life because she has a kid and is getting married already, but the way I see it, just because she didn't achieve what the world perceives as success, doesn't mean that she has failed or thrown her life away. I think she and Ryan will be very happy and she will be content. Whatever makes her happy, you know? My dad sees success in terms of salary. He said so much stuff tonight that was basically saying that if you don't get good grades, you won't make a lot of money, and if you don't make a lot of money, you are not successful. He seems to think that I will be making "six figures" by the time I am 25. I highly doubt this, and I don't even want to be rich. If I am, I will donate so much money and help out with so many charities. He said something about if my brother doesn't start getting serious about school, he will be "digging ditches the rest of his life." I dunno. I don't see success and happiness in terms of grades and money. At all. But he did help me out financially. I think I will definitely have enough money to buy everyone Christmas presents now. Yay. :). And to pay my tuition, as an afterthought. On the way home, after I finally snapped and made my brother turn off the sports talk (which he listens to as if he is deaf), we tried to sing the 12 Days of Christmas and that was extremely interesting. We couldn't remember all of them so it went something like this. "12 maids a milking, 11 maids a milking, 10 maids a milking, 9 maids a milking, 7 swans a swimming, 6 geese a laying. FIVE GOLDEN RINGS! 4 calling birds, 3 french hens, 2 turtle doves, and a partridge in a pear tree." the end Lisa

And I am leaving here at 9!! wooow woowowowowowwowoooooooooo I need this break before dead week, let me tell you! lisa
