Lisa I'm still in love, but I'm one of the million hearts you'll some day break. Close my eyes, but still i wont give up. Still i wont give up

Aw man, guys, sometimes I just love life. Last night was the FACES camping trip and I had so much fun. There were about 20 of us, and we all stayed the night at Turner Falls Park in Oklahoma. This place is huge and it has miles of forest and hills and rocks and caves...and, wow, I had so much fun. There was this old, fat cop that was on duty until midnight and he was really lonely so he volunteered to take all of us on a tour of the cool places in the park. We got to tour this old castle that was built in the early 1900s, modeled after Old English architecture. It was sooo incredibly cool, and it was closed to the public, so we got special priveleges. Also, it was in the dark, so that added an element of creepiness to the whole experience. We got to hike to three separate caves, and that was definitely fun. We saw this waterfall, and it was soo beautiful. I have come to two conclusions. 1) I want to travel a lot, and go backpacking a lot, and see all of the beautiful natural things of the world. 2) I want to live in a castle. After our tour, we came back and ate s'mores and then, since it was a FACES sponsored event (FACES is a club that focuses on political and cultural awareness type stuff), we had this deep discussion around the camp fire. I didn't speak up, but I enjoyed listening to everyone else's views. They started talking about the Iraq situation, but it turned to American politics in general, and then on the Asian minority power in America, lol...that part was mainly Josh (Liao...AzN guy). Then David said something about the new Blink 182 CD being good (*coughselloutscough*) and I was like, "Riiight. Since all they did was copy other bands." Laura and I tried to figure out whether Blink or GC are the bigger sell outs and we concluded that Blink were the bigger sellouts, but Good Charlotte wasn't far behind. It's funny how this all works. Then a bunch of us explored Ankit's (Ankiana Jones he calls himself) "Fort" which was just a path...with a cool looking rock wall...and then Josh was all, "My biggest fear is sliding down a giant cheese grater and landing in a pool of alcohol." and Stephen thinks that sliding down a giant razor blade would be worse, but Josh is all, "Nah, man, those things would rip you up." and I was just thinking about how I thought I was the only one who ever cringed at the thought of sliding down a giant cheese grater, but I didn't tell them that. After that, it was around midnight, and I got my sleeping bag out, and Laura, Kelly, Hudgens, and I all laid out under the stars, looking for shooting stars and talking...I don't even remember what all about. There were so many stars, it was absolutely beautiful...in the city, you see maybe five stars in the sky...but when you get away from all of that, there are millions, tons...and they speckle the sky...it's so lovely. I pondered how weird it would be to be watching the sky and then all the stars went out at once...Hudgens and Laura started talking about how if they were a Captain Planet person, they would want to have the power of fire and Laura is all, "If I had the power of fire, I would be so much cooler." Chris (Hudgens) was all, "Yeah, I'd probably talk to you a lot more." It was amusing. Eventually, around 1, I fell asleep, along with them...but we woke up later, and went back into the tent. I didn't sleep very well, just because I was cold and I was on the ground...but I got to sleep, and the dreams were nice. Let's see...what else? Oh yeah :). Zahir was trying to be a pirate all weekend. He insisted that it was his goal in life and he put this bandana around his head in a "Pirate Fashion" and tried to get the drunken pirate walk down...he's so crazy. "Did you see Pirates of the Carribbean?" "Hells yes! Johnny Depp is my role model. That was a tight ass movie!" And David climbing all the rocks..."It's not a real camping trip unless somebody gets hurt." as he is climbing across the face of a 50-foot cliff. I got back, and have been hanging out with Naomi, Rebecca, and Sarah a lot. I got this pair of plastic glasses and was wearing them and then Rebecca and Sarah tried to wrestle them away from me...then Rebecca, Naomi, and I tried to fly a kite, but we couldn't figure out how to get it to work (How many tams kids does it take to make a kite fly? lol ok i'm a dork) and then we laid out, once again, under the stars, and talked about all sorts of things...I love the conversations I have gotten to have with people these past couple of days. I have really been thinking about what to do with my future...I just don't know exactly what to do... Then, we went out to eat with Kenil, Kevin, Norton, and Nic. They are one funny bunch. That was a lot of fun too. I also ate some of the best pizza I have had in a long time. As I said, I love life sometimes. I am completely happy right now. And glad I came here...there are a lot of things I am learning, and a lot of experiences I am having...just because I came here...and so I am glad. Before I came here, I didn't think that Naomi and I would be really close friends...but we are. She is a really good friend to have. Rebecca as well, I am so glad we are friends. And Laura. She is awesome. And the other Lisa. And Sarah. And so many people, I love them all. But, I love you Arlingtoners just as much! Will be in town in a few days. Will hang out with everyone. Yes, Fifer, we will go out and be hardcore, because we are naturally hardcore people. And Amy, I will definitely hang out with you too. And Sarah :). Because I miss you all, even though I think I am finally getting to where it almost feels like home here...but I think that is what should happen...since I do live here and all...:) :). I want to live in a castle. -Lisa

I should really stop having dreams. They are good, but not good...and confusing. But, interesting...so I dunno...hmmm... So, today was pretty darn cool. I woke up and went to Pre Cal, then ate with a bunch of people, then I am pretty sure I took a 2 1/2 hour long nap. That was really nice. Full of lots of nice and pleasant dreams. Went to chem recitation...that was...chem recitation...and then chem lab. My TA was really nice. I was supposed to have to do the last lab because I had already missed one (for my great grandmother's funeral) but she was just like, "Oh well, you can go." and I was like, "Are you sure?" and she was like, "Yeah, it won't hurt your grade." and I was like, "Score." So, I left. And then...something unprecedented in the history of Lisa's studying here at TAMS...I started my homework before curfew...and WELL before curfew at that. I started at 4:00! It took me 2 1/2 hours (Induction is tricky stuff, it is) but that is not bad, considering some people took up to 4 hours to do it. Sooo, around 6:30, I went to eat with Laura and Lisa and Sarah. And this is when my day gets interesting. Bruce was holding their 12 rock bands in 12 hours deal...from noon to midnight...and there were some pretty good bands, too. The one that was playing when I got there was doing an Alkaline Trio cover and then they did Weezer's Sweater Song, which was pretty funny, because the guy was super goofy. I went and ate and then came back out and this band called By Starlight was playing. They were indie sounding...kind of...anyway, I was hooked. I stayed their whole set (about an hour) and then the next band's set...and then the next band's set. I must've spent 3 1/2 hours just listening to people play music today. There was this one guy who just got up there with his acoustic guitar and sang all of these beautiful songs...and this one band that was super hilarious with their cover of the Proclaimers' "I Would Walk 500 Miles." And they kinda made fun of an Eminem song...great, great fun. Fifer, it was something you would like. College students sitting around in Bruce's lobby, listening to people play music. It was by far the most hardcore thing I've done on campus so far. So, I came back here and took a study extension so I went down and chilled in Mac for a couple of hours...studying for my chem test tomorrow some of the time...some of the time just talking to Laura and Katie and Kai and Osato and the other Katy...I dunno...was cool. I had a cool day overall. Very good. Oh! And Laura and I figured out what our Goldcore project will be!!! It is going to be awesome. That is all. -Lisa :)

"I say never be complete. I say stop being perfect. I say let's evolve. Let the chips fall where they may." This has been the leading quote on my aim profile for a good four or five days now, and every day, it holds more meaning for me than the day before. I don't know how to put this without sounding...like I am trying to make excuses for not being as perfect as possible or making the grades that I wish I could be making, but the past few days, I have seriously been thinking that being imperfect should be embraced, not something that should be remedied or escaped... So many times, I think that people see what others have labeled as "perfect" or the "right thing to do" and they just mindlessly try to attain everyone else's goals. They strive to go to the best school, have the best grades, be the most talented, have the best personality, do the most, have the most possessions, have the most money, have the most stylish clothes...be better than everybody else... To quote Ed Norton's character in Fight Club (the movie the initial quote is from) "You buy furniture. You tell yourself, this is the last sofa I will ever need in my life. Buy the sofa, then for a couple years you're satisfied that no matter what goes wrong, at least you've got your sofa issue handled. Then the right set of dishes. Then the perfect bed. The drapes. The rug. Then you're trapped in your lovely nest, and the things you used to own, now they own you." And it doesn't just apply to materialistic things either. The superficial dreams for things that you don't really want...the superficiality of it all, actually...it ends up owning you. Everything you do is under the authority of the materialistic or superficial thing that you want or you strive for. Bottom line: Do what makes you happy. Have a passion for something and immerse yourself in it...feel alive. Don't pursue things that society or other people have told you will make you happy. Don't go to college just because it is "the thing to do." Don't get married just because it is expected of you. Don't buy that shirt just because you think someone you are trying to impress will like it. Don't let the things of your life own you....Own them. Own your own life; be the final and complete authority of your life. Do things that will make yourself happy. This is not to say that you should forsake your morals just to selfishly make yourself happy. There are other peoples' feelings to take into account and how your actions will affect others. Just because owning the latest Britney Spears CD would make you happy (although I can't imagine why it would :) ), that does not necessarily mean that you have the right to steal it from a friend and claim it as your own. You have to incorporate a system of morals into your life and take responsibility for your actions, otherwise, happiness is not necessarily something you deserve. And even though your morals may not be the same as everyone else's, as long as you stick to what you say you believe, and don't behave in a hypocritical fashion, your morals are yours to follow and hold yourself accountable to. But, I digress. Perfection leads to unhappiness, I am convinced. Most every "perfect" child I have ever met, has been without personality, on the verge of mental breakdowns...most have little to no social life. However, making perfect grades and going to the perfect college could very well make someone happy, and there are a few that truly want to do that with every fiber of their being. It makes them happy. "It's only after you lose everything, that you're free to do anything..." When we are not afraid of losing our reputation as the smartest or the richest, when we are not afraid of losing our new car or our computer...that is when we start living life...when you are destitute, at the lowest part in your life...when the only place you can go is up, that is when you are completely and absolutely free to do whatever you want. The world is free for you to do whatever you please, because you have absolutely nothing to lose. We never need to stay stagnant. We need to be ever-changing, ever-evolving. We should never be complete; we should always be challenging ourselves, our character, our intellect...and above all, we should let ourselves develop into the person we naturally are. "Let the chips fall where they may." Don't try to control the world, your surroundings...you can't. That would imply perfection, which is unattainable. Let things be how they be. Things are going to happen sometimes that you cannot do anything about..."It's what comes afterwards that truly counts. That's when you find out who you truly are." (-Buffy Season 2 finale) It's amazing how one movie, based on one piece of literature, can make you think so much. I now see how people can base their entire philosophy on one novel. I now see why Jon was always so obsessed with this movie. It sticks with you. It's been almost a week now, and I still think about it...I'm still thinking about it. "I just don't want to die without a few scars... May I never be complete. May I never be content. May I never be perfect. Deliver me, Tyler, from being perfect and complete." -Lisa

The TAMS community never fails to amaze me. I do believe that most of the people here are funnier and/or more interesting than a lot of people I know. It was "Family Weekend" this weekend. Mmmm...translation: lots of things going on. Saturday I saw the play that the theatre group put on. They did Hansel and Gretel. The guy that played the witch did an excellent job...when he was pushed in the oven he was all, "I'm melting!!!" It was quite funny. And then the Talent Showcase was at 7:30...omg, it was the best talent show I have ever been to, and the most diverse, that is for sure. Kevin did his version of Wonder Wall, "McConnell Hall." Osato and Guo did a rap duo..."T-A-M-S Y'll throw it up!" That was quite amusing as well. The TAMS orchestra did their thing...I swear, half of the ppl in that were violin-playing Asians...lol...it was great. Abby and Colin did a version of "Picture." The one that Kid Rock sang that sounded all country. One of our RAs sang Britney Spears' "I'm not a girl, not yet a woman." (he is a guy) Kyle, Steven (diff. Steven), John, and this other guy did a circus thing...which was basically Kyle with the hackey sack, Steven juggling tennis balls, and John doing his crazy flips all over stage..and the other guy playing them music. Hmm...We had a "Fan Dance," which was some kind of Asian tradition...and an Indian traditional dance...and Matt did "Jamie"...that was great. Hmm...I can't remember all of them...but it was very entertaining. Today was the Ring Ceremony! Basically a little over 100 of us Juniors got our class rings presented to us. Every Senior/admin could say a little thing about the person they were presenting to. Hudgens' were so funny. Vikings, hardcore rebels, ice cream, praying mantises...he is a funny, funny guy. Hah, and Josh had the last person so he proposed to him... :). Betsy made everyone a haiku, so that is what mine was. Something about "The future rock star Someday you'll sing about TAMS Hope you like your ring!" and then she gave a moving, poignant speech about TAMS...I forget what it said exactly... They were all very interesting, though. Hehe. My mom, Matt, Brian, Naomi, her mom, and I all went out to eat at Tia's afterwards...Good ole Tex Mex food...mmm...we have lots of leftovers...anyway, dinner itself was quite interesting...I mean, I suppose I should have known that a combination of Nopei with any 2 of my 3 brothers would be interesting...lol ;p "Antonio Banderas?" "Aha!!!" -Lisa

Man, I hate it when I think really high of someone and then they end up disappointing me. I mean, it isn't their fault...they are under no obligation to live up to my expectations but I mean... I guess I just lost a lot of respect for Steven tonight, not that I even really had a crush on him anymore anyway, but yeah, I thought he was a different kind of person I suppose...well, to put it bluntly, he isn't. That is not to say that he isn't a cool guy to be friends with and that is not to say that he is not hilariously funny, but he is just...like every other shallow, sex-driven male on this planet...hah, but oh well. I suppose I am just looking for someone a little more...reserved in what they do with girls and such. Not in that he doesn't kiss or hug, but in that he...I dunno, doesn't always look for the butt to grab or the makeout session to have...I'd like any relationship I have to be deeper than all that... Yeah, so about 12 of us all played Taboo tonight in Christina's room. It was pretty fun. I was going to go hang out with Lisa, Laura, Aaron, and Tyler after that, but then they left while I was upstairs getting my jacket, so I guess they didn't know I was coming...? But, it was cool, because Sarah and I started walking and talking. I decided that if I pretend to be happy, then I really will be...and it kind of worked...it was nice. We went to Denton Square and I found a whole lot of places I want to go to. Fifer, I found us our coffee shop hang out that it just as good as Starbucks, without the corporate logo. Denton Square is a cool place and all of the shops are really cute. The used book store is awesome as well. Three floors! Amazing, eh? That is all. I do believe I am going to go to sleep now :). I am hoping for dreams that will leave me wanting to sleep more when I wake up, but I haven't had any of those in a while... lisa

This week has been one of failure. Well, not actual failure...but close enough. It is really tough not getting perfect grades anymore. I know that sounds stupid, but it is. I got three test grades back this week. All B's. An 86 (chem), an 89 (Pre Cal), and an 84 (Bio). I mean, in Bio and Pre Cal I have borderline between A and B now...and the tests just keep getting harder...I actually think that the only reason I did so horrible on the bio test was because our professor cannot write questions for crap, but oh well...it's just that, last year, if I had gotten those grades, well...it just wouldn't have happened. But oh well. Change is a part of life, I guess. And our undefeated soccer team lost our first game last night!! To a team we had beaten before!! Zahir wasn't there and we had a lot of people play that had never played with us before. It sucked. Oh well. Afterwards, there were two girls teams that did not have enough players so me, Vanessa, and Adrian played for one team, and Naomi, Rebecca, and Leah played for the other team. I scored a goal the first half and second half I played goalie! Without letting any in I might add ;). And then afterwards, people were just taking shots on me and this one hit me in the face as I was diving for it, and this super...super cute guy came over and helped me up and was like, "Are you ok? That was a nice save." ....sigh....I need to meet more UNT guys... And today I went out to lunch with Matt and Ryan at the Tomato...it is probably one of the coolest restaurants around here...we played foozball (sp?) Twas great fun. Chem Lab was long and interesting...stuff with calorimeters...too bad I don't think I completely understood that concept when we tested over it in chem. :p And then around 7, I went to Matt's band concert...Bass ensemble or whatever...I only dozed off for like a third of it...and it was like an hour and a half long! I am proud...oh and then on the way back, I was telling Matt about the Anime shop and he was like, "Animay? Don't you mean Anime (he phoenetically pronounced it)?" And I was just like, "Are you kidding me?!" He had never heard it pronounced correctly before...or like most people do anyway...I laughed at him for a while...that was great fun. People here are so musical and well-rounded. I don't think I am either. This one guy, he plays like three instruments, he sews, he dances (like the real kind, not the "grinding" crap), plays soccer, is smart, and is just well-rounded altogether. I was amazed. He also listens to good music :). Anyway, I think I am finished now. Not much more to write about. I'm getting my class ring this Sunday!! Lisa

The disorder is characterized by odd forms of thinking and perceiving, and individuals with this disorder often seek isolation from others. They sometimes believe to have extra sensory ability or that unrelated events relate to them in some important way. They generally engage in eccentric behavior and have difficulty concentrating for long periods of time. Their speech is often over elaborate and difficult to follow. I dunno, man....maybe some of it...but, definitely not all of it... Lisa

Sooooo I just got back from a "Shower Party." Hmm yes, apparently, people find it humorous to steal things from my stall!! Rebecca, who was in the stall next to me, reached under and stole my shower bucket thing from me...and then, I finish my shower and lo and behold, my towel is gone! Now, Naomi had finished about five minutes before me, and I knew she was the only one gay enough to do something like that.... So I yell for Rebecca to go get my towel back from Naomi, so Rebecca goes out and returns...with one of my face towels...har har har...! And she's all, "This was the only thing I could find!" So I send her back...and she comes back...with another one...so I send her back...well, after about four trips, she finally brings me my towel and is like, "Gee, I just found it somewhere, I have nooo idea who stole it!" Ummm hmmm.... LoL. :) The Desaparecidos rock my face off. Lisa

I watched Fight Club the other night, and it was a superb movie...it is two or three days later and I am still thinking about the end. You know, I think everybody thinks of Brad Pitt as some pretty boy actor with no skills, but when you see him in movies like Fight Club or Seven, you really respect him as an actor more. And Edward Norton, well, he was amazing as well. He constantly amazes me with his ability to act completely different parts in different movies. So many times, a certain actor will only be able to get a part as a certain type of character or person, but Ed, he can play the heartless villain (The Italian Job), a hopeless romantic who also happens to be a priest (Keeping the Faith), or an insane insomniac who enjoys beating the crap out of himself (Fight Club). He is truly an amazing actor. He and Brad Pitt really complemented each other. This could possibly be one of the most interesting movies I have seen in a long time. There is a collage on my desktop now. It replaced the picture of me and the Jennifers when we went to Hooters :). Well, I should be studying for my insanely in depth bio test tomorrow...so, I guess I will go do that now. Oh yeah, I am in danger of making a B in Pre Cal...would that not suck? I think it would. Especially because I should be making an A in there. If I were at Summit, I wouldn't have a B so I shouldn't let myself get one here, you know? Gah, I screwed up on one test, and it will haunt me for the rest of the semester... Lisa

So uh, Saturday- Interesting day. Don't even want to go through it. I did have some fun though, apart from the stress that nearly killed me. There was a nice two or three hour pause from the stress at night when Laura, Lisa, Tyler, Aaron, and I all saw Love Actually at The Magnolia. It was fun hanging out with them and the movie was very cute. It made me happy and hopeful...and Hugh Grant....and Colin Firth...mmmm....those English accents get me every time. Now, on my way back from Denton, after dropping them off, I did get lost for two hours, but, eh, we won't talk about that. And we won't talk about how I didn't get home Saturday morning until...oh wait, it wasn't in the morning, was it? Haha, but, as I said, we won't talk about that. And we won't talk about my mom and my brother yelling at me. Or me only getting to see Amy for thirty minutes. Because I am in a good mood and I don't want to bring back the unpleasant memories. Today, I got to help build a house for Habitat for Humanity and that was really fun. Met this girl from UNT and we cut out windows and doors. And then I got to hammer stuff into wood. Oo, and this one lady that reminded me of my grandma had baked us all brownies and got us hot chocolate. Mm...chocolate... Right after that, I had to go to Sonic for afterprom fundraiser....worked until 9:30ish...got back here at 10...so, I was out for around 10 hours today. Craziness, eh? Oh, and on the way back from Sonic, Spencer was driving us back, and he was all spazzin out and turning up the classical and country music really loud and he is one crazy funny guy, let me tell you. Wow, it was pure spazasticness. Me and Naomi and Rebecca went and got some asian food...or AzN food....and that was good, and I turned in my app to be a HOPE committee head. Dunno if I will get that...prolly not though... My brother is still mad at me, because I forgot to give him back his cell phone. I don't think me and him are on very good terms right now. This is not a good thing. Anyway, I am here, back in my dorm room...putting off homework...pondering some things...yeah, yeah, that is about it. Lisa

What was I saying again? Hmm I don't remember. Something about today, I'm sure...but then I closed the window... So, I am a really stupid person sometimes, and sometimes I can be really boring and depressing. When that happens, I just need a change. Like today I just really needed to get out of McConnell Hall and I did. For a whole two hours. After I took a 4-hour nap, my brother picked me up and along with his roommate, we went to Chilis and ate dinner. They are a funny pair, they are. "So, Matt, I was thinking. Do you think that they kill more cows or chickens every year for meat?" "Well, you have to take into account that most every fast food restaurant serves mainly beef, and only a few serve exclusively chicken, and a lot of people like beef, so you would thinks cows...but you also have to remember that cows have more meat on them than chickens..." (the analysis continues) or... "I was thinking today about how someone with a billion dollars doesn't seem any richer to me than someone with 100 million dollars. I mean, I know that it is a big difference, but you just don't think about it. To me, they are the same level of richness." "Well, yes, but if they were to both pile their money in their yards, one pile would be ten times larger than the other pile. You would notice then, wouldn't you?" "Yeah, but the guy with a billion dollars would probably have a yard ten times the size of the yard that belonged to the guy with 100 million dollars, so you have to consider the yard-to-money ratio..." And there was a Dr. Pepper chugging (well, not really chugging per say, but drinking really fast) contest, and I think Ryan won... Me? I was generally just really quiet the whole night. Why? Probably because I had been in a bad mood all day and Matt was one of the reasons why. I hate myself when I get into a bad mood. I act really stupid and make up reasons to be mad at people. Hanging out with Matt and Ryan put me in a better mood by a whole lot for some reason. Afterwards, I hung out with Naomi, Rebecca, Zahir, Jonathan, and John cuz we all walked to McDonalds and we all teased Jonathan and Zahir told us what "the ultimate situp" was...disgust. And then around midnight, I went walking by myself around campus. It had been raining all day, so the sidewalks were slick with water, and the light would shine on them and the campus was literally deserted. It was so pretty, and so I took out the Jeff Buckley cd that Fifer burned me and walked around in the dark listening to him. His music doesn't make me sad, or happy...it just kind of captures the unending monotony of love and heartache and life...I like it. Pretty sure whats-his-face is with the other girl. Suck. Yeah, but it is no big deal. I mean, I don't care. There are other fish. I suppose. Oh, and I got to borrow three movies from Ryan. Fight Club, Rushmore, and The Usual Suspects. I expect they shall all be good. Bye yall...I'll be in Arlington tomorrow (er...today, because it is around 1:45 am)...despite all the trouble I had to go through to arrange it. -Lisa

MASTERMIND (Submissive Introvert Abstract Thinker ) Lisa Like just 8% of the population you are a MASTERMIND (SIAT). You can be silent and withdrawn, but behind your reserved exterior lies an active mind that allows you to analyze situations and come up with creative, unexpected solutions. Normal people call this "scheming." Don't learn German. Anyway, your sense of style and originality are your strengths, and people will respect your judgment once they get to know you. If you learn to be a little more personable, you could be a great leader--you've definitely got the "vision" thing down. Just make sure all the plotting you do behind those eyes of yours is healthy. Famous masterminds in television: Dr. Claw, The Scarecrow and Mrs. King, Montgomery Burns.

Gah controlling Asian parents make me so upset. Our Senior Mentor, Bestsy Liu, is the most awesome person you will ever meet. She is outgoing, friendly, nice, nonjudgemental, scarily smart, and she's just...awesome...I don't even know how to describe how awesome of a person she is. So, her dream school is Stanford, right? So she spent hours upon hours, days upon days, and weeks upon weeks preparing her application. I mean, she has prepared for longer than that, obviously, because she has been working her ass of her entire high school career so that she could go there. And she can. She has a 1530 on the SAT, her SAT IIs were amazingly high. Her GPA (at TAMS) is like a 3.98, at high school, she was number one in her class, she is president of the astronomy club, the head editor person of yearbook, she did cancer research this summer at a hospital in Dallas, she was National Merit commended, on the Dean's list, on the President's list...everything you can think of, she's it. The perfect applicant. And she doesn't just half-ass it and do things just so she can have it on her application, she goes all out and gets involved because she wants to and she enjoys being around and helping other people. However, one thing about Betsy is she is always comparing herself to her older brother, who she sees as the perfect kid. He had a 4.0 and is going to Johns Hopkins and was president of a lot of stuff too, but to their parents, he is the better kid or something, probably just because Betsy is more free-spirited than he is. She has this thing where she thinks that she will never live up to him, that she can never be as good as him. She thinks she will always be just second best, never the top pick. Her parents don't see how amazing she is. So, she works so hard on this application to Stanford, and the day she has it ready to send off, her dad comes to the school because he says it is not good enough and he has to make some changes. Ok, well, not so bad, right? Today her parents told her to forget about going to Stanford, or Cal Tech, or any of the other amazingly good schools that she could get into, because she is just not good enough, she is going to go to UT and that is it and she is going to become a doctor and everything is going to go their way. Except Betsy doesn't deserve that. She came in and told us and you could see in her eyes that she didn't want to accept what they had told her, but she has to, because it is apparently the way that Asian families work. I told her to screw that, she was going to apply to wherever she wanted to and go to college some place excellent and good. But...she is just like, "No, they know what is best for me." What is best for her is not to be in some public school, studying something she doesn't even want to be studying. UT is fine for my brothers, heck it's fine for me, but it is NOT fine for Betsy. She deserves to go to Stanford and pursue her own dreams of majoring in mathematics, working for Pixar, and opening her own restaurant. But, because of the way that Asian families work, she may never get to do any of the things she really wants to. Sorry, but this really makes me sad. It makes me sad and it pisses me off. I just..can't explain my frustration right now. I am so frustrated. I want Betsy to go to Stanford and have the best possible life. I don't want her parents dictating what she can do with her life. It is NOT RIGHT. Life isn't fair. She can't do much, because her parents were supplying the money for her to buy her applications, but we want to help. Naomi, Rebecca, and I want to buy applications for her, and encourage her to just fill them out. I don't know how this will end up, but I know that I want Betsy to be happy, and going to UT (which is like every TAMS kid's back up school) is not going to make her happy. Ahhh -Lisa

So, uh, basically, nothing of importance has happened these past couple of days. I had a Pre Cal test that I studied all Monday for and I think I did well on. I had an essay due today that I cowrote with Laura and we wrote it in between classes today before English. We won our 5th soccer game on Monday as well. Now we are 5 and 0 baby. ;) So, last night I ate lunch with Katy and Alejandro and Ian and these other two guys that were just what you would call your typical nerds and it was so fun. It's funny, because, you would think that being at tams would help me to hang out with more nerds but so far, I haven't really. They were all talking about rpgs and who could eat the most and it was just funny. I think nerds in general are the most interesting people on earth. I think I am about 90% nerd. However, since I have never engaged in a game of D&D or memorized all of the dances to the new ddr cd, I think that maybe I am missing around 10%. I do have the Tolkien/Adams/rpg/uil spelling team/tams/i like to read poetry and literature and take math electives for fun aspect of it down. Oh and then Naomi tried to convince me she was a nerd and I was like, "er, no." but she insists...and I was just like...no...I took a poll too. No one thinks she is a nerd...because she isn't...obviously. And today was mightily fun. I mean, classes, lunch, writing essays...who wouldn't have fun doing that? We had to peer edit in English and we read Andy and Matt's paper on how in The Lady's Not For Burning and The Flea, the male sex drive is what motivates all of their actions and how, basically, it made them all act like idiots. It was hilarious. They used lines like, "...so all of their attempts were flushed down the toilet." I mean. Seriously. I laughed, I cried, it was great. Well, I didn't cry per say, but...you get the idea. And then it was raining so me and Laura were running back and it was great fun and Tyler and her like each other and I didn't know that and I was all "oh sooo thats why he is coming with us saturday" because we are all going to see a movie and have a night on the town rather than go to homecoming because i dont see the point in going to some school sponsored event in which all we will be doing is grinding and talking over loud music and not have anyone to dance with to the occasional slow dance and going to the movies would be a whole lot funner and so Laura is all like,"ohhh youve got to get steven to go and then you can tell him about my steven sweater matching notebook" and i am all like, "blah blah yeah but we dont really talk anymore but ill ask him anyway and naomi freaking told him he should go to homecoming with me AWKWARD but she insists it isnt awkward but oh it is" and then this sentence is so run onned its not even funny, i wonder how long i can make this sentence/paragraph ok im done now. That is about it. It is raining now, although I think I already mentioned that part. And I'm done. out. finito. La fin. the end. asta la vista baby. come with me if you want to live lisa

Halloween. Last night. Great fun-filled evening. I picked up Fifer around 5:30 or so and then we went to Blockbuster to pick out some horror pics. Unfortunately, there is a lack of good scary movies at Blockbuster, but we ended up getting House on Haunted Hill, which I had not seen, and had heard was good. Then, we went to Jennifer's to help her get ready for her date. She was all excited, wearing her pants that were too small and the new sweater she got from Khol's for $12. We talked much- of people and places and music (of course). I am borrowing her Story of the Year and Thursday CDs to burn. :) I am also gonna burn Interpol from Fifer. We were there until around 6:45 or so. And then: To the tennis party! I walk in and immediately I hear everyone yell, "Lisa!" and then Olivia runs up to me and tackles/hugs me and Brittany does the same and I say hi to Shawna, Allyn, John, Kevinh, Nick, Melissa, Brad, Lisa, and others I am sure. I realized once again why I miss the tennis team so much. They are all so nice and funny. And fun in general. I hung out with Olivia, Alex (her guy), Brittany (my crazy Asian-Indian-Mexican-Hawaiin-who knows what else friend), Lisa (Arccy), and Fifer (Jennifer...different Jennifer) for about 30 minutes or something like that and ate some pizza and some cookies and drank some Sun Kist and asked Brittany about her college boyfriend (cuz they are getting really close ;) ) and her permed hair (which was super cute) and we spoke of college, where Olivia and Alex want to go, how Olivia had the SATs to go to the next morning... I left around 7:30? Something like that. And then we went and visited Amy...er..well, we drove around the block until we sited her and Lisa Higbee's kids trick-or-treating (sorry bout all the Lisas, guys). So we talked to them for a while and Fifer got to see Heather and I got to hold her but she started crying so not for very long. And then around 8:00 or something, we left...and went to buy batteries at Wal-Mart...for my costume...Mua hahahahahahahahahaa. Man, I wish I had a picture of me in my costume to put on here. It was a sumo-wrestling thing and you put batteries in it so that this little fan would keep it inflated all the time. hehe. I was so fat. Twas the "freshman fifteen." lol. So we walked around like that for a while and went and made her mom laugh and then we came back but, after sitting on my brother with the fat suit, there was nothing to do and Fifer had to go home because she had to be home early for her UiL meet. So, I sat around watching some history channel by myself when Jennifer walks in with Nick, her guy. He was really polite and nice, and was quite funny also. I approved. I knew him from work this summer but I had never really said much of anything to him, but I am glad Jennifer found herself a nice boy. We watched House on Haunted Hill until around 1, and then they left. The movie was gory, but not too scary...oh well :). Then I went to Amy's and we started watching Halloween, because it is a standing tradition with us, and I accidentally fell asleep, because I was meaning to come back here to sleep, but it is scary driving by yourself at 2 or 3 am after watching a horror flic. And today I went brides maid dress shopping with Amy and Sarah, which was pretty fun. And now....I'm doing nothing! I miss everyone :) Lisa

You know when you are reading a book and you are really getting into it and getting interested and then you stop for a second and realize that you don't remember anything from the last paragraph you just read because you started thinking about something that shouldn't even be bothering you but yet it is and so you start thinking and while you are thinking, you are reading, but you aren't really reading you are just looking and comprehending the words, and so you stop and tell yourself to just stop thinking and concentrate on the book, but then five minutes later you stop reading again and realize that the entire page has been wasted because you keep thinking about things that you shouldn't even worry about and you've had an awesome day but then you saw that someone was online and you just haaaaaaaaadddddddd to talk to this person even though every time you talk to them you have more to think and be confused about than you did before- at no fault to them of course. Because even though you like them, you hate them, and even though you hate everything about them, you like him. What then? And why do you still talk to him after you have moved away and yall talk more now than you ever did when you lived here and then he says all these things and you are just like well what a nice fellow and then you start thinking but he's a bastard I should hate him. But why is he a bastard? Well, he's a bastard because he makes me have butterflies in my stomach when I talk to him. Well, why do I have butterflies in my stomach when I talk to him? How the hell should I know? I am just an angsty, confused, fucked up wanna-be emo nerd kid that hasn't ever been kissed or drunk or high or anything, which may be good, who knows? But then there is always the what-ifs. And the what-ifs are the most confusing. So, I put my book down and I think ok, no more reading tonight, because I won't really be reading, I will be seeing and comprehending the words, and that is not productive. So, I'll lay down and not be able to sleep as my mind goes in circles from one thing to the next and I get mentally dizzy and I ponder the what-ifs...the past, present, and future what-ifs. I am going crazy.

Today was unbelievably fun. Abby + Jenn = Fifer and I laughing our nancies (hahahaha) off...and an incredibly high level of insanity. I don't think I even want to go through the whole day...and it really was the entire day. From noon to around 10...that is like...10 hours...wow...I don't know if I expected Abby and Jennifer to get along merely because of Jennifer's opposition to Abby's cursing "like a sailor" but it worked out well. I don't think Abby minded giving up on it for the day even though she did slip a couple of times lol. Man, but we had some hardcore times. Very deck. I want to be a polit. Kind of. That and a punk rocker. And an emo kid. And an indie rocker. I'm not sure if it is possible to be all four. Maybe so, though. Byeeee! Lisa

Was out of town for a while, four or five days, I don't know exactly how long. Was very interesting. Thursday morning we left at like 7:30 in the morning, I had stayed up all night waiting for a chance to put stuff in my mom's stocking so I didn't go to sleep until around 5, so I slept the entire five hours to San Antonio. First went to Aunt Hilda's for Christmas lunch. Lots of food and such. Played football with my brothers for a long while, learned a lot about football, and why it is not just a sport of guys looking for an excuse to tackle each other and slap other men's butts. Then went to Joe's Ice House to hook up with the larger family, more food, played paper football, was interesting. Went back to grandparents house, I feel asleep around 9:30 (yes, I know, shocking), and slept for about 12 hours. Friday- Got to play Poker with my brothers, my dad, and my memaw...was fun...learned a lot about poker...passed the day away doing...nothing? I dunno...my brothers and I hung out a lot...it is funny how now that we all live apart from each other, we are more like friends than siblings...had the family over for big steak dinner, lots of talking and laughter and such, then opening presents...hmm...after everyone left, played more poker, then I went and read until around 3. Saturday- drove to Bryan-College Station, went shopping with Nanny and PawPaw for groceries, and witnessed what I have to look forward to when I get old. my Nanny told me the story of how her and PawPaw met and fell in love...was quite a charming story...he played fiddle or something for some band and his sister was friends with her sister and so my Nanny would go up to the dance halls and see him play and they met each other like that and then one day, the two sisters wanted to go to Galveston or somewhere like that and they needed PawPaw to take them but he said he would only take them if Nanny got to go with him, and so she did and "we've been together ever since!" She was only 14, got married at 16. My, how the times have changed. So, after that, we all ate dinner, lots of famille ppl with us, and we talked some, and then around 7 went to Jason's apartment. Around 10:00 we all played Poker this time with Peter and his gf from Tennessee and this time with money (we all put five dollars into the prize money). I was the first one out, tee hee, but I went out in style, and got an ovation, while Matthew (who went out second but bought some chips from Brian to stay in the game and ended up winning), got the Na na na na na na na na hey hey hey you suck song sung at him. Quite funny it was. Got back to the grandparents' at 1, read til 6, slept til noon. That would make it back to today...big family party once again...chinese gift exchange, family bingo...I wish I could tape record my family...they are the weirdest, funniest, craziest ppl ever... Anyway, I loved hanging out with my brothers all week, they are tons of fun sometimes when they are not being dumb. I have actually begun to enjoy watching football on TV, God help me...and my Nanny cracks me up so much...quoting Christmas Vacation and whatnot...the part where he is like, "THE BLESSING!" "I pledge allegiance to the flag..." lol...anyway New Years Resolutions During the school year, get to sleep by 1:00 every night. Wake up by 7:00 every morning (is difficult when your first class is at 10) Read the newspaper and/or watch the news every day Make more time for fun reading Am almost done with the 8th Sword of Truth book...such a phenomenal series...I encourage all of you to go out and somehow get a copy of Wizard's First Rule and read it...you will not be able to stop reading, I promise you... But yeah, Christmas was great, and the presents were good...I always feel bad when people spend a lot of money on me, I certainly don't deserve it...oh well. CDs to get with Best Buy gift certificate Yellow Card The Early November Senses Fail Of course, the only one they will have is Yellowcard, but oh well...such is life...I shall have to search for other things I want... Well, I am off...prolly to read a lot until the wee hours of the morning like I did last night...unless I finish the book before then. Lisa

Today was nothing big- just some more of the last minute shopping and insane traffic and near-death experiences (which no day would be complete without) with Fifer, and then handing out Christmas gifts with Jennifer and more of the "Nick likes you"ness because we saw him and stuff...that's about it. I got North today...the new Something Corporate...I had been waiting for it because I wanted to buy it the day it came out but I had already told my mom I wanted it for Christmas and I was afraid to buy it and then get the same thing for Christmas so I didn't get it and then my mom told me that she didn't get me any of the CDs I asked for, sooo I was gonna wait until later after all my shopping to get it and I refused to listen to Sarah's copy because I love them so much and I just wanted it to be mine and perfect when I did listen to it for the first time...and so Fifer bought it for me today from the CD Warehouse (one of the only good places to buy CDs nowadays as the selections at Hot Topic are getting less and less what I like every time I go in there...although I have to admit, they still have a lot of good music but still...I guess maybe my tastes are changing...? I know not, all I know is that they didn't have the early november or senses fail the last time I checked and I was very disappointed). I put it on the way home and turned it up...because listening to music in the car is by far my favorite way of listening to music (besides you know live shows and the such :) ) and oh my gosh, it was lovely...beautiful...emotional...everything about it was great. I have only gotten to listen to the first five songs...but they are orgasmic...and I save that word only for music that I truly love...When I first bought Leaving Through the Window a year ago...almost exactly a year ago, when I couldn't find anything but If you c jordan on kazaa, I fell in love with so co...they were "the band that changed my life forever", as Allister so adequately put it...and now, I love their new music, if it is at all possible, even more...wow. Ok, well, I am going to go bundle up, sit outside on my balcony porch in the cold weather, listen to my new CD, think about my life, and ponder the condition of the human race... Lisa PS- Am very happy with my psat score. 219...top 1%...which means National Merit Semifinalist...which probably means more college money for me...which means more of a chance for me to live out my Boston dream...:)

So we went to Six Flags last night and who do I see but....Halston. ::Dramatic pause for significance of statement to sink into the audience:: He was performing a Christmas show on the stage outside of the Cliffhanger and I sat down and watched him and three other guys sing and dance and whatnot while Olivia and Stephen and Olivia's younger brother and sister rode this other ride. I had almost forgotten how beautiful he is...he is seriously in all probability the most perfect guy I have ever known. And even though I could only manage to speak about two sentences to him the entire time I had a crush on him, I could just tell how incredibly nice and friendly and humble and smart and...everything he is/was. Hmm...yeah, and six flags was fun...Olivia and Stephen were a blast to hang out with. We had some funny conversations. When I got home at around 10:30, I was really tired and wanted to sleep, but Jennifer had dropped by earlier and said she wanted me to call her and spend the night at her house because she wanted me to help her make her little Christmas baskets, and so I did, and there was much arguing between her and her mother, but not too bad, and Jenn told me how she really is planning on living with me this summer...hmm... Ok, so, now I left my purse in Jennifer's car so I have to go to Kroger for the billionth time this week to get it back. Oh yeah, and I got to stay at Olivia's the other night and watch Bend It Like Beckham....mad props go out to Jonathan Rhys Meyers for being so incredibly sexy... Song of the week: You and I Both by Jason Mraz...I can't get it out of my head...good song, good song... Lisa

Hey hey! Lessee...last night's show was really fun. No moshing, but that hardly detracted from my enjoyment of the show. The first band, Fishboy was absolutely hilarious. "I'm fishboy...to my left here is Slapbracelet and to my right is Sweatpants." Hehe. Sweatpants was this guy that kept this serious straight face the whole time but he had miscellaneous, random instruments. He played the kazoo, the keyboard, the trumpet, and at one point in the show he starting rocking out with this tambourine, and I mean, he was getting into it...twas hilarious. Slapbracelet, the drummer, would have been more appropriately named Wolfman, as he had a full grown beard and everything. He was kinda goofy, in a really weird way, and at one point in the show started drumming with his hands, instead of drumsticks...was very, very cool. Fishboy, the guitar person and lead singer, was awesome. He reminded me so much of Max Fisher, from Rushmore (hehe thanks Alice for recommending that movie), and he was hilarious....ah...and the songs...this has got to be one of the most original shows I have ever seen. Mae was pretty good...had good music, didn't entertain me as much as Fishboy. And then The Rocket Summer. I was expecting them to suck...but I really enjoyed them. It is mainly the one guy, Bryce, and he is truly a free spirit. At first I thought he was kinda fruity, but as the show went on, I decided that he probably wasn't...especially since he kept singing about girls. He is a beautiful person, inside and out, in my opinion...his style was unique, and he was an excellent musician. At different parts in the show, he played all three of the instruments in his band...very hardcore...and I don't even know how many times he called us "rad." and he said this was one of the best shows he's ever played...he loved the audience, and the audience loved him...and he had crowd interaction...he was just a free spirit...and for his encore, he played a Lisa Loeb cover ("I really like this song, but I'm not a wuss." lol) and he wrote a song for his family because they were all there and it was such a pretty and meaningful song...I was about to cry...hehe...and then he played his most well-known song, and that was really fun. Yes, very good show, am very glad I went... Afterwards, it was really late (like 1:30) and we went to Kroger's...so Jennifer could see her darling Nick...and yeah, the other Nick was there too, and apparently he told Jennifer I was really cute and he wanted my number but ok, he has had this girlfriend for like a year and they have promise rings and everything and he has cheated on her before...what level of commitment or honesty or merit could I expect from a person like that? So, Jennifer told him to get his girls straight and we left... So, that is that. Went out to eat and grocery shopping with my mom today. Screw Ryan, I am hanging out with Olivia tonight...ciao Lisa

Ok, if I have anything that could resemble a crush on him anymore, it is definitely not because I admire him, or because that I want to be with him, if that makes any sense at all. I mean, why would you have a crush on someone that you didn’t really like? I have nooo clue. He’s only like the rest of them- the rest of the sex-driven, egotistical, nice, intelligent, funny, witty stoner slackers… Our conversations get more and more interesting every night… But, let us not speak of these things anymore. Today was great. Got up, drove Matt to the airport, came home, went to Fifer’s to make cookies, went and ate Chinese and went shopping, bought a lot of books at the thrift store, went to help set up the garage sale for UiL, listened to James rant on about nothing really, laughed on the inside the entire time, hung out with Fifer and Mrs. Lands, which was fun, went back to Fifer’s, ate dinner, went to Kroger and waited for Jenn to get off, went back to Jenn’s and hung out for a while, and then went bowling with Nick, Nick, and Lance (so it was Nick, Nick, Jennifer, Jennifer, Lance, and Lisa). Bowling was interesting. Lance, the guy that I admired from afar all during my tenure at Kroger, was there and…we talked…hehehehehe. And Lance likes my jacket…tee hee. And he is beautiful, and * sigh * obviously completely perfect in every way…oh oh, and he taught me how to put twist on a bowling ball…tee hee hee. The other Nick (the one that Jennifer is not going out with) was hitting on me a bit. It was quite amusing. He was all, “You can put your arm around me if you want.” Or “I came over here to sit by you.” Definitely not as good as Naomi’s pick-up lines, but it was cute I thought…not sure if he was serious or not…hmm… Fifer is one of the funnest people to hang out with. I mean, there were times when I could not breathe I was laughing so hard. Jesus…man…I just love that guy. I mean, He is Jesus Christ for crying out loud… …breathe… Ok, sooo, definitely thinking that Sunday isn’t gonna happen, but oh well…I don’t care!!! He is just…stupid. He may be “smart” but there are so many things that he is stupid about…well, must go. I sure am tired from puttering around town today. LoL. Lmao. Jessica's so stupid. Lisa

I got to see the tennis team today. And hang out w/ Brit and Olivia...I misssssss high school....at times like those, anyway. But then, I think about how if I were here full time I wouldn't be thinking that I love high school...soooo, TAMS=good decision...right? Naomi's party was interesting. At first, not many people that I knew....got more comfortable with them as the night grew older...or the morning...whatever you wanna call the 10:00-1:00 time period. Rolled a couple of houses, the tree on one was quite artistic looking, I wanted to take a picture. I think Naomi liked my present...mua ha... Ohhh yeah, the confusion over my bio lab grade has been cleared up and so now I officially have a 4.0. According to the email Dr. Sinclair sent me, 84 out of the 216 or so people in our class got 4.0s...(its cuz we are all overachieving nerds...but actually, for an averachieving nerd school, not even 50% getting all A's is almost weird, dontcha think? Oh, and about 20 people got kicked out for having failing grades....Jonathan barely pulled through to stay with a 2.8 (2.7 to stay in and pull it up to a 3.0 by the end of the next semester), but poor Alejandro, who has to leave because of one point in Pre Cal...must go...stupid 69....:( Am almost finished with Christmas shopping. Am also almost out of money. I bought a lot of people presents at around $10-15 for each present, a little more for my mother...it is hard budgeting my money to get everyone presents and still have some for me so I don't have to hit up my mom for money every time I want to go see a movie, ya know? Umm...I think this is all. Weird stuff. Man. This is some weird, effed up stuff. Lisa

Christmas Break has been absolutely blissful so far. I start out my days by waking up at ohhh around 11:30 or so and proceed to lie in my bed for another half hour, watching the sunlight stream through my window blinds and think about what I want to do that day. Then, I slowly drag myself out of bed, turn on one of four CDs really, really loud (Thursday, Motion City Soundtrack, Fall Out Boy, or Taking Back Sunday) and take a shower with the door open. All of this I can do because I am the only one home for the first half of the day. Then, maybe I get on the internet for a bit, do some insignificant stuff, make lunch, and then I sit down and watch TV for about three hours until my brother gets home, at which point I either continue watching television or go to my room and start talking to my friends online as they all start getting home. Usually, around 3:30 - 4:00, Jennifer calls, wanting me to go places with her, and I usually end up going with her, to various places. If that doesn't happen, there is more vegging. After Jenn and I are done hanging out, other people call and invite me places or sometimes my little brother and I go Christmas shopping and I am home, on average, by midnight or 1:00. I watch more TV, fall asleep around 3:00, and begin the whole cycle again the next morning. Of course, I talk about this like it has been a long time, when in reality, this is the pattern I have followed for merely three days now. Oh, but it feels like it has been a long time. Tonight I hung out with Jenn, went shopping with my bro, and then went and hung out with Naomi and Rebecca. We shot off fireworks and watched embarrassing videos of me, Naomi, Bethany, and JoAnn from a couple of summers ago. "Yeah, Naomi, we can never show these to anyone." "Why?" "Because then they might actually find out that we really suck at being people." I left her house around 2:00, and now I am back here, blogging. Yay for blogs. Oh, Naomi's mom is so cool. She cooked Chinese dumplings (yummm) for my little brother because he has to bring a Chinese food to class tomorrow. She was really nice and generous about it, too. Oh, oh! And, I got some new shoes and they are really nifty looking, so that is exciting. Only $18.98 at Uprise. So, this week has been relaxing and excellent, and I wish I could go through everything, but that would take way too much time, and besides, I suppose it is not all that interesting anyway. What majorly sucks is that I bought two DVDs from Wal Mart but someone else got Kung Pow for Naomi and my dad doesn't have a DVD player so I have to return them and I don't think I have the receipts...so I hope they still take them :). Byeee now! Lisa

It's funny...these re runs of Saved By the Bell and Boy Meets World get better every time I watch them... Ok...so I've got some good news, some sad news, and some confusing news. Which should I start out with? I think I will start out with the sad. Because, this really is upsetting...Alejandro's out of TAMS. He won't be coming back next semester. He was one of my first friends there, and one of the nicest guys, and he listened to some of the coolest music, and he is just...awesome. I can't believe he won't be coming back. It sucks. It sucks a lot. I am going to miss him next semester a lot. I wonder if Jonathan pulled through with high enough grades to stay...last time I checked, he didn't have much of a chance...but I don't know, he might have pulled it off. Happy news...I got my 250$ for BUGS put into my account today! I really needed it, too! So I am happy. That and my week is filling up fast, looks like I won't be having as much free time as I had originally thought. Urg. I haven't gotten to see Olivia yet, either. But, it is happy news because it reminds me how great all of my friends here are. :) And I think I am going to dye/highlight my hair today with one of Jennifer's do-it-yourself kits. Haha. I am just ready for a change, I suppose. It won't be a horribly noticeable change, but...it should be interesting. And now uh...the confusing part...which really, I shouldn't be confused about at all, but yeah...Sunday is the day (kinda like it was for J-Chan ;) ) and we are gonna "hang out"...and really, I have no idea what hanging out means. What? Are we going to see a movie? Are we gonna go out to eat? Are we gonna sit around his house watching TV and eating cheetos? Or are we just gonna drive around listening to music or some such thing? I have no idea what hanging out is, but apparently, that is what we are gonna do. Hmm....I think too much, need to stop thinking. mua hahahahahhahahahahahaha. Lisa

I have about a million bruises on my body, I lost my watch in the moshpit (for the second time this year), my favorite pair of jeans is ruined (three holes, holy crap), my shoes have turned from blue to black, my ears are ringing, and my body feels like it has been run over by a steam roller thing repeatedly and then thrown from a three story building onto a bed of spikes. But, I love it. Ahhhh oh my god how I love it. The Code and None More Black were good. Against Me! was really good. Rise Against was good. AntiFlag was AWESOME. There is so much difference between real punk moshing and pop punk or emo moshing. I've seen soo many bands...The Juliana Theory, Something Corporate, SR 71, The Riddlin Kids, Bowling For Soup, MxPx, New Found Glory, The Starting Line, Mest, The Used, The Suicide Machines, Vendetta Red, Allister, Homegrown, The Early November, Senses Fail, Northstar, Letter Twelve, Clover St, Fall Out Boy...and tons more...I cannot even name them all!!...never have I been in a mosh pit to this degree of...insanity... It was violent, crazy, hardcore, and violent...it was like...gah I can't even describe it. This show was awesome beyond description. I feel so free at shows...it is like, I let go of everything and all my inhibitions...it is like the raw me, the raw feeling and the raw music, and it is...my sanity. The insanity is my sanity. I seriously don't know how I would emotionally survive were it not for music. I think if everyone at one point in their lives experienced being in the music like that and just outletting their emotions like I get to when I go to concerts, the world would be a much, much better place. La La La and the punk rock community is so...family like. I mean, it is like...unified...I don't know how to describe. Everyone passes around water bottles and shares the wealth... they help you up when you fall in a moshpit...they are so nice in general. And smart. I think that punkrockers are some of the smartest people in the world. Ahh...greatness.. Must go. Sleep and I can barely type this cuz my body is so exhausted...sdk;jl blah tee hee Lisa

So, uh, basically, my life is really boring and so I don't have all that much to blog about anymore. So, I will try right now...hmm... All I did this week was study...and climb a tree...oh! and on Tuesday me and Naomi made some snowflakes to add to our festive doorway. Rebecca taped a Christmas tree on her door. It was pretty hardcore, let me tell you. But, we had to remove all of our personal items from our door because it is December break. One whole month. Woo! I can't wait. For Naomi's mom to pick us up, that is. I think she just left like ten minutes ago. *Sigh* oh well. So, I took my last two finals today. Bio and chem. There were two for biology, the cumulative was optional, for if you wanted to replace your lowest exam grade with it..the first one was a little bit hard, pretty sure I got an A though, and the cumulative was simple. So, that went well. Chemistry is what killed me. Our professor is a psycho and so much of what was on the exam we never learned or went over. It was freeking craazy. Half of our exam was multiple choice, 50 of them, and I made an "educated guess" on ohhh about 20 or so. The other section was a little easier but I am still not sure AT ALL that I did all of them right. I had to make a 77 to keep an A in there...not sure I did it...aw shucks. Oh well! Dr. Allen emailed me and told me I got an A in Pre Cal with a 95 on my final. Yay! :) I studied hard for that. I made a 90 flat in the class. Next semester I will definitely pick it up in Cal. Oh and I turned in my book for that class. Ha Ha. I don't think the old lady noticed that chapter 7 was all loose-leaf paper stuck in there. Tee hee. You make me dizzy runnin circles in my head. One of these days I'll chase you down.... YOU KNOW YOU MAKE ME BREAK OUT...MAKE ME BREAK OUT.... I've always wondered what they meant by that. Does the person that is running circles in their mind made them get acne? Break out of what? Maybe I should read the lyrics...hmm So, it is my first Christmas break from TAMS. I only get two of these. It is weird thinking how I won't see any of these people for a month. Kind of how it was weird thinking I was moving away at the end of the summer. Everyone was going crazy moving all their stuff today. I have a lot of stuff to move too. Well, I suppose that is it. Hopefully, I will have a 4.0. That would rule like...something unbelievably cool. BYEEEEeee Lisa

Tonight is a full moon. Thanks for pointing that one out, Fifer. Of course, your reasons are a lot more crazier than mine, but eh...oh well. I woke up this morning and I did not feel like I was at TAMS, or here, or anywhere that resembles anywhere I've ever been actually. It was like...I was living someone else's life. I was taking a shower and I was like, wow this doesn't seem like my life. I proceeded to go with Laura to see our English professor about our paper and my two final essays and exam...and still, I didn't feel like I was there, or that any of that was actually happening. I went to eat and for some reason, none of the food seemed appetizing to me. So I got a bowl of Frosted Mini Wheats. And then Fruity Pebbles. Then we went and talked to our biology professor about our final exam and still...I don't think it had set in that hey I am living my own life. And uh, after that, I have no clue what I wasted my day away doing...I know at one point I took a lot of pictures for Naomi of David...all candid pictures... but i mean, it wasn't like I was being creepy about it..he knew that i was taking pictures..but he didnt know when...and they were really random...I think that being a photographer would be very hardcore. I kinda want to see Abby's photo essay about the door from the other night. And then me and Rebecca and Naomi said we were going to study outside. So we "studied" for a while and then we rolled down the PEB hill for like 30 minutes in my big blue blanket. And that was pretty crazy and fun. Oh and then I spent two hours helping Cherie and Starr and Naomi package all of our soldiers Christmas gifts...that was a lot of hard work. Oh, and I got to see the full moon tonight! I made a point to go see it to explain why things are so weird for me today. It was absolutely beautiful. Umm...is that really all my day consisted of? I think I wasted it all away, but it was the coolest waste away of a day I've ever had...if only because I didn't feel like I was living my own life the entire time. OK SO YOU HAVE ALL BEATEN ME TO IT NOW.....WHAT'S NEXT!?!?!? I am so far behind all y'all. *Sigh* I do not have a crush on him anymore, I swear to you. Then, why do I get butterflies in my stomach when I think about how we are supposed to "hang out" over Christmas break? STUPID STUPID STUPID. Stop. -Retard Girl

So many things to blog about, so little time. This weekend has been the best. Where should I start? Lisa's Hardcore Night of Fun and Fantasticness? The wedding of my best friend? My trip down memory lane? Nostalgia? My visit to Becky's house? What, what what? My mind is racing a hundred miles an hour despite the exhaustion that is taking over my body...and mind...lol I haven't even started studying for finals....OH WELL!!!!! LoL I will faillllllllllllllll. That is funny. Fail fail FAIL. Hahahahahahaha. That is freaking HILARIOUS. Umm..anyway, I have been non stop since Thursday...umm... ok... WELL, I got picked up and then we went to the rehearsal and Ben (Ryan's brother) was the Best Man and my escort down the aisle. HE LOST LIKE 3,000 FREAKING POUNDS I swear to you. The last time I had seen him was about two years ago before he went off to college and when he still went to Woodland West. He was a chunky fellow. I might even go as far as to say he was fat. But holy crap I saw him and I was like that is BEN!>!>!>?!?!??! because jiminy crickets he was SKINNY. I mean, seriously...SKINNY no meat. A completely different persoN!!!! i was like wwhoaaaa. what happened and then Sarah was like it was the drugs because he used to be on a lot of crap and i was like holy CRAp those must have been some hella powerful drugs. But he was super nice and I will get to that later. ANYway I saw Aimee and Kristen for the first time in FOREVER. Them two and Sarah were the other three brides maids. I was the Maid of Honor! Rehearsal dinner great fun. AMy gave me a charm bracelet as my present for being a bridesmaid and it was really cool because i don't have one or I mean I didn't have one and it is really pretty and I talked to Cody and Courtney and Sarah and Craig and Kristen the whole time and I really felt comfortable and at home and it was really...nice. Sigh. And then Friday I spent the whole day getting ready for the wedding and chilling with Sarah and Cody and Brett. My hair took like two hours to do!!! Then we were running around with Amy getting all these last minute things and then before I knew it it was time for the wedding!! I had my hair done, my dress on, and my makeup all done prettily (by Kristen) and I got a lot of compliments. I feel pretty oh so pretty I feel pretty and witty and GAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY. Haha west side story ok im done. Amy was. So. Gorgeous. I mean. Wow. I knew she was beautiful. But she shined last night. She was gorgeous. She gave meaning to the word beauty. So when I met Ben in the middle he was just like, "You look really nice." It was super duper sweet. He had complimented my hair earlier too. Aww. When I was standing up there for the duration of the ceremony, I was watching Amy and Ryan and my mind was racing. It reminded me of how people say before you die, your whole life flashes before your eyes. I remembered everything Amy and I had ever been through together. From every two hour long walk we've taken together to those times we would stay up until four o clock eating ice cream and watching movies. I remember the time we just started driving at midnight and ended up an hour away in the middle of nowhere and we never ran out of things to say. I remembered sitting in her room with her when she was obsessed with the dark and all she had to light her room was a black light. I remember when she told me about her first kiss and how I made her tell me EVERY detail. I remember when she told me about losing her virginity and exactly how she told me. I remembered walking to her uncle's house from the movie theatre one summer afternoon as it was pouring down rain...and how we called Spencer after we had gotten back there and dried off. I remember the night her house burned down and how she was only worried about her cat. I remember the entire summer that we spent almost every night together at her uncle's house and when she told me why my parents had really divorced...I remembered everything...from the year our lives were living hell because of Drew and Elise to her sitting in the car with me after I found out my parents were getting divorced and telling me she would take good care of Brownie while we were living elsewhere until my dad moved out...to our midnight swims under the stars where secrets were not secrets and we felt like the closest of friends...because I suppose that is what we were... All of this rushed at me in a deluge of memories and flashbacks as I stood there watching Amy and Ryan pledge their undying love to each other. And I just cried. They were both happy and sad tears. I was letting go of a part of my childhood...Amy and I...we won't ever get to spend every part of every day together anymore. Things have changed, we've grown up...things are different now...but my tears were also happy. She was moving on to live her life with the only guy that has ever really complemented her as a human being. I see them together and I see that they love each other. For the past two years...they have loved each other. I think that their love can only grow from here. oh my gosh there is so much more stuff I wanted to say but this is so long already and I know how annoying it is when people write a freaking novel in their blogs and people just have to scan over it...hehe that is WHAT YOU ARE DOING RIGHT NOW ISNT IT. Ok so anyways to make today short I got home at 1 in the morning from cleaning up after the reception and woke up at 11:00 (after going to bed at like 3:00). and then me and naomi went to visit Becky because her dad died last week and we caught up with her (so many memories sigh). And then Jennifer and Fifer came over and we watched Pirates (my third time of the weekend :) ) and then came Lisa's Hardcore Night of Fun and Fantasticness. Too many things to write a lot about but here goes. Oh my gosh and then i was on the stage but i didnt know it and no security guard came and got me so i jumped up and ran around behind allister and i didnt know what to do so i jumped and tried to do the rock symbol thing and i just jumped off the stage and I WAS ONSTAGE WITH ALLISTER. and then i ran to abby and fifer and I was likee akhdskfjaslkfjsjfkjf that was soo dfgjikf shfwikjf cool anf oidsjfsjlsjv.. janfkjk and they were like do it afain do iit again and ithen the set eneded and we ran out and threw beer bottles of the side of the roof (parking lot) and then we drove home and abby was being the insanest of insanity on the way home and talking in lyrics and about james hairy ass and wow. wowness. like jennifer with more cussing.. moshing. crowd surfing. meeting the musicians. indie coffee houses. fifer. abby. me. fall out boy. allister. buying cd and t shirt. GReAT FunF!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Olivia is supposed to be coming over in a little bit and we are gonna be very h.c. and stay up allll night even tho i should sleep to be rested for finals week but I DONT CARE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Woot! Ok, today was decent for a few reasons. 1) Our biology prof was out again today so no class...but actually, this might be bad since she hasn't been in for oh about 2 weeks so we have no idea what we are learning and our final is next week. 2) I got to take an hour long nap until Pre Cal. Yay. 3) In Pre Cal, I figured out that I did barely pull an a (90) for my homework average which is 17% of our average so the bare minimal I can get on my final to make an a in there is an 83. I think I may be able to pull it off. 4) All I have to make on the Chem final to make an a is an 80. So that was the first half of my day. I looked up so many colleges today. It would seem that no matter where I go, whether it be Public or Private, as long as it is out of state, it will cost a considerable amount of money. And I don't know how many of my credits a Private university will take, but almost any public one will take almost all two years I am getting from here. I don't know exactly where I want to go...sigh...I need to visit all the campuses...oy... Anyway, I also took care of the rest of my tuition and my library fines today. And then I took a 3-hour-long nap and was awakened to Naomi telling me how she finally talked to this guy she had been admiring from afar. She reminded me a bit of Ricky from American Beauty. She told him that she had been watching him from afar every day and that she thought he was interesting or something like that. I was impressed cuz you know, I would never have the guts to do something like that. They guy has a very, very cute thrift store style that is like actually thrift clothes not the Abercrombie "Vintage" style that seems to be getting popular now. And he is very unique...obscure music...The Rachels is his favorite band. Hmm but nuff about that. For dinner I had all this good, good food because the cafeteria had a Christmas dinner type thing and oh my gosh they had cheese cake that had a little peppermint flavoring to it...it was...soo....delicious. I want to learn how to make it. Oh, and Olivia is excited about going to the concert now so that is happy. I think it will be Me, Fifer, maybe her, and maybe JoAnn. Fall Out Boy here I come. Then MHA had their Pillow Fight GA. That was...interesting. I had a little bit of fun, but not too much. Eh, I guess pillow fights are more fun when they are spur of the moment and with your closest friends. I dunno...it was ok though. That is about it. No classes tomorrow! Yay! And not really Friday either because I will not be here! And then the show Saturday night! Fun fun! I am excited. Lisa

i feel rejected on so many levels. but yay for my pre cal test. i actually have a chance at making an a now :). I have to get a 94 on the final and at least a 90 for my homework average, which we get back tomorrow...i have no idea what my homework average is... i want to go to this concert saturday, but i dont think anyone is very enthusiastic about going to it with me. and i dont want to go alone. what is there to do. i think that i would be a lot mentally healthier if i got to go to a concert and mosh. and i dont want to study no matter how much people tell me i should cuz it is dead week. stupid dead week. stupid finals. although i guess i should be thankful for finals since they give me a chance at making a 4.0. but then why do i even care about making a 4.0? i dun even know. ciao lisa
