I am in my own way honoring Abby and Fifer's pact, even though I am technically not a part of it. This past week I have been so...unlike me...it is kinda crazy. I mean, it started with the whole talking to him thing...which happened twice...and then on Thursday (I think it was) Christina was talking to me about the date auction and when I made the argument that I am not the type of person that likes standing up in front of a large group she was like, "But you need to conquer your fears!" and that is when it hit me that I was being a chickenshit again, just like I always am, and I thought about how Abby and Fifer had that pact. Soooo I agreed to do it. Ah ha ha. AND I am going to do it by myself. Other ppl are auctioning themselves off in groups but I, Lisa, insisted on being up there by myself because this is a new chapter in my life (so sad I didn't get to end the old one in a certain ironic way, eh Fifer?). At the Dessert and Discourse last night about objectivity/subjectivity in the arts, I spoke up THREE times, despite my irrational fear of speaking in front of large groups. And one time I made a very viable point in the discussion. Twas great. I am tired of being the quiet shy girl. From now on I am not going to be afraid of talking or introducing myself to people, or anything!! Mua ahjahahahahahaha!!! The other night I was at an Astronomy Club meeting and a few of them were talking about Bush's plan to give more funding to NASA and so I was like, "Oh pleasseee, he just did that to get the nerds to vote for him!" and then I looked around and was like...er...crap. I was talking to a guy with floppy hair, glasses, and pants that when he sat down went half way up his calves, a girl with red pig tails, freckles, and glasses, and a small Asian kid that hardly ever talks. They all looked at me for a second, and the guy said something that sounded like an agreement maybe and then they went back to talking. I felt really bad. They didn't look like they minded that much, and I realize that coming to our school, everyone must be a nerd in some way, but they have probably been teased their whole lives. Maybe I should have said to get the intellectually motivated population of America to vote for him. Oh and now there is a couch war between us and the guys. It is pretty funny. I saw Mike and this other Asian kid steal the couch that we have on our floor the other day so I put up a flyer that said "MISSING COUCH" and they took it down and then Nicola brought it up at our "town meeting" and the next day it went missing from the boys' floor. So they put up their own flyer...of no creativity, it basically said what mine said...anyway, it is quite interesting. So this is gonna sound kinda weird, but TAMS really is beginning to feel like home. It is like everybody knows everybody else and in some kind of weirddd way, we are like one really big family of intellectually motivated kids. I just realized this week how much it is gonna suck to graduate...or closer, when the seniors this year graduate. Hudgens and Mordechai are two of the most interesting people I have ever met. Hmm... I am really worried for Jennifer. Fifer and I were over at their house and her dad and mom went freakin psycho again, and I didn't want to leave, but we kinda had to, and when we came back her car wasn't there but it wasn't at my house or Nick's house either and I have no idea where else she would have gone...I need o go see if she is at work today. Lisa

I remind myself of a giddy school girl. At lunch today, I was leaving Bruce and going to get an ice cream cone but they were all gone and then he came up behind me and was like, "Tell me there are still some left!" and then I was like, "No, I don't think there are." and he looked and was like, "Damn. This ruins my day." (it was amusing) and I was thinking, well, it just made mine...hahahahahahahahahaha. ahem. And so I was like, "Maybe we should go ask for some more." but then me and Sarah left and him and his friend left behind us....and that's it. I know it might seem like I am obsessed because all my blogs lately have been about this, but it is the most interesting thing that goes on, and Sarah and I have many, many jokes about it (much like Fifer and I have jokes about journalism boy and turkey), so it gets discussed a lot. Hmm...he is so awesome. Icecream cones are deck. Lisa

PS- Why doesn't anyone try to compensate my lack of love with coffee cake icecream and a bottle of ten dollar wine? Maybe I should start rocking the haro sport and cowgirl blues. Bleh. I just want some ice cream.

Highlight of the day: I talked to him. Yayyyyy. It was...interesting, lol. Will start talking to him more often now. Nonhighlights of the day: I didn't get to finish my Cal hw, I got my homework grades back and I have a 75. I thought I had like 20 pages left of my English reading when in reality I had about 100 left. Oh yeah and then Rebecca told me that I could submit my chem quiz by tomorrow at noon and of course that wasn't right, it ended tonight at 8:00, so I get a zero on that. Woo hoo. Basically, what this all means is that I will have to work my ass off to get good grades in my classes. I seriously feel so behind in all of them, save for government, and we don't really have to do much in there. I usually don't get stressed, but our first chem and cal and bio tests are coming up, and I am so underprepared. I really need to start studying more. Gah, I hate school sometimes. Nothing else happened. Lisa

You know how you have those weekends that just completely relax you and make you all warm and fuzzy inside? I mean, of course, if you are stuck in this TAMS jail like I am all week, and going home just gives you freedom and you get to see so many people, and remember what it was like before you came here and stuff. Saturday after going to Summit for a while, and almost barely missing Jesus/Nancy/Bob/Ryan/James/Judas (although, technically, I didn't miss James, but he was Judas and then he called Ryan Judas which put them equal to each other by the transitive property, which meant that Jesus was in fact Judas which means that Jesus/Judas actually betrayed himself with a kiss. Which defies the physical limits of a normal human being. But..um...I digress..), I went home and got to see my grandparents and my aunt Denise and they fixed me this drink with vodka...I just felt so a part of the family...cause they don't give the "kids" the alcohol, but they give the "adults" alcohol. Woo. It wasn't very much, tho. Oh, and it was really good. It was like sprite, coke, and vanilla vodka. Hmm... And then we went and saw Clover St. They were so incredibly amazing, I just cannot even describe it. Willie was singing his bleeding heart out, and I just absorbed the music and felt the emotion flowing through my veins. The guitarists rock too. They are all so good. Man. They put on one of the best live shows I have ever seen. I can't wait til their CDs come in. Ben, one of the guitarists, saw my Letter 12 shirt and was like, "We played with them and Senses Fail!" and I was like, "I was at that show!!" and so that was really cool. Then Willie was wearing this shirt that said, "Ben is NOT a person 2004." and one the back it said that he was a gnome and a rice krispie treat and two other things that I can't remember. They are so deck. I want a shirt that says Ben is NOT a person 2004. Haha. The ride home had this atmosphere...we were all so tired, and we were playing the MCS, and the fog was so thick that we couldn't see some of the overpasses, and when Track #3 came on, all of us knew every single lyric, it was so...infinite. It's like, going to Deep Ellum to see shows now isn't as special as it used to be, but I enjoy it just as much. The fact that its become just something that we get to do a lot makes it even...better...I think. I really feel that I am in my element, sitting in the Slackers lounge, or standing by the main stage...and just watching the people and the bands and getting into the music...I can't think of a more perfect evening. Today after church and eating with the Pattersons plus Craig, Sarah, and Dan, Me and Jenn and Fifer and Abby all went to Abby's to ride horses. I think it's cool that we have almost a group thing going on now. I haven't really had one in a long time, but it's like...when we get the chance, all four of us always hang out. I really like it. Anyway, we rode for like and hour and a half. My horse's name was Molly and she was painted...brown and white. She was actually a pony, and she was a free spirit. I could tell she hated being told what to do, and when we started cantering, she would automatically start whenever I would tell her to go from then on. She started going so fast sometimes, it was awesome. Abby was afraid I was going to fall off, but I had a good grip on the saddle thing, and I stopped her if she got to go too fast. Oh and Jenn said something about each of the horses showing something about our personality and said Fifer's was big and white, and mine was short and plump. Ahaha. Then Fifer was like, yeah and yours has attitude. I thought it was funny. But I have so much fun with thems. Abby's house was awesome. It was cluttered and stuff. Hmm...anyway. i dare you to forget the marks you left around my neck. -tbs (gotta love em) Lisa

I am sitting with Fifer at Summit right now. Interesing, ne? We were contemplating alternate universes and stuff...yeah. SAT was cool. My calculator wouldn't turn on for the first math part, but it was ok. Hopefully, I got a 1600. Woo. Haha. That would be funny. I love irony. My brother and I had a convo yesterday about how I think Jesus was albino. For different reasons. Umm...Anyway. Albino and HAIRY. HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHa. Gah, Jesus is so many different things. And I don't mean this in any disrespectful ways at all. Screw the 1600, all I want is a 1510 . Then I can be like....HAH. Going now. Khubiar is acting up. Lisa

In Government today, our teacher was giving us examples of how politicians who express beliefs that are outside of what the public finds acceptable, then they will not win an election. So she gave us a lot of different examples like the guy that was running for president and said he was completely against social security and then hypothetical situations like, "What if a candidate said that in order to keep crime down, he was going to execute criminals by publicly beheading them?" and then she was like, "What if a candidate said that he wanted to punish people in pocession of marijuana by having them publicly..." (she paused here as if searching for a word to use) And then from somewhere in the middle of the class someone yells really loud, "STONED!" Oh my god, it was effing hilarious. Our professor had to stop lecturing for like five minutes while she laughed. And then Rebecca and I went to the GAB because she thought that there was a supplementary Calculus class today, but there wasn't. So I laid down on the benches outside of the class and took a nap for an hour while Rebecca started her homework. I felt so...Bohemian. She said I looked really peaceful and something about my dream sure did put me in a good mood. At one point, there was an encounter with the boy, and I completely overanalyzed the situation, as usual. And, as usual, I did not talk to him. Oh well. Screw caring about ever finding a guy. On the way home around 4:30, my brother and I listened to the Moulin Rouge soundtrack really loud, and it was a really perfect day. I loved every minute of it. I got here and then Amy called so I went over there and it was fun. Heather was adorable and Craig and Brett were funny, and Amy and I got to talk a lot, and I got to tell one of my Michael Jackson jokes that is kinda dirty. Haha. It was funnn. Yay for Amy's house. My family is being extremely annoying right now. And I really don't feel like taking the stupid SATs in the morning, and stuff...and I really want the Yellowcard CD and the 9 CDs that I have decided to burn from Steve. Mua haha. He only picked 8 to burn from me. Lisa PS Results from MAPP Test Accounting & Finance: NOOOOOOO Animal Care: No Automotive & Diesel: Noo Aviation: Don't think so Business: Haha no. Computer: Yeah, right. Culinary & Bartending: Sounds interesting, but me? a cook? and bartending couldn't make me much money could it? Plus I'd be around drunks all the time. Dental: Putting my hands in other people's mouths? I think not. Education & Childcare: I would velcro them all to a wall. Electronics & Computer Repair: It could happen. I'd be incredibly bored with my life, but it could happen. Energy Trades: what is this? Heating & Refrigeration: ummm no Machine Trades: eh? Medical & Healthcare: prolly not Military: ha ha HA Motorcycle & Small Engine: umm righttt Office Professional: no i dont thinkkkk sooo Taxidermy: What the...nevermind, not even going to comment on this one Transportation & Trucking: Lmao...that would be GREAT. Until I was shot and murdered, of course. Travel & Hospitality: Travelll....now HERE is something I'd like to do. Can you major in travel and Hospitality?? If so, I've never heard of it. I don't think it is a real job, I think these people made it up. I think I really will be a penniless musician living on the streets of New York. I think that it would be first on my list if the MAPP Test people considered it a career.

I got a fortune cookie tonight from Clark's Chinese New Year dinner thing. "For a good cause, wrongdoing may be virtuous." I think I've found my excuse for everything I do from now until I die. Ok, here it goes. Haha, wait, first I have to say that a guy wearing a red dickies trucker hat just sat across from me and it's amusing thinking about Fifer and Abby's aversion to trucker hats to say the least. Now, where was I? Oh, yes. My mind is spinning, and I just don't know what to think about anything or anyone. Things the past couple of days have been crazy...surreal...and I don't even know if they would be surreal to normal people, but definitely to me. Tonight was just insane. From the moment I woke up and went to get my spend a day. Of course, it really just got insane starting with all of us going to Clark to eat after the soccer game. Apart from 10 different things just happening at once, and only me I think understanding everything that was going on, there were my personal issues that I just...I dunno. There was the boy and then there was Steve, and I was just like...well, I don't like him. But then, Ahhh oh my gosh. And the boy. He was wearing the sexiest outfit I have ever seen on anyone in my entire life. And it wasn't because of the style or because it showed off his figure. It was because it was the most hideously unmatching thing I have seen in my entire life...and he knew it...and he didn't care. He doesn't care. It was so beautiful. Plus, he looked good in it, even if Naomi and Rebecca thought otherwise. Red athletic shorts, a white shirt, and a brown leather looking jacket over it...it was so unmatching...but it was the most attractive thing ever...to me. *Sigh* From one side, I had Naomi and Kevin trying to get me to go and sit with him, trying to get me to go talk to him. From the other side, Osato and Rebecca, who had no idea what the people on the other side of me are saying, are telling me to go get the number of this guy they thought was my style or something or maybe they just thought I needed to get over my incurable shyness. And then there was Zahir and Rebecca hooking up. Naomi and Kevin hooking up. Leah, who thinks that Chris likes her, when he really doesn't, and is beginning to develop a crush on him. And Chris, who didn't say anything to Colin and David (who are the ones who started the whole Chris likes Leah thing), is now being told that he has to be the one to break the news to Leah, and then he sits with these two girls and meets them...Chris is one of the deckest people you will ever meet, by the way. Leah, all the time, still thinking that he likes her. And then Kacy walks in with Andy, and they sit alone together, which fuels Naomi and Rebecca talking about how she is a hoe because this is like the third guy or something...she is apparently dating two guys at the same time. But I don't care because it's none of my business. So that is going on and then Kaufman and Abby and Megan and Allan sit behind us...Megan and Allan just hooked up a while ago. Then, Steve arrives, and he is just...himself...and well, the old crush from last semester...ahhhhhhhhhh...so I went and said hi to him while the rest of thems people were planning what to do about walking home and who would walk with who. And they decided that I was the one that would walk back with Leah and ask her about how much she really likes Chris. Soo I do that. And the crush is not serious yet, I think. So that is good. And the boy left by himself a lot earlier, and Sarah was trying to get me to leave to, so I would start a conversation with him. But I'm so pathetic. I can't even talk to him. I am so shy, I can't do any of that. Then Naomi and Kevin and Rebecca and Zahir all wanted to go play hide n go seek, and all of a sudden, since Leah wasn't there anymore, I feel like I am the tag a long. The Fifth Wheel. The only one without a guy. So I start backing up. "I think I'll just go back to my room." I say. Kevin and Naomi don't want to leave me out, so they convince me to go. We go to the fourth floor of the basement of the ISB, way down below in this maze of shelves and books, and then Zahir turns off the lights and we are gonna play hide n go seek. I have to admit, it was deck as ef. But...it happened just as I thought it would. With them pairing up into their little dating things, and me being left by myself. So I left. And I came up here. To the computer lab above ground here at the ISB. I applaud all of you who read through this long description of tonight. My head hurts. Everything is so crazy. I feel so...left out. For some reason. Kevin and Naomi. Rebecca and Zahir. Lisa and...nobody. Nobody for the entiredy of her life. Because things like that just don't happen to me. I am pathetic. P a t h e t i c. I can't even start a fucking conversation with him. I mean seriously, wtf. But. I guess it does not really matter. The only of my friends left that hasn't had a kiss, the only experience with relationships being with people like Daniel Ruiz. I suppose I am glad that I don't know what I am missing. Perhaps, and maybe hopefully, I never will. Kevin and Zahir are extremely cool people. With that said, I think I am done writing about this. I met the guy that always plays the recorder outside of Clark. His name is Jeffrey. He seemed really nice, especially when I told him that everytime I heard him play, I thought it was beautiful. Surreal? No. Maybe not. But I never thought I would meet him, that's for sure. When I go home this weekend, maybe I will be able to sort all of this out in my head. But then, there is the meet on Saturday, and we all know who will be there... If I could just speak up, I would say that there is no truth. There is only you and what you make the truth. -Bright Eyes Lisa

Ok so I am on the University computers right now and this backaspace button really sucks so frm now on i am not going to correct any of my mistakes, no matter how much it might bug me. It's weird writing a blog around all these ppl ::glances over shoulder:: ok. We were in West last Thursday and this guy was talking to a table of girls, well, not just talking, I guess you could say he was "witnessing" to them. Anyway, I looked at him and I was like, "Naomi, I know that guy. Where have I seen him before?" and she was like, "I dunno...maybe you just see him around campus." and I was like.."Hmm...I don't think so." and so I thought and thought about it and finally came to the conclusion that he looked a lot like Darren Beames, but it wasn't him, so I thought maybe it was just that he looked like him and so that is why I thought I recognized him. So some nights later we were eating at Clark and he was sitting by himself at the table next to us and I was like, "Naomi, there is that guy that I know I know again." and she was like, "Fine I'll ask him." So she asked him his name and he was like, "My name is Riley." and we all introduced ourselves. And I was like, "Hmm Riley...I don't think I knew anyone from Summit named Riley." so I thought that the Darren thing was probably it. Fast forward to today: Naomi, Rebecca, and I went to Bruce to get snacks (aka I got a bowl of cereal) and Riley is there again. He goes up to Naomi and is like, "Can I just say that I love your shirt?" (it said Satan is a Nerd) and she was like, "Thanks!" and then he looked at my shirt and was like, "Letter 12?! I know them, they are some of my best friends and I am making their music video!" We got into a conversation about Summit and him knowing Jasper but not Matthew and we ended up eating together and then he said that his name was Riley Morris and I was like ok where have I heard that name before. And then in an instant it all clicked back and i was like, "You had a computer class with Dunja Dunda!" and he was like, "yeahh I guess so. I talked to her a bit." and so I was like, "Ok, I was the one with that weird website with the loser list that apparently you and her and Chris all looked at during class." and he was like, "I have no idea what you are talking about." Heh. It was said in a way that made me feel stupid. But, Dunja used to tell me that he thought that my list was super hilarious and that he wanted to meet me, so I guess that is why I thought he would remember. Oh well. He continued to talk, mostly about Christianity, and he said something about Pulp Fiction having a Christian message because Samuel Jackson quotes the bible and so I said something like, "Yeah, and then KILLED PEOPLE." I think that sometimes, people who are completely obsessed with religion or some set of beliefs, even political ones, can be naive about what they see and what it means, or with accepting the truth as truth. I don't know why I am writing a whole blog on this. Hmm...I feel like singing that song. Anyway, it amazes me that after hearing about Riley Morris (affectionately known as Milo) for so long, I have finally gotten to meet him. That is all. Sat by the boy in Chem today. No talking, once again. ahhh. In English, he made some really deck comments and I am so intimidated by him, it's crazy. Oh, heh, and got involved in the warning war between Taaha and Ryan last night. Ended up warning both of them. HHahaha, Ryan was begging me to warn Taaha two more times so I was just like "Click." and his warning went up to 90%. Taaha thanked me for my "impartiality." Go him. Went and saw Secondhand Lions yesterday. Tyler and Aaron are crazy with their "Muff" and their "Release!" Also, I want to die upside down in an airplane running into a barn. And I want to marry the Sheek's grandson. Mmmm.... Chocolate... Lisa

I went to Dessert and Discourse tonight, which was this philosophical discussion about one of Aristotle's works. And I realized that Aristotle was full of shit a lot of the time. Everyone had a discussion during, between, and afterwards. It was interesting listening to them all talk, although some people gave some opinions that I found stupid and ignorant, and a lot of them just wanted to hear themselves talk. But it was awesome still cuz it was all these nerds that use words like requisite to describe stuff. Haha. They were like blah blah humans just want to find happiness, and I dunno, maybe not, you know? And they said that humans need to feel like they have purpose, but once again, I dunno. They said a lot of stuff and got off on a lot of tangents in the course of almost 2 hours, but I can't remember most of it. Something about the ultimate purpose of man being to have some great thought. I was just like...er no. I'd rather live than sit around thinking all day. I think that happiness requires pain, which causes unhappiness. Without pain or things that are going wrong, you are bored and stagnant, which would make you unhappy. This would imply that in order to be happy, you have to be unhappy. Happiness is therefore unattainable. I am a content and happy person, but there is still that longing for something more, that ultimate state of unadulterated happiness. I think that people can get and get and get what they think will make them happy, but it never completely will. There will always be that longing. That is an inevitable part of life. Yes, I know it is a paradox. But I seriously sometimes think that thought is a curse rather than a gift or an "advantage." Animals are completely content, no? Hudgens was funny and insightful and I completely agree with him that it is more in the arts that separates us from animals, more than it is thought. Emotions and all that. He is one of those...people that appreciate art..lol. He meant music, theatre, visual art, films, and every type of art you can really think about. And then at the end Kevin was telling us about all the different types of discussion we'd be having and he was like, "We'll also be talking about whether or not art can be objective or not. Can one person take Britney Spears and Mozart, and apply some kind of test, requirements, or definition to them to say which one is better art?" My answer: No. I think that art really is subjective. I mean, you could perhaps objectively determine who has more talent, and who worked harder, but as to whether or not it is better is completely subjective. That is my opinion as of now, anyway. Ahh I am starting to sound like the pretentious people. Will stop now. But that is part of my view. Rebecca, Sarah, Naomi, and I had lots of discussions in our room afterwards, and I defended my reasoning behind my support of the idea of legalizing marijuana. I won't get into that though, because it would take a lot of typing, that I don't feel like doing at the moment. Anyways, the entire time, I just wanted to scream out that the answer to life was 42. But alas, I refrained, although I think I should've because I know there were people in there that would've gotten it. This one guy was talking about how if God was infinite but only knew things in our finite universe, he would not know himself (has its fallacies, I know) and then he was like, "Then, he would explode." Pretty sure that was a reference right there. This turned out a lot longer than I intended. I wonder if when my brother's away message says "Busy" with a little smiley wink face next to it ;) it means he is having sex with his girlfriend. Lisa

Dreamworld was effiin hardcore. "We are are no longer Inferno. We are hereby called Antigone." Quite the literary nerds they are. Dante to Sophocles in one move. Impressive. Josh and Chris, the two guys that Abby Fifer and I hung out with at the mall the other day were in it and then this other guy, Logan, that I know from school somewhere. Josh is hilarious. They were pretty good. The Cheese Song was the most deck song I have ever heard. Then Censored came on and I had seen them once before when they played after Nine Volt Nova (Ryan and Alex's band) and they were really good too. I knew Joe and Travis from that one, although I am not sure that Travis remembered hanging out with me homecoming night. I wouldn't blame him, I had trouble remembering who he was and he cracked me up that night. Chelsea showed up during Censored's set and we got to reminisce about old times and the talent show lol. She is like goth now, it is weird. But she is still cool. Er...deck. But ANYway. We went into the bathroom and wrote some dirty things on the wall, because like, it was already covered. I wrote urlLink Fifer . And then Abby did an SLC line and wheres my penis. It was pretty hilarious... Sooo after that we all went and were in the parking lot and Abby is all, "I LOVE EMO!! Everyone who loves Fallout boy RAISE YOUR HAND!" and it was funny cuz you know they are all punks, the kind that probably hate emo. lol. but that was funny too and then we had to leave and so me abby fifer chelsea and josh all had a group hug. that was pretty hardcore. Then we were leaving and Abby turned up the Baby I'm an Anarchist by Against Me! and Joe like ran over and near had an orgasm and told us all this story about how he boycotted Trees because his friend got beat up by some Nazis so he didn't get to go to the Antiflag/Against Me! show. and then he was all, "What school do you go to?" and she is all, "Summit!" and he was all, "Why didn't I meet you before I dropped out?!?!" "You did! You made out with my best friend!....and you offered me free sex!" That was definitely the most hardcore thing of the evening. Well, that and Travis leaving his ass print on the back of her car. That was effing hilarious. And deck. Grood. I mean good. I mean great. I mean great and good. Ok so we went home singing Baby I'm an Anarchist and that song is great by the way and in the car with Fifer and Abby I just felt infinite. Like I could do hardcore underground things like this my entire life and die happy. Hmm...Abby is borrowing my Letter 12 shirt because she has a class with Travis (different Travis). Hehe. Oh yeah, and we were our urlLink matching bowling jackets tonight. How deck is that. Oh and Fifer sucks because she had to brag to me about talking to a certain someone that I do not like anymore. Haha. "I heart you, James. Signed, someone who is not Jennifer Lemmers." We are sooo doing that. Ciao. Lisa

Prolly love actually or rotk…outside of theatre, fight club or american beauty…oh wait, how am I forgetting this? Moulin Rouge wins definitely. 31. I dress like myself…thrift storeish…I wear a lot of music shirts from concerts and such… 34. What kept you sane? Music. 35. Which celebrity/public figure did you fancy the most? Jonny depp was quite sexy in potc…mm but ewan singing in Moulin rouge…made me want him as well… 36. What political issue stirred you the most? I dunno…went to a few punk shows that bush bashed a lot…and in the heat of the moment that can stir you some I guess…but otherwise, I really don’t care all too much...well, ok, i guess the war thing did stir my emotions when it started...it made me sad and stuff 37. Ryan..LoL…no he was definitely not the best…I met a lot of ppl at tams…I guess it would have to be a three way tie between Rebecca, Laura, and the other Lisa 39. I think it is one of the weirdest things how you can go to sleep and then when you wake up you don't have any socks on. I mean really, socks are not easy things to take off when you are not trying to, but yet somehow, in the course of how I toss and turn at night, my socks come off, and my feet get cold. Well, I was ready for a long night at home without anything to do yesterday when around 9:00, Jennifer kidnapped me and forced me to go grocery shopping with her. The bet: She could buy a basket full of groceries for her mother for under $10. 20 boxes of Pasta Roni, 8 rolls of toilet paper, some paper towels, 14 things of yogurt, and $6.82 later, we were on our way out the door...well, except of course, for the whole having to see her darling Nick and talking to him for a while. She is quite proud of her shopping abilities. And I have to say, they are quite impressive sometimes :). We got back to her house, and she wanted me to to spend the night, so I aquiesced to her request, knowing, as I always do, what is in store for me whenever I spend the night at someone else's house. But oh well. It was three hours this time. Maybe longer, that is just when I stopped checking the clock. Three hours of laying in the silence and the dark, waiting to be able to sleep. My mind must have gone over every detail of my life in that three hours. It was crazy. I wonder if I will ever have normal sleeping hours. See this is why I will probably never get married. I would drive anyone crazy. Anyway So I come home to find that Matt has broken my toilet, stolen my Will Ferrell DVD, screwed up my internet connection even more (I am on Brian's computer now), and is now sleeping on the couch, preventing me from watching some early morning television, which I will remedy by playing some Final Fantasy X, because I have not gotten to play an RPG in a good while...like 7 months or so...and I never got to finish that game...but I really want to. Just one last thing though. The things my mind thinks about when I am waiting in the dark and silence for three hours until I finally fall asleep, they are not things that I would ever think about normally, and it scares me sometimes what I do think. Some people think that you get all crazy past 1 AM and so you start thinking and talking crazy-like. But what if you actually are thinking the clearest you've thought all day? What if those are the thoughts you are really having when all your guards are down and you are not worried about this thing they call "sanity." Hmm Lisa

Yesterday hung out with Jenn for a while, went back home, slept watching films on IFC that were in different languages, Olivia came to my house at around 7, and I went to Starbucks to talk with her and then she helped me pick out some make up at Wal Mart...then she had to go somewhere...then I went to Amy's to spend the night and hung out with her and Brett and Ryan and Craig for a long time...we played Scattegories...was very fun...I stayed up talking to Craig until like 4 in the morning. He gave me like his whole life story. All the different drugs he had done (everything I had ever heard of and then some)...which ones he had sold...how much money he had gotten from them...how many girls he had slept with...how incredibly screwed up everything had gotten and then how he had to go to prison...and how he is never going back. So he is not doing anything anymore. It was like hearing a real life version of Smack, the book Fifer gave me about the girl that gets tangled up in all the drugs and sex and all that...anyway, that is all. Survey time!!! Eyes Wide Shut, the first Stanley Kubrick movie I have ever seen, was freaking weird. I just finished watching it and it is crazy, and the ending, it just leaves you hanging with many unanswered questions, and I don't really see what the message the movie was trying to get across, if there was any. Umm...but it was extremely interesting. Lots of nudity, tho. Heh. So the last couple of days I have done much I suppose. Naomi and I reupholstered this couch for our room yestermorning and this morning. It was a lot of work, but it is definitely the coolest couch I have ever seen. Yesterday me and the Jenns went and played pool and then afterwards I dyed my hair this reddish auburnish color and it is really dry now and is not cooperating with anything I want it to do and I am not allowed to wash it for a couple more days so that it doesn't get dried out even more. But I like the color. Oh and yesterday I bought some bras and a shirt for really cheap so that was nice. And today I found a Ti-89 for $30 at a Pawn Shop, and they are usually $150 so that was very nice. I was excited. And I spent around $13 at Half Price Books and I got a lot of new stuff to read. Naomi and I were looking at Stephen King books and somehow struck up a conversation with some random guy about them. It was pretty cool. Oh, and then today when me and Fifer were at the mall waiting for Jenn and Nick to arrive, we went to the Calendar stand to chat with Abby, and I bought this Beatles Calendar for $4.50. It is pretty awesome if I do say so myself. I saw the Albert Einstein one later on and thought that I should have gotten that one, but eh, it was more expensive anyway. I felt sorry for Abby because her friends ditched her. She is awesome, so I dunno why they did. :) We are gonna have matching shirts and bowling jackets. Twill be awesome. I also saw Return of the King with Jenn, Fifer, and Nick. The movie was good, I actually cried a bit when Frodo was leaving with Gandalf. For kind of the same reason I cry when I watch Gladiator, but not really. It's the whole wanting to be back home thing but home just isn't the same..or nonexistent, because the journey or whatever has changed him so much...I mean, the situation in the two movies is entirely different, but there is just a feeling or a theme that is similar, I don't even know how to put into words what I am trying to say. Sometimes, I almost think Frodo should have died, but then I think that I wouldn't have liked that very much, although I would have cried a lot harder, that is for sure. Fo sho. I think that Aragorn and Frodo are definitely the sexiest characters. Aragorn would be my husband if I lived in Middle Earth. Liv Tyler can die for all I care. DIE! Ah ahahahahahahhaha. No not really, I am just kidding, I don't wish death upon Liv Tyler. Umm but anyway, and then Fifer came back to my house and we ate and watched SNL and it was cool and then that is when Eyes Wide Shut came on. Weird stuff that is. And why do both my mom and Fifer say I talk like a nerd? I don't mean to, it is just my way of talking. Is saying "We go back a week from thirty minutes from now." nerdy? Is "I am confident I could buy some shoelaces at Wal-Mart for cheaper." nerdy? I mean, really, I would like to know. TELL ME. Bye. Lisa

Everybody in the world decided to wake me up this morning before noon...hmm...Olivia came in from Daniel's at I don't even know when...and then she left...actually, I don't even know if she left right away, or how long she had been there...I guess that might have been around anywhere from 7 to 9...and so that woke me up, and then Nopei, Naomi's mom called at like 10:30 to tell me about a dinner party she was throwing that night that my family was invited to...and then I fell asleep after that...and then Jenn called at 11 and said she was gonna come pick me up and we were going to go shopping again...of course, I fell asleep after that too, because I didn't get to sleep until around 6:30, and I need at least 4 hours of good solid sleep especially since I never get sleep and oh I dunno cuz I wanted to sleep, and so I was awakened by her thirty minutes later when she came into my house and sat on me because I was on the couch. CDs I bought at Best Buy with Gift Certificates The Early November- The Room's Too Cold (came with DVD also) Bouncing Souls/AntiFlag split record Midtown- Living Well is the Best Revenge Punk Rock is your Friend (compilation Kung Fu Records) Woo! I've only gotten to listen to the early november one so far...and it was when I was feeling really sad because of this stupid thing that happened, but I guess it is ok now. So I spent the rest of my afternoon watching the marathon of Queer Eye For The Straight Guy and was really touched by some of the things the Fab 5 did for the straight guys. They gave Butch a chance for his art to be seen by art critics, they gave the vintage rock guy tickets to these events that had his favorite band playing there or something like that...they help them out in their lives as well as giving them a makeover, which can sometimes turn an average or ugly guy hot. Anyway, I went to Naomi's mom's dinner party later and then me and Naomi and Bethany and Jennifer and Nick all went to Ashley Arms' house and watched Dirty Dancing, and then just hung out there for a bit. Her house was freaking humungous and her neighborhood had a gate we had to go through with a code on it and stuff. Crazy rich Mansfield kids. Then we all went and ate at IHOP at midnight and Jared was our server and he is awesome. I don't think he ever knew last year that I had a crush on him, but oh well :)...so anyway, he was supposed to be off at 12, but he stayed so he could be our server and then he paid for all of the girls' meals...it was really sweet...like $23 out of his pocket...and he was super funny the whole time because Jenn and Nick brought the other Nick (heh) and Jared pretended to hit on him and it was hilarious...oh and then I leaned back in my chair to get the ketchup cuz Jenn had thrown it on the ground and I fell and everyone started laughing...that was funny. Afterwards, Naomi and I went back to her house and talked for a while with her mom and such. Her mom wants to teach me how to be rich. I think it is amusing. Hmm...so first day of year was cool I guess. I want to start watching Queer Eye a lot more. Lisa

My head is...aching... from laughing for like four hours straight. Aw man. Fifer and Abby never fail to make me laugh...and it is like...just amazing, the things we talk about...I think I am going to hell. tee hee. oh well. So yeah, earlier was....ok. Olivia is a great friend, so it was cool hanging out with her, but I had just imagined more people and stuff, and then we ended up just driving her friends around because they had been drinking and needed a ride so they wouldn't drink and drive and die. Then we went some places with them, and I saw some pretty crazy stuff...like people on some pretty hardcore stuff...but we didn't stay there for long. Then she dropped me off and it was like 1 and then I was talking to Fifer and then I went over there to hang with her and Abby in the after hours and wow I had so much fun, it was just unbelievable...I would put some of our jokes, but then people might think that I was like obsessed with sex, or completely stupid or something, and we all know that I am nothing of the sort! Hahaha...haha...ha... .... Um, so, this isn't what I imagined my new years eve to be like, but it was a good way to start out the year, with a lot of my closest friends. Especially since I went over to Amy's earlier in the day and played Risk and this other game with her and all the ppl that hang over there and then me and Jenn went to the mall and did some shopping, and that all was very deck and fun. So that is like, all of my closest friends. Except for like Naomi and Rebecca and JoAnn and Ashley...but eh, Jo and Ash had their own thing...and Naomi told me she wasn't having a party anymore (but ohhh she had something of the sort I hear :p I see how it is)...and Rebecca lives in Granbury. Sooooooooooo as you can see, it was not possible for me to see them today. Ok, well, I go now. Rest in peace. Lisa

So Mallory just came by...the issue of Three in Thirty was printed this weekend...much to the dismay of our admin, who got really bitchy about it all of a sudden because they want censorship or something...Mallory might be in a lot of trouble...maybe all of us (contributors) as well. But she said that she is fighting it tooth and nail and that Adam is right behind her. Adam is this guy that writes the most hilarious ed/ops for the paper and she says she wants to introduce us because she thinks I'll like him (not like that, mind you). The camping trip was pretty cool. The boy decided last minute not to go because he had to study for bio hardcore (the test is going to be very hard and he wasn't the only one who decided not to go...lots of ppl decided not to) so that was sad. We saw lots of bison and I wanted to cuddle with them but they told me I couldn't for some reason. The first night the sky was so clear and me and Kelli and Sarah and Tyler and Kyle all laid out under the stars and sometimes it would get so quiet and it was just awesome...That night we had our first toothbrush orgy. Haha. Well, actually, all we did was stand around a pump and brush our teeth together, but it was one of those things that makes you closer to people. We had a gay marriage discussion around the fire that night with the whole group and I told em what was up. Gay marriages are cool. That night a few of us also played Truth or Dare...hah. I picked truth three times and had to answer the questions, "Who do you like?" (2nd gradish, I know) "What is the craziest thing you've ever done?" and finally "Have you ever viewed pornography?" I'll let you try and figure out the questions to those answers on your own. Saturday we hiked for three effing hours and then that night we talked about a lot of issues including abortion...and I got to read the "ghost story with a hidden agenda" that I think the boy wrote...and it was deck and hilarious as ef. Then they all started telling ghost stories and that actually was really creepy. Had our toothbrush thing and went to bed, got up this morning and left. I got to be good friends with Kyle and Hudgens and Tyler this weekend. I was already good friends with Kelli and Sarah. I wish that a certain other person would have gone :P oh well. I hate sleeping when I go camping though. It is the most miserable experience ever. I am cold but sweaty, my back hurts, my hair gets plastered to my face and I just feel incredibly horrible when I wake up. I studied some today. And then I saw the boy...and the infatuation has gotten worse. He looks so sexy in glasses, he should wear them like every day. Mmm...he is so awesome. Ok, gonna stope talking about him now. Lisa

So I am so tired it's not even funny. There is so much to do, and so little time. I still have four chapters to read for the bio test and its a crapload of information. And the camping trip is from Friday to Sunday...mm stress. Heh. Today was good. I had classes in the morning and then after chem recitation, I went and ate lunch with the boy, and we had a really good conversation. We've gotten past the trivial flirting conversations and today had one about our life aspirations and our friends from home and our beliefs about certain things and such. It was really awesome. He wants to be a doctor and establish a Rock n Roll laundromat because "What do people want to do while they're waiting for their laundry? Rock out!" and it would include live bands and a dance floor and coffee ("And not the weak yuppie starbucks coffee...but some good stuff") and chairs for lounging...and I think he said something about putting a place to watch good indie films, but I don't remember. He talked about how he got into good music and his anti-racist views and such...he is a part of Anti Racist Action (I think it's called) and it sounded like some pretty hardcore stuff. And he talked about how his older brother is his archnemesis and a lot of stuff. I talked to him about how I don't really know what I want to do but I know I love to write. And he said that I love music so I could help him out with his laundromat. And I got to tell him about my divine albinism theory. Haha. He liked that one. And then around 6:00 I went with him to this World Religion Conference that they had in the lyceum and it was interesting at some points, and boring and repetitive at others. It was really cool hanging out with him. Also, Mallory came by today and talked to me about the article that I wrote for her yesterday and she said it was stylistically perfect and said she was going to give me the paper next year basically. It really meant a lot to me because she was like, "You really have an eye for journalism. Have you ever considered it?" and I was like, "Well, I was going to write for the newspaper had I stayed at high school." and she was like, "No, I mean as a career. I think you could make it." So that definitely made my day. We had a Dessert and Discourse on whether or not God exists tonight and that was mildly entertaining. I wish we could have just been let loose, but we had to go down and examine arguments and such. I'm done. He invited me to go study chem with him and I want to go, so maybe I will. Lisa

Ok, so, I went on a comtemplative walk last night, thinking mainly about two different things. 1) This whole thing with the boy...and trying to decide whether or not I understand why he likes me, or how long it will last before he realizes that I am not as cool as he thinks...and yes, I know ppl are all like, "But you are cool" but I just don't really see it, I guess...at least not cool in the way that guys like me...I dunno. I mean, I love this whole calling me everyday and asking me to go eat with him and smiling all the time in our conversations and just being...cool...but then the cynical side of me is just wondering how long it will take for it to end. I hope not any time soon. And 2) The whole religion thing. With Jennifer. She feels so betrayed now. I wonder how many people would feel betrayed if I told them what I believe now. A few of my close friends still don't know exactly what's been going on, and I think it is just because I didn't want to upset everyone, I didn't want to cause people to be "disappointed" in me which is the word everyone would use, I am sure. I didn't want to cause any controversy or problems with friendships, so I just kept quiet about it for the most part, except to the friends that I knew wouldn't care one way or the other. When I got up here, it was like I got to start out new, so no one had any expectations for me, so I just told people straight up exactly what I believe. Which definitely isn't what it used to be. I think I pretty much consider myself agnostic, if anything. I am very open-minded about everything, and I don't really believe in the bible anymore. I guess that is pretty much it. I told Jennifer that, in so many words, and she got really upset, and feels extremely betrayed and brokenhearted and sad and confused and disappointed...I guess I just don't see why it is such a big deal. It isn't like our friendship was based on religion. She said it was like if she had come out and said she was gay...but honestly, I wouldn't really care if she did that. Cuz I dunno...she is a really good friend though, so I hope we can get through whatever it is we're going through. So, anyway. This is the thing. I'm tired of dancing around the subject. There are only a couple of people that read this that will find this surprising or shocking, but there it is. Now, everyone get out your disappointment in the next few days so the next time I come in town, we can hang out and be good again. Lisa

Weekend was so deck. Friday night- Bouncing Souls, Hot Water Music, Longshot, and some other band...Bouncing Sould were frelling awesome. I lost my shoe, and found it at the end of the show...had to mosh with one shoe to the souls. They did a cover of Hey Ya. It was so awesome. Great show, great night. Saturday- Went out to eat with Abby and Fifer and my mom for my bday. Was very fun. I think we scared my mom. Abby: What would you not do for $10,000 but would for $one million? Mom: Go out to eat with yall again Tee hee...I guess we were being really...deck. And when I say deck I mean hyper and loud and funny. Haha. Then we picked up Jenn and went to Red Blood Club, one of the deckest places in Dallas...really nice set up...saw Stories of London and then Letter 12 and then Fourth Score and then Clover St. Letter 12 was amazing...Their music is what emotion would sound like, were it audible. Stories of London was good too. The lead singer was juicy. I got a shirt. Fourth Score didn't have any chemistry, and Clover St. had a bad night or something. They did not seem like they wanted to be there, and that just ruined the whole show. Oh well :P I still love them. Had a birthday bash (with my mom, Abby, and Jenn) at like 1:00 when we got back. I got this book about how to think like Albert Einstein and it is sooo a book about anarchy in disguise...it's all, "Break the rules, or fail." Tis great. Abby and Fifer got me a lot of really awesome things. Including fortune cookies that I did not suspect of being tampered with but that have fortunes like "You are uber deck." "You will get laid tonight." or my personal favorite, "Do drugs and have anonymous sex." I laughed so hard when I opened my first one to read "Wetting the bed does not make you a loser." Silly Abby... Sunday- Woke up, picked up Fifer ("FOB IS COMING!!!"), went to mall, bought some shoes and earrings, went back to Fifer's house for a CD Burning Extravanganza...ate with her and her parents...had a blast...went back to TAMS....played soccer game...won... Today- Ate lunch with boy again...:P Tee hee. He is funny. And then our wing and Elizabeth's wing played mud soccer...that was super ultra fun...and then the boy called me around 8:00 and asked me to go eat with him...so I did. :) and he is so cool. I think I like him more every time I hang out with him. Tee hee. Can't wait for the camping trip this weekend...Woo!!!!!!!! Lisssssssssaaaaaaaaaaa PS-Yay for squirrels. Queers are cool. Boys are deck (unless they are fin.)

So today was pretty cool. I uh...basically went to class, hung out with Betsy, hung out with Kenny (don't feel like detailing this one heh, as I just did in Fifer's email...ask me about it later) and that was all good and fun. Music is deck. I got this thing in my box and it was called, "Three in Thirty" (referring to the policy of having to get three quiet hour docs in thirty days to get any points): The TAMS Underground Revolution Issue 1. Some underground extremely opinionated newspaper type thing that Mallory Chesser started up and on the back it said, "Lisa, join the revolution. Scoop is poop." (Scoop is the name of the official TAMS newspaper). I thought it was really cool. The articles said things that we could never write in the real newspaper, and they only give it to cool, underground people. There were what I would consider editorials on a lot of different things, including politics and such. Some were downright hilarious. Anyway, Terra said that the reason I was invited to write for it is because Mallory had read my stuff in Scoop and thought it was the only good writing. I felt honored because Mallory is the TAMS kid that writes for NT Daily. Anyway. That was pretty cool. So is the boy though. Hehe. Hanging out with him was really really fun today. Lisa

I was busy once again today. But it was cool. First off, I tried the whole dying black streaks in my hair last night. It looks horrible. So I spent ten dollars this morning on some new red dye to try and cover up some of the black but it hardly worked so that was a waste of my money. I think I am gonna wait til this weekend until I have Jenn's help and then kill my hair some more and get rid of this hideous color. The red was so cool though. I will have to try and get the same color again. Hmm...ANYway. I think maybe I should do that Friday. Or Saturday. Haha. Whenever I get my cartilage pierced. I had classes and then BUGS, which was so effing boring because they wanted to talk to us about the science projects our mentees are doing but it just turned into an hour and a half long discussion about what was wrong with the BUGS program. God I wanted to fall asleep. It was soooooooooo boring. So I doodled. Hehe. I felt like a giddy school girl as I doodled his name and decorated it with stars and hearts. Heh. And then I wrote out a list of all the deck shows coming our way soon. I went to a Habitat meeting and then went back to my room. Anddd there was a message on our board that said for me to call the boy. But unfortunately it was time to go to chem lab, so I went. Mmmm...fortunately, he was there outside his classroom (cuz he has it at the same time as me, just different room) and so we got to talk. And...*sigh* talking to him just makes me smile. I forget what we talked about now. Just insignificant things, but it was great. He had just called earlier for our chem assignment, so I got to call him back later and give it to him. Hehe that was fun too. So then I had like ten million meetings to go to and such, including art club. I get to find a musical for us to go to. Then I played a two setter with Myra for wing olympics and won 6-2 6-1 (holla holla). Umm that is pretty much my day. Crazy, huh? So yeah. This infatuation thing is tough on my studying. I can't seem to really concentrate on things like bio or chem when I could be thinking of other certain things. He really does make me smile. Whenever I talk to him...or even think about him, actually. God, I sound like a dumb girl. Maybe I am a dumb girl. Oh well. Either way....I'ma gonna go now. And do my homework that I have neglected. Lisa

Me: "So are you guys going to eat now?" Him: "He (referring to Ryan) is. I just got done eating." Me: (disappointed) Oh. Him: "So, you must think I'm an ass now." Me: "Huh?" Him: "Cause of the dance and stuff." Me: "No. Not at all." (smiling ear to ear and blushing) Him: "That's good. Cause I was thinking that we should hang out, watch a movie sometime...cause you're really cool." Me: (eeking out the only word in my vocabulary at the moment and smiling even more and blushing even more) "Awesome." Him: "Yeah, it'd be awesome." Then, he had to leave, and I went with Sarah and Ryan to eat lunch and all is well with the world. And I am in yet another state of euphoria now. Am pretty convinced that I am not dreaming. I listened to all of my songs that are happy and pop punky and stuff. Everything I listen to that Fifer considers crap in other words :) because that music does have a place and time, tee hee. Tee hee hee. I can't stop smiling, guys. This is pretty damn awesome. Deck. And awesome. And then deck some more. This is so exciting. Lisa

Me: "I'm piercing my cartilage this weekend." Rebecca: "Your ear?" Me: "No, my spine." Today was fun. Last night I went to Kelli's for dinner with Hudgens, Naomi, Kelli, Vanessa, Sweeni, Chintan, and this other girl. Then we watched this movie, Party Monster, that had Seth Green and Macauly Culkin as bisexual "Club Kids" from New York city. Um...was interesting. Great fun was had at Kelli's house though. Today just consisted of sleeping, and eating, and shopping (I bought some hair dye...should be interesting...i want red with black streaks). Then we played our soccer game and that was fun and then I played a bit in the basketball game and sucked it up. But anyway. Still riding the high. I like the high. That in no way means that I like being high. I wouldn't really know. Hah. Anyway. Bye now. Lisa

I now know how Cloud felt when he said, "If this is all a dream, don't wake me up." If last night was a dream, I am so glad that no one woke me up. Things like this never happen to me. I am having trouble believing that it actually did. So...amazing. So I guess I should start from the beginning... Yesterday was perhaps one of the best days of the year. After the chem test, we came back here and I was getting really pissed at Naomi and Rebecca and them because they pretty much flat out told me that they did not want to hang out with me. So Sarah and I were just randomly walking around to different rooms, talking. Anyway, so we were sitting in my room, and Naomi came in and was like, "Hey! A concert is about to start at Bruce! Let's go!" and so I got my jacket and we left and then when we were about to walk down the stairs Naomi was all like, "Hey, who is in there?" and pointed to the TV room. So I turned around and... "Happy Birthday Lisa!!" with this huge cardboard sign with everyone's signature on it. There were so many people there, like almost all of my friends here. Laura, Kelli, Vanessa, Rebecca, Megan, Hanna, Terra, Tyler, Aaron, Hudgens, Jonathan, Osato, Kyle, Naomi, and Lisa and Gilda and soo many more. It was everyone that I love to death up here, minues a few that couldn't make it. They had ditched me all day today so that they could decorate and make me two cakes and stuff. It was so awesome. I can't express how happy it made me inside. Everyone had pitched in to get a really really nice hair straightner that takes about 5 minutes to straighten all my hair. It is so awesome. And Laura got me "Nothing Feels Good: Punk rock, teenagers, and emo." ("It reminded me of you!") and a $10 gift certificate to Barnes and Noble. Kelli made me a mix CD of some really awesome stuff and some candy. And everyone wrote me a little note on the big sign. The party itself lasted about an hour and we all just sat and talked...it was so deck. I started to get ready for the v day dinner after that because I had to be there by 5:30 to help set up. So I put on my waitressing outfit (some really deck pinstriped pants and a white shirt) and straightened my hair and got all my stuff together and helped Rebecca get ready and then we went to Clark, cause that is where it was. I helped blow up balloons and stuff. Anyway. Around 6:30, I was helping Naomi straighten her hair and I looked over and the boy was there, apparently dressed to be a waiter. He he. So I walked up to him and I was like, "Hey, you're waitressing tonight too?" and he was like, "Yes, I'm wait ress ing." and I was like, "Ohhh. Yeah. Heh. I meant waitering. I don't think you are a girl or anything." and he was all, "Thanks." Aw man, I felt kinda stupid, but its all good :). We had a little training session and I stole him some chocolate from the tables ("That was smooth.") and talked to him a bit more. Hmm...from 7 to 8 we were all waiter/ress ing and we had a couple of small conversations and Rebecca told him something about me running into walls, and it was funny. And I got to tell him about my birthday being the previous day and he told me happy belated birthday and it was just cool. Soooooooooo. Moving on. I wish I could fast forward this but I can't because I just can't. I ended up changing and eating with Naomi and Rebecca and Zahir and Kevin and Megan and Terra and Hanna. That was ok. And then after some pictures with Osato and Naomi and Rebecca and Vanessa, the dance part of the evening started. Hmmm. Hmm. Hmmmmmmmmmmm. How should I begin. I was sitting on the side, one of the few people. And so was he, a little bit in front of me, right. So, out of nowhere, he pulls his chair back and sits next to me and is all, "I'm gonna sit by you." and I was like, "That's cool." and wow he started analyzing everyone on the dance floor and making fun of them. Talked about middle and upper class suburban white kids listening to rap and how no one had any real rhythm and he would just be like, "Now, observe closely." and go into another analysis of people and he was so hilarious. All I could do was laugh. And then he asked me if I knew how to swing dance, and I said sort of and so he was like, "Ok, whenever a song comes on that we can swing dance to, you owe me a dance." and I said ok (of course). Soo...a couple of songs later, a song came on, and he grabbed my hand and pulled me out onto the dance floor. It was crazy and so fun. We were twirling and swingin and wow it was great. And then he danced with Naomi to the next song, and the song after that was another rap song, so I was sitting in the chair again and he came up to me and was just like, "So, you're just gonna sit on the sidelines?" and I was like, "I seriously can't dance to rap." and he was like, "Neither can I!" so he pulled me out there again and danced with me some more...but ok, it wasn't like rap dancing like you are thinking. He just mimicked other people by doing things that they were doing in really hilarious ways. He said he was just trying to be a big jackass. It was funny. He reminded me of on Clueless whenever Josh is dancing and he is absolutely horrible at it, but he has fun anyway. And the boy seriously did not care what he looked like, he was just having fun. It was so...awesome. One of the next songs was a slow dance, and so he overdramatically offered his hand and I took it and we started dancing, and then he was like, "Hey! It just started snowing!" and so we ran outside and he ran out onto the grass and started trying to catch the snowflakes with his tongue...:) and then he was all, "Come out here!" and I had to jump this rail and so I was like, "I have a dress on!" and he was just like, "No one's looking!" so I jumped the rail out onto the grass, and he was like, "So let's dance." and so there we were, outside, on the grass, under the falling snow, dancing to Monica (Brandy?)'s Angel of Mine. This is quite possibly a moment I will remember for the rest of my life. We looked up at the flakes falling across the light and he was just like, "It's pretty awesome, isn't it?" and I agreed...It was cold outside, but I don't think I felt a bit of it. At one point in the evening, another swing song came on, and I was trying to teach him the only move I know (the one that I practiced with Amy a lot) and I was just like, "Ok, all I know is the guy part, sooo you be the girl, and I'll be the guy." and he just laughed and said ok, so I taught him how to do it, and it is the one where you dip the person at the end, right? So anyway, we tried to learn it the correct way with him doing the guy part, and one time we got all the way through it and I leaned back to dip...and fell to the ground. lol. He was laughing and apologizing and he helped me up, and I was just like, "I think that's the part where you catch me." The night went on, and we danced a lot more, and then I danced with Osato some and the boy danced with a girl named Angela and I danced a lot with Naomi and Rebecca and Vanessa and Brian and Sal and such, but just like group dancing, it was really fun. At one point, we all got to do a line dance, and that was pretty fun. And I learned a lot of different dances to rap songs (I can see why people like to dance to those now.) I started dancing with the boy some more towards the end, and he took me up onto the part of Clark that is kinda elevated from the ground, and we danced up there by ourselves and then were joined by Naomi and Vanessa. There were balloons up there and him and I had a sort of fight and we threw balloons at each other and just...had fun. One of the last songs we danced to was a slow song, and I just loved dancing with him...it was just...it felt amazing I guess...I can't explain why... I had to leave kind of early because I had to help set up for the StuCo movie night, but the dance was so fun. He is such an amazing person. He is so spontaneous, and free, and he just doesn't care what people think of him. He does what he wants to. It's pretty awesome. :) :). I have been to a few dances here now and last night was the first time I actually danced. He got me to break out of this shell of mine where I am very self conscious when it comes to dancing. He made it so fun, and he didn't care that I sucked. And then the snow... that was just amazing to me. I came back here, and talked to a lot of people, including Ryan and Sarah, who went together tonight, and who, I think, are hooking up. A lot of people told me they loved my article in The Scoop about Dessert and Discourse, so I was happy about that. The movie night started at 1 and I was sitting with the other Lisa, but I couldn't stay awake, so I just went back to my room and fell asleep. Asleep, thinking about things, being completely happy. I woke up this morning with a blanket of white snow on the ground, and the flakes falling in sheets on the ground. Me and Rebecca got dressed and went outside to play with the other TAMS kids in the snow that was like 4 or 5 inches deep. We took an hour to make a ten foot tall snow man that was effing huge and then this asshole came and pummeled into it and I cussed him out, and then we played soccer in the snow, and then ate...and now I'm here. Things have been so eerily good lately, I wonder if this all really is a dream. Nothing like this ever happens to me. I don't know what to think, and right now I am just feeding off my emotions. I don't feel like going into overanalyzing logical mode right now. Right now I'm just feeling this euphoria, feeling this high, and I hope I don't come down for a long time. Something tells me that the high is always followed by the low, but right now, that isn't a reality for me. Right now is reality. Right now is forever. Tell me I am not sleeping, punch me in the face or something. Yesterday was Friday the 13th. I have decided that this does not necessarily bring bad luck, but maybe just weird occurences. Good weird occurences. He listens to ska. No one listens to ska anymore. But he does. Hmmm....whoa. Happy V Day everybody. Lisa

Birthdays rock, man. It all started around midnight last night (this morning) when Sarah and Christina and Katie all came into my room and were like, "Happy Birthday!" and Sarah gave me a card that was really awesome and I love her to death sometimes. We had a punk rock vs. rap conversation (me and Sarah representing the former, of course) and then I woke up this morning in a bad mood because I failed to wake up early and finish my cal hw :(. And when I say fake testicles I mean two ping pong balls in a stocking. LoL. It was realllly funny. Me and Naomi were partners and it was just like....awkward even though we are normally extremely comfortable with each other. Haha. Anyway. Then I changed and walked outside and Sarah and Craig were walking towards me!! I was like, "Heyyyyy!" and then we had a tearful reunion with hugs and laughter and all. Without the tears. ANd she gave me my bday present (a hug) and my v day present (it was awesome) and then we all went to the Olive Garden and ate and had a blast. Craig is so funny and Sarah is so awesome and we were listening to the awesome CD I burnt Sarah a long time ago and it was just....deck, man, it was deck. On their way out, Sarah dropped me and Vanessa off at the mall and we shopped for a couple of hours and I got a pair of shoes for the dance tomorrow, two pairs of jeans, and some panty hose. I know I splurged, but hey, it was my BIRTHDAY!!!!! and then we had difficulty getting back because the UNT buses werent running anymore so we had to use the city buses and that took a while and there was this old lady prostitute on one of the buses. Creepy. And then we went to Bruce to eat and met up with Naomi and Rebecca and then the boy walked in and so Naomi asked him to come sit with us and he had his cd player with him and I asked to see what was in it and it was Less Than Jake. Cool, cool, eh? I am interested to see what else he listens to. I would bet that it is some awesome stuff. And then we had an interesting convo about the fake testicle usage in our self defense class and everyone was laughing a lot. Twas great. We left and then hung out in my room for a while and then went to Dessert and Discourse, the one about love. It was really interesting, but I had to leave early because we had an indoor game at 10:00 and I scored a goal!!! And the game was really fun. And now I am back here, and I am about to have to start studying for bio. So many people wished me a happy birthday today. I love my friends. They are all so awesome. When I begin to lose faith in the human race, I just remind myself of all of them, and it is good! Also, Kelli and Vanessa are going to go to the Bouncing Souls concert with us, and they are both very hardcore people, so it will be fun fun fun. Wooooooooo. My dad is coming up on Saturday to eat dinner with me for my birthday. And tomorrow is the whole Valentine's Dinner/Dance and stuco movie night! Today was effing awesome. I love birthdays. I can see rated R movies now!!!! (Legally :) ) Lisa

Damn these crushes of mine and damn biology. I hate both with an equally fiery passion, and love only one with the same fiery passion. If that makes any sense. Which it probably doesn't. Cause I'm dumb. In fact, I am probably overreacting, but it's like, ok, now that I am not being a chickenshit, I am told that I was being overly outgoing, and that being myself made me look stupid. But then I think that yes, sometimes I am quite possibly the stupidest person I know. But I'm not...I just...seem that way...or get that way...especially when I am hyper or whatever. So yeah. I dunno. Life is so effing confusing. Pros? Maybe now we will all eat after English every Monday and Wednesday. Cons? I can't tell if he was being really serious about what Sarah thought he said. I guess I didn't include him and Ryan in the conversation enough, but it wasn't entirely my fault. I was the only one who freaking tried. And I guess I was acting a bit dumb, but that's me sometimes, you know? I think that the people that know me best know that I am an interesting combination of being simultaneously the stupidest and smartest person they know. And no, I am not saying that I am smart in any conceited sense of the word, since I did technically make a 58 on the bio test on Monday without the curve. I mean, 3/4 of the class did fail, but I was 2 points below average. Oh well. With the curve and the extra credit essay I wrote, it ended up being a 74. Translation: I have to make an average of a 95 on the next three bio tests to keep my 4.0. This is near impossible I do believe. Oh, and as of today I am officially failing bio lab! With a 55!! Woooooooooooooo! I am so freaking retarded sometimes. I have an A in everything else so far. It is just this damn biology. I hate it, I have no interest in it, and it is all just the rote memorization of the most random things in the world. Well, I didn't memorize random things but that was what our effing test was over, the random things. Gah. Things are just kinda pissing me off at the moment, but I am not in a pissed off mood. It kinda scares me how I really am not all too concerned about my failing grade and my C. I don't feel like studying at all. You know, Einstein failed out of his classes because he only studied the things that really interested him, and he just didn't do the stuff that he didn't feel like. I wish I could be like him. Of course, Einstein didn't go to TAMS, and he didn't have to go back to somewhere like Summit if he did fail out. Urg. I need a 4.0 for scholarships, but at the same time, there is no way in hell I am becoming one of those people who does nothing but study, which I think is what I will have to do to get an A in bio now. Hmm. Quite the conundrum. Anyway, I don't think there is much of anything else I can complain about. I have been so crazily busy the past couple of days. Last night I was auctioned off and I went for $9 which was good considering the average was about $11. Sal started the bidding, and then Brian bidded on me second, and then Osato finished it off with a whopping $9. I kept glancing at certain places in the room that certain person(s) were at but to no avail. Ohhh well! I totally talked to him today and I was being my normal crushy flirty transparent self, the same kind of self I was whenever I would go into the journalism room last year to get assignments. Heh. I crack myself up. He helped our English prof remember the name of this one indie film today, and he said a few, and I realized how incredibly awesome his taste in the arts has got to be. He said something about pop culture at one point, and it was kinda cynical sounding. And then he compared a part of The Invisible Man to socialism, and it was great. He is rocking awesome. But I hate having a crush. It sucks much. Much indeed, yes. Jenn came today and I only got to spend an hour with her, but it was mui cool, oui. Tres tres excellente. Woo woo. Fifer, I gave her something to give to you, keep reminding her about it. Lisa

This week is going to be crazy mad busy but also fun.....Oh and also today these squirrels tried to attack me and it was really scary. Squirrels are evil. Date Auction Questionnaire 1) What would your Dream Date be like? Going to a show at some obscure indie/punk club sometime in November and then driving down to the harbour to eat Wendy’s food and discuss life, politics, love, and music while listening to Bright Eyes or Something Corporate and looking at the stars and feeling infinite. 2) What do you look for in a boyfriend? Topher Grace meets Justin Pierre meets Albert Einstein meets Tyler Durden meets Andrew McMahon meets Ewan McGregor meets Ricky Fitts meets Richard Rahl meets Will Ferrell meets Halston Beggs. 3) What would you do with $1 million dollars? Put myself through school, help out my parents, travel everywhere, buy lots of CDs, buy an ibook, and buy lots of really awesome sweaters and shoes and jeans and go to lots of shows. And buy a car. 4) What is your favorite ice cream? Banana Crème Pie 5) What is the song that best represents your life? The Future Freaks Me Out by Motion City Soundtrack 6) Do you have any words that you live your life by? Or a quote that you like? It’s only after you’ve lost everything that you’re free to do anything. Today I went to West Village with a bunch of people but it was just me and Naomi that hung out together the whole time. We went around to all the shops, it was pretty cool but soooo expensive. When I get rich, I want to buy some things at Paul Frank because they have random stuff and they were playing The Postal Service...Lucky Brand jeans are really expensive but they have a cute style so maybe there too. The guy that was working there was so hipsterish, he had the big sunglasses and everything. We ate at this place called Tom Tom Noodle House and it had such a cool atmosphere, and then we got ice cream at this place next to The Magnolia and they had Italian homemade ice cream. It...was....soo...exquistite. And they played Italian opera the whole time and it was so cool. The icecream was so good, I just cannot even convey the tastiness. I haven't read 53 or 54 yet. No sleeping for me tonight! Lisa
