Ok...my college searching skills have led me to my 6 Top Choices as of right now (subject to change, of course.) 1) Boston University (well, you knew this one was coming) 2) Columbia 3) Amherst College (very selective MA school...a good distance from Boston though) 4) University of Rochester (upstate New York...get this: Students there get to use Napster for free as a result of an agreement between the university and the music companies and tomorrow Mitch Hedburg is going to be performing there and all undergraduate students get in for free...how deck is that?) 5) George Washington University (my least likely out of the 6 colleges, but still would be very cool to go to) 6) Harvard (well, I have to have one big name college...) Yes, yes, there it is...my backup school? I am thinking Florida Tech. Not because I want to go there but because it is a pretty good school and Betsy said I could get nearly a full ride. I guess I should apply to UT in case all other options fail or if nothing else is financially possible, but Rebecca keeps telling me that my National Meritness (that I will probably, but not for sure, get) will get me lots of money. I sure hope so. Also, I was looking at a list of Boston venues and shows today and have decided that it is a happening music place. Apparently, the Dropkick Murphys hail from Boston. And... 2/07/04 Motion City Soundtrack/MxPx/Sugarcult/Simple Plan (Avalon) 2/29/04 Fall Out Boy/Matchbook Romance/Dynamite Boy (The Axis) Neither of the tours will be coming to Dallas...or Texas at all, for that matter. Ha. I changed up the order of the bands as listed also, putting the bands I would be most excited about seeing first. Speaking of Matchbook Romance, I burned them from Steve, and they are absolutely amazing. Dynamite Boy is another one I got from him and they are awesome as well. Hmm...I wish I could go see them all play with FOB. That would be deck as ef. The deckest of all deck. And to see it in Boston...well...it'd be amazing. They play all up and down the east coast, like most bands, which is one of the reasons I think it will be really cool living up there. The music scene. *Sigh* well. I think that is all. Oh yeah, I think I muffed up my Cal test today. Oh well. -Lisa "I mean, roses only last like a couple weeks, and that's if you leave them in water, and they really only exist to be pretty. So that's like saying, "My love for you is transitory and based solely on your appearance". But a potato! Potatoes last for fucking ever, man. In fact, not only will they not rot, they actually grow shit even if you just leave them in the sack, that part alone is rockin' awesome and makes it a good symbol. But there's more! There are so many ways to enjoy a potato! You can even make a battery with it! That's like saying "I have many ways in which I show my love for you". Potatoes may be ugly, but they're still awesome. It's like saying "It doesn't matter at all what you look like, I'll still love you" " -Stephanie Hsu's profy

Highlights of Day: In gov't, our prof totally drew parallels between the Seattle WTO riots and the Boston Tea Party. I almost died laughing on the inside from the irony. Me and Fifer are hardcore. Even if we are living on two separate coasts one day, the spirit will be the same. People are really stupid though. I was one of the few that said it was alright to break laws as a form of protest and lots of people said that it was wrong to ever break laws to protest something unjust and our prof was just like, "So you are all saying that it was wrong for the Civil Rights movement to take place?" I think people realized their error in thinking after that. I even went as far to say that breaking windows (or throwing tea bags off the side of a boat) was ok in certain situations, but I also think that first people should try everything in their power to peacefully protest whatever it is they are protesting...but ANYway. After English I sat with the boy and his friend. It took a lot of guts. I was at the Salad Bar and was thinking to myself, well, this is it. Adhere to the pact or remain afraid your entire life? So I was just like, "Can I sit here?" and he was all, "Of course....not." but he was kidding, and I sat, and at first it was one of those awkward silences where no one really had anything to say, but we got to talking about stuff, and I dunno...he has some interesting points, and he is a cool person, but I haven't decided yet whether or not he is Lisa-liking material. I went and put my tray up and came back and heard the last part of something he was saying to Ryan (his friend....and no, I am not going to say what I am thinking) and it was something like..."...move to Boston!" Now, earlier, in English, we did the game thing where everyone says their name and what they want to do when they grow up and not everyone says a job or whatever so Laura was like I wanna be tall and I was like, "I'm Lisa and I....want to move to Boston." Now, granted, it isn't the most interesting thing I could have said, but I honestly didn't want to go through the long list of careers I am considering and that is really the only thing for sure I really know I want to do. Everyone had to go around and say everyone before them so everyone had to say it and anyways, back to what I was saying...when I walked up behind him, he was obviously quoting me or something...it could have been making fun of me, although I doubt it, and it was probably just him saying something humorous about what I said...I dunno but I was just like, "What did you say?" not really mad or threatening but kind of firm I guess in that you could tell I wasn't just going to sit back and pretend I didn't hear anything and so Ryan was like, "Er...nothing, Boston is a cool city." and since I didn't want to press it any further I agreed and proceeded to talk about how the east coast is the coolest place in America even though I have not been farther than Arkansas and the boy said he hadn't either but I am pretty sure he also said something about preferring the west coast. Hmm...And then I said I would see them later. Wow. Rest of my day was spent hanging out with people and going to seminar and selling yearbooks and Steve gave me his music collection of 83 CDs although I have to say, even though mine is smaller by about 10 CDs mine definitely wins in the quality of music department. He has really cool music and then Blink and Sum and Green Day, which aren't all bad...but, he also had a copy of Lavigne...now, he said he realized his mistake after getting it but then...why leave it with the rest of your CDs?? Well, anyway, I have got to go work out now. Ciao amigos. Lisa

You know, I have been thinking...well, mostly, I have been sleeping, but I had some dreams. As much as I love everybody up here, I think that sometimes, I forget to remember the people I knew before I came up here. It's easy to just get caught up in how busy you get, and how many interesting people you live with, and everything that goes on, but it is difficult to set apart time for your friends at home like you used to do. And before you know it, you haven't talked to a majority of them in over a month, you have no idea what is going on in their lives, and they are a little upset with you for it. I'm not saying that the person that sent me the email I received earlier this week from someone I never thought would try to hurt my feelings was justified in some of the things she said, but I am saying that maybe to some degree, I am guilty of neglecting people. I guess I am also saying that when you cut yourself off from a certain belief or affiliation, sometimes you do it so drastically that you unwittingly cut yourself off from the friends and acquaintances you made because of that certain belief or affiliation. And that is wrong to do. I should really just start over from the beginning, go back to my roots, and remember why I love the people I used to be best friends with. If not, then I'd be forgetting and throwing away my past, which isn't healthy, moral, or something that I want to do. Because I do still want to be close to everybody. I think that maybe I just don't know how. I have some phone calls to make tomorrow. Lisa

Prom was interesting. Naomi and Rebecca did my hair really nifty-like. It was all up in "pinwheels" and it had flowers in it and stuff...we (me, Naomi, Rebecca, Chris, Osato, and Mordechai) left around 6:30 but the place we were going to go eat at did not take reservations and so we had to wait an hour and 20 minutes to eat. But it was ok because we all went to Addison Circle to take pictures. We took like a million pictures or something crazy like that. The place we ate was really deck. The guy that cooked in front of us was all like, "This is Japanese kethchup...this is Japanses broccolli...this is Japanese cholesterol...oops, that was Japanese mistake." He flipped over my rice bowl without any of the rice falling out and he made this huge flame come off of the top of the table. Oh, anddddd I learned how to use chopsticks...kindof. But I can definitely almost use them efficiently now. I had a lot of fun there though. It got really interesting after that, because Rebecca's car wouldn't start and it was only a couple of hours until prom ended. So around 10:40 we decided to leave her car in Dallas and all squeeze into Mordechai's car, heh. Mordechai drove like 90 to get there because Dallas is a good 40 minute drive from Denton and we got there at around 15 after...but we didn't get into prom until around 11:30, so we basically spent about $1 per minute we were there. But it was cool. I danced with Lisa and Laura and Aaron and Tyler to a couple of songs, and they are fun people they are. I danced with Chris the second to last song and the last song was extremely ironic, in a very nostalgic sense of the word. After taking more pictures, we left and had a good half hour to change and get ready for AfterProm, which was pretty awesome. Four hours of free go karts, mini golf, arcade games, and our very own casino, with silent auctions that we used the gambling chips to bid on. Oh, and there was free food, of course. I spent the evening with a variety of people. Kelli, Vanessa, Sarah, Sweeny...yeah. Good times. I didn't get to sleep until around 7:00 and I slept until 2:30. I played a soccer game and a softball game and then me and Rebecca and Naomi and Sarah all ordered pizza. yum. I was supposed to do a lot of things today, but I didn't, as usual. I really wish that I was interested in more of my classes. More than just...one. Or two, maybe. I was thinking today about how close I am with a lot of the Junior class and how by the end of next year, if we are all even closer than we are right now, graduating is going to be so sad. Anyway, Rebecca is brushing her teeth now, and I need to get off of her computer. I have some phone calls to make tomorrow and some homework to do and...other stuff. Lisa "Looking back on the memory of the dance we shared beneath the stars above." -last song at prom (Garth Brooks, The Dance) Ironic, ne?

Listening to: Vapour Trail by Ride I am feeling considerably better. In retrospect, I shouldn't have been so upset in the first place. Boys will be boys, unfortunate as that may seem sometimes. Rebecca was talking to me earlier and said something to the effect of, "There are six billion people in the world. You are supposed to marry one of them. One out of six billion. So what is the point of being upset over this one boy?" This is, of course, assuming that I get married. Human emotion amazes me sometimes. Even within myself, I like to observe it, analyze it, know exactly what it is I am feeling and why I am feeling it. I am not sure if this takes the point out of feeling, but I don't think it does. I suppose I can't say that I am completely over this, but at least I am lying to myself already to convince myself that I am. I had this conversation with Lisa over lunch about my turning away from religion and her turning towards it. She is one of the only people I know that can talk to me about her Christian beliefs without seeming like she is trying to "witness" to me or impose her beliefs on me. I really respect her a lot, and it is people like her that remind me that religion is not bad. I am going now I think. Lisa

Well, it's later. And I am writing more. It's funny how when you think you have something figured out, you really don't. And you find out things that people should have just told you from the beginning because now you feel incredibly dumb...and stuff. Anyway. I found it amusing how Schaake tried to embarrass me in front of the class today. She's so dumb. English was alright. Lunch was cool. I suppose. Bio Lab...well, I'm glad he told me but then not. You know? So our prom group has changed a bit. Now it's Hudgens, Mordechai, and Osato with me and Naomi and Rebecca. It will be a very interesting night I am sure. Ciao amigo/as Lisa
Just kill me now. I hate emotions. *sigh* I'll write more later.

American History X is an amazing movie. I mean, there are few movies that just leave me...in awe at the end. Definitely goes in the top five. Uh oh. There are six movies in the top five now. Maybe I will have to change it to a top six. Anyways. My new Against Me! CD is really good. I was listening to it a lot today. It's like...Reinventing Axl Rose is the big party and ...As the Eternal Cowboy is the hangover the next morning, when reality comes rushing back at you and it is definitely not too pleasant. But it is really, really good. I answered the phone today. We're just friends, most def. Is good though. A friendship out of an I-can't-speak-to-you-in-a-coherent-manner crush (before I got to know him) is better than nothing by far. Vanessa told her brother I thought he was hot and gave him my sn. Weird times in McConnell Hall. He wants to meet me now. Heh. Life is weird. Lisa
According to the urlLink Which Something Corporate Song Are You? Test... Yeah...

I love Austin and I love free shows and I love Andrew (and he loves me!). And Justin. And Jesse. And all of MCS and Ludo and Against Me! and I love Ted Leo and those crazy pharmacists of his and I love The (International) Noise Conspiracy and I love Lucero and I love Melee and hell, I love Sparta and Don't Look Down too. I love DV8 and Feable Weiner and Bowling For Soup (especially when intoxicated). I love Ben and I love Willie and I love Abby and I love Fifer and I love music!!! I am so full of love right now, and Fall Out Boy is for lovers. So it is for me!! SxSw rocked the casbah and then some. I couldn't recap the past couple days if I wanted to. So many quotable quotes and laughable jokes and laughable nonjokes and singable songs and moshable bands (although I did not even mosh). You can read our urlLink travel journal here (coutesy of Fifer's xanga :p), because I don't feel like pasting the whole thing and stuff but it gives you a good idea of the crazy fun that was had. But it has ended...and I am back here, at TAMS. Did my calculus homework (joy) and learned about Naomi's mischievous break and went and ate Chinese with Rebecca and her. That is about it. Got to talk to Katie about our mutual love for Ed Norton, and she is going to watch American History X with me sometime soon and then we are going to rent the two of his movies that we haven't seen and watch them together. Fun stuff, eh? The next few weeks are going to just pale in comparison to Austin, guys. Lisa

If you're listening whoaaaaaaaaa Just listening to a little Jimmy Eat World...good stuff, man. So we are leaving in approximately 7 hours and I am not packed yet. My clothes aren't even done drying. But it's ok because I live life on the edge...woo. So, what will these two days bring? Life changing decisions? 48 hours of musical bliss? Two days of unadulterated fun? Nothing? I know not, but I suppose I will find out soon enough. I'm listening to a lot of poppy upbeat stuff right now to just keep reminding me of the fun-filled weekend I am going to have. I am seriously full of excitement. Maybe I shouldn't be building this up so much, I should expect it to suck so that it is that much better. Ohhhh well. Anticipation is 90% of the fun. That's why people like foreplay so much I think. Lmao...I'm such a nympho. I went and bought junk food for the trip with Fifer a while ago. She doesn't like those Danish butter cookies that you buy in the little can...psh, what a weirdo. So, anyway, I don't know what to do with myself these next 7 hours...I guess just listen to more music, and pack my stuff maybe, and watch some late night TV...maybe I'll even get a couple of hours of sleep. Cha. Wow, it's been forever since I've listened to this song. I guess I could keep typing and take you through my day which included helping Rebecca find a prom dress (which I was successful at) and then coming home to find that my brothers had locked me out and then having to get the neighborhood boys to climb onto my mom's balcony to let me in...but I don't want to borrreeeee you. Oh, oh, this song is so old. aAhahahahahahahahaa. I'm not sick but I'm not well .....hah. This weekend is gonna rock much. See you all in three days! Leesah PS- Since I will not be here Saturday, I would just like to say that Saturday is the 13-month anniversary of my blog. I forgot to have a birthday celebration in February sooo 13-month anniversary it is.

Mint Chocolate Chip ice cream used to be my favorite kind of ice cream but I think I have moved on to a new stage in my life. My new favorite kind is officially Banana Pudding...or Banana Creme Pie (@ Beth Marie's). I think maybe this marks the beginning of a new me. The Modest Mouse show was...alright. The first band was kinda...oh alright, they just sucked. Hard. LoL. Or at least I thought so. The second band was alright and Modest Mouse was good, but I just wasn't getting into it. So we left. After the second song. :) But it was alright cuz we got home at like 11:40 anyway and Fifer's curfew was 12. We have now been to all of the major underground scenes (I use the word "underground" lightly...very lightly)...emo, punk, indie...woo! And they really are different. For instance, the emo combover count was only at like 5 before the guy from Josh Hendrick's band sat by us. He had like three combovers on one head so then the count went to 8. Sooo this definitely was not an emo crowd. But they were still mui amusing. No moshpitting...no "Fuck Bush!" speeches...no talking to the crowd at all for that matter...I think I like the former two scenes better. Anyway. Went to 303 Mall today. With Jenn. Interesting. It's funny how...you change...and then other people don't...or maybe they have...and it is just in an opposite direction of the way you changed...and I dunno. Am contemplating. Had sausage for dinner with sourkraut (sp?) and cheese bread and corn. That was a pretty deck dinner. Oh, and then I had some Banana Pudding ice cream. Yumm...I think I had better go get me some more. Less than 48 hours until I'll be in Austin!! Lisa

So I get more and more excited about Austin every day. We're not leaving til 6:00 Friday morning, but that doesn't matter much I don't think. Friday all day is the AMP showcase with MCS and so many other deck bands and then that night is the Rock Against Bush punk show which is gonna be sos sososososososos uber deck (NOFX, Alkaline Trio, Against Me!) and then Saturday all day is the Take Action Tour with three stages and a lot of bands...awesome ones at that...I just can't even think of them all right now...Ted Leo for one... Oh...AND tomorrow night Abby won me and Fifer tickets to see Modest Mouse in Ft. Worth. Fun stuff, eh? Anyway so hanging out with my family is cool. Last night I went and ate at Outback Steak House with Matt and Brian and my mom. And they are so quirky. I love my family. Then me and Matt and Brian went to play tennis...well, I watched them suck it up anyway. Today I was doing nothing when Fifer kidnapped me and we went and sold books to Half Price. She got $25 and I only got $5 but it was ok. With our newfound fortunes, we went to Collin Park Thrift and she got a couple of things, but I didn't. Then we went to CD Warehouse and I got last year's Take Action Tour compilation for $4. We listened to that on our way to TCC because I wanted to get information about summer classes, but they don't have any yet. We parted ways a little bit after that and I've just been chilling with my family since then because Jason and Morgan just got in tonight. It's been a while since my three brothers and I have all been together...Christmas I think was the last time. I had three tacos and some Mexican rice tonight. Now I am craving some ice cream. I think I will go get some. Hm. Yes, I shall. Ciao. Lisa

I'm at Fifer's. Last night and yesterday were interesting. Our bowling escapade with Harry Potter who didn't look like Potter without his glasses and Penguin Boy was mui interesting. And I got a strike!! And there was this game that was uber exciting. And then there were hotdogs that were..uh...anyway... And then I ate some more food at Fifer's and Abby came and we went to pick up Jenn but she wasn't there so we went to feed the horses at Abby's house and then we were leaving to go see a movie and the cops pulled us over and Abby was saying how her brother might have had some "paraphernalia" in her trunk so that was interesting. So she got a ticket for running the stop sign (Take THAT corporate America) and then we went to Irving but all the good movies were playing too late and so we left and drove around aimlessly listening to TBS. Good times, good times... Then we ate and laughed and Abby is a pig and then we were in those states of barely awake cuz we're so tired and I don't even remember what we talked about then. Me and Abby slept on the floor together and I woke up when Frankie molested me at like 10. Fifer's mom cooked bacon and there was toast and apple cinnamon bread. Good stuff. I eat so much when I am at home. Literate and stylish; kissable and quiet... Seems to be Abby's lyric of the past couple days...it's a good lyric... -Squishy (lmao...)

There's something about stepping into my house after a long three weeks of living at McConnell that just puts things in perspective for me. It's empty and the sunlight is falling on the carpet in little stripes from the blinds, I hear Oreo barking from upstairs, and I just remember all of a sudden how incredibly relaxing being home is for me. I don't have to think about bio lab midterms that I have failed, or admin reading my article that sounds like I hate TAMS now that Mallory edited it...I don't even have to worry about a certain boy that I still have feelings for even though I am fairly sure the feeling is not mutual. I am just here, in this place that seems to be eternally laid back and relaxing....definitely not what it was when I lived here last year, but realities change when people and times change. And so I sit back and Fifer IMs me and there are plans to be made with people I haven't gotten to see in forever, and a stack of college mail waiting for me on the table, like...they were just waiting for me to be home. I suppose back when I was younger I never really understood the emphasis that people placed on home. In movies, and music, and in general...but I think now I do. And now I think I'll go out and be crazy and enjoy my evening. Spring Break, here I come. (Yes, I know I am lame.) Edit: I wrote this a while later, but I didn't feel like making a new post. It's funny how songs can bring you back to your past. Am feeling nostalgic. No one will guess why or about what. But man, it's like the feelings were there yesterday. Things change in two years...I am over it, but then songs like this play and it's just like...I dunno what. Music is some powerful stuff. I saw Amelie and Memento tonight. Amelie is my hero. Seriously. And Memento was so incredibly interesting. Like a cinematic puzzle mystery. And the end was pretty mind boggling. That is all. Lisa

Conflicting emotions. That is the general theme of today. Eek. I am really excited about heading up Scoop next year. We had our first meeting today and it will be the coolest thing in the world to have this paper and have the ability to shape it into what it will become...I dunno...it is like...art, the only kind I am good at. It will be interesting working with Norton next year. He is an interesting guy and he has lots of good ideas I think. So I have this chem test tomorrow that I don't really know how to do at all...hrm. I should work on this. But I really don't care that much. I just want 1:30 tomorrow to come so Naomi's mom can pick us up and we can be on our way home for SPRING BREAK!! My schedule is filling up pretty quickly. Saturday I am gonna go bowling and laser tagging with Pittman and Potter (Jared and Thomas) and Fifer and maybe Jenn or Abby and then that night we are camping out at Abby's and riding horses/cooking s'mores/singing Against Me! around the camp fire. Mmm...good times. And Monday or Sunday we are gonna have a poker night it has been decided. I'm sure the rest of the time we will be filled with hanging out with other people...like Jenn and Amy and Jo and Ashley perhaps...maybe Olivia, if I can get a hold of her. And then Thursday I leave for SxSw!!! Where was I? Oh yes. Plans for prom. I don't know what will be going down. Maybe a group date with me and Naomi and Rebecca with Kevin, Zahir, and Hudgens. But that is not in stone. It would be fun, though. Well, I think it is official now cuz Naomi just called Hudgens sooo there it is. That will be an extremely interesting night. Oh yeah, and at the World Religions Panel tonight the Jewish guy had the most awesome answers ever. The atheist was pretty cool too. Oh, and the Hindu guy, he was awesome. "Imagine we were all sitting around a campfire..." -Dr. Watt (Jewish guy) Tee hee. Ok, going now. Lisa

I found this in a random blog today: "There are moments between people when something happens. Something non-physical, non-verbal, inexplicable--mystical. It often doesn't make sense within the normal parameters of what usually contributes to the development of such a relational connection, key factors being time and shared experience. I'm not writing about love at first sight, or even romance for that matter. It certainly can be romantic, but the connection I'm referring to can also be purely platonic. I usually find this connectivity in making eye contact with others, but it doesn't happen with everyone. There is something I cannot deny in the eyes of some strangers, in some of my acquaintances that draws me to them, that evokes greater compassion, desire to relate. It is an unspoken kinship that often never becomes fully actualized. Somehow the experiences of these people, their thoughts, dreams, and fears, resonate deeply within me like monsoon thunder in July. I know this, whatever it is, when I see it. I am always thankful to find it. And when I do, I find my mind more at peace, my heart more fully beating." Oh, how I love when people put into words things that I have only thought that I imagined. So I am fairly sure that me and the boy will just remain friends. He doesn't seem like he is going to make a move, and perhaps we would just be better as friends anyway. He's a cool guy, and trying to be more than friends at TAMS is difficult. I would hate to have one of those sour friendships if we tried anything and it didn't work out. I am somewhat disappointed, but I think that being friends is a great consolation, and probably all I am really ready for at the moment. Tee hee. sxsw is gonna be so deck. I am glad I know what it is called now. Betsy was sad cuz she doesn't get to go. Austin is the place to be Spring Break apparently. Woo. Can't wait! Lisa

I glanced at myself in the mirror today and thought that I was someone else that looked like an ostrich. It was an extremely weird out-of-body experience. I think that a 4.0 in damage is sounding really appealing right now. I don't feel like going to school anymore. I could be like Mike. But then I'd have to go into Botany. But SOMEONE has to fight for em. ::hits fist on IHOP table:: Hmm... La de da de da. So I was talking to Hudgens today and I have decided that obviously we should all marry strangers and just stare at them all day and never get to know them because once you get to know them they'll never attain the level of perfection they had in your mind before you knew them. Actually knowing them ruins it all! I don't really believe that, btw. I just thought it was an interesting conversation. I'm a hopeless romantic...and you're just HOPELESS!!! (Bouncing Souls rock my face) Lisa

As much as I love irony, sometimes I don't. In other news, I am super excited about Spring Break. Just Abby, Fifer, (maybe Jenn?), and I and the open road...and Austin...and Motion City Soundtrack...and Against Me!....and it is going to be soooo awesome. I can't wait. I just have to get through one more week of these tests and this homework and then I am free! Today I had to work sonic for After Prom and then I just did homework/screwed around until our soccer game, which we lost, but it was alright. Vanessa and I got to play a scrimage with some random girls afterwards and it was a really fun game. So, uh...things are interesting. I was talking to Amy on the phone the other day and comtemplating how different of a person I am now, and how I have changed and such...it amazes me every time I think about it. Sooo....Irony. How uninteresting life would be without it. Wow. Ok, I must be going. Mmm... Today I woke up, and ate, and essentially did nothing. I watched Clueless with Sarah and Betsy and argued with them about whether or not it was gross for Cher and Josh to get together, and then I played tennis with Betsy for a while. My whole plan was to call the boy and hang out with him, and so I did and then he wasn't there but he called me back and apparently he had already called me and then he said something about hanging out tomorrow and so I went and got ice cream with Betsy and Aubri and I was all, "Ok, I am gonna call him back and be like TONIGHT." so I called him when I got back and apparently he had called me while I was away and so he was like, "I was thinking we should hang out tonight." and so we decided on watching a movie. I went up to his room for a bit to pick out a movie and then watched him play Megaman on Nintendo for a while. Then we watched Dogma, and it was a really good movie. Well, visitation ended at 10 so he had to leave then. I don't know why we didn't just go do something else...I'll have to think about saying that next time. Naomi and Rebecca got back a little while after that and we went and got Jack-in-the box but the doors were closed so we had to go through the drive thru on foot and that was fun. Then I played Rebecca on DDR at the Lan Party. Holla holla. Lisa PS- (I really, really like him)

So today was considerably better :). I got to sleep for ten hours last night, and I decided to not worry about my bio grades so much, cuz there is still hope. And then Matt (my brother) and I went to eat around noon and I got to borrow some DVDs from him. Then I went to chem recitation, and left early, and as I was walking out, the boy was walking in and it was raining really hard so he gave me his raincoat and said I had to bring it back for him after recitation so I was going to but then we had a tornado alarm right when I was supposed to bring it back to him so I felt bad and called him afterwards but he didn't really care and then he was like, "You wanna go run outside in the rain with me?" so I was like...uhhh...sure. Anyway. It stopped raining, but me and him and Kyle and Nic and Angela all went outside and played some soccer in the mud. Twas really fun. ::Remembers moments:: *Sigh* So I forget what I did the rest of the day. I went to the Dessert and Discourse for a while. It was ok. Then we played our soccer game and I scored a goal and we won, and after curfew I went and watched a movie with Kelli and Vanessa and Sarah. The Boondock Saints. It was a very good movie, and interesting...and such. The Irish boys were hot too, which was most def. a bonus. Anyway, I must go to sleep now. Peace out yo. Lisa

So I'm pretty sure Kyle didn't adhere to the "whatever is said in the circle stays in the circle." Cuz I've definitely been getting some different vibes last night/this morning. Hmmm...oh well. :P I guess it doesn't matter. So, today I had the closest thing to a mental breakdown I've had in a long time. Maybe it was because I haven't slept in about 36 hours or perhaps it is because of this weather or maybe it was because of my tests...or maybe it was a combination of all three. I didn't sleep last night because I was studying so much for our dumb biology exam. And from 3-6 I had to do my bio lab notebook because that midterm was today as well. Well. So much for studying and sleeping unhealthily too little. I've only slept like...5 hours this week. Hm. Most def. not a good thing. I got a C on my bio test and I am fairly sure I failed my bio lab exam. Oh, AND she tells us well you can turn in your notebooks next week instead of today. Well, gee, thanks for effing telling me NOW when I could have gotten three more hours of biology studying in last night. So I was sick and tired and in a bad mood all day and then I got out of bio lab nearly crying because I know I failed it and I go check my bio grade, expecting a high B/low A at least. A fucking 78. Then something just snapped in me I guess, and I just felt all this stress, that I ended up suffering for practically nothing, wash over me in this one big wave of stress and I just had to get out of there. I didn't want to be in my room, I didn't want to be in my dorm, I didn't want to be on campus anymore. I just wanted to drive away as far as I could or something...or maybe just home. I don't know...I ended up just walking...and I walked a long way. I eventually ended up at the Recycled Book/CD store in Denton Square and being there just...it calmed me down. Way much. It's like a maze in there with like three different levels and its so...cool. I could just hide behind some obscure bookshelf and read or look at books. I ended up getting three Vonnegut that I don't have and one Orwell. I am in a cynical mood I suppose. I spent about 2 hours there and then walked back, thinking a lot about a lot of different things. It's amazing how upset I was about doing so bad in biology. I would think I wouldn't care, since I don't want my job to have anything to do with biology. Or chemistry. Or math. Haha. Kelli asked me the other day why I had come here and I just don't know. To escape home I guess. And now that is where I want to escape to. Funny the way the world works, ne? Now, it's all over, the bio madness I mean. For the time being anyway. I'm listening to my Perks of Being a Wallflower mix right now. Scarborough Fair is playing. It makes me feel like I am in a dream. Infinite music fo sho. The original. Music is so amazing...it was so weird...earlier today, with the whole mental breakdown thing...I didn't even feel like listening to music. It was a weird feeling. Usually that is the only thing that I never reject or get tired of. I've decided I need to escape from here more often. Maybe go to my brother's apartment more or something. I wanted to go over there today but he wasn't home. Not having a car sucks. I ate lunch with the boy today and it was pretty cool. Pretty sure Kyle let the cat out of the bag...but it seems to have made more of a positive impact, so it's all good. Last night I walked out of MAC at like 1 AM and he was getting coffee so I joined him, and we had one of those conversations that just makes you smile for like an hour afterwards...just a short one, but I was glowy. Wow, from this point, if we end up being nothing more than friends, it will be one agonizing year. Because it's almost exactly a year til I graduate. Crazy, huh? College seems so far away and scary. Cuz this isn't like...real college. You know? I guess real college won't be very much more scarier though. So, I am just rambling now. I think I need to go sleep. Yup. Am doing that. See ya. Lisa

Last night, I had a semi-argument with Colin, who is known as like the music god up here, about emo. We spoke through a medium, Christina, and he argued that Sunny Day Real Estate started emo while I maintained that it was Rites of Spring. He also said that if I wanted some complex emo to listen to, I should check out Modest Mouse, so naturally I told Christina to tell him that I saw MM live over Spring Break and that if that was the most complex "emo" he could think of, that it was sad. This morning, I received a note from him in my box. I thought it was interesting: Lisa, Hey, this is Colin. This music thing with Christina has been bugging me since she left, and, for the record, you are right about the whole emo thing. Most of the time, I don't think about Rites of Spring and all those early bands on Dischord records as being emo, but you're right, they were the first to get the name. I was thinking Sunny Day Real Estate because I was thinking of who begat the whole Get Up Kids, Promise Ring branch of emo rather than the harder-core stuff that bands like At the Drive-In grew out of. Anyway, I just wanted to let you know that I was mistaken. I'd love to talk music sometime if you'd like. I love Christina, but trying to talk to her about music is pretty tough to say the least. -Colin PS- You are right, the whole Modest Mouse thing is pretty off. I'd just been listening to the new cd all day and they were the first band that came to mind. Music nerds are funny. heh. Normal people wouldn't have let a trivial argument like that bother them :P. Maybe it doesn't seem much to you, but the fact that he completely gave in and said I was right is amazing. He is one of those guys that always thinks they're right and such. He probably knows more about music than me too, hah. But he doesn't have to know that. Anyway, so I matched music wits with a hardcore indie guy last night and I won. Fun stuff. I can't believe I wrote a whole blog about this. Obviously, I am a music nerd as well. Normal people would not write a blog about winning a trivial music argument. Other news of the day: Computer is causing entire Res net traffic to be screwed up, had to shut down permanately until computer guy can come kick out the hacker guy that has been working through my portal. Also, got my letter telling me of my Senior Mentor rejection. And had my bio lab final. Good day? I would say not. But it was ok. I am so tired. Why am I still awake? Because I am an effing insomniac, that's why. I need to go now. Lisa

"Anyone who missed last night's show missed some good singing. Some Minor Threat-esque antics." "It was a very minor threat." "We are about the minorest threat that you can get." "You should buy Centromatic's album...if you like good songs. If you like bad songs...like maybe Hoobastank, or some other equally horrible band, then don't buy it. But if you like good songs..." ::Hugs a tree:: Death Cab for Cutie is hardcore. I heart them. I don't know any names, but the lead singer is really funny and cool and amazing at singing and the bassist is super cute. He made the second comment of the blog. :P. Centromatic was good, but nothing compared to Death Cab. We (me, Sarah, Kelli, and Vanessa) left before Ben Kweller because none of us really wanted to see him and we wanted to eat before we had to be back for curfew. I looked for Abby but did not find her!! :( But I got a shirt and it is really cool. It has an umbrella and raindrops that are really little skulls if you look close. Deck, eh? We ended up eating at Cafe Brazil. It was really good. The guys next to us were talking to the waiter about his night and the waiter was talking about how he had gotten trashed beforehand and was using his brother's 2-year-old son as a way to pick up chicks. It was...umm...interesting. Today I was thinking a lot on my walk to Sack n Save and back. It is funny how you might not understand something that someone did to you in the past and then you look at yourself in your situation and you realize startingly that you are in the same exact position and all of a sudden you understand exactly why the person did what they did and why you had to be hurt in the process. And you know not to make the same mistake, because you know that you do not want to hurt the person that is in the place that you were in a couple of years ago. Sorry for the vagueness, but I feel it is necessary. I'm sorry I ever was mad at that person. Although the pain is still there, I know that he had his reasons, and that is was inevitable what he did. We ordered pizza a while ago and Naomi, as a joke, printed off this fake coupon on telephone book paper. It looked so authentic. It was pretty hilarious. Me and her and Hanna and Rebecca have been sitting here eating pizza and talking for about an hour now. I was supposed to get that Scoop stuff to Norton by 1:00. Oops. :) Going now. Lisa Dear Lisa, I am pleased to let you know that you have been selected for the Intern News Writer position for the Fall 2004 North Texas Daily. I will be contacting you throughout the next few weeks and months to help you prepare for the next semester. Be sure to clear out the week before school starts in August for the NT Daily training week. During this time, you will learn all the responsibilities for your position, as well as the policies and day-to-day workings of the Daily. You are required to attend in order to be on staff in the fall. I urge you to contact me with any questions or concerns. Contacting me through e-mail is preferred. Congratulations on your new position, and I look forward to seeing you in the fall! Sincerely, Cindy Brown Editor in Chief

Being dragged into a puddle of mud by your fellow teammates is unpleasantly fun. :P I heart midnight soccer games with the soccer people. We surprised Vanessa with a cake this morning and woke her up by singing Happy Birthday. Twas cool. Then I scraped paint off of the window frames outside of McConnell because we are supposed to be repainting them soon. Rosecutting was after that and Chris gave a ballin speech. Seriously. He has a way of making people laugh that is just amazing. For a while, it didn't even seem like he was talking about graduation, just about his car and such...and then he just tied it together at the end by paralleling the two and didn't even directly state how they correllated...it was awesome. Katy had a really good speech as well and Allan's was cute. Simone's was pretty good as well. But I think Chris outshined them all. After the speeches they had an insane amount of awards and I thought it was interesting how Norton got an award for Scoop and I didn't....yes, interesting. Betsy won like three awards and left before any of them were announced :). Christina won the Junior Pacesetter Award and that was pretty exciting. I went and ate with her and Katie and Cherie afterwards. Then me and Rebecca chilled on the PEB field and read books under the sun and such. It was very pretty outside. I went and played football with Christina and Katie and Sarah and Lee Lee and Kelly after that. It was very interesting, mui fun. And then I caught the end of the talent show. Those silly TAMS kids... Oh! I also got stung by a bee for the first time today! That was exciting. My foot felt like it was going to have to be amputated or something. But I didn't cry. I only cry when I am emotionally distraught. Katie thought that was funny. So, graduation will definitely be sad. The one two weeks from now, and the one a year and two weeks from now. "Oh bring me back to the start..." Lisa

Old school celtic music is now my new favorite type of music. That is the only thing that is going to be playing at my wedding reception... World Fests are fun. Aztecs, gypsies, Indians, Turks!! (hahahahahaha) And many many more. That is all. Lisa

So the word emo has been tossed around a lot these past couple of days. Chintan's spend-a-day was a cute little Asian commercialized emo boy. Complete with girl pants, converse, a TSL t shirt (two sizes too small), an Early November trucker hat (good band, at least :P), and a pink belt. I walked into Cal with my Fall Out Boy shirt and I saw his eyes light up as he saw the first person (as far as he knew) that listened to good music. We had a short discussion concerning music. I don't think he goes much further than drive-thru and such. Anyway, after cal, everyone started talking about him and referring to him as the "emo boy." Heh. And they ALL noted his girl pants. It was great. Then Christina is all, "Lisa, what is emo?" ::Dramatic pause:: The unanswerable question, unexplainable concept. Haha, ok well, not really, but it can get quite complicated. So I tried to explain it to her, and I think she kinda of understood. And now she's been talking about it nonstop. Same with everybody else. It is quite crazy. I have had to constantly describe the difference between punk and today's "emo." Oh and also a couple of days ago I saw someone with a shirt that said, "War is emo." I'm not quite sure I follow their logic. Hmm. Anyway, today was super great. Felt like a Friday. My cal test was hard as ef and took me two hours. Then I had my interview for a position on the NT Daily next year. I think it went pretty well. If I don't get the part time job I am hoping for, I think that she will at least give me an internship. Then I went to lunch. Apparently, four of our Junior guys got caught smoking pot in their bathroom last night. They all got kicked out; had to call their parents at like 1 in the morning and get them to go pick them up. I feel bad for them because a couple of them were really nice guys and three of them were really popular with our class. One of them had it set. He was like a super genius and wanted to go to Harvard and stuff but there's no way an Ivy League school will let them in with something like getting kicked out of TAMS. However, even though I feel bad about it, they did kinda bring it upon themselves. I mean, it was dumb for them to do that. If you have to smoke pot, at least don't do it in the dorms! Anyway, I had Self Defense and then I went to Wal Mart with Rebecca and Megan which was interesting. Then I went to bio open lab cuz I figured out that if I get a perfect on the final I get an A in the class. Same with regular bio. So I have to study a lot so that I can have another 4.0! Anyway, I then took a two hour nap before our BUGS presentation, which went swimmingly. Micaela loved the gift basket thing I put together for her and it was pretty cool. I got a free lab coat, which I plan to wear to all my physics labs next year. And then Naomi called Tyler and Matt (guitar teacher guy from Arlington that was in town and our other friend from UNT) and we went and hung out with them. We all went and ate at this Chinese buffet place that was really good. And then we drove around a lot. They came back with us to McConnell and Tyler was just aimlessly wandering around Mac and Smitty. It was funny. Then Matt lost his keys in the bushes. Lol. That was great. He and Tyler were like making all this ruckus and everyone was just walking by and aw man, it was like three hours of non-stop laughter. Those guys are seriously some of the funniest people ever. They make me happy inside and definitely made my day. Good times. I need to study chemistry now. I only have two classes tomorrow! Woo! Lisa

CDs to buy (or rip): The Weakerthans Hot Rod Circuit Jets to Brazil I hate it when I let people get me down. And I hate myself when I realize that I actually do care what people think about me, no matter how much I say that I don't. I'm such a hypocrite and a coward. Why do people have to say the things they say sometimes? And why won't they give me a straight answer? This is dumb. I should just forget about it. I barely passed the GSP test this morning. I got a 100 on the spelling part, an 85 on the punctuation part and a flat 70 on the grammar part. It was very difficult and the questions were very tricky. Usually, I ace grammar tests. You know? But, I passed and so now I am officially signed up for Journalism 2310: News reporting and writing. Woo! After classes I had BUGS and my mentee and I worked a lot on our project which we present Thursday. She tells me about her life a lot. It amazes me how much drama a 5th-grader can have. I did some yearbook pages sometime after that. And now I am here, listening to my Hopelessly Devoted to You compilation. I really like it. But I let something someone said rip apart my contentness. I don't know why. I'm dumb. Lisa

When Betsy was pushing me around in the old shopping cart out behind McConnell tonight and the Get Up Kids were playing in my cd player, and we were laughing hysterically, I think I felt infinite for the first time in a long time. We ended up playing volleyball; me, Rebecca, Lisa, Naomi, Betsy, and Aarron. Betsy is graduating in three weeks. I think it is kinda sad. Sometimes I really love being up here. "Last night on the mass pike I fell in love with you" Lisa

So I have listened to Ted Leo a lot today. No reason. I swear. ::Giggles:: I'm a nerd. Actually, right now I am listening to Jets to Brazil. They are deck. There's a phone call aimed at me tonight... I wish there was a phone call aimed at me tonight. I am feeling particularly phone-callish. So let's see..it's been a while. Thursday night I went to the SGA day and got a wax hand and wiggled my ears for a pumpkin pie. Then me and Kenny were supposed to watch movies but we both had so much to do by the time visitation was over so he went with me to play soccer with a bunch of people. That kinda sucked, so a bunch of us left and played volleyball, which was very fun. Friday I just hung out with Fifer after getting home. We went to the mall and eavesdropped on some nerds in the bookstore. Nerds are so cool. I heart them. Then we got Wendy's food and went and watched random soccer games at the fields. But mostly we talked. It was cool. Saturday I headed over to Vanessa's and just chilled at her house for a long time and met all of her interesting friends. She has too many friends and a TV life we have decided. Her brother was pretty cool, didn't get to talk to him much though. They are too against drugs. In an over-the-board type way. But other than that, he and his friends are cool. I went home Sunday and watched 8 hours of Stephen King mini series. Mmm...8 hours of TV and doing nothing. I am too busy at school. Today was crazy and the week looks like it will be crazier. I wish that there was more free time so that I could watch movies. So I am just sitting here now...I was waiting for a phone call, and I got one, but not the one I was waiting for. So now I guess I am out to play volleyball with cool people. Lisa

I am both melancholy and perfectly content. But not melancholy in a particularly sad way, just a pensive, quiet way. I don't really know how to describe it. The madness is over for a while at least. Yesterday and today I was so busy. Yesterday I had class and then BUGS and then I had to skip chem lab to go to our semi finals game for the girls soccer team, which we won. Afterwards, they named me MVP of both the girls and co ed team. That was very flattering, but I suppose I do not really think that I was the most valuable player. :P I loved our teams this year though. I will be sad to see Leah and Aubri and Zahir and Kevin and Chris graduate. They are all such great players and people. After we won that game, I went and ate dinner with Kenny. Interesting times. Today was so crazy, I almost died. I had to do my cal hw in Bio and then skip poly sci to take a shower and finish the hw. Luckily English was cancelled, but I still had to ask Schoolfield to write my letter of reference for the NT Daily app and so then I had to go finish it, which took forever because there was so much crap to include and it was my first time to ever have to type up a resume for myself. But I got that done, had to go buy a manila envelope, drop off my learning log by Schoolfield's office, pick up my letter of reference, and finally turn in my application at 4. Then I had thirty minutes to study for my bio lab quiz which I am pretty sure I failed. Anyway, I have my interview for the job next Thursday at 9:00. Tuesday at 9 I have to take the GSP test so that I can sign up for the Newswriting and reporting class. After Bio Lab, it was a quick dinner and then off to the soccer games. I got a lot of people to come, it was great. But, sadly, we lost both of them. :( Oh well :). I have many battle scars that are even uglier than the ones from Anti-Flag in December. After we lost horribly, I played a little basketball with Sweeny and Chintan. Oh man, those guys are great. I need to hang out with them more. Kenny had to consult me for advice on what to wear to his research interview a little while ago. It was quite amusing. That kid cracks me up sometimes. And he gives me good music. I like laughing and good music. So I gave him some good music in return (Anti-Flag and Ted Leo ;) ) Annyywayy... I found out/realized a couple of things today that are both flattering and weird. Hmm. But they make me happy inside. However, for some reason, I am in a peaceful, pensive, melancholy mood. Bright Eyes and SoCo's Konstantine kind of mood, you know? Lisa

Today was a very good day. After classes, I ate with Sarah, Ryan, and Kenny, which always proves to be an interesting experience. Ryan is a cool guy, and intriguing. I don't think I have ever met someone like him. He's simple...but really interesting...and he's got a great personality, but he hates social situations and being around a lot of people. Hmm. Anyway. Then me and Naomi and Rebecca and Sarah and Lisa and Kelli all went easter egg hunting with Kyle and Carlos and Steven and Carl at Eureka Park. It was mui fun. We played on the playground afterwards and it was just so great. We were like kids again. On the way home, we blasted the YMCA and Celine Dion. Me and Lisa were singing our hearts out. It was great. Then we had our soccer game for the quarterfinals match and we won!! I scored the goal that made it to where we could win. Fun stuff, eh? It is rare that I get to do important stuff like that in a game, and everybody was so cool to me and kept telling me good job and stuff. It was great. The whole game was great except for this part when this guy was like groping me and pretending like he was marking up on me or something but I mean....he effing grabbed my breast. I was all "Get the fuck off me" and pushed him away. He didn't mess with me after that. Ha. :P Did some thinking later on while I was running with Naomi. I think that I am one confused person. The NT Daily Application is due Wednesday and I have to give them seven examples of my work and have two letters of reference and all this other crap. I dunno if I have the time or the patience to do that. And I don't even know if they'll let me write for them. But I guess I should try...:P Tax returns are due Thursday. And I have to take that dumb grammar test to be in journalism. I sign up for classes tomorrow too. Ahh. Lisa

After a plesant spaghetti lunch after I woke up, I did nothing all day, except for help my mom clean up our yard, in the cold and rain... Fifer came over around 5 and we just sat around talking and watching TV and then we had to go get some milk and then I made macaroni and cheese for dinner and she left to go see As I Lay Dying and Every Time I Die...haha...I kinda wish I coulda gone, but it was one of those family dinners and Matthew was making the chicken..yeah...my macaroni and cheese was ballin by the way. Even though I was punk rock and deviated from the directions (or suggestions, as I like to call them). After dinner, I played a game of poker with my brothers again and was second to last going out. Amy called after that and picked me up to hang out with her for a while. We went to Wal Mart because she needed last minute Easter attire. I saw Laura and Jerred for the first time in like two years. It's funny how I have been running into people lately. Anyway, then we just went back to her house and watched Cheaper By the Dozen while eating Spam sandwiches...mmm...they were tres bien. Jennifer got back from work at around 12:30 and then she jumped on me after making me put down the Spam (I thought it wasn't real meat anyway :P) and after the movie I talked to her for a while about stuff. I guess we just acted like nothing had happened, which is good I suppose. I am glad I got to talk to everybody this weekend that was having problems with me. :) Umm...so I am really tired and tomorrow morning I must sit through the torture that is mass...and I get lots of candy and such from the Easter Bunny. Exciting stuff, eh? Yes, I thought so. Lisa

OK, so I told myself I wasn't going to sleep in both Friday and Saturday, but I did anyways. :P oh well. Yesterday, I was just chillaxin around the hizzouse and I really didn't feel like doing much or going anywhere. I went to the grocery store for my mom and ran a couple of errands for her, but nothing else really. So, I really didn't feel like getting ready to go see Shut Up Agnes and, as Fifer pointed out, all of my favorite people were there, like albino boy and Satan. Haha. So I didn't. But it was ok, because I was playing poker with my brothers. I was winning a majority of the game until I went all in on a full house and then Jason had one as well that was higher than mine!! At that point, he had just as many chips as me so he got to take all of mine. Heh. But it was alright because they know I know how to play poker now. Around 10:00, Olivia dropped by to watch a movie with me before heading off to her boyfriend's house. We just talked a lot and caught up on stuff. And she invited me to go to Panama with her and a couple of her friends this summer. It sounded fun, I might want to go. Oh, and yesterday I found out that I only owe $1,700 for housing. I have around $1,600 left from my grants. That means I only have to ask my Dad for a couple hundred. This is good. Lisa

Last night I had this dream that I was trying to convince everyone I knew that I didn't do the things that they thought I did. I told everyone that I didn't get high or drunk and that I didn't have sex with random people and that I didn't go around breaking laws all the time. And not one person in my dream believed me. It was just a weird feeling...and dream. Last night's show was great fun. James went with us again and that is always interesting. There were a ton of people for The Door and half of them were annoying middle school kids who didn't really understand what it was all about. We met this guy named Sky that probably found his match/soulmate in Abby for the first time and after exchanging witty banter/insults, he called her incredible. But Abby played hard-to-get and wouldn't tell him her name. Oh, and Abby yelled really loud that A Walk to Remember was James' favorite movie and everybody in line was laughing. It was hilarious as ef. Inside, it was ridicuously crowded, more crowded than I have ever seen The Door before. I didn't like it. I really like smaller shows a lot better. And when I say smaller shows I mean that I like it when there is room to walk around and being near the stage does not mean that you cannot do anything but be smooshed between two people that pull your hair the whole time. So for the most part, I just watched the show. The people in the mosh pit were a bunch of 13-year-old boys a lot of the time, and up front wasn't enjoyable at all, so I just watched. Autopilot Off was good and Senses Fail, as usual, did not fail to amaze me with their live show and their connection with the audience. That makes my third time to see Senses Fail but this was the first time that I didn't get to be in the crowd for their show because of the aformentioned reasons. But, still, it was good. Rufio was good, but not amazing. They rocked out pretty hard, and they did a cover of Madonna :). I was standing near one of the moshpits at one point during the show and I noticed this guy coming up to me and then he got really close and I was like, "What is he doing?" and then he gave me a hug and I realized that it was Justin! So I hugged him back and I asked him who all was there and he said he was looking for Jeremy and so he left. After Autopilot Off was over, he found me again and I got to talk to him. I asked him if anyone was going around the church telling everyone that I was a bad person and he said no and asked why and I said because that seems to be the general consensus nowadays and he said, "Lisa, you're one of the nicest people I know. And I really mean that." That really meant a lot to me, and I wish I could have told him that before we left. But anyway, Abby and James came back from the concession stand and Justin started talking about how he couldn't crowd surf because he weighed a good 250 pounds and then started talking about how all those emo kids wear those tight clothes and he can't because he's fat (and he's not like fat in a gross way, he just is big and plays football and that kinda thing) and so he says he is going to design his own line of clothing of emo clothes for fat kids and call it Femo..or Phemo...Phat with a P-H...haha. That kid is funny. I heart him. So anyway, at another point in the night some kid sprayed the fire extinguisher and it was this powder stuff that got in my eyes and nose so I had to breathe down my shirt for five minutes until it got out of the air. It was super annoying. I spent the night at Abby's house and now I am home. I slept a long time this morning. I haven't had more than four hours of sleep since like...Afterprom morning...and before that...Spring Break. Maybe I should start sleeping more. Lisa

I went to a FACES session of Zen Meditation today. Really, it is just sitting and staring at the ground. I don't think I was very good at it. The point was to have no thoughts and just have a clear mind but I think there were maybe only ten seconds out of 24 minutes that I actually did that. It is hard. My thoughts won't shut up. I was mildly calmed down afterwards, and then Tyler called me to go play tennis with him because he wants to learn how. So I played with him for about an hour and came back here and talked to Sarah and Naomi and such. I feel extremely awkward today. Lisa

Soo I really just want it to be summer already. I think I spend too much time around certain people, and get too annoyed easily. I don't really feel like writing, so I won't really... Tomorrow I get to see Rufio and Senses Fail. Fun stuff. I hope I end up having a way to get home. Oh, and I got yet another email. This time, instead of anger, it was pity, which I think is simultaneously funnier and more annoying. Telling me that you cry because of me isn't going to make me feel bad. I think it's useless. Cry for yourself, I am fine, you know?

Currently Playing Complete Discography By Minor Threat This music makes me happy in an angry I-want-to-bash-in-some-windows-with-a-baseball-bat-Mike-style kinda way. You know what I mean? So I had a lot of anger today. In chemistry, I felt like hitting something. Grr. But I took a nap before English and so it was a little better after that. I want to be home for the summer already, dawgs. "I'm happy in a crying sort of way...curled up in the shower, biting your knees, wishing you were dead kinda way..." (Ludo rocks my world.) "LUDO hold the listener's attention with a feel good, uplifting, and promising debut." -random reviewer I think it is funny how they have such bitter lyrics but are called feel good and uplifting...I mean, I know they are, but it's funny how that works. Feeling other people's pain uplifts us!! Ok, going now. Maybe I sleep some more. -from Lisa's Xanga

The FOB show was sold out. Damn Mest and their popularity. But anyway, it turned out to be an interesting night. The reason we got there so late was because we had to wait for James to get back from UiL and he didn't get back until like 7:20 or something and so we didn't actually get on the road until like 7:40 and the doors opened at 7 soooo anyway. Like I said, it was an interesting night. Me and Abby played songs that were funny because of certain situations ("I wanna hate you sooo bad, but I can't! But I can't...."). Abby and James had a f...er, I mean...an explosion. That was pretty hilarious as well. After we found out the show was sold out, we tried to sneak in for a while until we figured out that it wasn't going to work and then we walked around Main St. for a while because there was some kind of festival. I dunnno. We ended up going to IHOP to see Jared. Man, that kid is funny. I heart him. But I don't want in his pants. Fifer. They didn't charge me for my buttermilk pancakes so I got them for free. Woo! I picked up the tip, though. After IHOP we dropped off James and then had a CD burning party pour moi at Fifer's house. Then she kicked us out because she was tired :P. Earlier, I spent the day with Amy. We had a good time catching up and talking and stuff. Good times. Heather is so cute. She is probably the cutest baby ever. But she slobbers a lot. Slobbering is gross :P. My insides are copper. Those anarcho punks are mysterious. Lisa

Went and saw Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind w/ Abby and Fifer. Good times. FOB is tomorrow night, I am excited. I am supposed to look for a boy with curly red hair named Jed. And Vanessa and Kelli told me to find a cute boy while I was there as well. Haha. That is amusing to me, cuz it's as if they expect me to be able to pick up a cute boy :p. Had a convo w/ the mother about financial stuff. Her: "You need to start budgeting your money better." Me: "Yeahh...." But there is just some stuff you have to do, you know? I think this would have worked out a lot better if I had negotiated some kind of monthly allowance with her and my dad at the beginning of the year. Oh well. Next year I plan on reffing on the weekends. I think it is unrealistic to go to school full time and work. Especially since I am going to be taking 19 hours again. A lot of people told me this week that I seem sadder than usual. I don't know why. I guess I have been rather melancholy lately. Hmm...I suppose it is a combination of things. Hah. It just took me like ten seconds to remember the word combination. I am debating whether or not I should go somewhere tonight. I need to, but I am not sure I want to. I dunno. Confusingness. Lisa

I'm tired of trying. So, Shea Sanford is gonna be working with me this summer. Interesting, eh? Yes, I thought so. Oh, and tonight after I got off, I thought I heard a familiar voice, so I turned around and who is it but my good friend Donelle. Haha. Six Flags must be the place to work for those Summiteers. Also, at graduation I got to see JoAnn and Ashley for the first time in over a month...or two...and then I saw Matt Jones for the first time in a couple of years. We had a good conversation about colleges. But, I don't want to think about college right now because even though I know I won't get in to the places I want to go, I am still going to disappoint myself by applying. I'm out.
Can anybody tell me what a Lazy Susan is? All I've done is worked recently. And went swimming and to graduation. That is all. I don't feel like writing.

So. Working "two days" this weeks has turned into five days - with a double shift on Friday. I expect that when I get my first pay check I shall be, as they say, "rolling in da money." So my mom woke me up at 5:00 this morning so that I could go get some groceries for her. Groceries... like an ink cartridge, 40 popsicles, and 20 gallon sized ziplock bags. Just the essentials, you know? Wal-Mart at 5:30 in the morning is interesting. The cleaning guys were shouting random Dave Chapelle phrases at the top of their lungs. My favorite part of the day has got to be before the park is actually opened and I get to climb this long ladder and flight of stairs to do safety checks. It's so pretty from up there and so peaceful...mmm... My other favotite part of the day was when these boys started doing the Mighty Ducks cheer on El Conquistador. That ride is the funnest. Jenni is really nice, and probably the one who talks to me the most. Lyndsey is really nice. Becky is cool too. Donni is cool. Ferrell is...ok I suppose. I guess the guy that has intrigued me the most so far is Greg. He reminds me so much of someone, but for the life of me, I cannot think of who it is. There are just some people that intrigue you even without you really ever being in a conversation with them. I haven't talked to him save for the work conversations, but for some reason I find myself trying to figure out what kind of guy he is. I wonder what kind of music he listens to, what his friends are like, what school he goes to, if he still lives with his parents, what his clothes look like when he is not in uniform, what he gets like when he's crazy or drunk or around people he knows really well. This creates much entertainment for my mind throughout the day. This is so much better than Kroger. I didn't even feel like I worked 10 hours today. HOLLA. Lisa

Last night I was ready to say goodbye to my computer and my music library of over 2600 songs forever. My brother reinstalled Windows onto my computer, hoping to recover explorer.exe. It was not recovered. And I wasn't even able to get to my itunes or the folder that held my itunes music. I was about ready to cry for the lost music and pawn off my computer. But then, I messed around on it and have improved its condition considerably. It is still incredibly screwed up, but now at least I have the internet. I think this is reason enough to not pawn it off until I have my new computer. I still can't play music on it, but at least I have been able to locate where my itunes music is, even if it is unaccessible still. These are the reasons why I am never going to use Windows or Microsoft ever again. Macs all the way. Woot. Anyhow...Three things I am exceedingly glad about right now: 1) On account of my brother deciding to tour with the Madison Scouts this summer, I will have full rights to his car and computer for the next two and a half months. His car, the Saturn with a CD player and AC...unlike my mother's car with neither...I get to use it starting this Friday. Exciting, no? 2) The swimming pool at our townhouse complex. I have a feeling I will be wanting to use it a lot after my long days working in the 120 degree heat this summer. 3) My ability to get into Hurricane Harbor for free whenever I want to...with a friend. I think I shall also have to take advantage of this. So, anyway, Saturday and Sunday I spent ten hours each day signing papers and sitting through classes and taking tests so that I can start working. I am only trained on two rides so far. La Vibora and the Conquistador. I work in Spain. I only work two days this week, though, because they said this week I am only working the open shifts they had. This is good though because I am off Saturday so that I can go see graduation. Last night I watched a movie called One Hour Photo. It was very creepy. Well, I'm off to see Ryan Fan at some orchestra concert thing of his in Richardson. Fun stuff. I haven't seen him since...well, I can't even remember the last time I saw him. Lisa

I almost forgot how fun it is to pretend to be an anarchist. Until tonight :P. Thursday I went to the Rangers game with Matt and his "friend" Meredith and Naomi. We saw Lisa there with her little brother, who is adorable. Afterwards me and Naomi had a Kill Bill fest until 3 in the morning and we watched volumes 1 and 2. I thought they were really good, if only a little cheesy. And today I went shopping with Amy and Heather for a bit, and that was fun. Then Fifer called and invited me to go to some carnival with her and Abby and Laura and so I did that and we met up with some guy from Buzz Oven named Alex who was really crazy. Almost as crazy as those carnies. lol. They think Abby and Alex are weird. "And when they think you're weird, then you know that you're fucked up." Haha. I think we rode every ride there. Then we had pancakes at IHOP and seasoned fries at Denny's and it was great fun. I have to be at my first day of work tomorrow at 8:30. And tomorrow night I'm going to some show with James and Fifer and Abby. So anyway. Ciao. (haha that reminds me of someone's voicemail :P) Lisa

Watched my mother's third grade class deliver the poems they memorized in front of the class. Realized that I really miss elementary school. Went to eat a picnic lunch with Jennifer at the park. Learned that UNT made me go psycho. Ate dinner at a chinese restaurant. Found that I can talk to my mom just like a friend. Went to my brother's football game. Was reminded how boring high school football is. That is all.

I have a job. :) The guy that interviewed me reminded me of Vin Diesel meets Adam Sandler...the former being looks and the latter being personality. He was crazy, but I think he was smart as well. And he was really nice. Six Flags has a "points" system. It reminded me of TAMS oh so much. Calling in sick is ten points. Being late for work is 5 points. 30 points and I'm fired. Not quite as flexible as Kroger was, but then, Kroger didn't pay $6.50/hour either. Anyway, Saturday and Sunday are my training days and then I start next week. My mother and I might have to share a car again this summer. Fin.

America has reached a new low with the WB's remake of American Idol. It's like hey let's take young people's goals, hopes, and dreams, make them believe they can achieve them, crush them, and put their acts in which they made themselves completely vulnerable on TV so all America can have a good hearty laugh at them. Ha Ha! Look at that girl think that she has achieved her lifelong dream of becoming a star! How amusing that she sucks but does not know it yet! With that said, I have some laundry to do.

So I am having trouble remembering anything productive I've done the past couple of days. I saw Troy last night. Which was funny, even though I don't think it was supposed to be. But, I mean, the war thing has been done so many times...Brad Pitt was sexy, of course. There were a lot of scenes with him half-to-almost-completely naked. Oh, and then Jill had a video of Trenton streaking. Censored, of course. :P And tonight I saw Supersize Me. It was very good. Really opened my eyes. I don't think I will ever eat fast food ever again. But yeah, I recommend it to all. Go out and see it. That is all. Lisa

I thought this was really funny: my pokemon cards bring all the nerds to the yard and they're like, you wanna trade cards? damn right, i wanna trade cards ill give ya pikachu, but not my charizard! I know I've said this before but everytime I hear the milkshake song, I automatically think of Ashley's backyard. But, I don't think she's a whore or anything. I guess it was just all those sunny summer afternoons back in the day spent in her backyard, or Noel's backyard...or something. I have an interview to work Ride Operations at Six Flags on Tuesday. At 6:15. I don't know what I'll do with myself until then. Summer is awfully uneventful so far. And I only have like $26 in my bank account, so I can't do much with money. This is why I need a job. Hrm. Late night trips down memory lane are fun fo shizzle. I think I understand my transition from religion to none a little better now. Oh! I almost forgot. I totally just beat Matt and Brian and my mom in a game of Hold Em. Word. Lisa

I am now officially the biggest nerd alive. :P Even though I left high school for TAMS, I came back to Summit to attend the UiL academic team (that I am no longer a part of)'s banquet. And I enjoyed it. Haha. It was fun though. I got to see everyone again and there were many hugs and such. I went with Fifer and Abby, and Abby isn't a part of the team either, but we had fun making fun of all of them. :P Things haven't changed much from last year. I can't believe it's been an entire year already. I remember Chess in a Tin at last year's banquet like it was yesterday. I saw Ryan, probably for the last time ever, since he is going to the University of Southern California next year. I decided to end whatever weird relation(friend?) ship we have with some sort of resolution, so I talked to him and told him thanks for getting me interested in journalism and told him about my internship and my editor-in-chief-ness next year. I guess it wasn't too much of a resolution, but it was good enough. He got up on stage to give a couple of awards tonight and I was reminded of why I used to have such a big crush on him. It's interesting how things change, but not quite as much as you imagined. Anyway, summer will be fun with Abby and Fifer. It was some crazy mad fun tonight. We watched the Fall Out Boy DVD and Abby started hitting me and was all, "I missed you so much!" Reminds me of Sarah in that way. Speaking of Sarah, the party last night was great. There were about 16 of us TAMSters there, and it was interesting. We all played soccer and catchphrase and guesstures. When 1:00 rolled around, we were just sitting and talking and such. We all fell asleep on Naomi's living room floor at around 4:00. I realized that I will miss Chris a whole lot next year. He is just one of the most interesting people I have ever met. And he's a good guy as well. I'll miss Zahir as well. And Betsy, of course. I think everybody else at the party was a soon-to-be Senior. But yeah, it was great fun. The most fun I have ever had at a party, probably. Man, I feel like I have rambled on too much, and I need to go to sleep. I am tres tired. I thought once school was out, I would get more sleep but so far this hasn't been the case. Lisa

I hope it doesn't rain tomorrow. I trekked out to Denton today to get my transcript and the signature I needed to take TCC classes this summer. My GPA is now officially a 3.7. Goodbye hopes of getting into Harvard :(. And Columbia. Oh well. I suppose there is still hope :). I was in Roberta Key's office, turning in my room key that I had lost the day we moved out, and she decided to give me a thirty-minute lecture on why Scoop sucks and what I should do to improve it next year. She kept showing me the April issue and I kept telling her that the rest of the new staff and I did not do that issue, but I don't think it got through to her. It started raining on the way back to my car. I was soaked. Visibility was at zero a few times on the way back to Arlington. I don't think I have ever driven in such heavy rain before. The rest of my day was spent going to Arlington Medical Center to apply for a volunteer position and eating a steak dinner at Naomi's house. Then I had to move couches and such for her party tomorrow. It is going to be holla holla. I got to make some mixes, which is like my favorite thing to do for people. They have a good number of radio songs though, but only because at a party there needs to be songs playing that everybody knows. Man, Will from Will and Grace is hott. Anyway, I was listening to Something Corporate tonight and I realized that I miss having a boy. But I don't want the ones that are interested in me right now. Quite the conundrum. Why do some cities have to be six hours away? The future freaks me out. Lisa

"Do you miss it?" my mom asked me this morning, as we dropped off my little brother at Summit. I said no, of course.
