But, as I watched everyone walk into the building with three minutes to spare, trying to find the motivation to make it through another eight hours of the torture that is high school, I knew that I did. Maybe it isn't that I miss high school, but that I regret not knowing what my last two years could have been. I picked up my mom from her school later on in the day, and as I was walking through the parking lot, I remembered how every day last year I had to walk from Summit to her school after tennis was over, and how I used to spend that time of the day to think about things and people. And then Fifer brought her yearbook over to my house because they just got them today, and as I flipped through the pages, I looked at the last page of Junior faces and noted how this was the first year since Fifth grade that my face hasn't been next to Tyler Waterman's. I looked at the Tennis Page and the UiL page...and it was just weird seeing my absense...I could still be doing these things and be great at them. I could still be hanging out with those people and being close to them. I could be heading up The Jagwire next year maybe...I dunno...it is just weird is all. I watched The Breakfast Club today and it just made me think about all these things. Summer seems so weird when no one is home with whom to hang out. Lisa

Post 245 Whoa, Blogger changed their layout...This is weird.... Trips to the Grandma's house are always interesting. "So, Lisa, if you could vote this year, who would you vote for?" "Kerry." "Kerry? What happened to Dubya?" ::Remembers that family still has perception of me as hardcore religious, conservative Lisa:: "I don't like him. He's a psycho." "Good. We don't like him either." And so commenced a weekend of Bush-bashing whenever politics came up. Woot. My grandma wanted me and my cousin Elisabeth, who is 16, to bond so she made her go to Wal-Mart with me. It was so incredibly awkward the whole time. I tried to make conversation and such since we will both be Seniors next year, but she is so...difficult to carry on a conversation with. I listened to a lot of music on the way back. Against Me, AntiFlag, Bouncing Souls, Bright Eyes (I didn't get past the first part of my CD case :P)...I heart music. Anyway, I'm off job hunting tomorrow. Lisa

Fishboy is hardcore. I am amazed at his musical genius. And his drummer's Psycho -esque antics for Mother's Day. The TaDas were really good too. We were talking to the guy afterwards and he was talking about how one time people were playing scrabble during his show. It was pretty funny. The show was at this little bar in Denton Square and there were maybe 20 or 25 people there to see it. I have decided that small shows are my favorite. But, anyway, yeterday was so crazy. I had to write two essays and put together my portfolio before 1:00, which took like three hours, and then Naomi and I had to clean our room spotlessly. We used so many chemicals and spilled Goop-Off (or turpentine, as David likes to call it) all over our floor to mop with it and people could smell it all the way from the staircase. We didn't get checked out until around 4:00 and it took an hour and a half to get home. So we didn't leave to go back to Denton until around 6:40 and we were about thirty minutes late for graduation. I am sad that I missed Zahir's speech. But it was cool. All of the colleges they are going to amaze me. The Prom King and Queen are going to MIT and Harvard, respectively. What other high school can say that? Anyway, after that we went to the place Fishboy was playing, only to find that the first band didn't go on until 10:30 or so, so Vanessa and I went and got food and then came back to see the last two bands. Great show. Afterwards, Naomi wanted to go watch a movie with David, Bruce Hall President and her pseduo-"We really like each other and hang out 24/7 but aren't together"-boyfriend. We were with two other people so it was ok, but then they both left, and so it was really awkward. Well, I take that back. It was awkward before they left, because the only person I knew was Naomi and she was laying on David's top bunk with him the whole time. But I did get to see When Harry Met Sally, which I had been wanting to see for a long time. Very interesting...really does get me thinking... Anyway, Naomi and I drove back around 3:00, and I had to keep her from falling asleep at the wheel, but there was no way I was going to stay the night in David's room. Ok, now it is off to my grandmother's house for the weekend. Have fun at Summit's Prom!! Lisa

It's the little moments that make the whole thing worth while. Everyone has their good qualities and their own quirkiness. I'm glad I got to know the people I got to know this semester. Especially a certain few of them. I think that the summer will be a pause in the relationships, but it won't be the end of them, and it won't make them any worse. I think that in four months we'll pick up where we left off, and have an absolutely awesome Senior year. I had a lot of little moments today. Oh, look, I am getting all tearful and nostalgic. I wonder how bad it will be a year from now. :) Lisa

So I think that this morning I had my first test anxiety/panic attack ever. It was so scary, I was looking down at the numbers and it was like I was reading a foreign language or something. Nothing made any sense. I tried to focus my mind but it just wouldn't focus. On a few problems, I just wrote down some random numbers because it felt like no matter how hard I thought about it, I couldn't get past the most elementary steps of thinking. And I knew the stuff, it's not like it was because I wasn't prepared. I just...I dunno what happened. There goes my A in Calculus though. That kinda sucks, I guess. I am so mad at myself. Now that I look back at the test I can see exactly what I was supposed to do. But it is too late now. So I was in there for three and a half hours and I probably failed. Bleh. I hate school. Tonight is my last night here. :( I will miss everyone so much over the summer, and it will be sad when the seniors do not return next year. Have a great summer, everybody. Lisa

Laura Simpson is deck. I surprised Fifer today when I got home :P and then I bought a Hot Rod Circuit album from CD Warehouse for $7. Yay. It is amazingly good and it makes me happy inside. And then we checked out Half Price books for a while, but I didn't get anything. Then we chilled at the Pattersons with Jenn and watched the end of A Knight's Tale. I forget what else I did. Adam Stepinski gave a showing of the film he made today. It was so good, he should be a filmmaker. I want him to make me a copy but I have to go get a DVD-R. I realized for the first time today just how attractive he is. I should've gotten to know him better :). But he graduates in two days, so I guess that is the end of that. We played volleyball tonight and such but it wasn't that great. I told Christina I would put an all-nighter with her tonight and study calculus with her. I only have to make an 81 on my final!! Isn't that exciting? I thought so. So, I won't get to see some people for a whole four months. Heh. One in particular. Oh well. I guess we have 8 months left together after summer. Ciao Lisa

Pet Peeve of the Day: People who think they're bad ass. And then brag about it. I want to go hooooooome already. Saturday and Sunday I went out of my room for an approximate total of four hours. And I still don't think I got As on my finals. Oh well. The worst of it is over. I hope I never have to take a biology or chemistry course ever again. Thursday is my last final - Calculus. Which should also be a very difficult test. I think my average in that class is like...a 91 or something. So I just have to get an 87 on the final. I think I should be able to do that. Hopefully. If not, my GPA is going to absolutely suck this semester. Yesterday, after the biology and chemistry finals (bleh), I got to go thrifting with Sarah and Katie and Christina. I got three new shirts and they are holla holla. I also got six books from this one place. Over all, I spent about eight dollars. Fun stuff. Then I went and saw Mean Girls with Hanna and Megan and Terra and Meena and Naomi. I found it extremely ironic that we saw a movie about "The Plastics" with the three "Plastics" of TAMS (Hanna, Megan, Terra). But they are not mean like the girls in the movie...at least not that I know of. Anyway, the movie was mildly amusing. Tim Meadows is really funny and the main character actress was pretty cool I suppose. I paid my housing balance today. $1,706.83. Handing over that much money was...difficult. Admittedly, only $200 of it was money that I earned, but still...I only have $50 in my bank account now. Need a job...will get one soon. Lisa

Here's to the night - So here I am, at 2:27 AM, writing this. The internet is shut off by now by the way, so this is on Word. I was going to just read biology until I drifted off to sleep but thoughts kept running through my mind so I thought it best to write them out. What a strange but wonderful world we live in. The night began when Naomi and I went and ate lunch with Ryan and Kyle, an interesting pair to say the least. The more I hang out with them, the more I like them, in a completely platonic way of course, but they are just so cool. Then Rebecca, Betsy, and I took Rebecca's car to the parking garage because she thought it was going to hail and we drove around in the garage listening to really loud music. She used the pillars as cones and swerved in and out of them. It was so fun. We were sitting there in the car, waiting for the song to be over, and Betsy was just like, "This is so surreal." Then we climbed onto the roof of the building next to us and just laid there staring at the sky and talking. Rebecca and I told Betsy how much we were going to miss her next year. And it's true. TAMS just won't be the same without my Betsy Liu :). Then the police officers made us get down and tried to threaten us. That was pretty amusing. We have decided to take a three-day-long road trip this summer. It will be interesting. When I got back to my room, Tyler invited me to go watch a movie with him and Chintan and Kelli and Vanessa and Sarah so I did that. The movie was Better Luck Tomorrow - a movie that hit too closely to home with smart Asians who are trying to get into Ivy Leagues and try to beef up their applications with all this stuff and then they get into some bad stuff and end up killing a guy. Quite disturbing at some parts. Not really one of my favorites, but it was interesting. Then we all went down to the Farewell Dance. TAMS dances are always the most interesting. I can't dance for crap but I still do goofy moves and everybody laughs at me. But it's all good. I got to slow dance with the person I wanted to dance with, as well as six other guys. As Naomi says, it feels like 8th grade all over again. When they played Lean on Me, it was amazing. Everybody in the room got in this big circle with their arms around each other for the first verse and sang along. Then we all just started clapping and free-styling, and man it was great. At one point in the night, Kelli, Naomi, Kyle, Kenny, and I all went for a walk. I love those kids. They are all so great. After the dance, a bunch of us were trying to get something to eat and ended up going four different places. Good times. I feel content. I am glad that I have moved on. I am glad that he probably has to. Because I really click with someone else, and it's a good feeling. Here's to the night we felt alive. Lisa

Monday and Tuesday I was sent home early from work because of all this damn rain. Yesterday after I was sent home, the park flooded apparently and they had to shut it down. I didn't experience any of the mad flooding because Spain drained all the water pretty well. I have had nothing to do without work though, which is kinda sad I guess. I was going to go experience the Alex Atchley Experience tonight but due to unforeseen plans that involve three kids that I love to death, their parents having to go to the hospital, and me wanting to do the right thing by helping them out, I think I will have to forego the experience for tonight. Perhaps another day, though. Last night I went to Naomi's for a bit and we collaborated on the TAMS Dating Article for the Junior Survival Guide and then planned out our trip for the second time. It works a lot better now. And now there are more colleges we are looking at. I think it is...Harvard, Boston U, Yale, Columbia, Princeton, U Penn, and Johns Hopkins. Plus a day of just hanging out in New York. And I get to see a Broadway show. Much excitement, yes? Anyway, 8 days away from here. I shant be able to wait.

College seems to be on everybody's mind, including mine. My father and I had a chat about college today. He doesn't want me to go 2,000 miles away (even though he knows he can't stop me) but if I do, he wants me to go to MIT. And he keeps pushing this medical profession at me. He thinks that since I am so "smart" or whatever that I should become a doctor. Hence the MITness. Even though I can get a good pre-med education at any of the places I am applying, if I so wished. I dread college apps in the fall. I know that my credentials are probably mildly impressive...but I don't know exactly how impressive. And I don't know how big of a role my essays will play into admissions...or those Bs I got last semester (I keep telling myself that it is ok because they were the first Bs of my...entire...life, but I dunno) I just keep thinking about how if I don't get to go somewhere away from here, it will be sad for me, because I have looked forward to it for so long. So my mom is out of town until Wednesday and my brother isn't home right now and my dog is barking so I am somewhat creeped out. I don't like being home alone. I feel like I should be having a super teen party. Too bad I am apparently not a partier. Oh well. Melee is awesome. They should be the soundtrack to my life.

All in all I'd say it was a pretty fine day. Melee, Flogging Molly, Taking Back Sunday, and the Bouncing Souls made the rain and the sharp pains in my neck from people landing on my head all worthwhile. True, I would rather see them at a smaller show, at some venue in Deep Ellum, but I'll take what I can get ::refrains:: ah, fuck it. As long as it's from you. I went with Sarah, Naomi, and Fifer and I ran into Katy, Chintan, Kyle, Vanessa, and Kelli. Fun stuff. So then we all ate at Naomi's and had a CD burning party kindof. I love how people that first meet bond over making fun of me. So, man, I've been talking to a lot of people online and it's crazy the different...conversations...and things you say...and relationships you have with people...and i don't even know. I think I should stop thinking now. And start living. Or sleeping. Yes, I am rather tired. I shall go sleep now.

I would just like to point out how incredibly stupid the human race is sometimes. Anyway, without further explanation, this week has been good. After the craziness that was Monday, on Tuesday I met some kid named Byron and got to hang out with him and Fifer. Wednesday, I found out that my eyes have gotten worse by .25 on each eye and then I drove all the way to Granbury to hang out with Rebecca for five or six hours. She should feel special. It takes exactly one-fourth of a tank of gas to go to Granbury and back. Today I chilled with Naomi down by the pool and we had some margaritas and then I ate dinner with Fifer and then I did a little babysitting for about four or five hours. $20 for watching movies and eating chocolate pudding. Joy. Apparently, they were really amazed with how I kept the house clean and the children peaceful. When we were watching Pirates of the Carribbean and it was at the part when it shows all the pirate fighting in their ghost forms or whatever, Tyler, 4, and Austin, 6, were all like, "I'm not scared, Lisa...are you scared?" as they huddled together on the arm chair. I was like, "Y'all can come sit over here with me if you want." and they were like, "Thank you!" and scrambled for a spot next to me. Aww. But that doesn't mean I ever want children. Nope. Double shift tomorrow but Warped Tour on Saturday. Everybody get ready to rock...out.

Some things are only for the priveleged to know. Last night...completed the four nights in a row of surrealism. If that makes any sense. I wish I could write a big long blog about it, but I think it might somehow diminish the experience. Let's just say...Kenny and I were gonna go see the Decemberists but we couldn't get in because he couldn't prove he was 17 so then we had to think of things to do. Which ended up with cop cars and trespassing and disorderly conduct and such. Shh. It's a secret. That I am posting on the internet for all to read. Cafe Brazil, The Terminal...back to Denton...sleep. Wake up at 6:45, coffee, leave for Arlington. Last night was one of the most unique and fun experiences of my life. Haha. Want details? Talk to me later, fools.

Sooooo I just got home. Yes, it is 7:00 AM. Yes, I have to be at work at 9:00. Yes, when Will and Alex found that out, they thought I was crazy for going with them, but eh, oh well. Tonight was kind of surreal. Katie and Christina came down from Denton to go to the Chomsky show with us (me, Fifer, Caty (sp?)) because they had never been to a rock concert before and they wanted someone with experience to go with them (me). Haha. We get there and who else is playing on the second stage but Dilitante, the band from Mansfield that I have heard so much about. And who is there to see them but EVERYBODY I KNOW. Haha jk. But seriously. Ryan Fan, Shea, Robert Rowe, Shayne, Alex, Heather...that whole group. Eventually, I am told Ryan (Essex) showed up, but I didn't see him. It was crazy how we didn't even plan to run into all of these people and then we...did. Dilitante's set was like an hour and a half and they were really good. Really mellow and chillaxy. When we went to the mainstage after that, Henry Holt was still on, and we didn't get to see Chomsly until around 11:00. I dunno how long they played for, but they were pretty effing amazing. Crazy guy was...crazy, insane...the lead singer was awesome. The whole band rocked. I could really make a habit of seeing Chomsky live. After the show, we were walking out and the lead singer came up behind me randomly and was just like, "Hey, thanks for watching. I caught you watching us, so thanks for watching Chomsky." and I was just like, "Oh..er..yeah, your welcome?...you guys were awesome!" ::shakes hand:: lol. It was interesting. We didn't get back to Arlington untli around 1:00, at which point we proceeded to Denny's for dinner and ended up finding Will, #3, and Terra. Later we were joined by Alex (not Atchley) and #2, who both decided to sit and talk with us the whole time. It was quite, quite funny. There were make out sessions (well, pseudo-ones) and water being spilt on laps and drawings of..things. Haha. Lots o fun. Then they all decided to go ghosthunting again, and I, having heard all these stories about it, wanted to go. In hindsight, I should've just not gone after I found out none of the four I came with were going, but oh well. Anyhow, So I dropped all them off and went back to Denny's where it was decided to meet at Will's apartment. Alex said he would ride with me but he wanted to go get his CDs or something first. So...we are in the car, right, driving down Cooper, and he's all, "So, I will probably never see you again." and I said something about how I wanted to go see AAE sometime, so maybe I would, and he said something like, "Well, I don't think I am gonna see you for a long time so I should just get this out right now. [dramatic pause] I am attracted to you." Me: ...ok. Him: Sorry if that makes things awkward right now. Me: No, no, it's ok. ::awkward silence that lasts for like two minutes:: Me: So, what kind of music do you like? Aw man, talk about your awkward conversations. No offense or anything to him, but I am in no way attracted to him. Soo...I didn't really know what to say. I don't really remember exactly what I said, I hope I didn't say thank you or anything. We went to Will's apartment, which is like, everything you would dream a punk rocker's apartment would look like, and then Will and Danny and Alex all rode in my car to the River Legacy Park with the other three in another car. Apparently, I know nothing about the real underground, by the way. I didn't even know there was a genre called Industrial until a few hours ago. We had to listen to this crappy fusion of techno and death metal all night (morning). Ugh. Oh well. I guess I am a tolerant person. I had to explain to everyone why I am not going to stop being someone's friend just because they are a conservative. All we did for two hours was just hike some paths in the park. Everyone was trying to make it seem really creepy, but I am not an easy person to creep out, so I was pretty unentertained for the most part, although the company could be quite hilarious at times. I was quiet for the most part, partly because I was so tired and partly because I am always quiet around a lot of people I do not know very well. There were some good times. By the time I dropped off Will and Danny, I was exhausted and when I told them I had to work at 9, they both said they felt bad, but I said it was my decision, so don't feel bad (I hate pity). So, yeah, I think I am gonna go try to find my mom's "Stay Awake" pills and take a shower now. I should be ok at work. Then I will sleep right afterwards until I have to wake up to go to the movies with Ryan and Naomi. Ciao peoples.

I should have told him I liked his shoes. It seems to work for Connor Oberst. "Thanks, can I follow you?" Why, you sure can. Anyhow. The show tonight was good. The music was excellent. New band I saw called the pits were very unique and good. Still Standing was fun, of course. Shut Up Agnes was fun. Shayne is sexy. A Faith Called Chaos was pretty good. Letter Twelve was...AMAZING. As usual. I will never get tired of hearing them. I'll take what I can get, as long as it's from you. How true. People show up in my Door and then are all nice and stuff so that I can't hate them. What the hell? Stupid boy. I met Charly. So nice and cute. We had a nice conversation before the Letter Twelve set. He was there by himself, very sad. Am glad I met him. He plays for Clover St. so I am gonna go see him and Ben and Willie and the rest of the gang play July 9th. Interesting night I think.
Synopsis of today and yesterday: Work. Ice cream. (10 pints, 3 half gallons to be exact) Wash car. Shop. IHOP. Sprinkler system, elementary school, Jimmy Eat World, infinity. The End.

So the last couple of days have been interesting. Yesterday after work I met Abby and Fifer at Cheddar's and ate they're left over fries and whatnot. Mmm free food. And then we just sat around at the park, talking and swinging and catching/naming frogs and such. It was all very cool. I think the park was the favorite time of my evening. Then me and Abby went back to my place to eat ice cream and Will called her or something so we met up with him and Travis and Ricky and this girl that I don't remember the name of and we all sat around Denny's for a while and then went dumpster diving at some places like krispie kreme and barnes & nobles. Then I watched Travis and Will spray paint some stuff on this Barnes & Nobles place. And then he wrote "Objectify women?" under the drivers window of this giant Hooters bus. That was pretty brilliant, if I do say so myself. The rest of the...early morning...was spent chilling in the Kroger parking lot, watching Ricky trying to smoke anything he could find, and then watching Travis and Ricky throw firecrackers out onto the street while we were driving. It was all so very punk rock, haha. The evening was accompanied by a very excellent soundtrack of bands like the refused, the weakerthans, the (international) noise conspiracy, and other various punk bands. Good times. I want Will's CD collection. It was an interesting night, to say the least. Anyhow. I didn't get home until around 5 or something so I got like 2 1/2 hours of sleep before my shift this morning. Today at work we had to shut down temporarily because of weather when it started storming and raining. There was this group of guys that came under the Queue line with me when it started raining and started talking to me. They were all so very nice and funny and the one that talked to me the most was so very cute. He had this little green polo shirt on. I was just getting into a good conversation with them when Matt had to come and tell them that they were not allowed to wait in the Queue line. :(. Haha oh well. I really want a nice, sweet guy by the way. Have I ever mentioned that? The guy today was just...so nice. ::Sigh:: I went home after that and then went and saw The Stepford Wives with Fifer and Abby and Kelly. The movie was mediocre at best, but it had it's funny parts. Particularly the part with Viggo. Ahahahahaha. I laughed so hard at that part. Then me and Fifer just chilled for a while and ate a lot. She had to go home at like 9 and then Amy called me so I went and hung out at her house for a while and attempted to watch Moulin Rouge but since I am running on about 2 hours of sleep or whatever, I had trouble staying awake. And now I think I shall go sleep because I am tired and do not have to work tomorrow. Woo!!

Wow, today I realized for the first time how much it really does suck that even though I promised myself I would, I haven't remained close to a good majority of my Arlington friends. I haven't done much of anything except work the past few days because after work, I don't really have anyone to call except for a few people, who are usually busy. I dunno. Naomi was telling me about orientation and how she met a guy that loves MCS (probably not as much as me haha but oh well) and this other guy that likes good music and she picked them out to be our tadpoles for Frog Night and I started thinking about TAMS and it just blew my mind how it has only been a month since I left for the summer and already it seems so very far away. It's like...this whole other world...and I dunno...it's just weird. The life I lead here and the one I lead when I am living up in Denton are two very completely different lives. I think that our Senior year will be really great...hopefully, it is anyway.

SLC Punk really is a great, great movie. I was looking through all my old pictures and scrapbooks and "common place" books today. It was pretty interesting. Nostalgia is...bittersweet. Tomorrow I am supposed to work 16 hours. I think I may die. I hope I can get out of the last few hours.

I can only describe seeing Cursive live tonight as indescribable. They were absolutely amazing. Beyond anything I had imagined. Tonight was definitely one of the best shows I have ever been to. Mike Park was great. He is awesome. I didn't enjoy Planes Mistaken for Stars, but they were ok I suppose. Anyone that plays for Plea for Peace has got to be pretty A-Ok guys. Saul Williams spoke with the conviction of an evangelist but the principles of a liberal activist...he also was also amazing. I enjoyed his poetry oh so much and he was so inspiring! And funny! Man, I enjoyed the entire show, especially Mike and Saul and CURSIVE!! Haha Cursive did a cover of the milkshake song and totally turned it emo. It was so great. I also saw Kelli there. Oh, and I saw Colin, Shayne, and Alex. And I bought a shirt. I'm off to sleep now.

So I just got home... Today at work it was raining so all we did was wax bobsleds and talk. It was pretty cool. I got to leave around 11:30. Woo. All I did with my day after that was watch these random TV movies about a guy that was trying to invent a computer to sell for $99 and a black guy who wanted to become a doctor and finally did at the end of the movie. Then I don't know what I did but around 9, Naomi called and I went over to her house. We planned our trip which will most certainly be going down July 7th-13th. Unless I decide not to take a class during the Summer II's. Anyhow. Wednesday- arrive/Harvard, Thursday- Boston University, Friday- Columbia, Saturday- U Penn, Sunday- Sightseeing in DC, Monday- Johns Hopkins, Tuesday- Yale/catch our flight back home. We will be hitting a total of six states, if you count DC as a state. This will double the amount of states I have been to in my entire life. I am very very excited. Yay! Actually, 7 because on our way to Connecticut we have to go through New Jersey. Wow. Seven states. In seven days. Oh my god, I just came up with the title for my book. Haha just joking. I am just very excited is all. Naomi got tired and wanted to go to bed so I left and called back Fifer who had called me earlier and they informed me that they were scheming so I had to go join them. Then me and Abby and her drove two hours to Czech Stop for some kolaches and then two hours back. I fell asleep, but it was still fun. We are some hardcore kids and mmm those kolaches are oh so good. So Cursive is tomorrow (er...today, actually :P)!! Everybody get excited.

My new name is {{{{{ 'GREGARIOUS-EXECUTIONER' }}}}} , apparently. My first act as a Ludo Ninja is to tell all you people out there that read this to check them out. That's right. Check out the "rock explosion that is Ludo." They are a quirky, nerd, punk band that is hilarious as ef. Their live show is amazing and their CD is great as well. So, everyone go to http://www.ludorock.com and check out some of their mp3s. :P Anyway, today there was lots of chillage with Fifer and we tortured James at his work and left him a ticket for $5,000 for being "the gayest straight man alive." We were just kidding though. And then we drove around randomly and listened to some Death Cab. Mm...good stuff. I have officially given up on guys. But it's ok, for real. I am just gonna go watch some TV now until around midnight at which point I will probably fall asleep and then have to wake up to another day of work. Have you ever felt nostalgic for something you haven't ever had?

Upon further consideration, Matt isn't a bastard at all. In fact, despite his tendency to try to show off to Nick after work sometimes, he is an A-Ok guy. The word A-Ok...that reminds me of two things. 1) MCS's song. 2) During the school year when Kenny said that he always insulted me because he thought I was A-Ok, which I never completely understood. Anyhow. Today was a long adventure full of Dallas and getting lost a block away from our destination. Good Records is deck. I had never been to a real record store before. CD Warehouse, Hot Topic, Best Buy, and Hastings were the only places I had really been, and I would be hard pressed to find as many good cds those places as I did at this place. It was amazing. I got to listen to Broken Social Scene and the album of the Decemberists that I hadn't gotten to listen to yet. Both were superb. I am definitely gonna have to see the Decemberists when they are here. I will have to find someone to go with, though... Then we went to some vintage store that was kinda dumb and then we went to the tattoo parlor because we are just that cool. Deck. Anyway, work was at 4 but I got to go home early at 9 because of the Phase 3 lightning. Yay for lightning. Edward Scissorhands is an excellent movie. I watched it for the first time in years today. I think I enjoyed the movie a lot because I relate to Edward so much. Everything I touch dies. Hrm. But seriously, the loneliness and such...yes. That movie definitely goes in the top ten. Or at least 15. I dunno. There are a lot of good movies. Oh, yeah! I accidentally flipped a guy off at work today on purpose. But it was behind his back, don't worry. I don't wanna get fired or anything. Some people are so rude. Don't let the bastards be your master.

I almost cried at work today. Which is weird. The one thing I hate more than anything in the world is crying in front of people. I didn't actually start crying, but as hard as I tried to keep my poker face, I think everybody saw through it. I was going on my 13th hour and the whole day had been pretty crappy. I found myself spacing out more than usual. Anyway, so 13 hours + boredom + unhappiness = me spacing out. I was confused with whether or not I was supposed to hold my gate because Clinton told me to but Matt said to open it and then I did and then Matt yelled at me for opening it, in front of everyone, which didn't help the situation any. I was so angry. Mad with him. But for some reason instead of getting mad, I just felt all hurt and stuff and god, I almost started crying at work. The guest I was loading in the bobsled was trying to reassure me and was all, "It's alright, don't let him get to you." Matt apologized after close, so he isn't a complete bastard. 14 hours is entirely too long for me to work. I am dead. I feel dead. I can't feel my feet anymore, though. Time for some cheese enchiladas.

Lead Singer: Well, if Ohio is for lovers, then what is Texas for? Crowd: ::mumbles:: Abby: SEX!! Good times, good times. Texas is for sex. I should make a shirt. Along with my moog shirts and "Your mom is for lovers" shirt. I have a lot of shirts to make. Hawthorne Heights is the shit. Or the crap. Whichever you prefer. I got a button and two comments on my "Fall Out Boy is for lovers" shirt from two very attractive guys. Mmm...I fall in love too easily. I have like thirty future husbands. Ohh well. Emery was cool, they had a moog and the moog player was juicy. He had a cute little hat and a polo shirt, worn emo...er excuse me...I mean hardcore style. Because emo and hardcore are not one and the same. ::coughs:: Oh well, labels are dumb anyway. I didn't really mean the comment about if Ludo are not sellouts, they will consider playing for Abby in August. If they do, though, I better see all you bitches there. And I mean that in the nicest way possible. Ahem, where was I? Oh yes. Alexisonfire was ok. I think they are way overrated though. Silverstein was last and they were good, but my favorites of the night would have to be Hawthorne Heights. Good stuff. We should never let James drive to Dallas ever again. Hey, if anyone wants to go to the Pedro the Lion show, please tell me so that I have someone to go with. Same with the Decemberists on the 21st. I will call Kelli, I suppose. Oh, and if anyone wants to drive to Austin with me on July 14th to see Fall Out Boy who I will miss in Dallas because I will be on the east coast (holla holla) July 7th-13th checking out colleges, then tell me as well. I can't miss my Fall Out Boy. That would be unoffice. Undeck. FIN. Anyway, I must go now and finish reading Hitchhiker's Guide...I have a ways to go and Fifer wants her book back.

I was waiting for a cross-town train in the london underground when it struck me that I've been waiting since birth to find a love that would look and sound like a movie. So I changed my plans and rented a camera and a van and then I called you. "I need you to pretend that we are in love again" and you agreed to. I greased the lens and framed the shot using a friend as my stand-in. The script, it called for rain but it was clear that day so we faked it. The marker snapped and I yelled, "Quiet on the set," and then called "Action!" Then I kissed you in a style that Clark Gable would have admired. I thought it classic. I want so badly to believe that there is truth, that love is real. And I want life in every word to the extent that it's absurd I know you're wise beyond your years, but do you ever get the fear that your perfect verse is just a lie you tell yourself to help you get by? Your perfect verse is just a lie you tell yourself to help you get by.

Well APPARENTLY its MY fault that my dumb bank didn't post my 100$ deposit that I made Friday morning and now my mom is pissed that my bank account that she wants to use does not have enough money for her to buy George Jones tickets because she does not have her own bank account because of some bitch named Elise. I don't understand things. Anyway, tonight was crazy. Tornado and such. I was at Amy's house and the power was out for a good twenty minutes, but it was all good. I got to bathe Heather in a bucket. It felt like Little House on the Prairie or something. Bye.

Sooo I am done writing about all those silly boys. All it is is drama, drama, drama, anyhow. Love is just a game. mua hahaha. Moulin Rouge:1 Lisa's love life: 0. I don't understand either. I think I am just typing for the hell of it at the moment. So yesterday I got to clean out the fountains by Conquistador and got $7 in coins. And then I gave Hendric a ride home and he gave me $3 for gas. I am rolling in the money. Today, work felt like it would never end. Mindi is like a little clone of Jennifer now. It is ever so annoying. God, four more days and I am free!! And finally, I figured out how to access my old files on my computer, which means good music and a new picture on myspace. I am listening to the mix Betsy made me right now. It makes me happy inside. Tomorrow I get to see Betsy. Hopefully her father will let her go this time. We are gonna go check out Planofest and then maybe steal a sign or two later on in the night/early morning. I expect I shall be having more fun than you.

Ahhhhh- my Jets to Brazil cd just got here!!! And I am listening to it!! And it is excellent!! "In the summer you'll really know. You're the only summer that I think I'll ever know. So I'll keep trying to find you somewhere smiling over me, over you, over me." Because of music, long drives during the orange glow of sunset, and advice from a certain friend with humorous anecdotes and well-made points, I think I am feeling considerably better, more adventuresome, and less inclined to be shy. Aaron texted me tonight: "Leeessaaa, whats up. I dunno either. Oh yeah this is aaron if ya didnt know. Anyways, i broke up with my gf for good this time i think. I'll tell you about it lata." Well, I am ready to give something a shot. Like I have said before, so refreshing it is for a guy to be making some kind of move. But, as I have resolved tonight, I am going to be making some moves before long. If I can adhere to my resolution. I still...feel somewhat disappointed by the way things turned out with the other boy. But I guess I will deal with my feelings concerning that subject in about a month. For right now, I am determined to have some fucking fun already.

Absolutely fucking nothing. I don't really know what else to say. I think I am just mad with myself at the moment. If he liked me, he would've done something by now. Anything. At all. A word, a held hand, a fucking kiss goodnight. But no. No no no no no no non nononononononononononoinooooooo. You just don't understand what it's like to be this close...and have nothing happen. It is the most frustrating feeling in the world. I. feel. like. violence. Does he understand that I spent $14 on gas today, drove to Denton and back twice to pick him up and drop him off, just so that I could spend time with him? Because I don't think you usually do that for casual friends of the opposite sex. I finally got out the question I wanted to ask him. "Do you remember the first time we met?" He, of course, did not. After telling him it was at IHOP that one time, I left it at that. What did I really want to say? I wanted to say that I remember that night because it was the first time that I noticed a TAMS guy that I could be interested in. I wanted to say that I listened to him talk about how the Smurfs really lived in a facist community and I thought that he was the funniest guy ever. I wanted to say how that instigated a crush on him that I had the entire year, even before we started talking. I wanted to tell him that on the night of the Valentine's Dance, when he asked me to dance and we danced half of the night together, that it made me the happiest I have been since I cannot remember when. That I was riding a high for at least a week. I wanted to tell him that he is the closest I have been to a guy since...two years ago. I wanted to tell him that yes, I still have feelings for him, and yes, it would be nice to know whether or not he has feelings for me too. I wanted to say, "Just kiss me, damn it." and make the first move. I just wanted to tell him I like him. But I didn't. Eleven hours together today and I couldn't seem to make the words come. Other words came...yes, but nothing of real importance...like say, us. I think perhaps this is me just beginning to realize that maybe his crush on me ended with the school year and now he just sees me as one of his friends. Platonic. Friend. The concept is hard to swallow, but it may be what I am going to have to start to do. I almost killed us on the way back to Denton because the roads were slick and I braked too fast and my car swerved out of control and we didn't stop until I swerved off the road into the grass...just a mere few feet from the median... "Soo... you wanna spend the night at my dorm tonight?" because that's what I did the last time we didn't think I could drive home without killing myself. He was joking. Half-joking. Not joking at all? I dunno. This time I didn't stay. Then, "We have the greatest stories together." Yes, we do. Everything that we plan screws up, but we end up making things work. Well, except for one thing. I had to call him when I got home to tell him I wasn't dead. "Goodnight, Lisa." It's always...kinda special to me when a guy says my name like that. Maybe it's just me. I guess I just am a sucker for any sort of attention they give me. If he ever read this, which would be really awkward, he'd prolly just say something about how I am too emo for my own good. Whatever. Fuck that. I am emo and who cares. I feel dumb. And stupid. And dumb. I think I should just give up. And move on.

This morning, as Aaron and I were filling up the water jugs for the rides, we got into a conversation about why he broke up with his girlfriend. Then he started telling me about a conversation with Rikki Ann in which he mentioned that it was all because of me. Then he went on to tell me about the rest of the conversation. Heh. Of course, I misunderstood the conversation and didn't get what he was trying to tell me. Me: So Rikki Ann thinks you like her? Him: No. She thinks I like you. Me: But you like her? Him: No. I like you. Me: Oh... But you got back together with your girlfriend? Him: Yes...it's complicated. All I can say is that it is very refreshing to have a guy tell me how he feels about me. I wish other certain people could pick up on this and tell me that they have liked me since February and that they think we should give something a shot. But, eh, he'll probably never get the balls to do it. Jk jk people. Aaron and I had break together and he shared his fries and pizza with me. :) Haha. You know...it's funny...Aaron likes me despite the fact that every time he sees me, I'm in some crappy work uniform. Despite the fact that he's never seen me with makeup on, never seen me with my hair down. Despite the fact that I am a complete and total dork. As I said, it is quite refreshing. If he had asked me on a date while he and his girlfriend were still apart (apparently because of me), I would have gone on a date with him. Oh well. In other news, I have been looking at all the applications for schools I've gotten in the mail recently. I didn't request them, but for some reason, I've been getting them. I was looking at the ones for Harvard and Yale the other day and thinking about how my stuff will look on them. The University of Chicago's "Un-common Application" is by far the deckest application of them all. The essay options are hilarious. I might write about a giant jar of mustard.

It's funny how just one little thing can make your whole day better. When I was on break, the guy that always clocks me in was there, and as I was leaving I accidentally dropped my cell phone into the trashcan. Haha. So I had to dig it out right in front of him and the people he was sitting with. Anyhow. I got off about 45 minutes early, due to the tree branch that fell on Bobsled's track, and who did I run into right as I was leaving the park but him. He made this weird face at me and that made me smile really big at him so then he smiled and waved and I waved back. It was a small gesture, but it made my day a little bit brighter, I suppose. After work, I chilled at my dad's til around 9:30. We actually got along and stuff, and he gave me the money for my plane ticket. It was weird. Last night was pretty interesting. Betsy cancelled on me last minute because her dad was afraid of the impending thunderstorm so I had to call Naomi and we had to improvise. We made a couple of Jack Daniels fudge cakes and then went to get ice cream at Braum's. Then we took the ice cream into IHOP and then harrassed Jared for a while. It was great fun. He sat down with us even though he was working. Then Jacob and Zach (from Dilitante) and Alex showed up and they sat with us and we all talked for a while. IHOP is Mansfield's Denny's . Then me and Naomi left for our movie. We were gonna see Fight Club at midnight but apparently that was only last week so we ended up seeing I Robot, which I thoroughly enjoyed even though I was expecting not to. The scenes of Will Smith with no shirt on did not hurt either. ;). Anyway, as I was working on editing the articles for the Junior Survival Guide tonight, I started thinking about how weird it will be to go back to school in August. I feel so...far away from everyone. TAMS seems like a lifetime ago, but yet it feels like it was only yesterday at the same time. I've reconnected with so many people this summer, and made so many new friends...going back to TAMS will be strange. Mallory wants to do another issue of Three in Thirty before the summer is over and get Jacinda to distribute it. You know, there comes a point when it is healthy to let go. She is trying to tell me how to run Scoop as well. Urg. I can't think of anything else to write.

You know, my mom is deaf in one ear. I don't know if I've ever mentioned this before, but she is. One day when she was a little girl she was cleaning out her right ear with a Q tip when she fell or something and...well, and then there was pain I suppose. Sometimes when we are riding in the car or walking side by side I will be talking about something, sometimes important, and going on and on about it and then I'll ask her opinion and she won't say anything. It's then that I look over and realize that she hasn't heard anything I've said in the past five minutes. It's weird trying to imagine what it would be like to not be able to hear out of one ear. I think there is something wrong with my ears. They hurt...or itch...or something. This is a new development. I think I should probably go see a doctor or something. I don't want to go deaf in one ear...or both. Anyhow, I saw Identity the other day when I was babysitting for Wendi for nine hours. It was a good movie. I certainly didn't see it coming. And after I babysat I got to see Jenn's new loft apartment. It really is quite cool and cozy. We chilled for a bit and then parted ways. Last night Sarah and I went to see Braid w/ Panic in Detroit, Moneen, and Recover at the door. All of the bands were good. I enoyed PiD and Braid the most although Moneen was pretty crazy and Recover was quite excellent. Travis was there along with four girls, two of whom were Rachel and Desiree so I talked to them for a bit and wanted to say hi to Travis but then realized that he probably does not know who I am. I was so tired that I almost fell asleep at many times during the show because we were sitting upstairs despite the excellent music. Anyway. That is all. I get to see Betsy tonight. Woot.

I was tired of my old template, I guess. Maybe one day I will get un-lazy and make my own. Until then... I just got back from Denny's with Laura and Joe and Deanna and Will and Alex and two of the Joshes. There were arguments of the correct pronunciation for the word wooooo or woOoOoO and Will showed everyone how he could stick his finger through his ear because of how big his gauge is and they were talking about ear odor. And it was pretty hilarious. Joe and Deanna were working on this crossword puzzle and me and Laura were helping them out. After it was just Laura, me, Joe, and Deanna, Laura and I were reading the Dear Abby letters and omitting certain words that made it sound dirty and funny. Good times were had by all. I think it has been interesting this summer getting to hang out with all the scenesters. They are all so very interesting and really very nice. I guess back in the day I always just kind of knew who some of them were and didn't expect to ever really become friends with them. It's cool. I love just sitting in Denny's with them until the wee hours of the morning...just hanging out and being...young, I guess. Hrm. Yesterday I sat in Barnes and Nobles for an hour, listening to music. I listened to a lot of stuff and it was all good, which makes it difficult to pick out which ones to buy. However, while all of them were good, only a few stuck out to me as excellent, and I think I need to start saving up money to buy those CDs. I really liked The Format and The Gloria Record. There were some other good ones too, although I don't remember them at the moment. When I left I noticed some hipster kid that was sitting next to me. He was quite cute. And tomorrow I get to babysit and then maybe go play frisbee in the park with Jennifer...? I hope it's not like...a youth group thing. And then I may go to Laura's house. But she has to ask her mom first. Her dad is out of town. I am devious, I am.

I have decided that I have crushes on the weirdest, most random people ever. For instance, today I discovered that I have a crush on the guy that clocks me in every morning. Sure, we have barely said anything to each other save for the occasional "Hi", smile, and wave, but nevertheless I find myself anticipating that time around 8:53 every morning when I will scan my ID and he will press some buttons on the computer and look at me and give me some kind of greeting while my timeslip prints out. One day, he even said more to me. As I was leaving he said, "Have a good day." and I said, "Ok. I will." and he said, "And if it's not a good day, make it one." I think that means we're in love. My three-day-long trip was pretty cool. Mississippi was kinda...boring. I guess Alabama was too. But I am convinced that no one in Jackson eats or uses gas to fuel their cars. My mother and I spent half an hour trying to find a restaurant and ended up having to get on the high way to another city to eat. There were a couple of fast food places, but nothing else! We also went to this blues cafe that was supposed to be a happenin' place in town but we made up half of the people that were there...but we did get to see Ironing Board Sam play a few songs and then he handed out his biography to everyone. That guy is hardcore. Alabama was pretty boring as well. We saw my brother's drum corps perform though, along with seven other corps. It was all very entertaining. Oh, and before we went to their rehearsal and I got to see 128 young strapping boys aged 16-22 shirtless and marching around the field playing their instruments. Sexy. I fell on the stadium stairs during rehearsal and there were like ten people sitting in the stands so everyone saw and after rehearsal was over one of the shirtless boys walking in my direction asked if I was ok. Why, yes, yes I am. Happens all the time. The riding in the car part was pretty cool. We stopped at an outlet book store and got a book on tape. Stephen King's Nightmares and Dreamscapes, which is a collection of short stories. They were pretty good. 9 1/2 hours of listening to that and then some of sleeping and 2 of listening to H.G. Wells' The Time Machine. Also got some good music listening in. I heart The Shins. They are great. And some reading. I am well on my way to being finished with the Douglas Adams collection. Anyway, I got back last night with no plans for the next two weeks. The only thing I know is that I need to work as much as possible and save as much money as possible so that I am able to buy that ibook after I get back from my trip on August 16th. $739 is what it is going to cost me. Plus shipping and handling because it is online. Best Buy doesn't carry Macs or anything but the latest models. I want an ibook G3. The G4 is the latest model but it is also around $400 more expensive and the differences aren't even that important. Anyway, I guess what I am saying is that if I play my cards right, and I think I will, by the end of August I could have a new ibook. Joy! Well, I lied. I do have one plan. And that is to go see Braid play on the 23rd. But that is it. Hrm. Well. My new favorite line from Chutes Too Narrow: I'm a walking cliche. And sometimes, that's just what I am. I don't think that's a good thing. :/ oh well.

So I have around 16 newly burned CDs and tomorrow I am driving 6 1/2 hours to Mississippi with my wonderful mother where we will have a night out on the town and go to a blues cafe with live music and feel all...southern and hip. We shall then proceed to Alabama the next day where we will see my brother's Drum and Bugle corps play and then check out what Alabama has to offer. Sounds like some pretty exciting days to me. I guess this past week I have been irritable and melancholy and down, but not to everybody...just to certain people. I think it has something to do with me feeling like a failure or something, I dunno. I mean, I've been having fun. After Fall Out Boy on Sunday, Rebecca and Lisa randomly showed up at my house and went out to eat with us and then I got to hang out with Chintan on Tuesday while we worked on the Junior Survival Guide and Wednesday I got to hang out with Rebecca and Naomi and then I had a really fun time at Denny's with Byron being his brilliant self and taking breathtaking pictures. haha. And Thursday I got to hang out with Sarah and then come home to a CD Burning Party with Abby and Kelly and Jennifer. So, the fun is there. But I am not, I guess. Hopefully, a break from here for three days will cure the misanthropy I have come down with as of recently. Today I worked 14 hours and was once again annoyed the hell out of by Jennifer. She's such a bitch to me and tries to thinly veil it with this fake kindness. I can't stand it sometimes. Xander is pretty cool sometimes. I definitely like him better than Jennifer. We have the same birthday. Afterwards, I had to go to my dad's to talk to him about my speeding ticket. And my missing license plate. And then my mom wanted me to tell him that she paid for my TAMS deposit so she didn't have to pay him back half of what it cost for Brian to take Drivers ed. His response: "I didn't expect her to pay me back anyway." Fuck you, Dad. He got all pissed off at me too. Just gave me these blank stares and rolled his eyes a lot and yelled a bit about how stupid I am for getting a ticket. I didn't think it was the best time to bring up writing Naomi's mom a check for $275. Maybe next weekend. When I left, he gave me a hug and was like, "I love you." and I was like, "Ok." And he's all, "I really do." I wish I could believe that. But I don't feel anything from him. "This just isn't love. It's just the remorse for the loss of a feeling." I fucking hate having to be the mediator between my parents. And have to hear them say shit about each other. I know their past is scarred and that they'll never love each other again and whatnot...because of reasons that I am reluctant to tell even the closest of friends. I understand all that. But I don't get how two people cannot work something out so that they are able to talk about things that are relative to their four children together. Their hate for each other is so...strong I guess, it makes me doubt the existance of love. Maybe love is just a short-lived fantasy before you really discover what kind of person the person you love really is. "They're just dead feelings."
I remember when I used to write things of substance on this site. Now, it's all bullshit.

I guess I should blog, although I am having trouble remembering what all I have done this week. I know that Tuesday night/morning I was hanging out with Olivia...and Wednesday I saw Fahrenheit 9/11 with Jennifer. Afterwards we ate at Jason's Deli and talked politics. I do not believe we did anything after that. There was a lot of Denny's this week. Thursday I picked up Abby from Houston and then me and her and Jennifer and Laura met a bunch of people at Denny's. Then we went to the park and sat around talking. Last night was the Clover Street show which rocked. The Alexander were really good as well. And today I ate dinner with my grandparents and then went to see Spiderman 2 with Laura and Abby and Jennifer which was good. I started clapping when Mary Jane and Pete finally got together. Then there was Denny's (once again) to chill with Joe, Deanna, and Alex. There was much fun that was had with Risk and looking at the classifieds and such. And there is an incriminating photo of Abby and I that might be making its way around the internet sometime soon. Pay no attention, it's not what it looks like... Tomorrow is Fall Out Boy. One more dayyy...my foot is in the dooooooor. Yay.

Tonight will make three nights in a row of crazy fun. Haha. The 4th was spent with Kenny, which always proves to be a fun-filled adventure. Kenny's town, Trophy Club, is Pleasantville meets Summerland minus the beach. Scary stuff. But he is not TV material. Vanessa's life needs to move to Kenny's town and we'd have the perfect WB Prime Time Teen Drama. I would comment on some of the...perfect WB Prime Time Teen Drama times we had, but I feel as if it is something I should discuss individually with each of you, so ask me about it. Last night, after getting off my 14-hour shift, I went to Denny's with Laura and Jennifer and Byron until like 2:30 and then went to Byron's until around 3:00. I hear Jennifer didn't get home until 6:45. ;). Some crazy times were had. Although I was completely sober, I do not think anyone in the restaurant thought so. I was...insane. And there were phone calls and much laughing. Ah, I love my friends. So yeah, tonight I'll be chilling with Olivia and friends. Should be fun and interesting. I think we are going to a party. Woot. Ciao amigos.

I'm in love with a boy that I might have never actually talked to. Well, I use the word love loosely, but oh well, it might as well be love with as close as I'll ever get to it. Today was rather nice. At work I got to walk the track at bobsled, stay at hat for three hours, take a break for longer than an hour at only a 45 minute pay cut, and I got to go to first aid because I cut my leg. All in all I'd say it was terribly exciting. Then I went to Jennifer's graduation dinner thing and then we made a run for it and went to Dallas to see Censored last show with Travis. They played with the Jump Boys, who I enjoyed immensely. Bravo, bravo, Jump Boys. And Censored was great save for the band insisting on playing their new stuff that Travis couldn't sing to even though it was supposed to be his goodbye show. The bastards. I don't know if I mention this enough, but I love punk rock so much. And ska. Ska is great. I wanted to bust a move so bad tonight, and sing along and whatnot...I just didn't feel comfortable enough or something I guess... And I love the way that punk boys are so antiwhateveryotherboyis and by that I mean they're not homophobic in the least and I find that to be very refreshing. Anyhow, I'm out.

Chicken Express's tea is delicious. Yum. And on that note, I went and helped feed homeless people yesterday. It wasn't like normal homeless shelter stuff, there were tables and food bowls and I got to host a table. A lot of the people at my table didn't talk much and left right after they were done eating. But I did get to talk to Alvin who introduced himself as the chipmunk and he was cool. Then I played tennis with Byron and totally beat him while Jennifer watched. Even tho we both sucked it up pretty bad. I am going to die at the tournament on the 9th. Then we all ate at IHOP and I had to argue with Byron's conservative views. The end. I need more money. I think I am going to go look for stuff to sell on ebay now.

I hope you have all had fun googling my soon-to-be new computer. Anyhow, today I saw Donnie Darko. Much goodness in movie form. Enjoyed. So I'm skipping town for a couple of days. See ya on August the 16th.

It will soon be mine!!! Five business days! So I went to my dad's tonight. We were just gonna look at computers for me. I had found a lot of refurbished ones and such that were semicheap. But, he decided he wanted me to have a brand new one so we went onto the Apple Education Store and picked out a *brand new* 12-inch ibook G4 w/ Combo Drive and 30 GB (i let him make sure the numbers were alright). It's so pretty!! I am excited! Anyway, the deal is that I pay for half of it (Around $600 once you add tax and such) and he will pay for half as my graduation present.

Holla guys. So today I got to shop some and I got a pair of jeans at Old Navy. It is like impossible to find non-stretch jeans nowadays. But I did. And I bought a purse at Target too because I got tired of carrying my phone/keys/wallet around. Then I went grocery shopping. Michelina's has the best TV dinners ever and they are only $1. Eh so that was pretty much my day. Ohh yeah and then I guess I went to the airport to pick up Jennifer and their were tearful reunions and such and me and her and Laura all went out and saw The Village, which I somewhat enjoyed even though I was told by some people that it sucked. Seriously. People say it sucked way more than it actually did. Just because it wasn't what they expected or something because it wasn't scary. But hey, maybe, just MAYBE, that wasn't the main point of the movie, eh? Oh, there was this whole, "Sometimes people in not doing things, don't do them because they don't want others to know they want to do them." or something to that effect and then she was all, "I know he has feelings for you because he never touches you." Ahaha. It all makes sense now. I think. Then we chilled at Denny's for a while. And now I am at Jennifer's house typing this while she is reading Spin. Haha I accidentally called Laura Simpson's house earlier asking for Laura Siders and her mom got all confused saying she was in Colorado. I felt dumb when I realized what I had done. Laura's mom will think I am stupid now. Oh what a day.

So wow. Life never fails to astound me. And boys never cease to amaze me. With their stupidity. Concerning certain things. Aaron = manwhore and liar. I guess I shouldn't have been surprised. I guess the thing that hurt my feelings was the realization that I am interchangeable like batteries or brake pads. It wasn't that he liked me, he just wanted a girl, a girl to temporarily fill in the spot of his old girlfriend. Glad I never fell for him. The bastard. Anyway, I quit work two days early. Today I realized that another two days of hell could quite possibly strip me of my soul forever and so I got people to fill in for me and I am DONE with Six Flags (hopefully forever). I got to say goodbye to the two people I wanted to say goodbye to (Shea and Lindsey) so that is good. Hrm...yes. Last night, I got lost on the way to Betsy's house and somehow ended up in Denton. We decided to meet at Sack N Save since Betsy lives like 25 minutes away or something and so I bought some fruit by the foots and some cookies and then made friends sitting with the girl outside who was on her break. When Betsy got there, we went to the lake that looked like it was in a picture and then went to IHOP. We talked a lot and listened to the new mix she made me (good stuff it is). Then we went by Kelli's and hung out at her pseudoparty for a while and left for Arlington around 1:00 or so. I just fell asleep after we got back to my house. It was very complicated finding a way for Betsy to get back to her house but we eventually did it. I like Betsy. I am going to miss her next year. But she is gonna let me know about all the cool stuff happening in Austin so I think I will be visiting her a lot. I can't believe I don't have to work anymore. I am just gonna take it easy the next couple of days. Relax, catch some sun, do some reading, get lots of sleep...it'll be nice.
